text: These didn't work for me because the tubes are too short to fit properly. I had to return them for a refund. Amazon was very accommodating.

The Biography of Maggie Smith reads like a telephone book. The author recites facts that can be found on Wikipedia and IMBD and manages to write in such a pompous and mind-numbing manner that I could hardly recognize Maggie Smith. He begins the book by categorizing the three great British female actors: Maggie Smith, Judi Dench and Vanessa Redgrave. Redgrave doesnâ€™t belong on this short list of mature women. So I was skeptical about his views from the get go.His recitation of places Maggie lived, when she became Maggie instead of Margaret, where she went to school, etc. is all written in a very pedantic style destined to remove her sparkle and wit despite his references to these qualities she is known for bringing to her characters.I cannot believe that Maggie Smith sanctioned or approved this biography, but apparently she did so quite reluctantly and agreed to meet Michael briefly on several occasions.  She succeeded in preserving her privacy perfectly.His recitation of her five appearances in the Harry Potter films (I havenâ€™t watched one of them), his interpretation of her performance and character in â€œDownton Abbey,â€ or the two Marigold Hotel films left me cold.The is a pedantic stultifying biography -I had to force myself to read every word in order to post this review.

Th Bissell is both bagless and cordless. It is very powerful and the Lithium Ion Battery charges quickly. It has to be removed from the Bissell and charged in a special unit that comes with the vac. While it is noisy, and I have yet to know of a quiet vac that has suction, it is very effective on both carpeting, wood and tile floors. Everything you need is stored in one unit except for the charger.I have two cats and one  of them is a long-haired fellow and they both shed 24/7. This Bissell picks up everything quickly.Because it has a powerful motor, it has some heft to it, but the handle is well placed and it is easy to maneuver. It also allows one to reach and vacuum higher spaces because of its handy attached wand. It is compact and easy to store in a narrow space.

This is an easy to use spiralizer and prices very long strands of zucchini for use in place of spaghetti. Carrots come out mor like curls. I bought this because I am prediabetic and avoiding carbs and sugars. The unit is compact and the blades are self storing. The suction cups in n the feet hold the unit firmly in place while using it.
Great for getting the lumps out of my long haired cat without too much fuss. Very sharp and effective
Excellent purchase and merchant

Jay Winikâ€™s â€œ1944â€ is a truly remarkable expose of the good, the bad and the unforgivable  unprecedented four term (albeit incomplete due to FDRâ€™s death early on in his 4th term) presidency of Franklin Delano Roosevelt.The good: The Lend-Lease Program, a brilliant solution to helping our allies before the US entered the Second World War.FDRâ€™s ability to charm the public and get congress to go along with what he determined was in the best interests of the US.His excellence as commander-in-chief of the USAâ€™s military forces during preparations for D-Day.His ability to â€œmobilize the war industry to produce 2 million trucks; 300,000 warplanes; more than 100,00 tanks, 87,000 warships, 5,000 cargo ships; over 20 million rifles, machine guns and pistols; and 44 million rounds of ammunition-the equivalent of building two Panama Canals every month.â€His emphasis on founding the United Nations, and a Refugee Affairs Department.The bad: his failure to oversee the nefarious doings in the US Department of State and the War Department where his appointees hid information from him.His inability to address a situation until it reached a crisis point.The unforgivable: His interment of Japanese Americans after Pear Harbor.His failure to accept the docking of the St. Louis, a ship filled with almost 1,000 refugees fleeing Hitlerâ€™s murder of European Jews, after it was turned away from Cuba.His failure to bomb rail lines leading to Auschwitz.His failure to rescue refugees from Hitlerâ€™s grasp although isolationist America had not yet filled any of its the quotas.His failure to believe and read telegrams and reports and counsel from those who had first-hand information about Nazi atrocities.His late entry into WWII after the Nazis had gobbled up every European nation except for Switzerland, Spain & Portugal.Reading Winikâ€™s â€œ1944â€ enlightened me and the pages engrossed me from beginning to end. It is a must read work of non-fiction!

Perfect size tarps for me to keep under my cats' litter boxes. I can wash them in my washer and fold them & reuse them. They are very useful for other things around the house and I also line my car seat with them when I carry my pets with me in their carriers.

These new Heft clear tall kitchen recycling bags are simply perfect. Many municipalities require clear bags so that sanitation can see what is to be removed properly. Where I live, clear bags are not yet required, but I like the fact that these bags fit my tall rectangular step-can receptacle perfectly and the fact that the a strong and tie on without twisty ties.For recycling purposes, they should hold oodles of cans, etc. It's clear to me that these are great trash and recycle bags.

A perfect neutral eye shadow without glitter or sparkle. I was looking for a matte eyeshadow in a neutral shade and found it. Although it is suggested for brown eyes, my eyes are green-blue, this neutral shad does the job of enhancing my eyes.
Great mascara with a curved brush that makes it easy to apply to my lashes. Really gave me that look of longer lashes and added to my eye appeal.

This is a far better model than my previous Philips Sonicare Airfloss unit. It can be adjusted for one, two or three spurts of air. It really removes food and other matter stuck between teeth and is an excellent addition to one's oral health supplies. This kit came with a special rinse to put into the cavity of the unit. I generally use a diluted mixture of mouthwash and water. It is cordless and recharges quickly on its base. The only thing that's a bit tricky is positioning it so that you can pour the mouthwash mixture into the cavity. Also, the cavity is just big enough to hold liquid for one thorough use. This is not a multi-family unit, but meant for individual use inasmuch as it only comes with the one attachment for use. I am very pleased with this unit, but, because of my modest dental background, I still floss, use the Airfloss and brush throughly. I am pleased to say that my dental hygienist always compliments me about how clean and healthy my teeth and gums are.

This is a marvelous assortment of six different types of brews. They are all smooth and rich tasting and not one of them has a sour aftertaste. I drink my coffee straight and I am enjoying the variety very much.  If you are looking for a smooth, mellow variety, you need not look any further than the Java Factory Variety Pack Single Cup Cofffee. Now that's my cuppa joe!

These are wonderful thin and long pads that stick perfectly to undies. They are much better than the cumbersome Always pad with the wings. They are not just perfect for minor incontinence but will work wonders for women with heavy menstrual flows. Always Discreet are definitely discreet because no lines will show not matter what one wears. It is difficult to wax poetic about such intimate items, but I really would recommend this pad to anyone even those who just have a long trip planned and might not quite get to the rest stop in the nick of time.
Love the natural shade because it doesn't look garish on me. I have fair skin, green-blue eyes and it complemented my complexion and coloring perfectly. I am really please with this lipstick.

These earrings are stunning. The lever back findings are very comfortable and the weight is perfect. They truly gleam with golden richness and I love the simple tiger eye bead. I've been wearing them for the past two days and have received many favorable compliments. I really enjoy seeing them on myself and love the intricate scroll design work.

I never used this type of electric shaver before, having been convinced that the three head types by another manufacturer did the best job. Now I know that my decision was correct.  It may work better on short stubbly men's whiskers, but did nothing shaving longer hairs on my legs. It is light weight, has a simple cord charger that plugs into any outlet  (both sides of the plug are the same size) and it charged quickly. My husband tried to shave off his bristly whiskers with it. Didn't work for him either.

This new Dove hair serum has a delightful very light scent and I use it after using the same series Dove shampoo. It leaves my hair feeling soft and curly and I am delighted to have found it through Vine's serendipity. I will now be buying it from now on. I wash my hair everyday and so this product is just the extra moisture that my hair needs. It is not oily, but a white cream in a pump bottle.

My two adults cats (8 years old) really love Nutro Chunky Loaf Chicken Dinner. I really love the wholesome natural ingredients in this canned food. There are no nasty fillers , so it provides pure nourishment for my finicky felines, Max and Airy. I adopted both of these cats as adults from a local shelter and they are truly special to me and I want them to have truly special food.
Lovely skin softening bath salts. Enhances a soothing and relaxing bath and leaves skin feelin smooth. Nicely scented too. Attractive plastic container sits in tub corner.

Don't try to carry this folding seat for back-pack hiking. It's heavy. For car-camping, it's OK.I am getting this folding seat for event viewing purpose (like July-4th firework show).It can be folded down for easy storing and transportation. The height is about 12 to 13 inches. I am 5 feet 4, So, the height is OK. For people over 6 feet height, this chair could be too low. Also, I suspect this seat can sustain big movement while people is sitting on it. The metal nuggets that hold the canvas may break easily due to extra weight or aggressive movement while siting on it.All in all, it's not a heavy duty chair, but it fits my need with its low price and its low profile for easy transportation.

I am in the middle of getting tooth implant. My old tooth is gone and leave a hole to be filled. For cosmetic purpose, I am now wearing a mouth-guard-like denture gadget. At home, I can remove the denture gadget for eating dinner and breakfast. But at office, I wear it eating lunch. After lunch, I need to rinse my mouth. I carry this soft cut with me. So, I can rinse my mouth easily without looking for a water cup.This soft cut can be easily folded down to store in my pocket. It's free from all kind of hazard stuff and safe for drinking water. It's not that big and won't hold too much water. People with big finger may have some hard time to use it.Overall, it fits my unique need well.

I bought Huawei's Ascend Mate 2 cell phone. It's a big phone with 6.1 inch screen size. So, I am looking for a bigger running belt that can accommodate my new cell phone. The Ascend Mate 2 can easily store inside this running belt. When wearing the running belt, the phone's body shape just stick out like a big plate hanging around my waist. Nothing wrong with the belt, the phone is just ....big. My waist size is around 32 to 34. The elastic belt fit my body well with plenty of room to expand to fit people with bigger waist size.Overall, this belt fits my need. I take one point out as the internal pockets for holding keys and wallet are flimsy.

I have been using prepaid phone for more than 10 years, the latest one I have been with is Tracfone (carrier is Verizon). My friend refers me to the H2O prepaid program (carrier is AT&T) due to its lower minimum deposit requirement, $10 for a 90-day period, instead of $20 for a 90-day period from Tracfone. I live in Cupertino, CA. Both T-mobile and Sprint do not have good coverage in my area (tried before).  I am not sure if AT&T has  good coverage in my area. The SIM card is virtually free. So, there is not much down side to give it a try.After receiving the SIM card, the on-line activation process is very fast. I drive around my area and AT&T coverage is good. The phone minute rate and test message rate from H2O's prepaid program are good. But the rate for mobile data is way too expensive (more like rip-off). I don't intend to use the mobile data from H2O as I use Karma pre-paid hot-spot for mobile data (they have much better rate for data).All in all, if your phone and text message usages are low and you don't plan to use mobile data, then H2O's prepaid plan is excellent.If mobile data is needed, stay away from H2O's prepaid plan then.For my intended use case, H2O's pre-pain plan is great, so I switch from Tracfone to H2O.

This selfie is made by the same company but it is sold and branded with various brands. I got one from local Fry's Electronics mainly because it is easier for me to return if it does not fit my need. I am using Huiwei's Ascend Mate 2 cell phone, which has a 6.1 inch screen size and the phone width is 3.4 inches without any protection case and cover. It's too wide for most of selfie sticks. The cell phone holder of this selfie stick is able to accommodate my Ascend Mate 2 without the original rubber feet. Yes, this selfie is advertised to open up to 3.5 inch wide, and it indeed can fit cell phone with width up to 3.45 inches....again without using the orange rubber feet.A lot of other selfie sticks claim the phone holder can open up to 3.5 inches, but in reality, they can not accommodate phones with width > 3.25 inches.The build quality is just OK...a little bit hard to extend and retract the pole.

I used the counter-top George Forman electrical grill before. It's OK to prepare small amount of food for 1 or 2 persons, but for a small family of 4, it just won't cut it. This "George Foreman GFO201RX Indoor/Outdoor Electric Grill" is a nice upgrade from the small electrical grill as it has a much bigger cooking space, but it also can be used either indoor or outdoor.Though I am handy in home maintenance work and it takes just about 10 to 15 minutes to put the whole thing together easily. Honestly, I think the assembly work is easy for most of people.It's good that the grill comes with a stand. However, the stand post does not integrate with the stand base tightly. The stand is somewhat wobbling when the heavy grill is in place. I am able to improve the situation by enhancing the binding between stand post and stand base with gorilla glue. Well, the down-side is not able to separate the stand post from the stand base anymore....not a big deal.A dial with 5 selection is used to control heat level. The included manual does not specify the temperature associated with each selection. Per my infrared thermometer, the grill surface temperature (without any food) is around 200ºF when the dial is at 1. And the temperature (without any food) is around 500ÂºF when the dial is at 5. The low setting is good to keep food warm, while the high setting is hot enough to creat a nice sear mark on the food. When starting from cold, it takes less than 10 minutes to reach the 500ÂºF. Definitely faster than cooking with charcoal grills.In terms of cooking real estate, it claims 240 sq inch surface, but I think it is somewhere around 210 sq inch. I have no problem putting 8 burgers on the cooking plate and still have some room to flip them easily.For this model (GFO201RX), it has a ceramic surface, not the normally seen Teflon coated surface. I don't know if ceramic surface lasts 5 times longer than Teflon coated surface or not (claimed by manufacturer). However, I do appreciate the ceramic surface as I don't need to worry about the risk of having Teflon coating in my food. From post-cooking cleaning point of view, this ceramic plate can be easily cleaned by wiping with wet paper towels...very impressive.So far, we have used this grill for more than 10 times this summer, mainly during weekends as I like to grill in the backyard. We have tried steak, fish, shrimp, burger, chicken, vegetables. It takes couple of tries to get used to the temperature control, especially when cooking with think meat. After initial learning period, we are happy with the results.Though I think electrical grill is generally good, it does have some nuisances:1) There is no place to hang the cover. So, I need to place a table next to the grill to hold the cover.2) There is no place to hang the cooking utensils. Again, a table next to the grill is need to keep cooking utensils handy.3) The grill plate can't be detached for cleaning.4) Storing this electrical grill is kind of hassles due to its size. It does take quite some space for storage. Well, I get a grill cover for it and leave it in the backyard when not in use.All in all, our family does enjoy this GFO201RX electrical grill this summer. And I do recommend it to people like grilling but don't want the hassles of dealing with either charcoal or propane gas.

A nice handy gadget for cleaning ashes, especially it's long enough to reach deep inside the grill to get to those hard-to-reach areas. The bottom L-shape metal plate works like a rack that scraps ash out effectively. After using it couple of times, I wonder how come I don't know the existence of this tool earlier. I would have purchased it by myself if I know how useful this tool is.Ash cleaning is not a heavy duty work, with that, I guess this metal tool could last for a long long time. I highly recommend this tool if you have a ceramic cooker.

A handy tool for me to remove hot grill rack from my Weber grill, so I can add additional charcoal during cooking, or I need to re-adjust the setting of my indirect cooking, or I need to add wet wood chips to my metal wood chip holder when I am smoking my food.It's strong and sturdy enough to lift and hold my grill rack. However, don't try to use it to lift metal covers of you cast-iron cookwares. This gripper is not designed for that kind of heavy-duty work.The only improvement I can think of is a longer handler to keep my hand farther away from the heat. For now, I am wearing a heat-resistance glove when using it.Be careful, it is not rust-proof and it would definitely rust if you just leave it in your backyard.All in all, I do recommend this convenient gadget if you cook with charcoal.

This OEM (not Hyundai genuine product) cabin air filter fits my 2013 Hyundai Elantra perfectly. It costs half of the Hyundai genuine air filter. That's OK, as I plan to change it more often. The installation is super easy. No special skill and not tool is needed. There are plenty DIY video on the web teaches you how to change the air filter. I am going to stock up couple of more....

I am searching online to find a small man-bag that I can carry around to hold my cell phone, wallet, car keys, reading glasses...etc. I don't want a bulky backpack-like bag, I don't want a purse-like bag,  I don't want a message bag, and I don't want a waist bag. Camel bag is OK, but most camel bags are still too big and bulky. Finally, I bump into this one. The price is very low. Even better yet, it is made of canvas, instead of cheap plastic material.  With this low price, I guess there is not much risk to give it a try.The shipping takes a while as it is shipped directly from China. After trying it on, I am very happy with this small bag as it meets my needs exactly...not too big or bulky, and not too small to be useless. My 7 inch tablet goes in easily. The canvas material does not make it looks cheap. The color and style make it a nice fit for man....yes, people can tell this is a man-bag. The overall build-quality is decent.The only downside is the short shoulder strap. I won't recommend this bag for people more than 5 feet 5 in height...unless you don't mind carrying a bag under your arm pit :-)Overall, I am very happy with this bag, I will get couple more as gifts for my brothers and nephews.

This grilling table is sold under several different brands in various discount stores. I got one from K-mart store couple of years ago. I  used it several times in camping events.  It always caught people's attention at the camp site. As shown in Amazon's photo, it has a hanger to hold paper towel, couple of hooks to hold cooking utensils, a mesh rack to hold items like plates and bowls. The two side tables are very convenient for preparing food and the center top table holds camping stove well.The whole grilling table can be easily folded up for transportation and storage. It's pretty steady when in use. I always recommend friends in the camping events to get one as it does improve camping experience.The surface of two side tables and the center top table are kind of slippery. Though the intend is not to get dirty easily. However, once a while, plates or bowls do slip away (and drop to the ground) while I am cooking. I take one point out for this.

Over the years, I have been through quite some monitors with various sizes, 17", 19", 22", 24". I have to say this HP 27" monitor is pretty impressive from several factors. First of all, a 27" inch monitor really gives me a big working space. I constantly VPN into office and work from home. I now can display several applications concurrently on the screen. This 27" monitor indeed improves my productivity.Secondly, HP does a good job on the industry design of this 27" monitor, it has sleek, elegant and clean appearance. It looks really appealing and modern.Finally, the color is vibrant, the image is sharp, crisp and clear. The 1920 x 1080 HD resolution along with its big screen size, makes it a great enjoyment watching movie on this monitor. I do try some quick action racing car movies, and there is no ghost effect from this monitor.I usually don't install vendor's software for monitors as PC does a good job in detecting monitor and picking up the right software driver. For this monitor, the included DVD software does do something beyond the generic software driver from window OS. The HP software helps to bring out the best performance of this 27" monitor. I would strongly recommend users to install the included software.Yes, this monitor does not come with speaker. Not a big deal, most speakers embedded in monitors do not have good performance anyway. Wireless bluetooth speakers are commodities these days. It's easy to find decent bluetooth speakers with good price.The only thing I feel missing from this monitor is height adjustment. I can only tilt the monitor backwards. I would take half-point out due to this.By the way, this monitor uses glossy screen. Be careful if light reflection could be an issue in your room setting. Not a flaw, but be aware of this.

This microfiber drying pad is highly absorbent, but yet it dries quickly. And it is easily washed in the washing machine. It is quite big in size and takes up quite some counter-top space. It's good that it can be folded to adjust the length.Usually, I use dish towels on the counter to catch the overflow from hand-washed dishes. This drying pad has effectively replaced those dish towels. Both sides of the drying pad can be used for drying purpose, where one side has a white mesh to let air flow through underneath the items drying on the mat.Overall, I like this drying pad and it serves its intended function well.

This is not a cheap oven mitts shown in Target, or Walmart. It's pretty high quality.From size point of view, it's pretty long and large. It covers my forearm to provide sufficient protection in case I need to put my hand deep into oven to get things out. The heavy-duty cotton resists heat up to 500 degrees. The lined rubber grips works pretty well on ceramic or glass dishes that are usually slippery for maneuvering. Yes, it's heavy-duty, but I can still bent it easily.From appearance point of view, the dark grey color makes this oven mitts less messier even if it gets food stains. And it is machine washable.It's good that they put the rubber grip coating on both sides. So my wife (right-handed) and I (left-handed) can all use the oven mitt.Indeed, the price is on the higher end side. But I think it's well wroth the money for the provided protection and its build quality.

Each package has two running belt. Each costs me about 6.50. With this low price, I won't feel sorry to throw it away if it does not work as expected. That's why I give it a try to place the order. The running belt does not look look cheap or feel cheap. The belt part by itself is pretty solid and can last long time. The two pockets are constructed with water-proof elastic material that can be expanded to hold stuff. One to hold iPhone 6 and the other one to hold car key, credit card and some cash. The zipper to close the pocket has locking mechanism. So, the zipper won't open by itself during running.The only issue I have with this running belt is the zipper. It's a little tight to operate the zipper when I receive the belt. I have to use wax to lubricate the zipper to make it easier to open and close. I take one point out for this.All in all, I am satisfied with this running belt. And I do recommend this belt to my friends. Actually, I order extra ones for my brothers also.

I need a belt for my weekend casual pant. This Dickie's belt fits my budget. However, as other reviewers have indicated, the top side is not genuine leather, only the lining part is genuine leather. I guess, I got what I paid for. Take one point out for their "somewhat misleading marketing" scheme to mark this belt as a genuine leather belt.

Got one from local FRY Electronics during during a sales event for less than ten dollars. With this low price, if it does not work well, I don't feel bad to throw it away.From construction and build point of view, this headset feels cheap. However, in my test, it works pretty well. I can hear the other side clear and the other side can hear me clear also. It also takes voice command, so I speak a number and it will dial out for me. I can also speak to the earphone for it to send out text message for me. My pre-paid cell phone does not have mute function, but this earphone has the mute function. That helps to address an issue that bothers me for long time --- now I can dial in a conference call, and put myself in mute mode.All in all, for less then ten dollars cost, I am very satisfied with this bluetooth headset. I am going to get another one for backup, just in case I misplace or break the one I am using.

This Medline VEN6025 latex gloves are not meant to replace your regular household cleaning gloves. These are premium version of "one-time-use" latex gloves. These gloves are thinner and less durable than the regular household cleaning gloves, but thicker and more durable than the typical one-time-use disposable latex gloves. Also, it's cuff is shorter than household gloves, but longer than those generic disposable latex gloves.For real heavy duty work, I still recommend to stick to the household cleaning gloves. However, for real dirty or nasty cleaning tasks that you don't plan to clean and re-use the gloves, this Medline VEN6025 Venom latex gloves are very good choices.  One thing I don't like about those disposable latex gloves is they tend to be very slippery when getting wet. I am glad that these VEN6025 gloves are far less slippery than those average disposable latex gloves. Better yet, the slightly textured figure areas make them easier to grab things.These Medline VEN6025 are one size for all. They are a little loose for my medium-size hand. If your hand is on the smaller size, these gloves could be too big for you.Though these gloves are marketed as "one-time-use", I think these gloves can be reused couple of times as they are heavy duty.All in all, I am satisfied with these Medline VEN6025 latex gloves. I will recommend these gloves to my friends, and I think it's a good idea to keep one box home.

This is not a cheap oven mitt that you would see in Target, or Walmart. It's pretty high quality.From size point of view, it's pretty long and large. It covers the forearm to provide sufficient protection in case you need to put your hand deep into oven to get things out. The heavy-duty cotton can resist heat up to 500 degree. The lined rubber grips works pretty well on glass or ceramic dishes that are usually slippery for maneuvering. Though it's heavy-duty, I can still bent it easily.I am glad that they put the rubber grip coating on both sides. So both me (left-handed) and my wife (right-handed) can use the oven mitt.I agree the price is on the higher end. But I think it's well wroth the money for its quality and good protection.

This Samsung MotionSync Upright Vacuum is by far the most maneuverable "corded" vacuum machine I have ever used. I do have a cordless Dyson vacuum machine that is better than Samsung in maneuvering, but that's a battery-based vacuum with short and limited operation time. So, it's not a meaningful apple-to-apple comparison.The width of the beater is narrower then other vacuum machines I had before. That's good for moving around in tight corners. But, if you have big area to take care, this might mean more work for you though. This vacuum has a lower profile also. It's easier to get into areas under table, bed-frame, cabinets. In a nutshell, combining the (1) MotionSync, (2) narrower beater size, and (3) lower profile, this vacuum machine is perfect for rooms with a lot of tight corners, tables, chairs, cabinets.The noise level of this vacuum is on the low side comparing with most of the vacuum machines I have used. The canister is easy to detach and clean. The overall size of this vacuum is on the slim side and it occupies smaller storage footprint.In terms of sucking power, I have hard time to assess whether this vacuum does a better job than my other vacuum or not. To be honest, without special testing setup, I am wondering how people can tell one vacuum machine has better (or weaker) sucking power than another. All I can say, I see similar amount of stuff are picked up by this vacuum.In summary, I am satisfied with the overall performance of this Samsung vacuum machine. I take one point out as the price seems to be on the high side.

I have carpet cleaner at home to shampoo carpet in heavy traffic areas about twice a year. So, I am used to the "wet" vacuum process. This Oreck Surface Scrub Hard Floor Cleaner works the same way like a carpet cleaner.It's virtually 90% assembled when I receive it. I just need to attach the handle. Two things get my attention right away....how light weight it is and how long the cord is (...30 feet long cord). Till I turn it on, I realize what a loud noise it gives out.My kitchen and bathrooms are covered by linoleum. I mop these area with swiffer on needed basis. It works so far so good. But I am eager to see how this Oreck Surface Scrub Hard Floor Cleaner works on linoleum surface.My first mistake is to use hot water in the clean bucket, the vacuum runs for short time and then stops. I fetch the menu out an read it carefully, then I realize this machine takes "warm" water, not "hot" water.  Well, my carpet cleaner has no issue taking hot water though. Anyhow, I have to wait for the water to cool down a bit.Like carpet cleaner, the first run is to dispense the water, then follows with two dry runs to suck back the dirty water. While operating it, I sense the water sucking effectiveness depends on how flat the surface is. For linoleum without too much pattern, this Hard Floor Cleaner works pretty well is sucking back the dirty water. But I suspect how effective it is on uneven surface, like tile floor with deep grout.Also, just like operating carpet cleaner, this Oreck Surface Scrub Hard Floor Cleaner need to be moved slowly in order for it to scrub the floor and then suck back the dirty water. So, the overall cleaning time is actually longer than using swiffer.Another thing to be noted, the vacuum-powered scrubbing wheels is not strong enough. I find myself using wet towel to scrub some stubborn spots.I don't expect one to use this Oreck Surface Scrub Hard Floor Cleaner to clean hard floor that often, just like the carpet cleaner is not used on weekly or monthly basis. Simply because it is quite a chore to use it. First, the floor need to be swept and vacuumed first. Then, need to spend long time (due to slow motion) to operate the Oreck Surface scrub cleaner. After that, the filters need to be cleaned before putting it aside.Final verdict, if you don't have big hard floor area to be cleaned, I would recommend to stick to swiffer.

I am looking for solution to handle the crabgrass in my front yard lawn. The crabgrass is pretty aggressive and hard to clean up.On my first test, I applied this Ortho Weed killer plus Crabgrass control on crabgrass around sunset time. After one week, the crabgrass did not show any sign of wilting. That could be my fault, as the instruction recommends to apply the weed killer with plenty of sunshine. I shouldn't apply the weed killer at sunset time.On my second test, I applied the Ortho Weed killer plus Crabgrass control on the same crabgrass area at 1pm noon time with plenty of California sunshine. After one week, I did see sign of wilting to show up. I thought I finally found a solution to deal with the crabgrass. But after another week passing by, I just realize the crabgrass is still growing strong...no sign of wilting anymore.I did apply this Ortho weed killer on other weeds and it did kill other weeds effectively. But I am disappointed that it could not control the crabgrass.This product is marked as "Weed Killer for Lawns Plus Crabgrass Control". I agree it is effectively in killing other weeds, but I think they should take out the "Plus Crabgrass Control" part.

This LG 24GM77 24" LED-backlit LCD monitor is great, but you need to play with the settings! Don't expect it to look just the way you want it after taking it out of the box. It takes me an hour of adjusting and testing to get my settings just right; but once I am finished I am very pleased. It is very bright the first time you turn it on (with the default settings). Be careful not to dim it too much or you will lose some of your color quality.This monitor is perfect for games that have a lot of movement as it keeps the image very clear when panning in a first person shooter for example. It virtually has no screen lag, and no ghosting or visual problem of any kind.  It also makes dark games look more clearer and vibrant, which is great for competitive multi-player matches that tends to have dark, hard-to-see areas.This LG 24GM77 does not have speaker. Not a big deal, just be aware about that. Most monitor's speakers are weak anyway. You can easily attach USB powered speakers as this monitor has 3 USB3 ports.This LG24GM77 comes with amazing # of hookups: 2 HDMI, 1 D-Sub, 1 DVI-D, 3 USB, 1 Display port. So, I can easily connect both my PC and game console to this monitor without the hassles of switching cables.Though the price of this monitor is on the high side, if you are a serious gamer, you won't be disappointed with this LG 24GM77 24" LED-backlit LCD monitor.

The moment I open the box and find out this Miele Classic C1 Olympus Canister Vacuum does not have a motorized beater brush, I know right there this vacuum machine is not much usage on carpet.Also, do not get confused by the term of "canister". This is not a bag-less vacuum that you can just dump dust out of the canister. This Miele vacuum uses a special deigned bag. So, there is some on-going maintenance cost.However, it does work pretty well on hardwood floor and tile floor in my house (mainly first floor where there are no bed rooms). The low profile vacuum head allows me to get into tight areas under table, TV stand, or sofa. These are the areas where I tend to skip when using my up-right vacuum machine as they are hard to reach. The wheels roll on hardwood floor easily. So, I don't feel like dragging a heavy thing behind me when vacuuming. Nevertheless, the whole vacuum is pretty light also, only about 12 pounds.The retractable cord has a better design than another model I used before. Mainly because I can control the speed when retracting the cord. In one model I used before, the cord retracts so fast and the fast flying cord becomes a hazard by itself.Another big plus about this vacuum is the noise control. This is by far the quietest vacuum machine I have ever used.However, even if your main usage is for hardware floor or tile floor, I still has hard time to recommend this Miele Classic C1 vacuum. The $300+ price tag is just a little bit too high.

This Toshiba 2-in-1 Touchscreen laptop is pretty light and thin from laptop point of view, but heavy and thicker from tablet point of view. I don't think people can hold it as a tablet for long time. But, overall, it's still very portable and you can easily slide it into brief case, backpack...etc.Comparing with my Acer and Asus chromebooks, this Toshiba 2-in-1 laptop is faster for both (1) power up from cold, and (2) wake up from sleep. That's impressive. I guess the 128G SSD does help on the speed. The program loading speed is also fast.The battery is embedded and not replaceable. That's the trend for these kind of 2-in-1 laptops...as most tablets' batteries are not replaceable also. The battery life is about 4.5 hours on heavy usage. Nothing to brag about, as this is a compromise between portability and battery life.I like the keyboard design. To save keyboard real estate, some laptops/chromebooks remove some functional keys (for example, page-up and page-down keys). This Toshiba 2-in-1 laptop keeps most  functional keys. They just make some functional keys a little bit smaller to save real estate. I think that's a good design trade-off.Comparing with my other notebooks and chromebooks, I agree the hinge of this Toshiba L15W-B1120 Convertible laptop is not that firm. I don't mean any manufacturing defect. I mean the hinge has less friction to turn. So, it's less effort to rotate the screen to either laptop mode of tablet mode. When the screen and keyboard are opened with angle between 30 degrees to 330 degrees, the hinge has sufficient friction to keep the screen in firm position. I operate the laptop by keeping tapping the touch screen, the screen stays put. However, When the screen and keyboard are opened with angle less than 30 degrees or more than 330 degrees, the hinge does not have sufficient friction to keep the screen in position. The screen starts to drift down.In laptop mode, I don't see how people can work when screen and keyboard are opened with angle less than 30 degrees. So, that is not an issue. But, in tablet mode, it's possible to keep the screen and keyboard opened with angle at more than 330 degrees though. Not a big deal, but something to be aware about.All in all, comparing with my other notebooks and chromebooks, I like this Toshiba 2-in-1 touchscreen laptop for its fast response time (power-up, wake-up and program loading), its portability, and its flexibility in converting into a tablet. I take one point out as the hinge does not have sufficient resistance to keep screen in place when the screen is opened at angle more than 330 degrees.

I am getting this TP-LINK Archer T8E AC1750 Dual Band wireless PCI card to upgrade an old desktop running window 7 for wifi connection.  I move the old desktop to the living room and use my 55 inch smart TV as the monitor. Mainly for kids to sing and dance with songs from some karaoke web sites. My smart TV does have wifi capability with quite some build-in apps, but I can do web surfing with my smart TV.After installing the card, I downloaded the latest driver from manufacturer's web site. The driver installed easily without problem. My router is in the study room, which is several walls away from my living room where my smart TV resides. With this card, I am getting full signal strength. Actually, the receiving quality with this TP-LINK PCI card is better than the receiving quality from smart TV's internal wireless connection. So, I end up also using the desktop computer to stream Netflix movies (not from my smart TV anymore).So far, I have been using this TP-LINK PCI wifi card for 3 weeks. It hasn't given me any problem yet. I am happy.

We purchase the whole rotisserie chicken from Costco for weekend meal on a regular basis. I usually use fork and knife to cut the chicken apart. Though doable but it's quite a chore, especially when I need to rotate or flip the whole chicken around for different cut angle. The fork and knife are just not quite the right tool for this task.The moment I see this Cuisinart claws, a spark light flashes through my brain right away. Yes, that's the exact tool I need to handle the whole rotisserie chicken :-)The handle is very easy to hold. The sharp claws grab the meat firmly. The metal construction is strong and I don't see it will give up on heavy lifting task. With this Cuisinart claws, I can easily flip or move around the whole chicken. I can break the whole chicken into small parts without even using knife at all. The small space between the claws make it very effective in stripping meat out of bones also.I also use it to break the pork rib instead of using knife and fork. What a relief for handling big meat.I would recommend this Cuisinart CMC-262 Claws if you have the need to handle meat, especially big meat.

There are two ways to configure this TL-WA860RE wifi range extender. Unfortunately, my TP-LINK N750 dualband router does not have the WPS (wi-fi protected setup) button. I can not take advantage of the auto-configuration approach. So, I have to choose the second method by manually entering my network password into this repeater.I wouldn't say the manual configuration is a fool-proof process, as it took me three iterations to finally enter network password into the repeater correctly. Once the password is in, the rest is pretty straight-forward....just plug the repeater to a power socket.If the repeater is too close to the router, it will show orange light. So, you just need to move the repeat far away from the router.My router is in study room, and I always get 1 or 2 bars when I use my Chromebook in kitchen. With this TL-WA860RE N300 wifi range extender in the kitchen, my Chromebooks shows 4 bars (the best signal quality).Some of my old gadgets in the living room does not have wireless capability. I am glad this TL-WA860RE N300 wifi rang extender has an ethernet port to provide wired connection option for those old gadgets.For speed testing, I stream HD video from a desktop PC to a notebook computer. I need to physically move the notebook computer to kitchen, so it connects to my home network through this wifi range extender, not through my router directly. I am impressed with the speed. The HD movie plays well, no pause, or slow motion.All in all, I am very pleased with this TL-WA860RE wifi range extender. The price of this range extender is close to the price of a low end router. However, the convenience of easily moving this range extender around the house is hard to beat. I would recommend this wifi range extender if there are signal receiving dead stops or weak spots in your house.

I have a Fintie kindle paperwhite smartshell cover for my kindle papwerwhite. I am getting this Belkin Folio for my wife's Kindle Voyage. I like the Fintie smartshell of my kindle paperwhite a lot,  I thought this Belkin Folio is similar to the smarshell cover. Well, I am somewhat disappointed for following reasons: (1) it feels so plastic and looks pretty cheap, (2) it does not have the auto wake/sleep function.However, from protection point of view, this Belkin folio is sufficient, the kindle voyage fits snug in this cover. Actually, after I put the kindle in, I could not get it out (I don't want to enforce it.). And the magnetic cover will not pop open by mistake. Also, the cover is very thing and light. So, it does not make kindle voyage bulky.My Fintie kindle paperwhite smartshell is only about half the price of this Belkin Folio. Clearly, the price is on the high side, I would recommend people to shop around.

A local real estate club host interviews the author, Garret Sutton, on a radio show. This book is mentioned in the interview. I am hooked by the title of "Loopholes" of Real Estate, as I am active in learning tricks for tax saving. So, I go ahead and get a kindle version. After reading the whole book, I realize this book does not offer me any new tricks in saving tax from my real estate portfolio....don't get me wrong, this book does cover quite some tax saving techniques, but I know them already. However, to my surprise, this book has quite some asset protection related subjects. And I do learn quite a bit on this subject from this book....things like:1) What is a land trust? This book helps me to fully understand the purpose, the usage, the pro and con of a land trust.2) Why a California LLC is a weak LLC. Why Nevada LLC, or Wyomin LLC are strong LLCs.3) What are the homestead exemption differences in different states. And how the homestead exemption can protect asset.4) The difference between Grand deed and quit claim deed.5) Use mortgage to discourage lawsuit.6) Use line-of-credit on property to discourage lawsuit.I especially like Garret Sutton's approach in this book by using layman terms to cover subjects that could be hard to understand. Even better yet, quite some examples (or cases) are used to ensure readers fully understand each subject well.I have 10+ rental properties all under my own name. I have been using both personal umbrella and commercial umbrella policies as the shield for asset protection. This book really helps me to have a clear picture how to proceed from here to implement a better asset protection scheme.This book costs me less than 10 dollars. But what I got from it is far more than the book's cost. I highly recommend this book for real estate investors...whether they are looking for tax saving tips or for asset protection recommendations.

This is the 1st time we use a professional class blender. It far out-performs our current white-brand consumer class blender from Walmart. The 1000 watts really gives out strong chopping power to quickly grind through ingredients. For testing purpose, we put ice cubes to see how it goes, which we never dare to do so with our cheap blender. Wow...this beast just chews up the ice cubes like cutting through cotton balls. In about 10 to 15 seconds, the ice cubes are turned into snow! Yes, like snow making machine used in the ski resorts.We also like how easy to remove the blades completely from the pitcher. It makes the afterward cleaning work so much easy now. With my old low-end blender, the blades is not removable from the pitcher. So, it takes some careful clean work to remove food stuck at the button of the pitcher while not to get cut by the blades.The Ninja's blade design allows it to handle large foods. So, we don't need to cut carrots to very small pieces before putting them into the blender. That's some effort saving here.We also like the control button design...especially the pulse mode. So, we can fine tune how fine the food need to be chopped.Overall, we are pleased with this 1000 Watt Ninjia blender. I would recommend it to my friends and relatives.

I use this small area rug to replace my existing 5-year-old area rug at the front door entrance area. That's a heavy traffic area that I use an area rug to protect my carpet.This Loloi Aqua/Green area rug fits my need well from the size point of view. It's low profile and dense. You can really feel the firm support when you step on it. The color and pattern are not too aggressive to the surrounding decoration.Though I am putting this rug on top of my existing carpet, not on a hardwood surface, I still put a layer of non-slip cover under the rug as it's back is kind of slippery.Overall, I think this Loloi Aqua/Green area rug is good quality. If you have a need of small area rug and the warm color tone fits your existing decoration scheme, I would recommend it.

I have some rental properties and I manage some fix-up and renovation work by myself without 3rd hand. From time to time, I run into situations that need another pair of hands to hold stuff for me. I have a portable working bench with vise. But the vise is too weak to hold heavy objects, or wide objects. And my portable bench wobbles.I am so glad to find this jawhorse from Amazon. Majority of the jawhorse are built with metal, only few non-load-bearing components are plastic. It is not only heavy duty, but also very heavy. But that's the good part, its weight helps to keep thing stable.The clamping mechanism is a smart design. I can use both hands to position the object and then use one feet to step on the pedal to clamp the object. And the clamping power is great.When not in use, this jawhouse can be folded down for easy transportation or storage as it really does not take up too much space.In summary, this is a great investment if you need to work on large objects that won't fit in the typical bench vise, or you need additional hands.

The bluetooth wireless speaker is a pretty mature product with plenty of products available in the market at various price range.This bluetooth speaker stands out well comparing with other bluetooth speakers from industrial design point of view. It is very small (a golf ball size when fully closed) and highly portable. The battery life is very good (18-hour run time on wired connection and 10-hour run time on wireless connection). The bluetooth connection is very easy to operate and very fast to get connected with other devices. The included RCA cord at the bottom of the speaker is convenient. It also has a built-in microphone. Frankly, all these features are better than my other bluetooth speakers.However, as a speaker, the quality of audio is one of the most essential selling point. Unfortunately, this speaker has a lousy audio performance. Not only base is virtually not there, the volume is so small. I guess the meaningful usage of this small speaker is when you want to share music from cell phone or mp3 player. With this so-so audio and small volume, I just don't see how this bluetooth speaker can replace the speaker of my notebook, chromebook, or tablet.

I have some rental properties. When properties are in vacant and need some big fix-up work done by contractors, I hang this key storage box at the front door knob with key inside. Just need to text the lock number to contractors for them to access the properties. So far, it has been very effective. It's easy to reset and change the lock #. And it's easy to hang the storage box at the front door. The space inside for key storage is big enough to hold couple of keys. All in all, I am pleased with this key storage box.

I do fix-up works for my own rental properties. Lately, I need to take down some cabinet doors for painting work. I need something to keep the cabinet doors while I am painting. After some web searching, I find this painter's pyramid stands. The price is not that bad. So I give it a try. The stands are made of plastic, I am not sure if it can hold 200 ponds of weight as it claims, but it is heavy duty enough to hold my project (about 30 pounds). The only issue I have with these stands: I hope they could have some weight, so it won't be moved easily. Other than that, I am pretty happy with these pyramid stands, as they effectively keep my project from ground surface during painting.

I do fix-up work for my own rental properties. My folding working bench top is a little bit too slippery. I use this bench cookie work grippers to keep my project steady. So far, they are effective. Also, this bench cookie provides space between bench top and wood board. So I can do drilling work.All in all, these bench cookies are useful in my work. I would recommend it to friends.

Wow....this is quite a project to build the set as there are are more than 700 pieces that need to be put together. To add more challenging to the task...all the 700+ parts are in one single box. Yes, the parts are not pre-sorted and separated into different bags like Lego. Luckily, the instructions are pretty clear. The instruction booklet by iteself has 86 pages, all in color. Seriously, I think they do a good job on the instruction manual.It took my two kids to work together the whole weekend to build the set....and they occupied the whole living room floor as they need to sort all the parts out first. From time to time, I could hear some arguments, but most of the time, they two worked out well. I was happy that I didn't need to step in either resolving their dis-agreement, or to help them out.The final completed kit sits on a base that stands firm. The model includes three play figures: the Master Chief, Cortana and Didact. All these 3 figures are more realistic than those figures from Lego.Seeing the efforts to assemble the set, I seriously doubt this Mega Blok sets are suitable for kids below 12 years old. Definitely not for young kids.

This roller is very light weight but pretty stiff and sturdy. The diameter is kind of large than the ones that I used at gym. The 24 inch length is good, not too long that may require a bigger working space. If you get used to other softer rollers, you will feel a little pain on your muscle initially when using this roller. But you will get used to it. Personally, I like the stiff surface as it does not yield when I pressure on it. It's more effectively to stress my muscle with stiffer roller.The only thing I don't like is the large diameter size. It would great if the diameter is a little bit smaller.

I own some rental properties, and I managed some fix-up work myself. From time to time, I need to move construction related stuff that are heavy loads. I already have two folding hand-trucks to move heavy items around. But one hand-truck is too big (it takes too much of trunk space), and the wheels of the other one are too small (it's hard to move around on rough surface). I find this Costco-brand hand-truck/dolly is a great fit for my application. When in dolly mode, the two wheels has good size for moving around on unpaved surface. When it is folded for storage, it really does not take up too much trunk space.This costco hand-truck/dolly has good construction quality for carry load up to 300 ponds. Yet, itself is not too heavy as some parts are built with plastic. Don't worry, the plastic parts are not in the area for carrying load. The folding and unfolding mechanisms are very easy to operate.I doubt this heavy-duty hand-truck/dolly would be an often-used item in normal households. But I would recommend to keep one in the garage for special occasions. It really does not take too much space when in folded position.

I received a review copyThe power of social media! Author Cassandra Dunn and I found each other online via our love of the Vizsla breed â€“ we each own these Velcro dogs and bonded over ownership of the uniqueness of this breed. When Cassandra let me know her debut novel featured the loveable V, I immediately accepted her review offer.There is a lot more to this novel than the brief mentions of the Vizsla. We get the POV from several characters â€“ Lana, her two children, and her brother Matt. Lana is struggling through a divorce and raising her children, Byron is trying to find his own while in high school and entering the dating world, Abby struggles with an eating disorder and bullying, and Matt has Aspergerâ€™s, and has daily struggles in his life. I thought it was interesting that we got these multiple POVs, but it makes sense when you think about the title. Each character is adapting to something, and over the first few chapters, I began to warm to the pace. While I tend to lean towards the faster novels (a characteristic found in many chick lit books) I was soon into my reading groove.I am highly impressed this is a debut novel, as it was rich, compelling, and definitely tugged at the heartstrings. I loved the overall tone and message of the book, which is basically learning how to not only adapt to changes in your life, but to thrive along with them. And the Vizsla scenes didnâ€™t hurt either :)

I received a review copyThis was my second ever audio book selection, and it was fun to listen to as Jane Green is also our narrator! This book has a lot of serious subjects in here, as Cat is an alcoholic and struggles greatly in her life. While slightly slow in the beginning for me (and I honestly didnâ€™t really feel like the flashback to her mom and Brookâ€™s relationship was super necessary) it picked up for me once Cat learned of her father and her other family living in Nantucket. Then, it started to get really juicy, but just as abruptly, the story switches and we are fast-forwarded in time. That I didnâ€™t love, because then I felt like the pace of the story was once again slowed down as we met this new, older Cat, and understood what her past years had been like after the big incident that forced her to leave her new family behind in Nantucket. The ending is definitely a redemption story and I was rooting all along for Cat, though I do wish more of the story had been on solely her road to that redemption, to her making the amends, instead of all the backstory we got. It was a nice book to listen to on my long walks with the dog, and Iâ€™m sure Jane Green fans will enjoy.

I received a review copyI was so looking forward to reading this book this summer, as Iâ€™ve been hearing so many people praise it. I found it to be a ton of fun, a real page-turner, and the perfect beach read. It was hilarious to watch Imogen try to keep up with all the changes at Glossy and the world in general. But the book was so true and it almost scared me a bit. We are Internet-addicted. We are all about technology and never leaving our phones and trying to get ahead. This book gave me plenty of good reminders not to get too caught up in it all, and that itâ€™s okay to just enjoy life and not put so much pressure on myself all the time. Eve gave me plenty of chuckles as well as â€œI want to throttle youâ€ moments. Looking for a vacation book or just a summer must-have? This is one.

I received a review copyI was planning on taking this book on my vacation this weekend, but I ended up finishing it in less than two days! I absolutely live for books set in Paris and we got along as well as I expected us to :) A fabulous chick lit delight, I was transported to Paris along with Chloe and happily kept up with her life, her job, and her romance up and downs. Perfect for summer, perfect for the beach, and chick lit fans are sure to enjoy!

I received a review copyThis is actually my first book from Stacey Wiedower but I sure hope it wonâ€™t be the last! From the beginning I got caught up in the story, and the heartbreak that is Amelia and Noahâ€™s relationship. Watching them try to make it without each other hurt my own heart, but I couldnâ€™t figure out how the heck the two would find each other again and if they would get their happy ending. I also loved the story of Amelia and having her best-selling book turned into a movie, plus her subsequent relationship with a famous actor. That was so much fun to read about! Overall, a super cute beach read!

I received a review copyTo start, I will say this was my very first audio book I have ever listened to. Since summer means walking the dog several times a day, I thought I needed to join the audio book trend and Iâ€™m sure happy I did. This was such a terrific book to listen to during my long walks, a story filled with struggles and triumphs, delicate family issues, and so much more. Where to start? I have read every book from Sarah Pekkanen and truly love her writing. I get excited when I see she has a new book out, and know I will be in for a terrific story. All true again here. This book deals with a white police officer shooting and killing a Hispanic teenager, but there really isnâ€™t a race issue at all in this book. What I think Pekkanen is focusing on is what effects a family, what effects a marriage, when something so huge and traumatic happens. Yes, we do get into the other issues, and we get both sides of the case, which I thought was great. But the parts that kept me on my toes were watching Jamie and Mike try to keep it together in the aftermath, watching the cracks appear in the once happy family façade, and waiting anxiously until the end to know how this story would play out. There are some fantastic subplots as well, including Mikeâ€™s ex-girlfriend and mother to his child and her role in all of it, which had me holding my breath at times. There was one particular scene where I started to cry, which you can image while walking down my street with my Vizsla at the end of the leash probably caused a funny scene if anyone was watching me. A powerful and gripping read, and one I highly recommend to you.

I received a review copyI have read all the books in the Allison Campbell series, and I love them all! Tyson has a way of bringing you into the world and right in the center of the mystery. Dying Brand was no exception. I loved the short and snappy sections of the book, and it made the story seem to fly by. I couldnâ€™t put the book down, especially as I neared the end. There were so many possible suspects in the death of Allisonâ€™s ex-boyfriend, and I had trouble deciding who I thought was the real killer. Turns out, I really wasnâ€™t close at all! Definitely a mystery series not to miss.

I received a review copyWhat a sweet read! This book was quick but filled with fun. Chase really did seem too good to be true, but he also came with his own unique set of baggage that we slowly learn about. The twist with Lucyâ€™s sister was really sad to read about, but added a lot of depth to the story. This was chick lit and womenâ€™s fiction wrapped into one, and was a delight to read. I have not read the first book in this series, Any Way You Slice It, but that didnâ€™t hinder my reading experience with this one, but definitely made me want to pick that up as well!

I received a review copyTo be honest, I wasnâ€™t sure I was going to end up liking this book as I much as I did when I started reading. The cover didnâ€™t particularly reel me in, but the subject matter did, and I am really impressed with this book on a whole. The beginning does a terrific job at pulling the reader in. Each girl that we follow is so different and has a unique story to bring to the overall book. I found myself invested from the start and happily followed along the way. Highly recommend for new adult fans.

I received a review copyI read episodes 1-3 of Conquest, and I have to say, I thought this was pretty genius. It was a terrific hook for readers, and it really worked for me. This was short and to the point, and just took me a day to read. I could definitely see myself keeping on with the series and moving on the other conquests that are listed. I thought this was a unique read, and especially if you are an erotica or erotic romance fan, I think this is one for you to snatch up!

I received a review copyOh man, this is a true laugh out loud chick lit tale. I absolutely love how this is written, like Avery is talking right to us, and the beginning of each chapter starts with such a hoot. We have a classic heroine â€“ single after her husband finds someone younger, in peril with her job, an abysmal cook (I can relate to that, so that particular scene really stuck with me) and trying to move on and find a new Mr. Right. I laughed so hard I snorted, I giggled so much I got tears, and this is a must for your summer reading list.4.5 stars

I received a review copyWhen reading this blurb, I knew without a doubt that I was going to love this book. I mean â€“ a pet psychic? Yes, please! That alone seriously had me hooked, but I knew I was going to get a fun and funny chick lit story from Tracie Banister as well. I wasnâ€™t wrong, folks â€“ I absolutely loved it! Laugh out loud funny and fast-paced, I followed twins Willa and Sloane without abandon along the way. I loved each character equally, and they are both so well-written and different, yet loveable. Okay, Sloane can be a little rough around the edges and Willa sometimes had her head in the clouds, but two very loveable sisters none the less. The pet psychic parts nearly had me in stitches (and I really wish I had one in this area to help me out with Aries!) and all the romances along the way were quite interesting! Just when I thought something was going down the predictable route â€“ wahbam! â€“ a new twist occurred. A chick lit treat not to be missed!

I received a review copyOoh, what a quick but intense read! The mystery starts off right away, and just climbs from there. Much like in Deadly Bloodlines, I wasnâ€™t sure who was behind everything, and the ending had me surprised. Just when you think everything is wrapped up â€“ it isnâ€™t. Remy was a great character to stand behind, a tough woman who isnâ€™t afraid to stand up for what she wants and believes in. This is especially the case when it comes to her love life, and I found that refreshing to read about. Wonderful series so far!4.5 stars

I received a review copyThis was a book that had me invested from the very beginning. I absolutely love books that flip between past and present. While we only got little clips from Kathleen Eaden on her past, they were full of knowledge and really tied the story together. Each competitor has their own unique story going on, and because this book was pretty thick (I received a hard cover) I knew from the beginning that we get pretty in depth with them, which was the case. Though I canâ€™t cook or bake myself I love reading foodie books, and delighted in the recipes given and the thorough baking guide throughout the way. Sometimes I did tend to mix up the characters since we were following so many, but I truly enjoyed this book as a whole. Perfect for a rainy spring day!4.5 stars

I received a review copyI say this in all my reviews for Nicky Wells â€“ I loved this book! What a fascinating concept this was. This book is definitely more on the mature side, as well, the book was basically all about sex! But it never got raunchy or on the erotica side of things, instead, it explored the relationship between the newly married Alex and Casey, and if indeed they were suffering from a curse that caused them not to be able to have sex. Some parts in here were kind of hysterical â€“ such as one time when they attempted sex and the bed broke, the roof caved in and the bathtub went through the floor. I was reading that scene while applying eye makeup (because I just canâ€™t not multi-task) and I had to take a break so I wouldnâ€™t smear eye liner everywhere because I was laughing so hard. A true romantic comedy, and one for your summer reading list!

I received a review copyReview:If you read my review of The Seeds of a Daisy, you know how excited I was to read the second book from Alison Caiola. And I was not disappointed. This book was very different from the first one, where it explored the relationship between mother and daughter. In this one, we watch Lily try to move with her life after losing her mother and becoming a mother. She is trying to also move on from Robbie, the man she loves but is on a medical mission in Africa, but she quickly learns he has been kidnapped, and the action really starts. This book got my heart beating fast, as we try to rescue Robbie from terrorists with Lily and the C.I.A. and Navy SEALs. I was not expecting this from book two, but it was really spectacular. I canâ€™t imagine the research that was put into this book, and I give major kudos to Caiola for writing such an adventure book. Highly recommend both reads to you.

I received a review copyTo be honest, I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect from this book when I first picked it up. The cover didnâ€™t necessarily draw me in or intrigue me, but this is a classic case of not judging a book by the cover. This is a fast-paced story that left me wanting to read book 2 from this series when itâ€™s ready. Irene is the typical college student â€“ trying to juggle guys, friends, money and family throughout her studies and student life. There is a lot going on in this book â€“ from serious family drama to domestic abuse â€“ but the book never felt too heavy or hard to read. I was highly impressed with the writing from Lori Goldson, and Iâ€™ll say it again â€“ I look forward to more from this series.

I received a review copyOMG, my friends. I said it best on social media when I announced I was reading this book. I said â€œThis book is making me want to pause life so I can just keep reading.â€ I mean...do I even need to say anything else? From the first page, and Iâ€™m not lying, from the first page I knew I was going to be totally hooked. Anita Hughes is one of my favorite writers, and her books have the complete ability to make me get lost in them. I love that this time I was taken to France, and wrapped up in not only a mystery in the present, but from the past. I loved the dueling time periods we get, from Serena but then also Yvette, as she takes us back in time along with her. There was a twist near the end that Iâ€™ll be honest â€“ I didnâ€™t see coming. When a book makes me gasp aloud and my eyes bug out, you know itâ€™s a good one. I canâ€™t say enough good things about not only French Coast but Anita Hughes, and this one is a must-read.

I love this blush! I got a color from the baked collection, which again, Iâ€™m not seeing on their website â€“ the color, not the collection. They must update frequently! But I got a muted pink with some sparkle in it, and I really love it. Iâ€™ve been hearing that Luminoso is a must-have for your collection, and I have my eye on it! I think that will be my next purchase, along with a Bella eye shadow. I didnâ€™t find the blush particularly long-wearing, but itâ€™s such a pretty color. One to pop in your bag on a night out!

For the eyeshadow, I actually went looking for the Bella line when I was shopping, and I guess they were too new for my Kmart to carry (or Kmart was going out of business and wasnâ€™t buying new products...thatâ€™s probably it). Looking on Milaniâ€™s website, I donâ€™t even see this eyeshadow listed, which Iâ€™m not sad for you because I didnâ€™t love it. It was a really light pink with sparkle in it, but when I put it on my lids, it basically was just like putting glitter on there. None of the pink shade really came through, and the only way to get any color was to load up on product and use a liquid like Mac Fix + to help give it a boost. I wasnâ€™t going to recommend that for you, but Iâ€™m still wanting to try out the Bella line, because I really good things about that.

I received a review copyI have also read the first book in this series, and while I usually prefer book one over two, I actually really enjoyed the second one quite a bit more! It was fun and past-paced from the first page, and really never a dull moment along the way. I thought this was chick lit all the way, especially with New York City as the setting, and I think chick lit fans will love this one! The ending...whoa, what a cliff hanger! I kept swiping my Kindle thinking there was no way she could leave us hanging like that. Iâ€™ll definitely be looking for book three in the series!

I received a review copyWhen I first agreed to review the book, I looked at the cover and title and thought it would be chick lit. After reading the synopsis and my eyes catching on the â€œdarkly comic taleâ€ part, I was even more curious about what I would be reading. I am really glad the author added the word â€œdarklyâ€ because I probably would have been completely thrown off guard if not. This book touches on a lot of extremely sensitive subjects, like body-image issues, rape and suicide. Dotâ€™s journey was very interesting yet at times hard to read about, but I commend Lisa Souza for writing a thought-provoking and very honest novel.3.5 stars

I received a review copyWell. All righty then. This book was...wow. Where to start? This is all positive thinking, by the way! This story was juicy, unpredictable and the ending literally caught me with my mouth hanging open. Though it started just a little slow for me and I wondered if I could get a hang of the narration since all four friends get their chance at the POV, I quickly caught on to each women and was hooked. I really donâ€™t want to say much and give anything away, because I truly was blindsided by the ending. It was, for lack of better words, awesome! Please, go get your copy!4.5 stars

I received a review copyA book with mystery, set on the beautiful island of St. John, and our main character is named Samantha. Sounds like the perfect book for me :) This was a quick and humorous read, filled with plot twists and honestly kept me guessing until the very end. Bloomstrom did a terrific job with building scenes with suspense, and also on bring the characters to life. I felt like I was friends with Samantha, and we connected on the Midwest bond, too! Sometimes she could seem like a total air head, but hey, thatâ€™s all right! Her journey made for a fun read!

I received a review copyI donâ€™t often seek novellas out, but I get super happy when I read one and love it. Red Hot Blues is fast, to the point, and a little on the bad side. We got just a quick glimpse into Tellieâ€™s life with her non-traditional (to put it nicely) mother Kittie, but I could definitely see their antics being turned into a full-length book! I was able to read this in just two speedy sittings, because I was having so much getting lost in Tellieâ€™s crazy life! I would definitely check this one out!

I received a review copyI always look forward to reading books that heavily feature travel or taking me to a location Iâ€™ve always wanted to visit. I was really looking for to reading Vacation in Naples for that reason, as the title jumped right out at me. I was expecting to get a beach read, but when I read the synopsis I quickly realized that wouldnâ€™t be the case, and I got even more excited to read this, as I am also partial to a good mystery! While a little slow in places, I still had a lot of fun reading this story. It gave me a few laughs, had me trying to figure out the mystery aspect, and gave me great descriptions of Naples. Entertaining and enjoyable.3.5 stars

I received a review copyYay! I get so excited when I get to â€œmeetâ€ a new author (virtually, of course) and fall in love with their books. That Old Black Magic is the second book in the Lizzie Hart series and I did not read the first book, but that didnâ€™t impact my reading time except that I really, really want to read book 1 now. I had such a fun time getting to know Lizzie and if you follow my blog you know I love a little magic in my stories, so I was sucked in by the title right away! The writing was fantastic, the storyline had me curious the whole time, and I highly recommend! Even though I havenâ€™t read Itâ€™s Just a Little Crush (yet!) I suggest you might want to grab that one too!4.5 stars

I received a review copyDonâ€™t Mention the Rock Star was a quick read, thanks to the short and snappy sections, and to the point plot. We bounce around from Kellieâ€™s past and present, meeting the boy she dated back in the day, and learning about the man she married. This book was really interesting because it discusses the question of can we ever forget our first love, and the added twist in here is that Kellieâ€™s first love went on to become a successful rock star â€“ and now heâ€™s back on the scene. There are plenty of other twists and turns along the way, including one that really took me by surprise. Definitely thought-provoking â€“ give it a read!3.5 stars

I received a review copyIf you follow my blog, you know that I love some magic in my books. Rubyâ€™s Letters delivers a little of everything: intriguing storyline, a dash of romance, a mystery, and ghosts! Because itâ€™s the way I roll, I think I liked the murder/mystery/ghosts the best while reading, but it was so fun to follow along and try to figure everything out â€“ including how the ending would come about. What I also really enjoyed was the humor breathed throughout the pages. A truly fun novel to read, and I highly recommend!

I received a review copyOoh, just like how I love my chick lit! New York Dolls was a quick read, filled with celebrities, fashion, a little romance and a lot of laughs. Denton was easy to get along with, and no one could blame her for getting swept up like she did. It was interesting to read her moral dilemmas as she got more and more involved with her new celebrity friends. The supporting characters were fun to read about as well â€“ Mr. John gave me a few giggles â€“ and the ending actually came with a little surprise, which I thoroughly enjoyed discovering that. Fun, fast, and fresh chick lit!

From my childhood, I remember Ace Bandages that needed those little hooks.  Using Velcro is a big improvement.  Not really much to say.  It's a bandage.  It wraps around a torn muscle.  The Velcro works fine.  As I said; it's a bandage.  :-)
I only use this for baking (ie, mixed with other ingredients).  So, I have no idea how it tastes, or how well it does or does not work in "egg" dishes.  For baking, it works quite well.

Don't own yet, but played last week in a group of 7.  Only one person had played before, but one practice round was enough to get us all up to speed on the rules.  Figuring out the strategies took longer, of course.  Game moves along quickly.  With 7 of us, the game took about 90 minutes to finish, and that time just flew by.Of the 6 of us who did not yet have the game, 5 of us are now buying it.  So, that should give some idea of how enjoyable it was.  You do need a flat surface to play, since you need to see what cards are face-up for each person, how much 'money' each person has, etc.  But, as a card game, it's very mobile...a perfect game to take on camping trips, on family vacations, etc.

The lack of sidespin is a huge flaw.  A such, this is geared towards entry-level players.  It would be very useful for learning the basic strokes.  Most people who would spend well over $500 for a robot likely would want to spend a few hundred dollars more for a robot that can give a wide variety of spins, more placement areas on the table, etc..But, as long as you are aware of the large limitations of this robot and are happy with what it has to offer, you'll probably end up happy with it.

Love the product.  I hate that the "lifetime" subscription ends when a product breaks...a great incentive for TiVo to produce low-quality hardware.  I'd like to see 2 options: (a) a lower-price option that covers only the model you buy, and (b) a higher-priced option, which is a true lifetime service.  Obviously, a great way to ensure a lifetime of TiVo users--no way I'd migrate to a rival DVR if you had this sort of subscription.

Only took about 45 seconds to get the rules.  Game (to 13 brains) took 5 minutes.  Game to 31 took about 15 minutes.  A perfect game to play when you want to do something quick.
