Sophie is a lonely girl with a unique talent. She can bring other peopleâ€™s dreams into reality. Which is how she ended up with a pet Monster, who is as loyal as a dog â€“ and can speak. Sophie helps her parents by collecting dreams from her fellow classmates. But when her parents disappear, Sophie, Monster, and a new friend try to track down the culprit.The Girl Who Could Not Dream is a fun and exciting fantasy for middle readers on up. With fun and colorful characters, and plenty of mystery and suspense â€“ this book was hard to put down. Durstâ€™s novels are always a must-read for me. And this was another one to love â€“ as it was a fun, light-hearted (yet with some dark imagery at times), and unique story.

The Bissell Trilogy is a nice vacuum for small homes with hard floors. My floors are all hardwood and tile. And this does a great job of getting into hard to reach places and getting all of the dust and dog hair that visibly accumulates. My only complaint is that it can't stand upright for storage, since it's too top-heavy. But the power and suction are great for such a small vacuum. The top-heavy design at least means that the top is easily detachable for a hand-held vacuum feature that is great for furniture and smaller areas. It's also lightweight and quiet. I'm really loving this new vacuum.

I have tried out several harnesses on my dog. For us, they are easy as she helps me put them on her. Some slip off to easily when she stops and can back out of them. This Ferplast harness seems like a sturdy, well-made harness that dogs wouldn't be able to slip out of. My only hesitation with using this is how easy it is to undo the break-away straps. I had to adjust the straps to account for her larger size. Unfortunately, it's still a bit too small - and she's only the size of a large Beagle. My biggest concern with the straps is that all it would take is for her to roll around on the ground (which she does often) and the strap could break away. The latches were that easy for me to move, with just a bit of pressure on the latch. If your dog doesn't roll, you're safe. But I won't be risking it.

This activity tracker is for those who don't want to pay for an Apple watch or Fitbit. This is a fraction of the cost. But you get what you pay for. I love that you can get the different color bands and change up the look or just use it in your pocket. The band feels a lot like an Apple watch. And it's sweat-proof. And I love that you don't have to recharge the device every night. However, past the look and feel - the function leaves something to be desired. It just doesn't work as well as other activity trackers. The steps are way off. But for someone just wanting to improve themselves each day, this would be okay. But I wouldn't use it to track actual goals in a day, as it seems to count many more steps in a day than are actually done.

Assembly for this cat tree was extremely easy and only took 10 minutes or less. It's a sturdy design with a bit of weight to it. And the poles are nice scratching posts. The only thing I'm not sure about is the hanging string balls - I think one of the cats may pull those off pretty easily. So far, they've held up. As you can see by the picture, it's a hit with the cats! The blue carpet is soft. And the whole tree fits snuggly in the corner of the room.

I received this faucet and less than a year later, it had to be replaced. It took quite a while to install, and worked fine for a while. And looked great. But almost a year later, it caused a leak under my sink - which caused a mess of problems. But in researching the problem, it led back to a faulty seal with this unit. Even worse, this all happened on Christmas Eve, as we were preparing dinner at my house. Thankfully, Lowes is open on Christmas Eve! I wouldn't recommend this faucet to anyone. It's cheap and cheaply made. I went with a better brand after this.

These foil grill/oven bags are a genius idea. They are sturdier than dealing with most foil, and in a bag shape that saves a lot of time and mess. I will always keep a stock of these (and crockpot bags) from now on just for the ease of cleaning afterwards! These bags are so convenient that they are well-worth the price. Sealed on 3 sides, these really keep in the juices and make for easy cooking of savory meats and vegetables. Loose meats and vegetables are ideal, not full-size birds or hams. Though there are plastic oven bags that will fit them. I highly recommend.

I prefer higher end brands of makeup, but decided to try out this palate. When it arrived, pink powder was everywhere. But as I checked the blush it looked intact. Not sure why there was such a mess. The black eye liner is very chunky, definitely not a fine line if that's what you're used to. I doubt I'll use it. The lip gloss is a light pink, that I'll save to use in spring or summer. Definitely not a fall color. And the blush, while a pretty color, isn't something I'd use. I love Laura Geller baked blushes too much to use anything else. There are instructions on how to use the palate (and get a smoky eye look) on the back of the box AND an insert inside the package, which is very nice. The eye shadows themselves go on very well with a eye shadow brush (I won't use the cheap, dated applicators included), and last throughout the day just fine. And they blend well. And the highlighter is a nice bonus, though I rarely use highlighters. All-in-all, this is a nice kit for the price, if you'll use everything.

I will probably only use this product in the winter time when my face is dryer. I'm afraid of making my face too oily otherwise, as the description says for normal-to-dry skin. I'm pretty much only using this on my forehead and cheeks for now, and the effect is immediate. It goes on very smooth and is absorbed right away. A little bit goes a long way. I'm younger than the target 45, but have a spot on my forehead that I'm looking forward to seeing if prolonged use helps.

These were a nice box of chocolates. I love that there is a nice booklet attached that has a picture of each chocolate with a description. Every different one I tried was delicious and very smooth. This would make a great gift around Christmas. There were a few too many hazelnut for my taste, but I loved the caramel and merengue ones.

Jack Link's Tender Bites Bag, Flamin Buffalo Chicken are definitely NOT spicy by any means. I'm not sure why they're labeled as "Flamin' Buffalo" because there's only a hint of buffalo sauce, and it's not at all hot. There is only the slightest bit of a tang, not remotely hot or spicy. The chicken bites themselves have a very mild taste, and taste what you'd imagine packaged meat to taste like - bland and processed. They are soft tho, and my dog loved them. These might make for a decent snack on the road, but I'll probably use them as (not-so-healthy) dog treats.

This Bubble Bath set contains 3 separate, distinct scents. Surprisingly, the lavender is the only scent I didn't really care for. And I love lavender scents. Maybe because it's a stronger, musky scent. The other two are very nice and mild, flowery scents. I don't use a lot, and it still seems to bubble and work well. The bottles themselves are fairly small, and look like something you'd get from the dollar store. But the quality is MUCH better here, and the smells are no comparison. These smell like much higher end brands. I'd definitely get this again, if offered with Amazon Prime, free shipping.

I had been using a sharpie to cover up my mailing address on magazines, but if the paper is glossy, it doesn't work well and makes a mess if not given enough time to dry. This is a quick, convenient tool to cover print for added security. It doesn't replace shredding, but it is nice in place of just crossing things out. It glides smoothly and quickly. No complaints for what I use it for.

Following the events in The Return of the Jedi, the remaining leaders of the Empire conduct a secret meeting on Akiva. While the Rebel Alliance try to hunt them down. There are a few familiar characters such as Wedge and Ackbar. But for the most part, the main characters of this story are new. And there are quite a few.Aftermath is written in present tense, which takes some getting used to, but I quickly forgot about it after awhile â€“ the same with the Hunger Games trilogy. The numerous new characters were difficult to keep up with at first, making reading a bit slow. But about halfway through, the pacing picked up and the characters became easier to follow as several join forces.There has been quite a lot of blacklash for this Star Wars installment. Itâ€™s certainly not a bad Star Wars novel. If youâ€™re looking for a main character novel with Luke, Leia, and Han, pick up one of the childrenâ€™s novels released this month that will center on those characters leading up to the movie release this winter. This story introduces new characters who become a team, a bit unorthodox and colorful. I enjoyed their adventure and the concentration on one planetâ€™s battle between the Empire and Alliance. I look forward to reading the rest of the Journey to the Force Awakens releases as well.

As a fan of Once Upon a Time, I jumped at the chance to read this original tie-in novel. Red is a fantastic character, and this focuses on her early years before she knows the truth of the wolves in the forest.Redâ€™s Untold Tale is a story of Red and her grandmother struggling financially and Red dealing with bullies. Red also has a secret crush on her best (and only friend) Peter. This quick, fast-paced tale is engaging and suspenseful. My only complaint is that the one of the subplots is left completely unresolved â€“ having to do with . Iâ€™m not sure if there will be another installment, but the title sounds like a standalone. Regardless, the finale doesnâ€™t disappoint with climactic suspense and a sweet resolution. I hope this is just the first of other Once Upon a Time tie-in novels.

Alasdair is a brilliant scientist who dreams of going to college and studying under the man who inspired the work bringing Oliver back to life. Oliverâ€™s memories were wiped when he came back. And he definitely isnâ€™t the same.This Monstrous Thing is an inspired steampunk version of the Frankenstein story. Itâ€™s a wonderful blend of gothic horror, steampunk and YA. The story unfolds in an engaging and suspenseful way. I thoroughly enjoyed this dark and surprising tale.

Call was told he heâ€™s actually not some innocent boy, but supposedly an evil magician reborn inside his body. But he doesnâ€™t feel evil. And he has no memory from this other person. He cares about his family, friends and chaos-ridden wolf. And when Call hears that the Magisterium may kill his father for stealing a dangerous artifact, he decides to flee school and help his father.The Copper Gauntlet is the second installment in the Magisterium fantasy series for middle readers on up. Harry Potter fans will definitely want to check out this series. With engaging characters, quirky creatures, and fascinating magical worldbuilding â€“ this series is now a must-read for me. The sequel is just as fast-paced and exciting as the first novel. The next book canâ€™t come soon enough.

Trenton and Kallista hunt for clues and slowly assemble Leo Babbageâ€™s invention. Meanwhile, Trenton tries to hide his secret life from his friends and family. Trenton is a genius with machinery, but a bit dense with his relationship with girls. Kallista has a brusque and standoffish personality. Sheâ€™s not really likeable at all. You feel bad for her home life and past, but itâ€™s obvious why she doesnâ€™t have any other friends.Fires of Invention is the first in an exciting new scifi/fantasy series for middle readers. The world is fascinating and inspired. The mystery behind Cove is well worth the wait and completely unpredictable. The story is evenly paced, as suspense builds the longer it takes Trenton and Kallista to build the machine. And the finale is thrilling and captivating. I look forward to the next in this series.

Months ago, when I saw that Disney Hyperion was coming out with middle grade novels set in the Star Wars universe and starring the main characters, I knew I had to read them. In this story, Han and Chewie are sent to rescue a spy for the rebellion as the Empire closes in. Preteens to adults will enjoy this exciting adventure, as itâ€™s not really a childrenâ€™s story. Itâ€™s a fun, heist with my two favorite characters, but edgy. The main villain is a new character and was well-developed. Iâ€™d love to see her in future stories as well.Iâ€™m guessing the â€œhints and clues about the upcomingâ€ Force Awakens, is stem from the interludes that are set years in the future, when Han and Chewbacca are older. Even if there arenâ€™t actual clues, these are entertaining enough standalone stories on their own.

Months ago, when I saw that Disney Hyperion was coming out with middle grade novels set in the Star Wars universe and starring the main characters, I knew I had to read them. In this story, Leia and C3-PO join a crew on a subversive mission to thwart the Empire. Preteens to adults will enjoy this novel, as itâ€™s not really a childrenâ€™s story. Though, I loved the fantastic illustrations. Itâ€™s a morally ambiguous mission that leads to some soul-searching from Leia. Itâ€™s a bit dark, with plenty of suspense and fun characters.The â€œhints and clues about the upcomingâ€ Force Awakens probably stem from the interludes that are set years in the future, when Leia is being interviewed about her past. Even if there arenâ€™t actual clues, these are entertaining enough standalone stories on their own.

This margarita mix is super convenient - the whole reason for getting these. Of course, it's not going to be as good as fresh from a restaurant by a professional. 5.5 ounce cans are pretty small though. It states in the description that you can try these without alcohol, but you'll still want to mix in something with it. It's mostly high fructose corn syrup, so it's sickly sweet. It's not really for me. But it's convenient and quick in a pinch.

The Disney Descendants Villain Coronation Evie doll was a big hit in my house. After watching the movie multiple times, my niece was so excited to play with this doll that she was literally squealing. The doll is Barbie-sized, with an overly-large head. But she's still pretty, tho doesn't look much like the actress who plays her. There is a great amount of detail to the flowy dress to the fun accessories. My niece loved the matching ring that she got to wear. The doll's appendages bend and contort - and even pop back into place if pulled out. The only negative I have is the rough-textured hair that doesn't get smooth again with brushing. It never looks quite the same as when it's all tied up in the box. The girls couldn't care less, they've spent hours playing with Evie... and are asking for Mal already.

This is the first time I've tried a boycut fit. Usually, it's bikini. The fit feels a bit off. There should be more stretch to the leg holes. The "breathable" fabric was fine, but I still prefer cotton - and more elastic. The waist was still low enough for my low rise jeans, but the positives didn't outweigh the negatives for me.

The Mashin' Max Game is a fun game for young kids who like fast-paced games like Hungry, Hungry Hippo. My nieces and nephew enjoy it for a while, before getting too rambunctious. The set-up is easy and so are the rules. The characters are cute, and there's enough diversity to keep it interesting for a little while. It says for 4 and up, but I don't think kids would enjoy it much beyond age 10.

The Schleich Horse Wash Area is a German-made toy. The attention to detail is fantastic. From the faux stone work to the etching in the saddle - I was definitely impressed. And the young ones in my life LOVE playing with this. In fact, they just about fight over it, so I may have to order another. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this fantastic toy. It's a nice size with plenty of accessories and the groomer that all comes with the set. Horse lovers will love this set.

Dusty and her friends have a new mystery to solve â€“ keeping her mother from being convicted of murder by finding the real killer. To complicate matters, Paul shows up again but claims he can help. Meanwhile, Dusty and her boyfriend are still trying to be with each other despite being told theyâ€™ll be cursed for their decision.The Nightmare Charade is the third and final installment in the Arkwell Academy series. While each book has itâ€™s own mystery, the overlying arc is finally tied up â€“ and doesnâ€™t disappoint. This story is well-paced and full of suspense, intrigue, strong characters, and fun twists. Donâ€™t miss this unique YA fantasy trilogy. I only wish the series would continue, as Iâ€™ll miss these characters and fantastic worldbuilding.

Carl and a team from Phoenix Island is sent to a compete in a brutal contest â€“ where many die. But there is more going on behind the scenes that Carl will have to face if he wants to get out alive.Devilâ€™s Pocket is the sequel to Phoenix Island. This science fiction thriller is fast-paced and full of intrigue and suspense. The characters are well-developed and engaging â€“ even the unlikeable ones. I thoroughly enjoyed the story and only wish we had gotten to see more of Carlâ€™s enhanced abilities outside of the fighting ring. The television show based on the first novel was cancelled. But the novels are much better than the show, as to be expected.

Nicolette (or Mechanica) is a brilliant mechanic like her mother was. But after her parents died, Nicolette is forced to be a servant for her stepmother and stepsisters. However, she still has her little machines â€“ and dreams of the future.Mechanica is a fun and intriguing twist on the Cinderella story. Nicolette does fall for a young man, but this isnâ€™t a Disney fairy tale. She has a good head on her shoulders and thinks with her head more than her heart. Full of fantastic inventions, magic, and suspense â€“ this story is captivating. YA fantasy meets steampunk in this inspired tale with plenty of heart.

These Wellness Pure Rewards treats are a hit. My extremely picky dog LOVES these. She's usually a gentle treat taker, if showing any interest at all, but she inhaled these. I respect the Wellness brand and love that these are grain free and made in the USA. I expected these to be crunchy like I read in a description, but they are actually chewy and a bit soft - which is another reason my dog loves them, I'm sure. I'll definitely be buying more of these when they disappear.

This Purina Grain-Free dog food has a decent list of ingredients. And my finicky, older dog actually enjoys it. She's a Beagle mix, so smell is everything. She also has a sensitive stomach. She seems to enjoy this new food - at least for now. So I may continue with it. The price isn't bad for a grain-free, healthier option. We'll see how it goes for the next few days.
Didn't work and I didn't have to replace it for my costume.

Poor design.  Workmanship is great, but the buckle sticks to far out to make it practical to use.  It needs a better design so that the buckle hooks closer to the waist and doesn't stick out so far that it is conspicuous and easy to catch on things.
Good materials and workmanship.  Gets a laugh from people. I put it on the back of my Shelby GT500 and I see people smiling and I get comments regularly.
Does not fit on a 2007 Mustang Shelby GT500. Threads are to small.
Materials and workmanship are good on the hoodie and great for fans of Shelby Cobra.  Shrinks a bit when washed so I would recommend going a size larger.
The plastic box on a cord is clever and the contents aren't bad.  The price is reasonable for the survival kit, but the postage is ridiculously high.
Get one before they are forced to change history and their flag.
Great looking and fit perfect on my short Shelby atenna. Fast shipping and good price too.
Well made plastic table.  Great for porch or deck to set refreshments or other items.
I love the emblem, but it took weeks to get it. So if your don't mind waiting for a slow boat from China, it is good quality plastic emblem.CA Luster

I love the Borg Cube.  The green light can be turned on or off.  It can be used for cooling or heating, and it is portable.  If you have an ac outlet in your car it can be used on trips or for tailgating at sports events.
To bad SpotItOut, LLC isn't around any longer.  Great concept for Garmin with celebrity voices and direction programs.  Wish they could work out whatever issues they encountered.
Saw her singing this on a Dodge Ram commercial.  Nice song with a good melody.CA Luster

The first time I saw the Jeep Renegade commercial and heard this song it stuck in my head and I immediately went to Amazon music to find it.  I was happy I was able to purchase it digitally and add to my USB that I play in my Ford Edge.  :PCA Luster

Amazing detail in this miniature Hallmark limited edition Rocketeer.  Fans of the old TV serial shows like Captain Midnight or fans of the Rocketeer books and movie will definitely enjoy receiving this Hallmark Keepsake. It is well worth the money and keep in mind these are sold in limited supplies and can skyrocket in value.CA Luster

My father owned an Ercoupe many years ago and I was lucky enough to fly it with him while he was alive.  This is a great present for anyone that is familiar with this airplane or any flying enthusiasts.CA Luster

I have enjoyed this since it's first release and I heard it playing in a record store and I instantly became a fan of Mannheim Steamroller.  Back then it was only available on LP but I bought the Masters to get the best possible recordings of all their albums.CA Luster

I don't typically enjoy remakes of others music, but DJ Scrappy Coco doesn't try to make it into something it wasn't (i.e. elevator music).  It is a great job of keeping the single hits key sound and making it different without detracting.  Check it out.CA Luster

This review is for the four movie set of Jacob Two Two Meets The Hooded Fang/Tommy And The Cool Mule/Mee-See/Fish Tales selling for less than eight dollars.  Two good and two decent movies for the price of one.  Definitely a family friendly set.  Most kids will enjoy them all and adults will probably enjoy Tommy And The Cool Mule and possibly Mee-See.CA Luster

Exceptional price for a Hallmark Christmas ornament.  Great quality and an excellent gift for airplane enthusiasts.  I'd be surprised if their inventory lasts long at this price.  I highly recommend you get one even if you're not sure who you will gift it to in the future.CA Luster

Does it follow previous fiction stories written about these subjects? Perhaps not, but they were making it up as they went along too.  Don't take it too seriously and you will probably be entertained.  I've seen better cancelled, and far worse still on TV and DVD so as long as those that determine what we get to watch keep it on, I'm watching it.CA Luster

Actors: Emile Hirsch, Olivia Thirlby, Max MinghellaDirectors: Chris GorakFormat: Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, WidescreenLanguage: EnglishRated:  PG-13 (Parental Guidance Suggested)Studio: Summit EntertainmentRelease Date: April 10, 2012Run Time: 88 minutesThe Darkest Hour may not have had a blockbuster budget,  but it puts what it has to great use.  I didn't expect near as much as I got.  Compared to most of the SyFy movies this is far more thrilling and re-watchable. Great story, directing, casting, acting, F/X, locations, sound, and music.  Be sure to catch this gem.A group of tourist visiting Moscow have to use their wits to survive when an alien invasion wipes out most of the city. As they try to stay hidden they meet other survivors and try to find a way out of the city.  One such survivor they meet gives them hope with a discovery of an alien weakness.CA Luster
Great song by the verve.  This song will appeal to a wide audience because it has elements of rock and orchestra.CA Luster

A great movie about those that worked at Blechley Park to crack the German Enigma code.  It was crucial to the Allied effort to reduce the convoys being attacked by submarines.  Good casting, directing, camera work, screenplay, sets, locations, wardrobe, and music.  I recommend it to anyone that enjoys a good drama or WWII movie.CA Luster

I bought this for my wife as a gift.  It arrived quickly and she loves it.  The fit and quality is great.  If you have a pharmacist in the house I recommend this company.  They sell for men and women.CA Luster
Great look and fit.  I like the color and pattern.  They wash and wear well too.CA Luster

Two part miniseries movie from Hallmark.  This version has Patrick Swayze as Allan Quartermain.  Allan takes the daughter of an honorable man from his past in search of the legendary diamond mine of King Solomon. During their journey they encounter a native that wishes to accompany them to complete a quest to save his honor.  The lady is kidnapped and he must rescue her and find the mine.This adaptation of the story is well made and a favorite of women and men.  The casting, directing, locations, camera work, music, stunts, and special effects are excellent.  I highly recommend buying both parts of the movie to add to your Amazon Prime digital collection. This is not available on Blu-ray at this time and getting hard to find on DVD.  Great price for a movie that the whole family will enjoy.CA Luster

They kill their masters.  A little bit Indiana Jones style adventure based on a wonderfully written Michael Crichton story.  The wife and I both love it.  An expedition to set free a gorilla and find a group of scientist that disappeared in the jungle while looking for diamonds for technological advances in communications.  There are many unexpected results once they find a legendary city and mine.  Superb casting, directing, acting, camera work, locations, music, and special effects.  This is well worth adding to your library and a great price to boot..CA Luster

Great Series with one negative.  I am not sure why they feel the need to torture the owner of many of the cars by making them think their car is stolen, repoed, or worse.  A little hurtful ribbing goes a looooooooooooooong way.  Keep that to a minimum and all the wonderful things you do to the cars will be appreciated without all the mind tricks. I am sure most owners don't laugh about those gags themselves afterwards.  I find myself saying that's just not funny regularly.Fans of automotive shows should enjoy this series.  Incredible car restorations with a level of restoration you will rarely see anywhere else.  Foose is an excellent leader and really has his heart in the right place.  I also like the fact he pays close attention to the details of the likes of the car owners.  He tries to maintain as much of the original car as possible and design changes that improve instead of deter from the original concept.CA Luster

A good mix of the New Wave music from the 1980s with well known artist for the era.  Be sure to check out New Age music from the 1980s as well by artists like Mannheim Steamroller, Yanni, Patrick O'hearn, David Arkenstone, and Enya.

This is old style indeed as some have said, and the creature looks like they re-used a 1950s Leech monster.  The movie shows age in the overall film effects and picture quality. You have to be patient with it like the first creature features because it isn't the same quality as Alien [HD].  It is still reasonably good considering it wasn't big budget or a blockbuster even when it was first released.  I still enjoy it and the price is good enough to buy the digital version.Recommendations: Leviathan, The Abyss, and Deep Blue SeaCA Luster

I like the first two Halloween movies and H20 because Jamie Lee Curtis as Michael's sister isn't going to just lay around and wait to die.  That and Michael being indestructible and stabbing everyone to death wasn't boring.  After the first two it pretty much get's old.  I wanted to say to those creating Halloween 3 through Halloween Ad Nauseum (aka How Long Before they Bankrupt Us For Keeping Michael Alive), use some originality and have Michael use something besides a big butcher knife, and let the people fight back more instead of being sheep to slaughter.  Curtis and Donald Pleasance are great in the first two movies.  If you want a good scare, catch this movie.Recommendations: Halloween [HD], Halloween H20, and The Cabin In The Woods [HD]CA Luster

Leviathan was a bit of a disappointment for the critics compared to some of the high voltage super SciFi hits in the genre during the late 1970s and the mid 1980s.  Remember movies like "Alien" (1979), Escape From New York (1981), "The Thing" (1982), "Blade Runner" (1982), and "Aliens" (1986).  Some probably considered this a B movie.  I am here to say I like it, but I will admit I have a taste for anything in this genre as long as it doesn't try to be outrageously bloodthirsty or fall on it's face with horrible F/X.  Leviathan works because they borrowed a little from a couple of other movies, but they twisted it enough to keep you guessing a little.  They did a pretty good job with the confined atmosphere in the underwater mining facility and the characterizations with some well known stars as well.  At least rent it, I don't think you will be disappointed.Recommendations: The Abyss, Deep Blue Sea, and Deep Star SixCA Luster

I'm not an expert on Asylum films, but I have been watching B movies for over fifty-five years.  We all know there is a large portion of SciFi out there that we don't want to waste our time on once let alone buy.  Fortunately this B movie falls in the category of worth watching and even buying.  I am considering adding this to my SciFi library because I could see watching it a few times.  Good production values, writing, casting, acting, F/X, and music.  A virus is spread from a little girl that arrives in New York airport.  A Colonel wants it to create super soldiers even though they become large mutant bloodthirsty wolves.  A lone major and a scientist must fight even the military to keep them from stopping treatment for the virus to help the infected.  I hope this comes out in Amazon Prime Digital.Recommendations: Dog Soldiers, Red: Werewolf Hunter, and Bad Moon [HD]CA Luster

Divergent is in fact divergent.  It has elements of stories that may remind you of some other movies like The Hunger Games.  That said it is unique and engaging, and still keeps the action fan in us happy.  If you enjoy Science Fiction movies that are philosophical about a utopian society you will probably be pleased.  I found it exciting, emotional, and intelligent.  It isn't easy to combine those into a theme that doesn't seem either over the top ridiculous or mushy.  It is successful in making us see a society of people divided into five factions.  Although it seems perfect, inevitably someone gets the idea they are better for ruling the rest.  In this case the supposed intelligent lawmakers.  Was this a jab at lawyers?  The peaceful agrarians that have been the decision makers are now in danger of being overthrown by the treacherous cold and calculating leader of the lawmakers.  These lawmakers shouldn't be capable of such treachery and yet the leader somehow has convinced others like the leader of the law keepers it is for the greater good.  Now to add a twist there are those in the society that could fit in anywhere they want because they have the makings of all, but this divergence is considered a threat and so they are ostracized and are killed or forced to flee the protection of the city.  Perhaps a jab at our worldwide societies having difficulty finding rulers that have intelligence, compassion, and strength of character to stand up for everyone.  I had heard mixed things about the movie, but I'm glad I decided to rent it.  Although I thoroughly enjoyed and purchased both Hunger Games, I found this more thought provoking and I plan to add it to my library too.  It seemed to me they left Divergent open for the possibility of a sequel, at least I hope so.CA Luster

A farmer (Boar) from the Boar War in South Africa travels to forget the horror the war did to his family and his past hunting the natives.  The British have given him amnesty for fighting against them, but the enlisted men despise him.  He is hired by a British officer to track a murder suspect when a British enlisted man is found dead.  His tracking abilities are better than even a local tracker. He captures the suspect but has his doubts about him being the killer during their cross country trek back to civilization. Good story, acting, cinematography, and music.  Well worth a rental, and I am considering adding it to the library.CA Luster

The movie was the first to have surround type screen and three projectors to show it.  It is a movie of epic proportions with a sweeping story.  The more you find out about the making of it the more you will be impressed.  Alfred Newman did a magnificent job of conveying with music the adventure, grandeur, heroism, injustice, and sorrow of exploring the West and settling it with all sorts of challenges.CA Luster

The Magnificent Seven is a great soundtrack.  The Main Title and Calvera are my favorite.  This sounds just like I heard it in the theater.  This is not a digital upgrade so it does not have the same quality as current recording standards and should not be reviewed based on those standards.  Keep in mind this was made in 1960 and originally released on LP record.CA Luster

This is the original Alfred Newman soundtrack from the movie.  If you like music from Westerns, especially grandiose style, you should enjoy this music.  I saw the movie with my family as a child.  I loved the music then and now.  If you enjoy this soundtrack, check out soundtracks for "The Magnificent Seven", "Once Upon a Time in the West", and "The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly".CA Luster

Made of heavy plastic, the ammo box will last a long time.  The two clips on one end keep it tightly sealed.  It is plenty large enough to store lots of Zombie combat supplies.  I filled my with various items I picked up here on Amazon that should keep me well stocked to survive the Zombie Apocalypse.CA Luster

Now for those that like the originals or a close facsimile this is your music.  I don't know for a fact this is the original but I have seen the movie enough times to know it sounds like the original music.CA Luster

Now if you want soft versions of the original music to lazily listen to as background this is your music.  However, if you're looking for the flavor of true spaghetti then I suggest looking for Morricone's versions for the movies.  This sounds like it was made to play in hotel lobbies and elevators.CA Luster

Being a huge fan of Westerns, especially the Spaghetti genre I have to say this album doesn't sound like the originals.  Take my word for it I am collecting MP3 versions of those that are original or very close to them when the originals are not available. Now it's okay for some background, but if you compare the songs to the actual originals in the movies you will see they are not a match.  These have more of a elevator version tone.CA Luster

If you enjoy action/thriller movies with Arnold you will want to see this film. He plays an agent for witness protection assigned to protect a whistle blower. A nice tie in with the main story from a previous person he saved. Plenty of action keeps it moving at a good pace. Good story, directing, casting, acting, and music.  I like the fact it has a touch of humor as well. To bad that Arnold didn't do more with this character in sequels.  Would still love to see him team up with Tommy Lee Jones in something along lines of Witness Protection or Marshal service.  Morton Downy Jr. and/or Johnny Depp would be good additions.CA Luster

Now if they just make one called Sanity Clause at Christmas.  ; ) Good story, casting, acting, and suspense.  This has more red herrings than a can could hold.  Probably one of the best things about the movie is not knowing till the last few minutes who killed everyone.  This is worth a rental for that alone.  If I saw this it must have been years ago.  It's a sleeper thriller.  Now you may not enjoy it enough to want it in your library, but I recommend you at least rent it.CA Luster
Read my lips "Riiiip Offffffff!".  Get it at Costco or Walmart for half this price.  I bought a 12 pack at Walmart a few days ago for under $11.CA Luster

Pros: They got to fly some of the best planes in the world brought about by a war for air supremacy.Cons: They were fighting against a madman's attempt to conquer the world and he didn't care if he wasted pilots trying to do it.I have been lucky enough to fly in a few planes from that time.  I can't imagine what the air combat must have been like.  My cap is off to the brave men that went through it.CA Luster

Brilliant idea.  When I saw that bridges are being destroyed by metal/brass locks and they are considering fining people, I thought well why not make them of plastic and the proceeds go to bridge restoration.  Well this is probably better because no locks go on the bridge, but you have a photograph to show your love.CA Luster

Wife and I enjoyed this comedy about a cop that takes his clumsy brother on a ride a long.  Some good casting, writing, and stunts make it well worth a view.  I can see going back and watching this one again.  If you liked it be sure to catch "White Chicks".CA Luster

This is fairly funny with a good cast, and not a bad story.  Borderline great but not quite there.  A group doing a medieval/fantasy re-enactment find that the book they are using spawns a real demon and all hell breaks loose,CA Luster

Okay, so when I first saw this product I couldn't help but think that it was not a well-conceived idea.  I asked myself, "Who in their right mind would want a collapsible Silicone Water Bottle?"  But after using it for a few weeks I now find myself wondering how I ever lived without it!Prior to this bottle, I carried with me a used plastic water bottle, or sometimes if I was feeling fancy I'd use a thermos.  The plastic water bottle would crinkle and make tons of noise while in my bag.  The thermos was big and bulky and heavy.  Both did the job, but both were not convenient.  So in comes the Collapsible Silicone Water Bottle.  I was able to just roll it up and put it in my bag, it made no noise, was tiny, and very compact.  When I passed a water fountain, I would open it up, it would expand into the shape of a typical water bottle, and I would fill it up!  When finished, I'd just rolled it back up and put it in my bag.  Very eco-friendly as it has minimized my waste-byproducts significantly, as I was drinking bottled water previously.It is about 17oz in size, has a hooked top with a clip so you can easily clip it to your belt, or a bag or something. It has top you can unscrew to fill it via the wide opening, and also a flip one where you just squeeze the bottle to drink.  I try to minimize the contact I make with the bottle, and in doing so it keeps the bottle clean for much longer.There were no residual tastes or odors and I love having it!  I am thinking of buying several more, especially giving one to my wife to keep in her purse as she tends to lug around a water bottle right now as well, and this honestly is superior to that.  Highly recommended!DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. My wife is an amateur make-up enthusiest and likes trying new types of skin care products, make-up, and accessories. I have multiple lanterns, and so far, this one is my favorite!  This thing looks amazing, like something straight out of a SCI-FI Movie!  Honestly, you could strap this to your arm and just use it for cosplay as it looks like some futuristic alien power generator or weapon!  This is really a cool looking lantern!With that said, the lantern itself is actually pretty well made and doesn't feel cheap.  It has some weight to it and feels solid.  In order to activate the light you just pull up on the handle and it smoothly slides open to reveal the light.  It is very bright and plenty to illuminate your immediate surroundings.  I have a couple of lanterns that are brighter, but not in this price range, let alone all the extra features!This lamp has six tiny LEDs that combine to reflect off the polished reflector. The outer surface is made of plastic, but it has a faux brass look to it, again, great for SteamPunk Cosplay perhaps?  It has three AAA rechargeable batteries included and is charged via an included cable, which is short and proprietary but it works. There is also a USB port that turns the lantern into a portable power bank, giving the ability to charge other devices.I did test the built in solar charging and after leaving it out on my southern facing deck for an entire day, I believe it was able to trickle charge a good amount, as it went from being near dead, to producing a bright light.  I will have to deplete the battery, leave it out on a clear sunny day and then time how much charge it has.Overall, it is great quality, has great features, and is definitely a great value given the quality of the light and just how versatile this device is!  And again, it is a great if you need a SCI-FI Prop.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I am relatively new to coffee grinders, but I can't imagine them getting much better than the Idson Ceramic Burr Manual Coffee Grinder. I have used many sleep masks in my life, some are those cheap cloth ones, others such as the MindFold, which completely blocks out light and allow you to open your eyes completely and see nothing, pitch blackness.  Given my experience with eye masks I was anxious to try this one.The mask is very comfortable, and has a padded area that feels good.  It also seems to work well in being breathable keeping you from getting hot or sweaty.  The elastic is easily adjusted and comfortable, I could see sleeping with this without issue.I do have a large face and my nose is not very large, so the issue I was having is that you can look straight down and still see light.  So if you're looking for a mask to completely block out light and you have a smaller nose this may not be the one for you.  That is honestly the only flaw, but unfortunately that is the major purpose of a sleep mask, to block out light, while being comfortable and not putting pressure on the eyes.Overall, if you're looking for a mask to block out 100% of light and you have a smaller nose this probably isn't for you.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I tried the Aprince Suction Cup Soap Dish (Style 2), the Aprince Suction Cup Hook Holder (Style 1), and also the Aprince Suction Cup Paper Holder (Style 3). Unfortunately I am unable to provide separate reviews for the items, so they will be combined in this single one.Aprince Suction Cup Hook Holder (Style 1)I was looking for suction cups to hold a net in the bath tub for my son's toys.  The suction cups that came with it were not strong enough and would constantly fall.  So I installed these to hold up the rather large net and it has held up for many weeks now and has not lost any suction!  The bath tub is a plastic one, not tile, and I did clean the area well and dried it prior to apply the suction cups.  In all, it seems to be able to easily hold a ton of wet toys, probably weighing close to 20 lbs without any issues.  As for the look, it looks great, and honestly, if you don't look closely, it almost appears to be a permanently mounted hook.  It seemed to work best on glass or super smooth surfaces.The quality of the hooks is very good, they are a chrome-plated plastic with some stainless steel elements.  This is good because the plastic will be resistant to corrosion in moist environments like in a shower.  The actual hooks swivel inside the mount as well. My favorite feature is the red ring on the button that notifies you if it is losing suction. The literature states it can hold up to 30KG for a short period of time!  Not sure how long that is, but so far I've had it easily hold 20 lbs without issue.Overall, I highly recommend it, as this is probably the most durable, well made suction hook I have ever used, and for the money you get a set of two of them!Aprince Suction Cup Soap Dish (Style 2)I have had an issue in my shower where the soap will get all soggy and fall apart from the built in soap holder. It did not have proper drainage or air circulation so I knew I had to find a new solution as I was wasting so many bars of soap!I ran across the Aprince Suction Cup Soap Dish Holder and it looked to be exactly what I was looking for!  I received one soap holder, and the quality was incredible, very heavy duty stainless steel, it felt almost commercial. I thoroughly cleaned an area within my shower, and pushed it on to suction it.  The suction cup itself is great, it has a red edge to the suction button, so if you see red start appearing it means the soap dish is losing the suction.  I have had my suctioned to my shower wall for several weeks now and it is still as strong as the day I first placed it!  The design allows air to circulate and for the bar of soap to dry completely!  I honestly think this thing would easily pay for itself as we've noticed our bars of soap lasting much much longer!Aprince Suction Cup Paper Holder (Style 3)This was similar to the other items.  Had a great vacuum, as the suction has held for weeks and not weakened at all!  It is stainless steel, high quality, and held my toilet paper roll exactly as it should!  Highly Recommended!DISCLAIMER: I was provided a discounted or sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I love Star Trek, although I wouldn't consider myself a "Trekkie" but I have seen all the TV shows, well, except for DS9, have not gotten around to that, but hopefully will some day soon! When I was given the opportunity to own a pair of Star Trek Cuff Links I figured, why not!?The cuff links arrived in a little plastic baggie stuck inside a black jewelry box.  So if you're buying this as a gift I would recommend opening it up, and putting the cuff links properly into the jewelry box for proper presentation.  Honestly, that is the only real negative here, the fact that they didn't go the extra step to place these in the box properly.  But to be fair to them, this probably saves a ton of money, which they have obviously passed on to the consumer, as the price is incredible for the quality, especially with it being Star Trek related, as that tends to always command a premium.The actual link itself is about an inch long, and the Starfleet Logo is painted on metal.  The paint looks durable, but I have not worn it enough to see how much abuse they can withstand.  But honestly, how often are you going to wear them?  Unless you're an executive that is in a suit, daily, you probably will only wear these a few times per year on special occasions. The fact that the logo is black and white is great as it means it will essentially match anything you pair it with. They are also light and are not noticeable at all when wearing them.Overall, a high quality great product that I would recommend as a gift for any Trekkie in your life.  Besides the need to properly unpack and present prior to gifting, and maybe the paint job being not as detailed as I'd like, it is a great gift!  And really, no one is going to notice it unless they are literally several inches from it, and if they are that close to your wrists then, well, they are probably a close friend, and probably aren't going to be a jerk and call you out on petty details such as that.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I was actually in the market for a portable sewing kit and was happy when I was given the opportunity to try this one out!  I will be honest, I don't know much about sewing kits, nor am I very good at sewing, but it is always good to have a kid like this around in case you need to fix a tear or reattach a button!The sewing kit comes in a little plastic bag, and the actual sewing components are in a stiff zippered holder. It has a pair of tiny scissors, some needles, buttons, a safety pin, a seam ripper, threaders, measuring tape, as well as some assorted threads.  It really has everything needed for an emergency.I did go by Wal-Mart after getting the kit to see how much all this would cost separately, and I was surprised to see just how cheap sewing supplies are!  I priced out everything, as if I was going to build my own kit and it was about half the price of this particular kit.  But to be fair, I still did not have a zippered organizer case, and the amount of time I spent picking out all the items, then to pay for each item, then to go home and organize it, well, it takes time.  So what you're paying for here is a sewing kit, with the necessary things you need, already assembled into a convenient carrying case. That is what you're paying the premium for. As for the actual case itself, it seems to hold the items pretty well, I have had a few come loose inside, but with the case being zippered I have not actually lost anything.Overall, this is a decent quality kit, that takes all of the work out of buying and organizing the components yourself.  It is great for travel and I keep it in my laptop bag so that if I have any emergencies between meetings I can easily mend my clothing. Honestly, the kit is great and overall functional, but isn't something super impressive or mind blowing.  It gets the job done and that is what you're paying for.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I actually own half a dozen headlamps, I love them and use them often.  I mean think about it, when you're outside in the dark it is a good idea to have your hands free.  Why hold a flashlight that you have to point in the direction you're looking, when you can just have one strapped to your head that automatically does it for you?  And most of the time when you are in a dark place with a flashlight you're there for a reason, typically to fix or retrieve something, and it is pretty darn convenient to have both of your hands free. So that is why I switched from handhelds to headlamps years ago, as it just doesn't make sense to have a hand held flashlight in most circumstances.The headlamp contains a standard elastic band that you can easily adjust to fit your head size. It has 3 different positions allowing you to point it at exactly the direction you'd like. It also has a bright white led and also a red one as well. The build quality is pretty good and it is supposedly water resistant although I did not test that out.  The design itself isn't anything fancy but it is built well to withstand abuse and I can see it lasting through a lot of it. The headlamp runs on three AAA batteries and is easily replaced and securely locked.Overall, compared to other headlamps, this one ranks near the top!  Yes, there are better ones, brighter ones, and more durable ones, BUT they also cost significantly more than this one, and for the value, it honestly isn't worth it to upgrade past something with this quality and in this price range.  I have a $90 headlamp that is only slightly better, for that price I could almost buy 4 of these!  So I could break this headlamp through severe abuse, several times, and still come out ahead!  Great Quality, Extremely Bright, Highly Recommended!DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I have many bluetooth headphones, and several of the neck style ones, including the LG Tone, which these actually look very similar to. The Bastex Bluetooth headphones actually are a pretty good value given the features.  It functions very similar to the LG Tone.  Call quality was good, as well as microphone quality. Again, this is significantly cheaper than the LG Tone, and although it was not as good, it was good enough given the price.These use Bluetooth v4 which gives better connection quality as well as improved battery life. The headphones include a Micro USB cable and it came in a baggie, so it is not in a packaging state to be gifted unfortunately.  If there was a nice box it would have improve the presentation but at this price, I am sure they figured they woudl rather pass the packaging savings on to the customer instead of charging us for a prettier box, which is understandable.All the controls seem to be on the left side fo the device, and it only takes a few minutes to learn how to use them by feeling around and experimenting. The micro usb charging port has a cover over it to help keep out dust and debris, and although this felt flimsy it seemed to stay in place when pushed back in. The magnetic headphone holders worked well although they did nto hold the headphone earbuds as well as the LG Tone.  It typically took multiple tries to get both headphones held in place by the magnets. The wire is plenty long enough and the slack can be adjusted.I was able to easily pair this with an iPhone 6 and also an Amazon Fire Phone without issue, as well as a random Bluetooth dongle I had lying around.  Sound quality was pretty good, actually slightly better than expected but not as good as the LG Tone.  Microphone quality was good as well and callers said I sounded fine although occasionally muffled or low. Battery life isn't so bad either I've used it for 8 hours without issue, when charging it glows red and shuts off when done.The build quality feels durable, although the plastic doesn't feel as solid as the LG Tone.  I do feel it will hold up just fine though and the lighter plastic does help give it a weighless feel when wearing it around the neck.Overall, for the price it is a really good value.  The sound quality and microphone quality aren't the best, but they are very mangeable and work well given the price.  At the cost you could easily buy several of these over the price of a single LG Tone, so if you are prone to losing things that might be a better option.  There are better neck headphones out there, but not at this pricepoint.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I tend to the gym a few days a week, struggling to get into shape and lose some weight.  It is all about changing your lifestyle and you do that by implementing new habits. I have been a watch fanatic for years and I have owned many different types of watches and bands available.  I own several Omega Watches, Rolex Watches, a Breitling, and a Tag Heuer.  I also own a Seiko, a Citizen, and my previous daily work watch (Before the Apple Watch), which is a Casio G-Shock.  Overall, what I was trying to say here is that I know watches, and I know watch bands.  So when I received this watch band for my Apple Watch, I will say, that I was impressed!So I said I was impressed, yes, by the watch band itself, but the box?  Well, that left much to be desired.  It comes shrink wrapped in a box, not a watch box or velvet lined presentation case, but just a cardboard box. This is fine, as it gets it to you in one piece without flaws, but if you are thinking of gifting this to someone I would probably suggest heading over to a local jewelry store and possibly obtaining a box for a few dollars.  But honestly, I don't think most folks will care, as they will forget about the cardboard box the minute they lay eyes on the watch band itself!The watch bracelet is very high quality.  It appears to be a stainless steel with a wonderful finish that reminded me a lot of the Rolex and Breitling!  It does have some weight to it, which I love, but if you're looking for a light wristband then I would definitely not suggest this.  The quality is there, and with the quality of the metal comes with it weight. The clasp itself works precisely and locks the watch onto your wrist, not releasing until the buttons are properly actuated.  This is very similar to my Tag Heuer and Omega Watches.  Again, the quality of this band rivals those!The included watch band tools are also a great touch!  To be honest, the tools themselves are typical cheap tools, like ones you'd find on eBay or a discount watch website. They work, and work well, but they are not durable, as I have owned similar ones previously and they will work for a few dozen uses before finally cracking.  But they are fine for this, as how many times are you going to remove your watch band anyways?  Probably never if you put this one on, as it is REALLY good.  And once you size it up and remove the links you're good to go.The tempered glass screen protector and clear bezel cover were great additions and they worked and looked great!Overall, this is worth the money, as I have spent far more on watch bands that were not even close to the quality of this one!  In my opinion, it is even better than the official Apple watch band, and at the price difference, is is most definitely worth it!  Even if the watch band somehow broke, you could replace it many times before costing the same amount as the Apple one.  If you're looking for a stainless steel band, then this is it!DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I have reviewed other beard balms and beard oils in the past, so I am definitely no stranger to such products.  When I received this product I was impressed that it was packaged, sealed in a bubble wrap pocket, and the bottle of oil was also inside a nice little canvas like bag.  It gave it a very fancy, nice presentation.  It also came with the tiniest little bottle you've ever seen, which was empty, but I assume is meant to put a little bit of oil in to take along with you as it is just enough for a very light application to a moderate beard.I will say that this beard oil smells very good, slightly minty but still very masculine, although the aroma is not very strong. When applied, it conditioned the beard, softening it and making it look and feel great. The skin in, around and underneath did not feel oily either, but keep in mind you have to apply this lightly and not soak your beard. The oil also seemed to help with the scratchy feeling and made the beard feel more comfortable on the face.  It also seems to have tamed the frizziness, making it appear much less scruffy.Overall, the product quality is high, the package presentation is at a level that it can easily be gifted that way, and the oil itself is great, non-irritating and helps soften and tame the beard while conditioning it.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I LOVE SHOWER HEADS!  They can make shower time fun, or they can make it dull, as it is all in the presentation and feel of the water.  The KFL08B 8" Modern Round Shower Head caught my interest and I just had to give it a try!The actual shower head itself is made out of a high quality stainless steel that seems to resist water spots pretty well.  The stainless steel should offer up protection against corrosion over the years and the build quality is very durable.  The silicone rubber nozzles are also great and they help to minimize mineral build up over time.  If you ever do have a nozzle not functioning as designed you just have to massage it a little to break up the minerals and it will again work good as new.  The actual look is interesting, as it is 8" across and very thin, it does have a very modern feel to it.I had originally installed it at an angle, to see how it would work.  It actually worked really well and produced a powerful flow.  I then installed it directly overhead and I honestly liked it better that way, as it did give it a strong rainfall effect and felt better.  Again, slightly better overhead, but worked great at an angle, so don't be afraid of that.  The water pressure was consistent across the nozzles and it actually seemed to have increased my water pressure.This particular showerhead does not have any adjustment controls, but personally when I am in the shower I just want an enjoyable experience without too much thought or effort.  I just want it to work, especially since most of the time I am still have asleep so trying to fiddle with adjustments is not something I want to do in the mornings.  I have owned numerous adjustable shower heads and honestly, after the first few days you tend to never touch the adjustments again.  It just becomes too much effort.  So I don't think it is a major loss, especially with this shower head, as it just works, and it works well.As for water useage, this did use more than my previous shower head, but it was not as significant as some of the larger rainfall heads.  I wil say though, this is definitely not a water-saver model, but it isn't too wasteful either.  It is a good balance and we still had hot water left over (50 gallon gas heater) after using it for 2 showers over the course of 35 minutes.Overall, I love the design, I love the quality, and I love the wide even spread of the water.  The stainless steel mirror chrome finish looks great and the rubber silicone nozzles compliment it well.  The super thin design is also eye catching, as most shower heads are really fat, but this one, it is thin and beautiful!DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I have purchased many hose adapter nozzles over the years, some from Wal-Mart, some from Lowes, and some from the Dollar Store.  They tend to work great at first but over time start to have issues, leaking everywhere, before eventually breaking.  Due to this I have been on the look out, constantly, for a better option.I was given the opportunity to give this nozzle a try, and being skeptical I figured it would work great for a day or two before being completely damaged.  I hooked it up to my hose, and began going through the different settings.  It has the following settings:CONEJETCENTERMISTSHOWERRINSEFLATSOAKERYes, 8 settings, I have no idea how they were able to fit so many in such a small package, but I have never had one with this many.  Each of the settings worked great, the only one I feel should have been lsightly better was the SOAKER, as it just seems to dribble/pour out at a low pressure, but I suppose that might be the point, to just soak something.The handle itself is plastic, while the nozzle part is metal, and the adjustment ring is plastic.  It has a good weight to it and feel pretty heavy duty and not like the cheap dollar store ones. The handle is slip resistant and comfortable to hold. One of my favorite feature is a little clip that will keep the hose on, spraying, without you even holding it.  It also has two washers for you to install if need be into the spray nozzle and your hose if you need.The one issue I have noticed was that the paint on the metal part seems to chip easily.  This is more a cosmetic issue and it has not impacted the actual function of the device.  The nozzle has been dropped numerous times, and I have let my 4 year old son play with it and trust me, he was not gentle, and it still works like new!  It has passed the toddler test!Overall, this is a premium hose nozzle, and it is somewhat pricey compared to other options available at your local stores. But I do honestly feel that this one might last quite a bit longer.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I have always felt that cables, large and small, expensive and cheap, tend to be similar in quality and design. What does matter is when a cable is certified, and in this case, the Amroke Lightning to USB cable is MFi Certified by Apple computers, which attests that it has passed their quality standards.  With that, you are being reassured that the cable won't be a complete gamble and will charge and transmit data precisely.I have used the cable for several weeks now and have noticed no issues.  It has performed flawlessly and worked without problem.  I will say though that I do not jerk the cable around, nor did I manhandle them.  The cable is used in my vehicle and I tend to just plut it in when using the GPS app on my phone or iPad.Overall, for the price, it is within the prices of many other cables.  I feel it is a good value and cheap enough to warrant buying several to have available to you.  The quality was great and it just worked.  I think the biggest selling point though is the warranty, as the manufacturer provides a lifetime warranty and they truly seem to want you to be happy with the product.  Most of the other cables in this price range tend to have very limited warranties, but not the Amroke. There are cheaper cables, but none at this quality and warranty.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I have reviewed a lot of Bluetooth headphones, and I will be honest, when I opened this up I was a little taken aback by the size and design.  They are somewhat larger then others out there, and didn't exactly look as fashionable as other, more expensive options.  But honestly it isn't much larger and for the price, if it works, it would still be a great value.One I put them on, the DBPOWER BE-900 HIFI Bluetooth headphones actually looked pretty good.  They are black in color and finish and have a stiff wire that connects the two pieces which goes behind your head. The box also has several different sized ear pieces to help customize your fit. The instructions suggest charging them for at least 6 hours, but I went ahead and just left them overnight. It did come with a micro USB Connector to charge with, but honestly, it will work with any micro USB cable, as they are everywhere these days.This synched via Bluetooth on several different devices without issue.  I connected it to my iPad, iPhone, and Amazon Fire Phone without any problems. All I did was hold teh power button until it began flashing red and blue, and then found the headphones on my device.  The buttons on the headphones can skip songs, or adjust the volume.The fit was not as snug, so there was some exterior noise invading the music, but they did stay on my ears.  Honestly though, I liked the fact that I could still hear what was going around me somewhat while listing to music.  I am unsure how much the noise canceling made a difference, as it just seemed to change the audio a bit, but at this price point, I didn't expect much as most headphones with that feature tend to cost much more.Overall these are great headphones for working out.  The sound is pretty good, I'd say better than average, and it fits tightly onto your head so they stay in place.  They are a little large, but no one will care, and honestly they look fine.DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

This beard Balm smells great!  It also gives a cooling sensation on the skin. I would dab a little in the morning after I got out of the shower, just rubbing it in with my hands.It helps the beard become softer and easier to manage.  It also does not leave a greasy oily residue. Overall it really did smooth out my beard. It really makes the beard feel comfortable on  your face. It also seemed to help tame the frizz and relax the curling.It may not look like much with the small bottle, but a little really does go a long way and it seems to work better if you don't over use it!DISCLAIMER: I was provided a sample unit by the company. It conditions it well providing a very soft feel to it, reducing prickliness significantly. It also smells wonderful.The amount you get in the bottle, although it looks insignificant, is quite a bit at 4oz.  A little goes a long way I can easily see this lasting a month or more with daily use. The pump dispenses just the right amount for the average beard. I have a lot of car chargers for my various devices. The kitbest Car Charger is actually very good quality and feels durable. The USB ports were a little snug but I don't see it breaking down anytime soon.  There is a little LED light that indicates power charging and is faint enough to not be distracting during night driving. The ports are very close together so any USB cords you use will not have to have a bunch of extra plastic around the plugs themselves otherwise it may not fit well.It contains four ports, there are a couple of 1AMP ports and a couple of 2AMP ports. The charger did not come with any cords and is the actual charger plug itself. It is very small and easy to take with you anywhere, I actually bought 2, one I keep in my car and the other I keep in my backpack in case it is needed while traveling with friends or family.I was able to charge my iPad Air, my Amazon Fire Phone, my iPhone 6, and a Samsung Infuse.  I also plugged it into my dashcam and it powered it without issue.The plug has a 1 year + 6 month warranty (18 months total) which says a lot, as the company seems very willing to stand behind their product.After reviewing this I bought another one at full price because I was so impressed by it.DISCLAIMER: I was sold a discounted sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

The Marrywindix Over the Door 7 Hook Metal Rack does what it is meant to.  It hangs on the door, is approximately 17" wide, the hooks are about 3" apart, and it is able to hold heavy coats or other items without bending or warping.  The only adjustment I had to make was by bending the over the door part so that it formed a tight clamp to the top of the door, otherwise it would jangle and move about, although with weight on the hooks it is pretty sturdy. There are dull nubs on the ends of the hook to ensure it doesn't tear through your clothing. Overall, it is a nice item and even though the metal is very thin looking, it is strong and doesn't really look cheap.  Overall, this isn't anything fancy and honestly it feels somewhat light and "cheap" out of the box but it looks fantastic.  Basically, it just gets the job done and adds some decorative touches.DISCLAIMER: I was given a sample unit by the company.
