I've only been using the headphones for a couple weeks with my Amazon Fire Phone, and my usual rule is to try a product out for at least 30 days before writing a review. In this instance, I felt compelled to at least put a cursory review up as I have been VERY impressed with these headphones. I am a casual audiophile, and I have tried many headphones, and ear-buds.  I will say that the sound isn't comparable to high end headphones but I was sufficiently impressed with the sound quality!  I could hear all the instruments, vocals, and even almost feel the bass from the mids and lows.I am very impressed with the sound!  The one, slight negative I have with the sound is that there is a slight, noticeable hiss when the volume is turned up on the actual headset.  The way to eliminate that is to just turn the volume on the headset down and turn it up on your mobile device.The one thing I kind of struggled with at the beginning is placing the ear-buds properly in my ears.  If they are slightly off the sound quality is reduced sounding quieter or even muffled.  Proper placement results in some amazing sound though.The rubber plug that covers the charging port is tough to get out, and to get in, but it fits snugly and I like that, as it does what it is meant to, protecting the actual plug.  My biggest concern with the plug though is that it is so tight that I think it might get damaged with repeated chargings.Bluetooth pairing is fast, easy, and stable, with decent range.  I don't get the loss of signal when I turn my head like I have on other units.The actual headsets are comfortable and with the included rubber pieces i was able to have it perfectly fit my ear and they stay in, no matter how much I move or work out at the gym.I think the biggest test will be how long they last, as durability seems to be one of the bigger complaints. So if there is interest I will definitely update this review with my experiences as time goes on.DISCLAIMER: I was given a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I have had the lantern for almost 30 days now and feel that I can now offer a detailed helpful review.  So the lantern is made with a somewhat durable plastic, although it is thinner, as the light can shine through it.  This is actually somewhat good as the lantern operates as a collapsible design, working by sliding it open to reveal the clear plastic and LED bulb.  By sliding it up partially you can reduce the brightness of the light, as this is the only way to do so.  Besides that it is either ON or OFF, there are no switches.The lantern takes three AA batteries and has thin metal handles, which aren't exactly comfortable nor meant for carrying the lantern for long periods of time. If you hang this lantern up and slide it to close it, it will eventually turn itself on as gravity pulls it back open.  I am guessing it does this due to the batteries being in the bottom portion, making it heavier. So in the middle of the night you may awaken to the lantern being on and wondering if someone was in your tent... But just rest assured it was just good ole gravity.There are a lot of reviews that talk about the smell, and I will admit, there is a strong plastic like smell that the lantern gives off.  If you leave it out for several days it is severely diminished though and is no longer noticeable.THIS LANTERN IS NOT WATERPROOF.  There are way too many openings and unsealed edges to prevent water from entering into it.  If you are walking th rough light rain it should be fine as the plastic is water resistant but if it gets inside the unit then I would suggest removing the batteries and letting it air out.The actual brightness of the lantern is pretty impressive for something so cheap and so small.  The light is also a soft brightness so it isn't too harsh, although I still would not recommend looking directly into it.It also comes with a compass on the top, which seems somewhat accurate, although it sometimes gets stuck and needs to be jostled to get it pointing correctly.I guess the biggest con with this is the camouflage design, it is pretty good and if you aren't careful and are in the right kind of brush you could actually lose the lantern.Overall, it is a good lantern and I do recommend it.  I will say though that for about 50% more in price you can get a better quality, more durable, and much brighter lantern, the one I recommend is the Rayovac SE3DLNACOM Sportsman 240. I have had several and used them for many years without issue.DISCLAIMER: I was given a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

So, I have used the LG Tone previously on and off and I really did like it.  I ended up giving the LG Tone to my father and after a while realized that I missed having the Bluetooth headset hidden under my collar throughout the work day, at my ready to play music or to answer a call. When I was given the opportunity to try these out I knew I just had to share my experience with others. I tried it out for 30+ days before writing this review.The entire reason one gets this is so they can have a long battery life product that has a good microphone, good sound quality, and is discreet. The design of the GRDE Aptx Neckband Headset reminds me a lot of the LG Tone, and unless you are very close folks won't be able to really tell what you have. AS for appearance, one thing I did not like is the chromed out buttons that are shiny and visible.  The entire reason I like this style of headset is for them being discreet, and the buttons kind of distract from that.As for the build quality, the plastic does not seem to be at the same level and quality of the LG Tone, but keep in mind, the LG Tone also costs more than double. The headphones store away in these little alcoves at the end of the headset around your neck via magnets. Unfortunately, the magnets are very weak and I had a very tough time storing them away as they would keep falling out.As for the actual earpieces they fit the ears pretty well and are tolerable in regards to comfort.  I was able to wear them while working out on an elliptical for an hour without any major discomfort or issue. The sound quality was okay, it was clear and there was a little bass response, but nothing spectacular, and I say that as an audio enthusiast, so for the average user it may be okay as I was able to hear the lyrics of my music clearly, as well as phone calls without issue.  The microphone is also pretty decent, although at times I was told I sounded somewhat muffled, although the MIC itself just seems to be a tiny hole.I was able to pair this up with the Amazon Fire Phone and an iPhone 6 without any issues, both utilizing BT 4.0.  The connection was stable and I had no issues with disconnects of static when the phone was nearby.  Occasionally if the phone was in my pocket, depending on how I turned my head I would get slight static or disconnects but it was somewhat rare. Interestingly though, the actual unobstructed range for the headphones is quite good as I was able to get clear signal 30+ feet away.The headset charges via a Micro USB plug that is hidden away by a plastic cap. The cap itself is tight and very hard to remove without fear of damaging the headset.  The Micro USB Plug itself is also VERY tight and I fear that it may eventually fail due to this and the pressure that is put onto it from inserting and removing the Micro USB plug.  It also has a little on-off switch that you have to literally slide, although the unit will power off to conserve battery after being idle for a while.Overall, the headphones are tolerable and the sound quality is okay.  The build quality is durable but does not have the feel of a higher end product such as the LG Tone. For the price I feel it is a good value, although if the price were to decrease by about 25% it would be a much higher recommended purchase. Overall, if you don't want to spend the extra for the LG Tone or other similar higher end headset then I can say this is a good value.  I would just treat the headset with care, but so far, after 30+ days of near daily use it has held up and works just as good as the first day.DISCLAIMER: I was given a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I will start this review off by saying that I consider myself an audio enthusiast and I tend to listen to a lot of different headphones.  Given that, I will say that the quality of these headphones is "Okay" but nothing fantastic.  They sound good, are clear, and offer slight bass response, but I felt that the sound was somewhat flat.  After fiddling around with an EQ app I was able to improve the sound a little but it is still nothing like a higher end headphone. With that said, I am not going to be reviewing this as an audiophile for audiophiles, but will be reviewing it for the broader audience who are going to use it for music or TV watching.I tried it out for a full 30 days to see how I would like it.  Over that time I noticed that for TV watching (via Bluetooth on my laptop) the sound was absolutely fine.  I was able to clearly hear dialog and the sound was clear, crisp and the bass was enough to give you a slight "feel" when those explosions happened or when the characters would walk into a night club or something that had thump. For Music, it was fine too and sounded good. But again, the sound doesn't really have depth to it, it is just a clear headset.So I can more accurately compare the sound quality for folks out there, I felt that it was maybe slightly less than a "Skull Candy" or "Beats" set of headphones. But keep in mind there is also a huge price difference and with these costing much less than those, it is actually a decent value for the price to sound you receive.Now on to the actual build quality. The build quality feels pretty solid, although I will say that it felt Overly padded at the top that goes on your head which made the headphones sit a little strangely on my head and ears. The material used to create the soft padding also felt cheaper and did not "mold" to your head as well as some other headphones, which led to there being some slight sound leakage depending on how your head was positioned. There are rubber covers that protect the recharge port, but on my particular headphones the cover did not cover and would just dangle open, no matter what I did I could not get the cover to stay on. The LED light is also a little bright if you're going to be using them in the dark.As for the battery life, it was pretty good and I got several days of heavy use before it needed a recharge. If I were to calculate it in hours I think around 8-12 hours.The Microphone worked, but it was comparable to a common (not high end) Bluetooth earpiece.The included 3.5mm stereo cable worked fine and is a flat cable design so it doesn't tangle as easily.  The recharge cable plugs into a computer to recharge, as there is no wall adapter included. The carrying bag is just a fabric bag that offers protection only from scratches.I have a very large head, and these headphones at their max adjustment still did not fit it properly and felt uncomfortable to me.The biggest negative of this device to me is the price compared to what you get.  Yes these are Bluetooth headphones, and the quality is comparable to lower end over the ear headphones with sound quality a little less than SkullCandy and a little bit more less than Beats. So for the price it it selling for right now I would probably recommend spending a little more to get a better set of headphones, but that could just be the audiophile in me speaking. But if you're unable to do that, I honestly would not have a problem recommending these, although I still feel that the price should probably be about 30% cheaper.DISCLAIMER: I was given a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I actually had a bug problem in my garage and was looking for a less poisonous solution to my problem. I went ahead and plugged this up to an outlet in my garage and also set out numerous glue traps to test how many bugs they caught.  Previously the glue traps consistently caught many many bugs so I knew that if there was a decrease I could tell by the glue traps.Upon receiving the product I noticed the box itself was not of the highest quality and was somewhat smashed due to the thin cardboard.  The actual unit itself is made of plastic, and is not super durable feeling but it is probably good enough for the applications as it is meant to be plugged in and not handled constantly.So I picked the spot in the room that would broadcast the ultrasonic waves efficiently to cover the entire garage. One thing I did notice upon plugging it in is that you could hear a very slight high pitched sound, not very obvious but if it is VERY quiet and you hold your breath it is there.  For me, being extremely acoustosensitive the device made me nauseous ans slightly dizzy after a few minutes so I had to leave the garage.One thing I noticed is that if I have the garage open now, the neighbor's dog begins barking which I am guessing means that it is audible to animals, so if you have a pet I would definitely recommend you only use this in an area that your pet will not be exposed to.  I will also say that my neighbor's pet was a good 50 ft from my garage so this device must be pretty loud at those ultrasonic frequencies!So, after having plugged it in and let it run for nearly 60 days and checking the glue traps weekly, I did notice a decrease in bugs.  I actually counted how many were in each glue trap and compared to before the device, it seemed to decrease the amount of bugs by a few percentage points per week.  By the end of 60 days I was only catching about 25% of the bugs I use to, so that is a 75% decrease!To be fair though, this could just be coincidence, and due to possibly the weather getting warming and the bugs leaving the house, I don't know as I do not have any data to compare it to last year around this time.The one CON I have here though, is that the feature that sends a signal throughout your entire house via the electrical circuitry was tough to test. As there was no way for me to isolate a particular room to see if it helped or hurt it.  I also was not sure how the signal would flow through the various junctions and breakers. I will say though that when I enabled it I seemed to have some slight WiFi / Internet issues but I can't be sure if it was caused by this device completely or not.Overall, I feel it did decrease the bug count in the immediate area that it was used for, but I can't say for sure if it helped anywhere else.  Pets can also hear it and might be annoying to them.  The Blue Light on it is somewhat bright for a night light, but works great if you need a light to illuminate a hallway.DISCLAIMER: I was given a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

I have not tried a Glucosamine Supplement before so I was anxious to give the Viva Labs Glucosamine Chondroitin combination a try.  I dove into the research and discovered that this particular supplement is designed to help relieve your joint pain, improve skin health, and remove toxins as well as help repair cartilage. Diving into a bunch of clinical studies I found many that showed improve of subjects, and also many that showed it was no better than a placebo.  With the scientific studies being divided I figured the best thing to do was to give it a good try.I compared this to a lot of other products you'd find at Wal-Mart and other online and it seems this product may be slightly less potent per pill than other offerings, but if you calculate the price vs dose ratio it isn't actually much more expensive. I also feel that the capsules allow for better absorption than those solid pills.I gave this particular supplement a minimum of 30 days to ensure it was given plenty of time.  I have back joint issues, knee issues, hip issues, wrist and shoulder issues, etc.  So I knew if it worked I would at least know from one of these improving.A lot of places suggested to take a "higher starting dose" for the first couple of weeks to help build up the body's levels of the supplement.  So I took a daily double dose for those two weeks, and then a normal recommended dose the remaining 2 weeks.  The pills themselves were fine and I had no issues, they were slightly big but nothing too difficult to swallow.I honestly did not notice significant improvement until well into the third week. I was getting out of bed and going about my day without even noticing any pain, when previously I acknowledged the pain constantly as it was hard to ignore.  By the end of the fourth week I feel that there was a 75% reduction in joint paint throughout my entire body.  I look forward to trying it longer to seeing if there is additional improvement.DISCLAIMER: I was given a sample unit by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide a fair review to help other users make an informed purchase.

Over the years I have had the opportunity to try various wine pourers. I will say that this one pours the cleanest out of all of the ones I have tried previously, as it cleanly combines two streams into a single one before it pours from the bottle. The pour is easily controlled and very precise and it seems to aerate it perfectly.Now I have not tried a Chilling stick before, but I did follow the instructions, placing it in the freezer for several hours.  I did notice that the wine was cooler, but not overly cold.  I did not do an official measurement but it did not seem to cool it to optimum wine drinking temperature.  I would suggest that this would be good to use with an already chilled bottle of wine, as it did not seem as effective on a bottle that is at room temperature. Again, it did cool it, but did not get it to the level to adequately enjoy the wine. If it is already chilled then I feel it would help keep it chilled longer.The Packaging of the item is also superb and gives it a very high-class feel, as it definitely does not look cheap. It would make for an impressive gift as friends, family, and clients would be sure to appreciate the look and feel of the Cucina Casa Wine Chiller.I am giving it 4 stars, as the chilling feature is somewhat lacking, but the quality, pouring, and aeration are superb.DISCLAIMER: I was offered one at a discount by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to provide one.

So, I've been using these toothbrushes for over 3 years now.  When they first were introduced I bought one for myself, one for my wife, and one for my parents to share.  So in all, I have experience with 2 in my household and second hand experience from my parents.  My Father-In-Law also bought one as well and had a similar experience as ours.With that said, this toothbrush is incredible!  It cleans better than any electric toothbrush available.  I love the different settings and programs it offers. It is also extremely stylish and looks like it is from the future. I have gone to the dentist and been told that there really isn't anything for them to do as I didn't have much to clean at all.  The convenience it offers when charging is also incredible as all you do is plop it into the base or put it into the cup and it charges without plugging anything into it.  The travel case is also incredible and works perfectly, you just plug in the usb cable and it charges just like how a cell phone would. Overall this toothbrush is everything I was looking for in a toothbrush!  With that said, I have to go into detail with the issue we have all had with the Sonicare Diamondclean handles.The battery holds a great charge and is not an issue.  The function when it works is excellent!  The accessories are great!  But there is some fatal flaw in the design of this toothbrush that makes it extremely fragile.  Something inside comes "unglued" and the vibration delivered to the brush head is reduced by 90%, but you can feel the mechanism inside the handle vibrating and making strange noises.  This will occur if you drop it, EVEN ONCE.  I had this happen on my first brush, it slipped out of my hands (As it is a very sleek design) and fell into the sink and it was broken.  I contacted Sonicare and was told that dropping it voids the warranty and there was nothing they would do about it as it is considered abuse.  The fact that it was dropped from about 1 ft into my sink, ONCE, was not of concern to them.  After speaking with several supervisors they sent me a replacement as a one-time customer goodwill.  From this point on I was incredibly paranoid using it, gripping the handle until my fingers turned white for fear of dropping it and destroying another one.  I also briefed my wife on it as well as my parents, telling them that they better not drop it as it would void the warranty and even a little drop would break it.Things went well for a while, until about 14 months after the replacement, the same issue that occurred after dropping it, was happening again, but I had NEVER dropped it and have actually handled it with such care due to the trauma of my original experience with Sonicare Customer Service.  The mechanism had again somehow disengaged partially, reducing the vibration by 90% and making the Sonicare more of a normal toothbrush with a vibrating handle.  I contacted Sonicare, and after adamantly denying that I dropped it, they finally authorized a replacement, thank goodness for the 2 year warranty.  Mine lasted about 10 more months and it again, had the same issue and had never been dropped.  I contacted Sonicare and was told that I was a couple of months past the 2 year warranty and that I was out of luck.Now for my wife's Sonicare Diamondclean, as she experienced the same issue.  She never dropped it, and was paranoid after my experience.  After about 11 months she had to have hers replaced due the same thing I experienced.  Her second one broke after only 8 months so she got a second replacement.  It lasted about 9 months and now she is out of warranty and her THIRD Sonicare Diamondclean handle is now also broken, several months out of warranty.My parents also had a similar experience.  The first Sonicare Diamondclean handle broke after about 8 months, received replacement.  Second handle broke after 10 months, received another replacement.  The third one broke after 9 months and is now out of warranty.My Father-in-Law also purchased one of these after seeing how awesome it was during the first few months, and I told him he better not drop it.  He ended up having the same issue come up and when he tried to redeem the warranty for a replacement, because he did not have the receipt they refused to replace it.  Keep in mind, this is when the toothbrush was first released, so the thing hadn't even been out for a year yet.  Even so, they refused to give him a replacement without the receipt/proof of purchase and it took me escalating it to darn near the CEO to get his replaced.  I calmly explained to them that my Father-In-Law was NOT A TIME TRAVELER and he had not somehow traveled into the future, bought their Sonicare DiamondClean, and then traveled back in time 18 months before release of the DiamondClean.  That their product had not even been out for 1 year, let alone 2 years.  After this reasoning they replaced it and said that it was a one time exception.  Interestingly, it has been working fine since then, going on close to 20 months now, but I suspect it will fail within the next few months, and he is already out of warranty.So there you have it, 4 Sonicare DiamondClean toothbrush sets, 3 of us went through multiple replacements, and all but 1 of them after 2 years are now broken.  NONE of those have been dropped, and I can personally vouch for mine and my wife's being drop free.  As for my parents, they assure me it was never dropped and that is enough for me.  I also know for a fact that my wife and I do not brush our teeth hard and we literally just let the brush head "glide" over the surface of our teeth applying just enough pressure for it to make contact.Overall, the toothbrush is ridiculously awesome, and when it works it is the best thing ever!  The fact that I have direct experience with 2 Sonicare Diamondcleana, and another 2 through second hand experience, and all of them break, is unsettling.  Also the fact my Father-in-Law got lucky and his replacement is still working after 20 months also shows me it could be a sporadic quality control issue.  Either that or my Father-In-Law doesn't brush his tooth as often as us.  So either we are all the unluckiest family out there, or there is some design flaw that causes the Sonicare DiamondClean's vibration mechanism to come loose inside the handle.So now I have a bunch of replacement brush heads sitting in my drawer but no toothbrushes that work with them.  We have resorted to using a normal manual toothbrush while we figure out what to buy to replace the broken DiamondClean handles, especially since our finances are not in the best place due to medical bills, and lets be honest, the Sonicare Toothbrushes are not cheap. My gosh how horrible it is to not have an electric toothbrush, as it feels like my teeth is not getting even 1/10 as clean as it was getting with the Sonicare.  It really makes you miss an electric toothbrush.On a side note, the one warning I have for people who use electric toothbrushes is to be careful brushing a tooth with a crown on it, as I have been told by my dentist that the vibration will break down the cement holding the crown in place causing it to come loose.  How did we come upon that subject?  because my crown fell out.  ;)  So careful if you have one.I do hope this review has helped you guys out and helps you make a more informed decision.  If you buy this Sonicare Diamondclean, SAVE THE RECEIPT and remember that you will probably have to get at least 1, maybe 2 replacements.  If your Sonicare Diamondclean is acting up, even a little and it sounds like the handle is beginning to rattle, get it replaced immediately.  I would highly recommend attempting to get it replaced before the 2 years is up, as that way you can at least get almost 3 years of use from the original purchase.Overall, I am giving it 2 stars as the toothbrush is incredible, the accessories are great, and it works fantastically!  I am taking away 3 stars because of the lack of reliability, although Sonicare WILL replace the broken handles IF you have your receipt and it is within the 2 year window. As I said, just realize you are paying for the privilege of using the Sonicare DiamondClean for at least 2 years, anything past that is a bonus. It may not be the original one you bought, but Sonicare will ensure you get a replacement as long as you are within the warranty period.  Also, their customer service is not the most friendly and they will try to trick you into admitting fault so they can immediately deny a replacement and void your warranty. They also require a receipt regardless if you registered your product, as I said, they basically accused my Father-in-Law of being a Time Traveler, trying to deny the warranty when the toothbrush had been out for less than a year.So now you know the risks and perils involved with entering into the transaction of obtaining a Sonicare DiamondClean.  Farewell and stay vigilant, as it is a great toothbrush, but you are going to have to fight for your right to brush with it...

I am currently in the market for a new shower head and due to this I have seen a lot of them at my local hardware stores. I will say that the quality of this feels VERY high.  It is made out of plastic, but it does not flex or bend easily nor does it feel cheap at all.  I will say that in my search for a shower head that most new ones are made out of a similar plastic, even ones many times more expensive than this one.The installation was VERY easy, I just unscrewed the old shower head, and screwed this one on.  I didn't even have to use a tool and it took all of 2 minutes from start to finish. The metal part is precisely machined and it fit snugly without any bit of wobble, due to this you have to get it lined up PERFECTLY in order for it to screw on, which I loved!  I did not even use the included Teflon Tape and it has not leaked at all.As for the experience, it was wonderful!  It does not provide a "Downpour" like experience like some of those rain shower heads which use A LOT of water (upwards of 3gpm) but this one provided a wide, constant, perfectly equal stream of water across the entire shower head.  I found it impressive as I have tried other similar shower heads and some of the streams tend to be less than the others, very uneven, but with this one, it is nearly perfectly distributed across the entire shower head!Now for water usage, as it is not stated anywhere in the specifications.  I crudely measured it by filling up a 2 gallon pot and timing it at 1 minute.  With this one it seems to be about 1.25 gallons of water in that minute, so 1.25gpm.  So this uses quite a bit less than other similar heads which will help with water conservation and your hot water.  It does though use quite a bit more than my original shower head (Kohler) but it also covers about 5 times the area!  I love how my entire body is being hit with water all at the same time, and I am a pretty big guy.Now for the unique feature in this shower head, the expandable leafs that makes it 2" wider.  It works well, although the pieces connecting the leaves are a white color, which does not match the shower head well.  I really do wish they had went with either a gray color that matched the shower head or made it a chrome color.  The white feels almost like it isn't meant to be exposed and overall detracts from the beauty of this design.  To expand it you have to grab leaves on the opposite sides of each other and gently pull them outward, so it isn't exactly anything special or high tech and I do wonder how many times you can expand it before it cracks, as it does feel a little flimsy when the leaves are expanded. As for the actual experience, I really preferred having the shower head closed, as I can feel the gaps when it is fully expanded as the water is now not uniformly hitting your body.  I will try it expanded and also retracted and see if my preference changes but so far I like it retracted.I do not have an overhead shower adapter, so mine does angle from the wall a little.  The shower head gives you SOME room for adjustment but honestly doesn't move much, most likely due to the size being restrictive.  It did not touch my walls or anything, it just doesn't have a high degree of freedom in aiming it.  It did however keep whatever position it was placed in without sagging / falling back down.Overall, I love it and would recommend it, however I do not like the white plastic pieces that become visible when the leaves are extended and I am concerned with long term durability as it feels a little flimsy when expanded, not to mention it isn't exactly easy to expand, especially with wet hands, so I would think you keep it in one or the other configuration permanently. For the price, it does seem to be a better quality shower head, and honestly the design is insanely unique!  I am sure I will be getting compliments from guests when they see this thing! :)TLDR:PROS: Excellent Quality, Great Modern Look, Fast Easy Installation, Water Flow Feels Incredible!CONS: Hard to expand and when expanded it feels flimsy. White connectors when expanded do not match look of shower head. Higher Water Usage (Approximately 1.25 gallons per minute) which results in more hot water which increases utility costs.CONCLUSION: No Issue with the actual shower head, highly recommended if you want a large shower head that can cover your entire body and does not use an excessive amount of water, although this is definitely not a water saver shower head and you will probably have to take quicker showers if you have multiple folks waiting to use it in order to conserve your hot water.DISCLAIMER: I was actually in the market for a new shower head when I was offered one at a discount by the company. I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to do so.

The quality is VERY good and feels like something much higher end than the price sold here.  I had already visited my local Home Depot and Lowes in search of a replacement head and I will say that this shower head compares easily to a lot of the much more expensive ones offered there.  But in reality, I did not see a modern style glass one designed like this so it is unique in those respects.The Installation was incredibly easy, I unscrewed my old shower head (Kohler) and screwed this one on, and that was it, literally less than 2 minutes to uninstall the old one and install the new one.  I was very happy about that as I'm not exactly a handy man and was afraid I would have to hire someone.There was another review that stated that the shower head would not maintain the position it was tilted at and would "fall" after a few seconds.  I have showered with this for close to a week and tested every conceivable angle and it never slumped back down, it kept the position I would place it in without issue.  If yours slumps make sure that you have tightened it properly, or email the vendor as it might be defective.So now to the most important question, HOW DOES IT FEEL!?  Honestly, it feel incredible!  I love it!  It was like I was swimming in a monsoon with a solid downpour of water, and the pressure was great!  It felt way better than my Kohler that I had replaced and I was now excited, looking forward to showering each and every time!  In fact, I think it improved my hygiene as I was looking for excuses to hit the shower! :)Now to the negative.  Although the quality is excellent, the installation was super easy, and the feel of the water was incredible, there were a couple of issues that are more specific to ones personal preferences.  The first being the fact that it uses A LOT of water.  I tested it multiple times, with the shower head filling up a 2 gallon pot and I estimate that it has a flow rate of approximately 1.8 gallons per minute.  This is significantly more than my previous Kohler shower head.  Due to the increased flow, the hot water would run out much faster.  This is really the only negative, so if you have one of those tankless water heaters (I have a large traditional gas water heater), then it might not be an issue as you would have an endless supply of hot water.  But keep in mind, it will use more electricity or gas to heat up the water due to the high flow rate.  And if you pay for your water usage, it will increase that a bit. To be fair, there are other shower heads that use upwards of 3gpm, so in those respects, this is still not as bad as some out there.  The difference is that those state it in their specifications.If you're a conservationist looking to be eco-friendly, this might not be the shower head for you as you will use more fossil fuels heating water.  And if you're going from a water-saver shower head to this you will be shocked at the increased use. If you don't mind that, and are looking for a luxurious shower experience with a high quality shower head, then definitely go for this one!!!  I had absolutely no problems with the product itself except for the extremely high flow design which was not stated anywhere in the product specifications.TLDR:PROS: Excellent Quality, Great Modern Look, Fast Easy Installation, Water Flow Feels Incredible!CONS: Not Eco-Friendly due to High Water Usage (Approximately 1.8 gallons per minute) which uses more hot water which increases utility costs. This needs to be stated in the product specifications.CONCLUSION: No Issue with the actual shower head, highly recommended if you're going for that modern look and are okay with the high flow design.DISCLAIMER: I was actually in the market for a new shower head when I was offered one at a discount by the company.  I did not promise them a review but seeing as I used it, and I love to review things, I was more than happy to do so.

I tend to drink a few sodas per week, and I wanted something that would keep my my hands from getting cold and also to stop the condensation that appears on the cans. This does both, but I will say that the fit is not as snug as I'd want it to be as there is a noticeable gap all around and the can does "wobble" inside the holder slightly if you shake it back and forth, not a whole lot, but it does move.  The thermos beverage can insulator is flexible, if you squeeze it lightly it will deform.  This brings up concerns with how long the actual vacuum will hold up under heavy use and with constant flexing of the metal.  As for keeping it ice cold, in my experience an open can of soda will keep "cold" for maybe an hour or so, with it staying "cool" for another hour or so.  If you keep an unopened can in there it does seem to keep it pretty cold for over 2 hours though, but it seems if the can is opened a lot of the coolness escapes.Overall, it does the job, it does keep it cold longer than without.  It keeps my hands from being cold and it keeps things dry as you can set it on a table without it condensating.  Truthfully though, who takes 3 hours to drink a can of soda?  I finish most of mine in under 30 minutes so it is more than enough for me. I wish it was a little tighter around the can and that the metal was a little more sturdy, but it is a good product regardless.

I've been using this for several months now and so far it is exactly what I was looking for!  What was I looking for?  A light to kick on when we walked up to our home at night so we could find the keys and unlock the door.  It works great, is extremely bright, has a wide beam throw, and activates from about 10 ft away so it easily lights up the walking path to the door so we don't trip over any packages.  I ended up using the adhesive to stick the light mount to the top of the metal front door.  So far it hasn't fallen off but I am very concerned I will come home one day and see my light, broken, on the ground.  If it does happen I will definitely update this review. The only real negative I have is that it slides off the mount very easily, so it is possible that someone could easily take your light with little effort.  Now, on the flip side, i have on several occasions slide the light off the mount and used it as a flash light while looking for something in the yard, as long as you keep moving it will stay on.Overall, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  Works great, and I hope the batteries last a while.*** UPDATE 6/18/2015 ***So it has been about 6 months since my last review and I wanted to say that I AM STILL ON THE ORIGINAL SET OF BATTERIES!  The light is triggered probably twice a day, staying on for as long as we need to while unlocking the front door, and then shuts off.  To be fair, it has gotten about 50% dimmer due to the decreased battery capacity but it is still very much useable and I will not be changing the batteries for probably a few more days.  So honestly, you can get a full year out of two sets of batteries, this is well worth it in my book!

I tried this out for several weeks, using it daily.  It fit snugly into my 2012 Toyota Camry XLE CD player slot and held my phone firmly. Unfortunately, the actual part that goes into the CD player is tight but the arm that holds the phone mount wobbles so incredibly bad while driving that you can not see what is on your actual phone screen.  The intense vibration makes it really useless, as I could not read street names on my phone's GPS as it was shaking so badly.  The rubber prongs that hold it in the CD player also cause the felt parts on the CD slot, that protect the CD player, to deform which makes it look horrible as well.  Beyond that, if it had worked and held the phone firmly without the shaking, and it also didn't damage the CD player slot, I would have been happy.  It does put your phone at the perfect location so you can easily tap the screen and see things clearly.PROS- Works as advertised, holds phone via CD slot.- Decent Build Quality.CONS- Shakes badly while driving making it incredibly difficult, to read the GPS on the phone due to vibration.- Damages CD slot felt protector, hopefully not permanently.I ended up going with a AC Vent Slot holder which does not look as nice but seems to hold it much firmly.

So I finally ran out of the Xacto blades and wanted to get some more.  After researching exhaustively I went ahead and bought these aftermarket blades.  I will say, compared to the Xacto blades, they perform nearly identically. But for the price, you can buy twice as many of these for the same price as the Xacto, so even if it was not quite as good as Xacto, you would still come out WAY ahead by buying the Techni Edge blades. Just like with the Xacto blades, If you change the blade out when it starts becoming dull, it offers a great cut, and there really is no noticeable difference in quality. I highly recommend these blades, and honestly, can't really tell the difference!  Highly recommended!

I just got it yesterday, so I've only had it for about a day so far.  My impressions so far are mixed.  The case looks great, it feels great as well.  The issue I have with the finish is that it really is prone to marks, scratches, smudges, etc.  It is some sort of matte plastic finish with a velvety feel. Interestingly though, it seems, at least to me, to make the phone more slippery!  I have already on several occasions pulled the phone out of my pocket and nearly had it slip out of my hand.The case itself is also quite large, nearly doubling the thickness of the phone, it also makes it heavier by adding 2oz more to the weight. When you hold the phone without the case it feels nice, and well balanced.  With this case the phone feels unbalanced almost unstable in your hand. I am guessing it is from the distribution of the battery weight in the rear of the case.As for protection, from the looks of it the case offers absolutely no protection, as the sole function is to provide your phone with extra battery capacity.  The only real protection I can see is that the edges of the case come up on the sides from the face of the phone so it helps protect it from surfaces if you were to lay the phone's screen down onto a surface.  The case itself that surrounds it is just a flexible plastic, so if you did drop it, it might save the screen and prevent major damage BUT most likely at the cost of the incipio case itself.The case also puts a border around the edge of the screen which makes it difficult to swipe left and right in order to bring up the side menus that are prevalent on the Fire Phone.  If you keep the gestures turned on you can still tilt it to the left and right, but I turned them off due to them accidentally getting in the way time and time again.The other issue which I am absolutely not happy about most of all is the fact that you have to use a special micro usb cable that is suppose to come with the offgrid case.  The charging port is deep inside the case and the edges are crafted to only fit incipio's micro usb cable.  If you try to use any other cable the plastic edges of the micro usb adapter will not fit completely and due to this the cable will not stay in.  Yes, it will charge with other micro USB cables, but only if you don't touch the phone, as otherwise those cables will just fall out as they are not seated completely into the micro usb plug within the offgrid case.One thing I really do like about the case is the fact that there is a button on the back that, when pressed momentarily, will light up 4 little leds to show you how much power is left. Also, the extra battery does not kick in until you tell it to, that way you're not always draining the external offgrid battery. To enable it you hold the button down for a few seconds and it will enable, charging your dying phone. There is also a couple of little holes at the bottom part that redirect the sound from the two speakers forward, and it seems to actually improves the sound quality.I needed more battery life, as the Fire Phone does have a pretty fast battery drain, so that is why I got this case. Unfortunately, with all the other negatives I am unsure if it will be worth the high cost in the long run.  I have given it a balanced 3 stars, but if this review is found helpful by folks I will update it as time goes on.***UPDATE 12/04/2014***Well, I was able to charge it up and actually use it to charge up my battery, it seems to add about 60% to the Fire Phone before being completely depleted.  This is without using the phone at all, letting it sit, being charged by the Offgrid case without touching the phone at all.  This was a tad disappointing as the Fire Phone has a built in 2400mah battery while the Offgrid case has a 2,700mah battery.  I do understand there is always going to be some power transfer loss during the charge, but I was hoping it would at least give it 80%, as the photo on the box seems to show it adding approximately 80% additional capacity.  I will do a FRESH reboot of the phone and try it again to ensure there were no vampire apps loaded up that were causing the phone to drain more than normal.  But as of right now, the OffGrid Case can add 60% to the battery built into the Fire Phone on a full charge.***UPDATE 12/06/2014***Well, the OffGrid case is now doing something strange.  When I enable it, the phone will begin charging without issue from the case, but then it will disconnect after 15% or so of use.  I will then had to push and hold the button down again, it will do it for a little more, then disconnect once more.  On the third attempt the button is no longer responsive and the little LEDs on the back of the case quit working.  The only way to "Fix" it was to plug the OffGrid case into a Micro USB plug to trigger it to charge, for just a second.  Then I was able to do it again a few times before having to "reset" the OffGrid case again.  No idea what is going on, but it almost seems to be triggering it to stop charging, and after a few attempts it just locks up and does not work without a reset via a micro USB cord.  I have emailed the company and awaiting a response.***UPDATE 12/08/2014***Well, after an overnight complete charge, the case seemed to work again without issue.  Although to be fair, previously when I had the issue I was attempting to charge the Fire Phone from 20% remaining life, so perhaps due to it being so discharged it was possibly pulling more power to charge faster than the Offgrid could handle?  Not sure.  But I was able to charge it from 40% to 100% without issue and it did not trip and shut off.  Hopefully it was just a fluke and not a sign of things to come.  After 3 emails, I have still not heard from the company.  I had originally heard that Incipio had decent customer support, but as of right now no one is answering their emails.  Maybe they are all off for the Holidays???***UPDATE 12/10/2014***After another email, I finally heard back from the company.  I was told that the issue I was having, it prematurely disengaging the charge cycle, is a flaw in the actual hardware and that it was eligible for warranty replacement.  I will let you know when I receive it if the problem still persists. I will be happy if I can go from a 20% battery to 100% without it shutting off, and if that is the case then I will be very satisfied! It has been a real bummer having this huge case and it really offering no benefit due to my issue, so I am excited to see if the replacement works without any problems.  Even though it took nearly 6 days for a response, they seemed to be very courteous, prompt, and professional once they do respond.***UPDATE 12/14/2014***I received the replacement case today and so far so good.  It seems to work well and keeps a charge.  On the initial test run it charged it from 15% to 95% before stopping (80% Charge Capacity!) so that matches the box claims exactly. I am still unsure if it will survive a real drop, but at the very least I suppose it should protect the phone, although the thought of losing a nearly $100 phone case is also kind of unsettling. I will say that, even given that I was ignored for a week, I am very impressed at how quickly the company came through to ship me a working case!  Maybe they really were just having email issues?***UPDATE 12/16/2014***So I've been using it for a few days and it is nice to not have to worry about finding a charger all the time.  I can just use the phone as much as I want, don't even plug it in when using WAZE in the car.  When it gets to around 20% I kick on the charge!  Now the issue I do have is that I have noticed I accidentally bumped the charge button multiple times, so I was surprised to see my phone at 100% half way through the day but it was still charging.  If you hit the charge button in the incipio case and it hits 100% it will just keep trickle charging it from what it appears to maintain it to 100%.***UPDATE 2/26/2015***LOWERED TO 2 STARSWell, I received the replacement case, it worked well for about a month before sporadically having the same issue as before.  I hit the button, it charges for maybe a few minutes, then it quits charging and will no longer function until you plug the battery pack up and charge it again.  It is almost like some protection circuit inside the unit is tripping completely disconnecting the case from working until you plug it up to power once again.  The other possibility is that it is never completely charging and it just charges what little is left in the battery pack and then shuts off.  Either way, I find it frustrating that I can no longer, once again, rely on having a backup battery solution.  I will be contacting incipio again to see what can be done.*** UPDATE 6/18/2015 ***Well, I have still been using this case since I purchased it.  The company has grown unresponsive.  Although I did a complete discharge of the Battery Case and charged it up and it seems to not provide a slight charge.  As long as I don't let the phone battery fall below 65% I can bring it back up to a 100% charge.  Once it falls below that threshold it seems to only give me a 20% or so charge before completely "Crashing" and no longer functioning until it is plugged up again for a reset. This has basically made the offGRID case unreliable to the point I now carry a portable power brick in my bag in case my offGRID fails, again.  :(Overall, I can not recommend this case, and most likely the company doesn't care due to the fact that they are not making any Amazon Fire Phone products anymore so they are not interested in supporting the case. What I hope they understand is that customers tend to share their experiences, regardless of what types of phones other people have, and most people tend to switch phone brands/models often.  So it might be wise to support customers regardless of their phone and your product offerings as they may be a customer in the future.  At this point I am unsure if I would trust an incipio case again.

Charges my iPad, iPhones 5 and 6, Samsung S3, Kindle, LG tone Headset, and many other items quickly without any issues! Has great voltage and can charge multiple products 100% before having to be recharged itself. Built in flashlight has come in handy many times and is bright enough for most needs. Very high quality, durable feel, reminds me a lot of Apple's engineering. Display is very easy to understand and clearly readable. Only negative I have experienced so far is that I wish there were more ports for simultaneous charging.

Maybe the best open world game I have ever played. With 111 collectibles, revealed via certain missions by obtaining maps, or you can just roam around and discover them yourself. Each type of collectible has a very tangible reward such as health, fighting abilities, skill upgrades, etc. Mostly hand to hand combat based with some shooting. Has a "Departed" kind of feel to it. You're an undercover cop that has infiltrated organized crime, need I say more? Well over 20 hours of game play that will leave you wishing for more!

You can destroy anything, similar to Bad Company.  You can just roam around Mars breaking everything with your hammer. You can unlock new weapons to have more destructive power. When you die you just respawn at your base and pick up where you left off.  The game isn't exactly challenging but it very entertaining.  It is an open world sandbox but there isn't much to do outside of the missions. Still highly recommended.

I purchased an Xbox 360 Slim which has 4gb built into the system.  Unfortunately with the 360 you can't attach large hard drives easily, there are aftermarket ones but they can have problem with DLC. Fortunately this 16GB USB Flash drive works flawlessly!  You just plug it in and works easily with DLC and other downloadable games onto it.  It is small and just works exactly how I wanted it to!  Highly Recommended. I only wish they could somehow make a larger one that doesn't have DLC issues.

Purchased this item for my data hoarding needs, and it was everything I had hoped for and more!  The sturdy well built casing really gives it a touch of class and makes it feel high quality. The included software actually works quite well on both Windows and MAC computers. The cord that came with it was pretty short, so I ended up having to actually order a longer one from amazon. The data transfer speeds are great if you have a USB 3.0 connection, it seemed to suffer slightly when utilizing USB 2.0 though.

I purchased four of these phones when it was originally released back in July 2011.  My family has been using all four everyday, since then, going on 3.5 years!  None of us have cracked screens, and there have been very few issues.  One being that the power button can get "jammed" and needs to be blown out with compressed air to work properly again, otherwise it will continue to randomly reboot.  The other is that one of the phones suffered from screen burn in after it got stuck overnight on the alarm app.  beyond that, we've had no issues!The one good thing about this phone is that it has had a ton of support from the aftermarket custom ROM community, and there are numerous options to bring it from the original Froyo / Gingerbread to Jellybean and even KitKat version of Android.  It is very easy to do and instructions can be found on the XdaDevelopers website.  http://forum.xda-developers.com/infuse-4gI currently have a couple of them running KitKat with minimal problems (Camera is stuck at 480p otherwise it stutters and HDMI out is disabled), but it runs great with this latest release!  The other two are still running stock Gingerbread and have no issues whatsoever!Now I will be upfront, these are old phones, I mean at the time the Infuse was the largest / thinnest available smartphone, my how times have changed!!! This thing is "tiny" compared to what is now available!  The processor isn't the fastest, and the memory is lacking, although you can expand it via a microSD without issue. It also won't run a lot of the latest games without a lot of lag.  But if you need a phone that uses many apps without issue (Waze, youtube, gmail, twitter, facebook, snapchat, etc) then this will do just fine! :)  And the cool thing is that it still looks great so no one will know how outdated it is. :)

Probably the best glass cleaner I have ever used, and I have tried many.  The one negative I have is that the odor is very strong and tends to linger.  I have used this to clean mirrors and windows in and around my home as well as my vehicle. I highly recommend this cleaner. :)

I have only had the screen for a week or so, but in that time it has worked very well.  Now I must be upfront and state that the chances of you getting an undamaged screen are pretty low.  Mine came with a couple of dents in the rear, as the metal seems to be thinner on the back of the screen vs the front.  These "dents" were produced from pressure being put on or near the center of the screen, the motors on the edges weighing them down causing the metal to buckle.  So if you do get a flawless screen, make sure you have two people lift the screen up!  If you do it with only yourself holding it near the middle or on one end it will cause the screen to flex, bend, and buckle causing the metal to dent pretty badly.As for the motors, it is quiet, and works quite well!  One thing I have to warn, if you have the power outlet wired into a dimmer, make sure the switch is not dimmed when operating the motor.  The dimmer will reduce the power flow to the motors and the motors will not function correctly.  The Remote worked great as did the box built into the cable.  THE CABLE IS LOCATED ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE SCREEN.The thin metal housing is a concern if you are planning on transporting this screen as I am unsure if it would survive.  Also, the plastic end caps attached to the metal loops are also something I am wondering will crack and fail over time, although, to be fair, the plastic is quite thick.As for the screen itself, it was pretty good with only slight imperfections that are not noticeable when a projector is in use.If there is enough interest in my review, I will continually update it to let you guys know how it goes.***UPDATE 6/15/2015***The motor has held up well and works just like the first day I used it.  The imperfections have lessened but unfortunately when the projector is off you can still notice them  The edges of the screen have a slight curl to them but once the projector is running it is not noticeable. Overall, I feel it was still an incredible deal!  I have had numerous folks over for movie night and all of them have been impressed by the setup, several of them have gone on to order one for themselves and have been happy with it.Thank you so much for all the helpful votes, I can see there is interest and due to this I will try to continue to periodically update this review to let others know about the overall quality and durability of this screen.

Great storage case that is heavy duty and zips closed to protect the contents.  I prefer this zipper storage case over the old classic wooden box as it stays closed when zipped while the wooden box would tend to unlatch. The one negative is that the blades and handles are stored on a very flimsy plastic holder with magnets behind them to hold the blades in place. I fear that over time the flimsy plastic will give and crack.  I wish they had chosen to produce thicker plastic.  Beyond that, it is classic X-Acto and it works great!

I purchased this keyboard to help a student with vision issues and for a while it seemed to work as advertised. The Keyboard worked pretty well for the first few weeks.  As time went on the keys seemed to become less responsive and required more force to activate. After only a couple of short months the letters began to rub off, which completely defeats the purpose of having this high contrast keyboard, especially for the visually impaired.  I can not recommend this keyboard as it is very cheaply made, the letters rub off, and it puts excessive stress on your wrists due to the amount of force required to press the keys.

I had tried other brands of Epicor, most much more expensive, and this works just as well!  If I forget to take it I can usually notice the next day as I will have pretty severe allergies, coughing, headache, etc.  Epicor is highly effective for allergies, although I will say that I have not noticed it preventing me from getting sick any more than usual.One thing I did notice is that some batches will be pristine with the pills being a brownish color, while other batches will have white splotches within the pills.  I contacted the manufacturer and was told this is a normal variable and the product was still safe and within their guidelines, it all depends on how it is mixed and settles but it does have the doses of Epicor and Vitamin D3 stated. I was also told that the protective seal may come loose and when you unscrew it the first time it will come off and appear to be unsealed, that is the reason they put the plastic ring around it.  The reason being they use a food quality safe adhesive that can come unglued.  I was told that it is still safe to consume as long as the outer plastic ring/seal has not been broken in addition to the interior one.

I already purchased a back up bottle of this serum as it is my holy grail product in hand with the Beta Glucan. Looking forward to my results within the next few months.

I moved into a new condo that had a security system already installed. Unfortunately, a lot of the Honeywell 5816 transmitters on windows and doors were missing magnets, so they were constantly faulted when I turned the system on. I bought these magnets to replace missing ones. They worked great for doors, but not all windows. They were too big for my double hung windows. I'll post a product pic so you can see what I mean. I needed a Honeywell Ademco 5899B magnet for the windows. That's a similar magnet to this one, only smaller. I do recommend the smaller ones over these bigger ones. It's a better bet that they'll fit where you need them to fit!Also, you may want to shop around for a better price for this product. When I bought it a couple months ago, the pack of 4 was just under $15. Now it's almost $20. I'm giving the product 5 stars because it does what it's supposed to with no issues. Make sure you check size first though, and go for the 5899B if you need to.

At the start of the year, I decided to get on board with the stand up desk craze. I read about all the benefits and such and decided to give it a shot. I want to live longer. Not sure it really will extend my life, but it's definitely better than just sitting around.The first 2 weeks were hard, but it got easier after that. At first I'd lean a lot, shift from side to side, and take a lot of sitting breaks. With time, I started spending more and more time standing up straight. The only problem was that over time, I've developed pain in my heels. I know I'm not always in ideal posture. Knees are supposed to be slightly bent so that they're over the center of your foot, that moves some weight from heels to toes. It's hard to constantly remember to correct my posture though. I'd subconsciously move back to my heels.So plan B. Instead of mastering posture that would allow me to stand without pain on thinly carpeted concrete, I decided to change what I was standing on. I bought this 24x36 inch Stanley utility mat, and I'm so glad I did. On the day it arrived, my heels were already aching. It was lunchtime when the mat arrived. I eagerly opened up my package and put the mat underneath me. It was miraculous. I'd step on the "carpet", my heels would ache, I'd step on the mat, the aching would almost completely disappear. That helped me last the rest of the day without much pain. Starting the day after, no heal pain at all.I'm so glad I bought this product! I definitely recommend it for people who stand stationary for a couple or more hours a day, like I do. I stand about 7 hours daily, and this makes it alright. When I first searched for anti fatigue mats, I was very put off by pricing. This 24x36 inch mat for $40 is a lot better than other top rated mats I've seen out there. Go for it.

I love trying new coffee brands, styles, and flavors. Every month or so, I try a new coffee off of Amazon or from my local grocery store. This is possibly the best of all that I've tried. It is a matter of taste, so I can't say this coffee is for everyone. It's definitely a medium roast - smooth, strong in taste with no bitterness. If you don't like flavored coffee or only want your coffee dark roasted, this may not be for you. If you're anyone else, I very highly recommend this product!!The experience starts with the smell during brewing. It filled my kitchen with awesomeness and got me excited. I usually like my coffee with barely enough half and half to change the color and one spoon of sugar. When I'm trying a coffee for the first time, I taste it black first, then add my milk and sugar. This coffee tasted really good before I added anything. I could drink it black, and that's rare for me. I still do prefer it with my milk and sugar though. The flavor is terrific. I'm not the best at identifying flavors. I may not have been able to tell you this was vanilla macadamia if I had blind tasted it. All I know is - I absolutely love the flavor.This coffee is as good as it gets for me in all categories - taste, strength, smoothness, and acidity. If you're not opposed to flavored coffee or medium roasts, get this now!! I doubt you'll be disappointed. Other ground coffees I recommend (all medium roasts available on Amazon): Tim Hortons Coffee, Dallmayr Gourmet Coffee, and my previous favorite, Lion Coffee Toasted Coconut (also a flavored Kona blend).

This 9 foot hanging wire met my needs and was definitely worth the $4 I paid for it. That's honestly a great price. I used it to hang up a 24x36 inch canvas in a fairly heavy frame. The wire is flexible enough that it's easy to bend, loop, and move around, yet it's firm enough that it won't come apart when twisted together. I used less than 4 feet of it for hanging the painting. I'm definitely keeping the rest handy for the next time I need something hung.

I have GE fridge model number GSS22KGMA WW. I noticed it was leaking water last week from under the freezer side. When I opened up the freezer, it felt warmer than a freezer should. I could see that the source of the water was the ice in the ice maker melting.I was worried it would be expensive to repair or that I'd need a new fridge. I have no idea how old my fridge is. I did a Google search and followed advice to look inside the freezer to see if the back had frost on it, and it did. Online threads I read said it was most likely the defrost heater element. I unplugged the fridge and followed instructions to get the old heater element out. Sure enough, that was the issue :)I looked online for replacement parts. Buying a replacement from GE is just shy of $40. This compatible defrost heater is a fraction of the price (under $10 at the time of purchase)! I ordered this part and fixed my own fridge 2 days later, on Sunday (thanks to Sunday delivery). I couldn't be more pleased. I saved some money, and the issue wasn't as big as I thought it would be. I do recommend changing this part out yourself. It isn't difficult.I recommend this product for the price! I don't know about durability. I see that some of the negative reviews say it doesn't last long. I'll be sure to update my review if I have any issues with it over time. I just installed it a couple days ago.INSTALLATION NOTE: To clarify, this is a dual defrost heater, even though the pictures above show a single defrost heater. That means this should last longer, but if you're replacing a single defrost heater, there's an extra step in the installation process. You'll have to move one of the 2 wires that connect to the heater element from the left side of the fridge to the right side (so that both connectors are on the right side of the heater element). I had to do that. No big deal.

I love these coffee filters. They're the perfect fit for my 12 cup coffee maker. As many other reviews have emphasized, they're all natural and not needlessly bleached like other paper filters out there. This pack of 100 is currently $6.25, but did you know Amazon also sells a pack of 600 for $17.88? That's less than half the price per filter than what you're paying for this 100 pack. Here's the link: Melitta Cone Coffee Filters, Natural Brown, No. 4, 100-Count Filters (Pack of 6) You're welcome! All mentioned prices are obviously current to the time this review was written.

I'm an immigrant to the States from a far off land where bidets are common. The transition to the American "dry erase" cleanup method has be a literal pain in the rear. That drove me to do some research. I decided to buy this bidet first: LUXE Bidet Vi-110 I love it. It's still in use in the guest bathroom. Super easy to install and use. The issue is that the water gets extremely cold in the winter where I live in Ohio. The Luxe bidet has no hot water hookup. It's usable in winter, but seriously uncomfortable. So I decided to give this Hyundae bidet a shot.Now that I have this Hyundae bidet installed, it's definitely a comfort upgrade from the Luxe. However, some drawbacks to consider:1 - In my house, it takes the water forever to heat up. The water comes out of the bidet cold for up to a minute, even when the heat setting is on the highest. It's not as cold as the Luxe cold water only bidet, so I still do recommend it for winter. How long your water takes to heat up is something to take into account!2 - Installation was such a pain. Seriously! I'm generally a do-it-yourself guy, although I don't know much about plumbing. Connecting the hot water tube to under the sink was a struggle for me. The sizes were different, so I had to make a couple visits to Lowe's to get the right adapters. Perhaps it's best to hire a plumber to do the job if you're not big on plumbing.Those are the 2 reasons I've detracted a star. I've posted pictures in the product gallery with comments. That will give you an idea on what goes into installing and using this bidet. If you live in a warmer area, I do recommend going with the cold water bidet. The link to the Luxe one I recommend is above. This bidet is a good option for colder climates.

We got the "Sugar & Spice" color, which is the Gingerbread man. I posted a picture in the product gallery so you can get an idea of what it looks like on our black stove top. I'm a big fan of this spoon rest and love the look of lots of others on here. It's really creative, colorful and pleasant looking. It's practical as well. Easily holds a couple spoons at a time and is slightly curved inward, so nothing drips off. Love it! Highly recommended!

I used to be pretty frugal with my printer. I have a Canon MG6120, which uses 6 different ink cartridges. It runs out of ink way quicker than I'd like, so I just didn't use it much...only when I absolutely needed to. Now that I've discovered these replacement cartridges, I do a lot more printing!At the time of this review, an official PGI-225 cartridge is $15.99 directly from Canon. This is a set of 3 of pretty much the same thing for $11.99 from Blake Printing. That's $3.99 per cartridge instead of $15.99. That's some serious savings!!I usually buy all the different colors of ink cartridges in one pack together. That's offered by Blake here on Amazon as well: 12 Pack Compatible Canon CLI-226 , PGI-225 2 Small Black, 2 Cyan, 2 Gray, 2 Magenta, 2 Yellow, 2 Big Black. I run out of black ink first though, so every now and then it's necessary for me to buy one of these 3 packs of black cartridges.I cannot recommend this product enough. I can see no quality difference between these cartridges and the official Canon ones, only a drastic price difference.

I definitely like this shelf. I do wish it was cheaper (currently $57 for the black 5 shelf), but I wasn't able to find a better deal for the size/capacity. This shelving unit claims it can hold up to "125 lbs per shelf evenly distributed". That may be possible under ideal conditions and weight distribution, but I'd recommend against nearing that weight limit. I got this shelving unit to organize my garage. So far, it's been doing a great job of that. I posted a picture in the gallery so you can get an idea of what it looks like fully loaded.I've read other reviewers claims that it leans or that the shelves sag. You'll definitely need to exercise some common sense when loading the shelves. It may be rated for 125 lbs per shelf, but I can tell you right now, if you only put 125 lbs on the top shelf and nothing on any other shelf, this thing will lean. Weight distribution matters! Put heavier things on the bottom. Also, if you put some small dense 125 pound item in the center of one of these shelves, it will sag under the weight. So make sure you distribute weight evenly on each shelf, and try to put heavier items on the bottom or as close to the bottom of the shelving unit as possible.I recommend this shelf for people who are just using it as a garage or laundry room shelf and don't intend on hitting the 125 lbs per shelf weight limit. I'm detracting 1 star because (1) I do think this shelf should be a little cheaper for what it is and (2) it's not going to be stable if you blindly follow the "125 lbs per shelf" claim that's being made.The product description states "Can be divided into a 3-shelf unit and 2-shelf unit". I haven't tried, but that may be a good option if you want it to be more stable with a lot of weight on it.

When I bought this drain pan a couple weeks ago, it was $6.15. The price has gone up a couple dollars since then. For the price I got it for, this is a steal. Look around on Amazon and elsewhere. I wasn't able to find a drain pan this big with a spout for the price.With that said, what other reviewers have said about the spout is true. My spout lid closes just fine, but the spout really should be pointing up, not down. After pouring liquid out of the spout, it continues to drip till I close the lid over it, getting some liquid on my hands and around the lid. This would not be an issue if the spout was angled upward.Even with that one downer, I'm giving this a 5 star rating because of the incredible value. For $6.15 this is as good as it gets! It looks like the price fluctuates though, and I don't think I'd pay too much more for this.

This is a great value. The price is currently higher than when I bought it for $12.76 though. I've used it for cutting cables and wires, and for stripping the tips off of 16 gauge speaker wires. It's worked great for what I've need it for thus far. It seems pretty durable. I look forward to using it for years to come!

I bought the following king mattress on Amazon based on stellar reviews: Brentwood Finale 11-Inch Quilted Eurotop Inner Spring Mattress, Made in the USA, Full Size My wife absolutely loved the mattress, but I wasn't all that impressed. It's a tad too soft. At the same time, we'd bought a memory foam mattress for our guest bedroom, and I had a memory foam topper on my old twin bed from my bachelor days. Sleeping on those was a more pleasant experience for me. So the wife agreed to get a memory foam topper for our new inner spring mattress.I decided on this mattress topper because it's rated quite well, met the description of what I was looking for, and the price is awesome ($150 at time of purchase). It arrived quickly and rolled up nicely. I unrolled it and gave it a day to air out, although I didn't smell anything. My sense of smell is known to be lacking though. I set it on our king mattress, and it covered it perfectly. Other reviews have mentioned that this topper is a little too big, but it's perfectly sized for our mattress.Anyway, I lay down on it, and it's divine. It feels so comfy. Adds a little firmness to a bed that was too soft for my taste. This mattress topper feels so good! It's not too firm or too soft. Actually, I think it would be just as good for softening a mattress that's too firm as it was in firming up our overly soft mattress. The material that covers the topper feels so good...too bad we have to put a protector and fitted sheets over it.I very much recommend this mattress topper. It has made my dreams that much better!

I bought this for my wife, and it works, to my everlasting joy. I no longer have to fear taking ill timed deep breaths in her presence. This stuff is marriage saving. My wife is not as self conscious about her foul smelling gas, and if there's no sound, I don't even notice. I cannot recommend this stuff enough. I've read other reviews that say it didn't work for them. I guess it doesn't work for everyone, but it worked for my wife. So give these a try if bad smelling gas is something you struggle with. Who knows, you may never have to blame that foul odor on the poor dog or a random stranger ever again.
