It's a beautiful design and looks just as good in person as in the picture. I've posted an image of this welcome mat at my front door in the product gallery. It sparkles a little (in a good way). I love the color, design, look, size, material...everything about this mat really. I recommend it. If you like the picture, you won't be disappointed. What you see is what you get.

I decided I wanted a stand up desk several months ago after reading a couple articles on the health benefits. I found some cardboard boxes around the office and propped my 2 monitors, laptop, and keyboard on a makeshift stand up desk. That worked great for a couple months! The first week was the hardest, but it quickly got easier. The biggest pain was the fact that it would be too much work to disassemble and reassemble it if I wanted to sit for a short amount of time. So I just stood all the time, which wasn't convenient. A couple weeks ago, my cardboard makeshift desk collapsed in on itself. Fortunately, there was no damage to anything, but that incident convinced me it was time for the real deal. I'd been standing long enough to know it wasn't just another one of my whims.We ordered this desk and it came a day earlier than anticipated. Setting it up was cake. There's no assembly. I got everything setup in 15 mins, and it was back to work. I love the desk. I'm 5'10" (1.78 meters), and this desk is the ideal height for me at it's highest setting, so I can understand why taller people have given the desk negative reviews. My review may not have been as good if I was a couple inches taller myself. For my height, it's perfect. I've posted a couple pictures so you can get an idea of what it looks like. The second picture I posted shows how the desk looks next to me, a 5 foot 10 inch guy.Some have said the desk is unstable. The monitors do shake a little when I pound away at the keyboard, and I'm detracting one star for that. I wouldn't call it "unstable" though since I don't see any chance of it falling or of anything falling off of it. It's only a minor inconvenience. I adapted quickly. It didn't bug me much considering my last desk was cardboard :) I do recommend this desk for people that are my height or shorter....and maybe an inch taller.Being able to easily switch being sitting and standing is a big plus! Standing for too long has it's risks as well (varicose veins).

My wife and I love this product. We added it to our wedding registry not sure what to expect. We wanted a basket that would allow us to separate fruits and vegetables without taking up too much counter space, and this looked pretty cool in pictures. Well, it turned out to be awesome. We love how it looks in our house, especially when it's full. It doesn't look as great when it's empty. What better motivation to keep the house stocked with fruits and veggies? I know I need all the motivation I can get, and a fruit/veggie basket that looks way better when it's full does it for me.The hammocks do swing, so it can tilt and drop things if you overload it. Keep that in mind. I posted some pictures so you can get a better idea of how it might look in your kitchen. I do recommend this 2 tier produce basket.

These are the best boxer briefs I've ever owned. Actually, they're the best undergarments of any kind that I've ever owned. I bought a red (cabernet) pair and a navy blue (arctic night) pair. I got them in medium, which is my usual size, and they fit great. I wanted to treat myself to a nice comfy pair of underwear after my usual Hanes boxer briefs started wearing out again. I'd buy those in bulk. I decided to give these CK Modal briefs a try since they were rated highly online - despite the price tag, which can be a bit discouraging. I decided to make the purchase, and I'm so glad I did.These are the most comfortable boxers I've had the pleasure of pulling up. The material feels so good. When it comes to color, my wife and I both like the red pair more than the navy blue. I was worried that they'd be tight based on the advertised pictures. I looked around online, and all the pictures of these boxer briefs make them look tight. I don't like tight. I suffocate easily down there. These look as tight on me as they do in the pictures, but they don't feel tight at all. They're incredibly comfortable and breathable.The 2 downers are (1) price as I've already mentioned and (2) no easy access opening for the urinal. I think number 2 does result in a more comfortable design, but just not as practical for business time. Despite the 2 downers, I'm still giving this 5/5 stars since (as I may have already mentioned) it's THE most comfortable pair of anything I've ever worn. If you can part with the dollars and cents on the price tag, get these! You won't be disappointed. I can't comment on durability yet as it's only been 3 months.

I have a Toyota Camry, and my wife has a Kia Optima. The place I get them serviced at recommended I get the transmission fluid flushed on the vehicles (they're both at around 90k miles). They quoted me $130 per flush for non-synthetic fluid. I called around and couldn't find a better deal. I did some research and decided to do 2 "drain and fills" per vehicle instead of flushing the transmission.This was the only synthetic transmission fluid I could find that was recommended for both Toyota (IV) and Kia (SP-III), and at $5.5 per quart it's a steal. I'm really happy with the price and quality of this product.So I made 2 orders (12 quarts total). I did 2 drain and fills on my Camry. I waited a couple days between them. I followed a youtube video on how to do that. It's pretty straight forward as long as you can get under the front of your car somehow (ie, jack and jack stands). In my case I also needed to purchase a 10 mm hex bit to remove the transmission plug and a drain pan (or something else to catch the transmission fluid when it pours out). Each drain and fill used about 3.5 quarts.The gear shifting feels smoother than ever, and I saved a ton of money! My transmission dipstick now shows reddish fluid instead of that brown slime that was there before. It's a beautiful sight and only cost me $38.5 per vehicle.

I drink Bold to Ex. Bold flavored coffees so everything other than that will taste a little watery to me.  But I have to say, this is not bad at all.  If you're like 80% of the coffee drinkers out there that like medium strength coffee, you'll like this particular one.  I purchased this for house guests - good choice.

Let's be blunt... you're looking at this product and reading this review because you or someone close to you has a problem.  If it's you you're probably sitting down at your computer leaning off to one side, or standing up with your tablet.  That's not important.  What IS important is that you need some relief and you're wondering if this stuff works.I won't say that my problem is worse or bigger than your problem.  What I will tell you is that when my problem shows up, I start referring to myself as "us" or "we" instead of "I" or "me".  Last year, while on vacation, I actually started referring to it using a person's name.  Anyway, I told you this to emphasize the truthfulness of the review and give you an idea of what you may expect.I read a lot of reviews about smell and bad breath and all that stuff.  Does this stuff have an odor?... yes, it does.  It's best described as a mixture of medicinal, herbal, with a little bit of dirt scent thrown in there for good measure.  I personally don't find it unpleasant and as a matter of fact, Prep H is worse because it smells fishy to me.  The ointment is extremely thick and doesn't stain undergarments or clothing (something I've recently experienced with the H product).  I'm happy to say my breath is no worse than it is already... let me rephrase... I didn't have bad breath before, during, or after using this product.  Maybe if I emptied the entire tube into my nether regions would this be a problem.  But a little dab will do ya, and there's really no reason to go crazy with this stuff unless you're getting some sort of weird enjoyment out of the application process.Once on, the experience you'll get is one of cooling (like something with eucalyptus or menthol in it but not quite as severe).  The sensation was almost immediate and to be quite honest, a huge relief from the burning and pain of an untreated problem.  After a few minutes the pain went away and lasted quite a long time.  Finally, after less than 24 hours after application, the swelling goes down significantly.This is the first product for this problem I've ever used that actually worked.  I'm amazed at the results, and highly recommend it... both of us do.

Why switch from Keurig to Tassimo? Espresso, Cappuccino, Latte, and Cafe Ole. Tassimo does them, and for the most part Keurig does not. Keurig has in fact come out with a new machine called the Rivo but there were two things stopping me from purchasing that one: 1) Milk tank on the side of the Rivo instead of milk pods... I can't be bothered with keeping milk in the fridge and cleaning the tank, 2) Price... Rivo is a lot more expensive.First, some thoughts on the Espresso and Cappuccino that comes out of the Tassimo after all, it's why I switched in the first place. I do like the Cappuccino and Espresso that this machine makes... it's good. Is it on par with what I've had at a really good coffee shop or at a cafe in Italy?... not really. Let's face it Espresso and Cappuccino coming out of a $5000 machine, made from freshly ground coffee, with fresh milk, lovingly crafted by a trained Barista is going to be WAY better than anything coming out of the Tassimo. Expectations adjusted, I think this is a very good machine for the $$$ and I like the fact that a decent cup of Cappuccino is now a quick and convenient option for me (and for guests at my home).Next, coffee.  Does the Tassimo make a good cup of coffee? Well, yes and no. Yes the coffee I made (King of Joe Dark Roast) was good, but I like Green Mountain Coffee Dark Magic for the Keurig better. So it's not the machine, it's the coffee. All things being equal, I'd say the Tassimo / Keurig coffee making capabilities are identical. As a matter of fact, they even operate in a very similar manner... water goes in a holding tank, you turn the machine on, you put your cup under dispenser, load a pod, push a button, out comes coffee. There are subtle differences though and here are the ones that are really important to me...Power on / energy use... Keurig immediately begins to heat up water and is ready a minute or so later, then it anticipates that you might want a second cup and heats up another cache of water. Tassimo is ready right away and starts heating the water when you push the button. Coffee comes out of the Tassimo machine faster, and rarely do I want a second cup right away. POINT - Tassimo.Cup size... My old Keurig has three cup sizes 6oz., 9oz., and 12oz. Tassimo reads a barcode and dispenses a predetermined amount of water based on the info in the barcode. You can however, press a '+' or '-' button before or during the brew process to adjust the amount of water used. POINT - Tie.Beverage variety... Keurig does coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. Tassimo does coffee, tea, hot chocolate, espresso, cappuccino, latte, and cafe ole. POINT - Tassimo.Beverage brands, availability, brand quality... The quality of the coffee is about equal between Keurig and Tassimo. The major difference here is that Keurig has way more variety and choice when it comes to the sheer number of brands and varieties of drinks, plus my favorite coffee is a Keurig-only brand/variety. POINT - Keurig.Beverage quality... Both Keurig and Tassimo make a quality drink. POINT - Tie.Build quality / warranty... Both excellent quality machine, both standard warranties. POINT - Tie.Pod price... Apples to apples (coffee pods only, not coffee/milk pods), without any discounts, the least expensive Keurig pods cost between 61 cents (8 o'clock coffee - 94 cents (Starbucks) each.  Tassimo pods cost between 50 cents (Maxwell House) - 79 cents (Gevalia Dark Breakfast Blend).  POINT - TassimoThere are some other differences that I thought were less important... Tassimo has a smaller water tank (-), Tassimo's water tank accommodates a water filter - I use filtered water so this is sort of a moot point (+), Tassimo is quieter (+), a second cup of coffee takes longer with the Tassimo (-), Tassimo take up less space on the counter (+), Tassimo's cup holder is adjustable - you can remove it entirely or it moves up and down (+).Why I picked the T55 over the other Tassimo models... Simple: the (+) or (-) water adjustment capabilities. The other models allow you ADD water to the brew.  This is something, based on my preference for strong coffee, I would probably NOT do.  I would however choose to run LESS water through the machine and make the brew stronger.Here's my recommendation:1) If getting Espresso, Cappuccino, Latte, and Cafe Ole in addition to Coffee, Tea, and Hot Chocolate out of your machine is important (this is me by the way), then the clear choice is Tassimo.2) If however you only want Coffee, Tea, or Hot Chocolate and huge variety is not really important to you then I still say go with the Tassimo; if anything, you'll save money on the pods.3) Lastly, if you're blown away by the variety and choices of coffees and teas, then go with the Keurig (I THOUGHT this was me, turns out I was wrong... after I tried a bunch of regular and flavored coffees for about two months, I ended up sticking with one brand/variety afterall).GETTING 13 DIFFERENT DRINKS FROM FOUR TASSIMO VARIETIES...Here's what I bought: Caramel Latte Macchiato, Cappuccino, Regular Coffee, Decaf Espresso.  Here's what you can make with that by mixing/matching coffee and milk pods:Caramel Latte Macchiato (as packaged)Caramel Espresso (caramel espresso pod only)Regular Latte (latte milk pod + espresso pod from cappuccino)Decaf Latte (latte milk pod + decaf espresso pod)Cappuccino(as packaged)Regular Espresso (espresso pod only)Caramel Cappuccino (cappuccino milk pod + caramel espresso pod)Decaf Cappuccino (cappuccino milk pod + decaf espresso pod)Regular Coffee (as packaged)Cafe Ole (cappuccino or latte milk pod + regular coffee pod)Decaf Espresso (as packaged)Double shot half-caff espresso (one regular espresso pod, one decaf espresso pod)Double shot half-caff caramel espresso (one caramel espresso pod, one decaf espresso pod)EDITED 11/19/2013...1) I found two dark coffee pods that I enjoy as much as the Keurig Dark Magic... King of Joe Dark Roast, and Maxwell House French Roast.  Both are excellent and the Maxwell House is the least expensive of ALL the pods (SCORE!)2) I have the the PERFECT recipe for Cappuccinos and Lattes for the T55... Milk Pod press the (-) key on the unit; Espresso Pod press the (+) key on the unit.  This combo yields creamier milk and gives more coffee flavor to the drink.3) No regrets on switching whatsoever... I LOVE this machine.

Here's what you can make with that by mixing/matching coffee and milk pods:Caramel Latte Macchiato (as packaged)Caramel Espresso (caramel espresso pod only)Regular Latte (latte milk pod + espresso pod from cappuccino)Decaf Latte (latte milk pod + decaf espresso pod)Cappuccino(as packaged)Regular Espresso (espresso pod only)Caramel Cappuccino (cappuccino milk pod + caramel espresso pod)Decaf Cappuccino (cappuccino milk pod + decaf espresso pod)Regular Coffee (as packaged)Cafe au lait (cappuccino or latte milk pod + regular coffee pod)Decaf Espresso (as packaged)Double shot half-caff espresso (one regular espresso pod, one decaf espresso pod)Double shot half-caff caramel espresso (one caramel espresso pod, one decaf espresso pod)EDITED 11/19/2013...1) I found two dark coffee pods that I enjoy as much as the Keurig Dark Magic... I LOVE this machine.EDIT #2 11/12/2014...Well, the machine is still going strong - no problems whatsoever.Corrections, comments, tips, etc:1) This Tassimo is faster than Keurig on both the first and second cups.2) I do in fact use the button to put more water in the cup.  First I press the "-" to get a stronger brew, then press the button for five seconds to put a little more water in.3) TIP:  My tap water is really hard and descaling is a MUST.  I use a small amount of Lemishine dishwasher crystals to get the mineral deposits out of the machine.4) TIP:  You won't spill any water putting a filled tank in the back of the machine if you pay attention to the maximum water level.  If you do and you're still spilling, then you're angling the tank further than you need to.5) BB&B that certain store chain that sends 20% off coupons that don't expire has a nice selection of TDiscs at good prices (I go there if the Amazon price gets too high)

I've had two Android smartphones in the past... 1) The original Motorola Droid & 2) The Droid Bionic.  Here's the stuff about Droid that drove me to Windows Phone 8...**Battery life - crazy bad to the point where I had to install the extended battery and cover (also true of my friend's Samsung phones).**Connection issues - 4G showing up in the display and the phone telling me during a navigation session "Data Connection Lost".  Really? I'm navigating somewhere... now what?**Random reboots - Oh yeah, never during a call but I'd be in the middle of web browsing session only to have the phone reboot itself.**Browser crashes - happened all the time.**4G to WiFi to 4G transition - a nightmare.  I'd have to turn off WiFi, wait a couple of seconds, and then turn it back on.**Bloatware and the inability to delete Verizon apps.  There were a LOT of unused apps, taking up space, that I would have loved to delete if I could.**Cost - $299 w/2-year contract renewal.Comparison to the Nokia 928**Battery life - you can't change the battery but you really don't have to.  It lasts all day with power to spare**Connection issues - there are none.**Random reboots - never happens.  As a matter of fact, I haven't had to manually reboot this phone for any reason whatsoever.**Browser crashes - none**4G to WiFi to 4G transitions - smooth as anything - there's no interruption in the data flow.**Bloatware - I actually LIKE the apps that came with this phone especially Nokia Drive, HERE Maps, HERE City Lens, and all the Nokia photo apps.  The one "already installed" app I wouldn't use, ESPN, was easily erased.**Cost - $99 w/2-year contract renewal.Notable features of the 928 & Windows Phone 8...Beautiful displayEasy OS - One screen for shortcuts (tiles) and one screen that lists ALL the programs.Great camera - pretty good low light photos, beautiful daytime photos, and a bunch of creative photo apps from Nokia that are fun and impressiveCall quality - very good; no complaintsProcessor speed - very smooth; no lagLive tiles - not the "nightmare" that I've heard of... some are kind of cool, some are functional.  All in all a nice feature to have.Navigation - works without an active data connection (map file is pre-installed).Apps - This seems to be a huge issue for some people.  Are there less apps available for WP8?, yes.  Do I care?, not really.  Why?, there really hasn't been an app that I wanted I couldn't find, or find an acceptable substitute.  I have Facebook, Skype, Open Table, Netflix, Hulu, Pandora, etc.  More apps are being made available daily.  I found a decent tip calculator, a Drop-Box & You-Mail interface that's fully functional, and a bunch of games.  I know there's a zillion apps for Android and Apple IOS, but most of them are crappy or repetitive (how many flashlight apps do you need anyway?).  Oh by the way, all the apps I downloaded and installed were freebies.Thing I don't like about the phone...**Volume control... there's seems to be one control that affects everything (ringer, notifications, alarm, media, etc.)  A minor annoyance, but I would like to have more controls.**No FoxFi (I didn't use free WiFi tethering THAT often, but now I'll have to deal with its absence).Conclusion...I don't miss the Android OS at all.  There were too many issues with it for me to continue using it.  I was waiting for this phone to come out on Verizon and I'm glad I did.  It's not perfect, but it works really well.  Even though there are less apps than Android, they seem to be better written (more polished, more functionality, etc.) and there hasn't been anything I needed or wanted that I couldn't find.  I can't believe I got this newly released phone for $99.If you're in the market for a new phone, don't listen to the FANatics, think for yourself, and take a good look at this phone.

I purchased this pool relitively late in the summer, but I couldn't pass up a $[...] purchase (including tax and delivery) on a pool that others are selling for $[...].  I initially thought I'd just buy and store until next summer, but it was important to me to make sure everything was a-ok before the warranty expired.  Warranties start when you receive the item, not when you start using it.  So ... I decided to set it up and now I'm hoping for warm weather well into September.I've read reviews here on Amazon and at other places.  To anyone that put up this pool by themselves: Kudos!  I had someone help me and it took us just under two hours.  We were extra EXTRA careful to follow all the instructions and we took our time.  I'd recommend that you have at least 1-2 people on hand to help ... it will make installation much easier.Important thing I didn't know when I purchased the pool and planned the installation: If you're installing the pool on grass or ashphalt, Intex recommends that you place a 15"x15"x1.2" steel, wood, or reinforced tile support pad under each U bracket.  With this pool that's 12 pieces.  Well, at Home Depot we realized our only choice would be to have a 2"x12"x8' piece of pressure treated wood cut into 12 equally sized pieces.  Not quite the 15" that Intex recommends, but far better than using nothing.  Cost: $[...].  IMPORTANT:  The grain of the wood MUST be perpendicular to the support or it will split.  Now about the pool...Delivery: The delivery from Pilot Freight was on-time ... as a matter of fact, they came 1/2 an hour early.  Although it's curbside delivery, the two delivery guys brought the 300 lb. box to my backyard on request.  For that not so little 'extra',  they deserved an appropriate tip.Ease of Installation: 5-stars.  There's a lot of easy steps.  Also, there's an instruction book for EVERYTHING and they include two DVDs as well.Overall Quality: 5-stars.  The pool went together without any incidents at all.  Everything fit to-a-tee and worked as expected.  The filter/sanitizer combo is quiet and really pumps strongly.  The leaks around the fittings that I found were easily remedied by slightly tightening the connections (I didn't tighten them enough).  I found no leaks in the liner.Sturdiness: 4.75-stars. Once the pool is filled with water it's seems extremely sturdy although you shouldn't be concerned that the corners 'self-adjust' as you're swimming ... they're designed that way.  NOTE: The only thing that isn't sturdy is the ladder.  I wouldn't say it's flimsy, but it does shake a bit when using it so you need to be EXTRA careful going in and out of the pool.Package Completeness: 5-stars.  Everything is included to setup and use the pool except salt (you need three, 40 lb. bags to start - got at Home Depot), and the supports I mentioned.  The deluxe cleaning kit includes a skimmer unit, adjustable pole, vaccuum head, brush head, and leaf skimmer head.  It also comes with a debris cover that fits nicely on the top (and also heats the first couple of inches of water when left on in the sun), a Volley-ball set (I didn't bother with the Volleyball set ... It's still in the package), and a large but pretty thin ground cover.  There's also a ladder, which I already mentioned.Fun:  Yup, it's fun.  It was filled and being used in under 24-hours after receiving it.  Although it fits in my small backyard easily, it doesn't 'feel' small when swimming.  The combination of the 18' length and especially the 48" depth makes it fell larger than it is.I'm VERY happy with this purchase.  I think with proper care, it should last many summers and honestly ... what's MORE fun in the summertime than a swimming pool?  This company makes owning a pool easy and does a great job in letting you know everything you need to make the experience even better.  I wish I had though about this three years ago when I bought my house.

Purchased this watch this past Spring.  By the Summer, the screws holding the watch case to the bracelet came loose and the watch fell off my wrist while driving.  I was able to find most of it and sent it back to the mfg. for replacement.  The people at Timepieces International were very nice and I received my replacement after about six weeks (they were out of stock at the time).  The crown on the replacement however was bent and prevented me from screwing it down.  My third replacement had the same problem but only slightly, so I decided to keep it.There's no denying that the watch is beautiful and this one is acceptably accurate, but I've never had any watch ... not even a cheap 'gift with cologne purchase' watch just fall apart like this one.  My suspicion is that the movement may be Swiss, but even the Swiss make cheap movements.  Further the watch doesn't say 'Swiss Made' which leads me to believe that the watch, for all intensive purposes is actually Chinese.  I work quality for a cosmetic manufacturing company and the Chinese imported components I've seen are of such low quality, that needless to say I'm not a big fan of Chinese made goods.I do have to give kudos to customer service though ... they were very responsive, they didn't interrogate me about details of the problem, and they gave me accurate information about the turnaround time.I don't think I'll be buying any more watches from Timepieces International.  I have a couple of friends that have watches from them and they each have complaints (inaccurate, short battery life, etc.)  If I want a good cheap Swiss movement watch, I think I'll go with Invicta instead.  I own several and all have been problem free and their designs range from big chunky modern to classic 'Rolex Submariner' type and everything in between.Too bad too ... this watch line is extremely attractive to me but I can't get past the poor quality problem.

I received a free sample of this planter in exchange for a fair and honest review. I really like the size and color of the planter. There is an insert for the bottom so that your plant isn't sitting in a puddle of water, and a plug in the side so you can drain any excess water. Overall the planter is a great item for the price and I would highly recommend it. I currently have a spider plant in mine and in the spring I plan on purchasing several more for the porch to plant flowers in. I love the bright colors and the chain is strong and durable also. Definitely holds up to the amount of weight added with pottting soil and a plant. Great item!

Hunting season has arrived, and it's no shave November... each year my husband insists he's going to grow a beard and each year he gets itchy and has to shave his face. He has had a goatee year round, but even that gets to a certain length and starts to itch and give him a certain amount of discomfort. When I was offered a sample of this item in exchange for a fair and honest review I jumped at the chance. I wanted to see my husband with a full beard, and he wanted to try it out because it was scent free and wouldn't interfere with his hunting. (yeah right) ;) Anyhoo, he's been using it every day for a little over a month, and he LOVES it. He hasn't shaved his face and he hasn't had the issues that he has in years past either. No bumps or itchy spots and he really does like that it isn't scented for when he wants too hunt. He's obsessed with smelling like dirt and mold when he walks in the woods. :( His beard is so soft it's unbelievable! We are both very impressed with the results of the beard oil and he says he's going to continue to use it, even after hunting season. Which means he can play Santa Claus this year too! YaY!

This mask has been a lifesaver in the last several weeks since I received it free in exchange for a review. I quit smoking 5 weeks ago and believe it or not, it caused me to get the worst case of sinusitis that I've ever had. This mask has worked so well, I use it hot and cold to soothe the sinus headaches that I've been suffering from for a month, I don't like to take a lot of pills for pain, and while I wait for the antibiotics to kick in, this mask has been working great to ease the discomfort. I love how it conforms to my face and blocks out all the light and it's not so heavy that it hurts when added to the pressure from my sinuses. The scent isn't overpowering and I actually find it soothing also. I would recommend it to anyone who suffers from headaches, or sinusitis. It's done wonders for mine!

These are great socks!! I received these socks in exchange for a fair and honest review approximately a month or so ago. These socks wear wonderfully, they don't slide off your foot, even when you're on the go from dawn til the wee hours of the next morning. He could wear them in regular tennis shoes and higher sneakers alike without fear of them sliding down or off his foot. They fit true to size, and were comfortable, nice and thick and stretchy. They clean up great, hold up well to his rotten feet that seem to eat socks and he loves them. So the verdict would be that these are a bargain for the price, and great quality!

I received these decals in exchange for a fair and honest review. I have to say, I LOVE them! I carry my day planner with me everywhere I go, but I have a really hectic schedule at work. This is a great phone case. It fit the iPhone perfectly and I love how it stays closed without flopping open constantly like the one from the mall did! It has just enough room for my debit card, my driver's licence and a few bills. Which is really all I need in a pinch when I'm going out and don't want to carry a purse. I really like the case and how well it's made. The fact that it actually stays shut is what makes it a keeper for me!I received this case in exchange for a fair and honest review.

This is a great bulb, I recently purchased a home and remodeled several rooms in the home and installed new lighting. It has a nice golden light and isn't glaringly bright, even at it's brightest. After more than 10 years my winter boots finally bit the bullet. The thinsulate was more thin than insulating, and they were starting to leak. They were no longer bugaboots, they were slush catchers. I needed something warm, and I needed them BEFORE the cold weather started! I have literally searched high and low for something stylish and warm, and this is what I chose.I LOVE these boots! They are comfortable, stylish and warm. The color is great, they weigh virtually nothing compared to my last pair of winter boots and I love that I can wear them all day without getting fatigued from the weight of the boot! Keen has definitely outdone themselves as far as I'm concerned. I will be treating them so that they don't get stained from salt and water, but other than that I'm confident that they won't leak. The workmanship is wonderful and they are gorgeous!

I LOVE this mouse, I received it free in exchange for a fair and honest review and I have to say, I've started using it exclusively and put away my "name brand" one that I paid three times the amount that this one costs! This mouse is comfortable in your hand, and has nice rubber or silicone type grips on the sides that make it a nice firm grip. My more expensive mouse didn't have that feature, so I had to seal it in a baggie when I replaced it so I didn't lose the little widget. :( I really love this mouse, and for the price of less than $9 you just can't go wrong!

So I'm not a tech savvy person, but when I was offered this item in exchange for a fair and honest review I jumped at the chance. I have an older laptop that I have a ton of movies and music on and I was unable to hook it up to my TV at my camp and I wanted to be able to watch shows and movies that I had downloaded. I was easily able to hook this unit up to my TV and laptop and watch everything and play music through the TV also. I was actually surprised at how easy it was to do! The unit is very good quality, comes with it's own power unit and is super easy to use. I would highly recommend it, especially for the price of $15.99!

I purchased this as a gift for my boarder. I found that I had tortured him to the point of his nearly wanting to move out so I thought I'd bribe him to stay with a hard to find gift. He nearly cried when I gave this to him. Mainly because I put it in one of those trick things that you have to be a genius to open and I forgot how to open it and it took me three days to find the paper that told you how to open it. He had been looking for this CD for years and he was so pissed he couldn't listen to it... hehe I'm surprised he's still here!!

Sooo I have a couple of secrets I don't normally discuss in mixed company. So gents, leave the room. NOW. OK gals, here's the skinny. I have a hairy chin, I know, I know, you'd never have guessed it right? Seriously. I'm 45 and I have PCOS and hypothyroidism. The hair falls off my freaking head and grows on my chin at an abnormally fast rate. God hates me. It's just that simple. If he didn't hate me the hair would fall off my chin and grow on my head at an abnormally fast rate right?I received this mirror in exchange for a fair and honest review. I was so excited when I got home from hunting camp and it had arrived that I literally opened it right up, sat down and began plucking! Yes, real women pluck, yank and tweeze. Anyhoo, the mirror comes packaged in the box shown, nicely protected in thick foam. Very little assembly is required, you simply have to screw the base to the stand attached to the mirror and you are in business!I immediately sat down at the dining room table and used the bright afternoon light to get to work. After having been at camp with no tweezers for the weekend, I was in need of a good going over. I was absolutely SHOCKED at just how many hairs I had on my chin! I literally had a hundred! The 10X magnifier just amazed me at how much I could see! I was blown away at how well it worked with or without my glasses! I was easily able to find all the blonde and dark hairs alike without having to twist my head into contortionistic positions like I do in the bathroom mirror in order to get the right angle :( Plus I was much more comfortable sitting at the dining room table making my boarder watch me while he fixed his lunch. I invited him to join me, but he chose to eat in his room... his loss. I mean, it was dinner and a show as far as I was concerned. ;)As far as I'm concerned this mirror is worth every penny you'd pay for it. I have been using a 5x mirror that was my grandmother's for years and I'm amazed at the difference. I am seriously buying a couple of these mirrors for both of my hairy sisters for their Christmas gifts, and giggle if you will. I happen to know they will be their favorite gifts! Take it from a grizzle chinned girl, this mirror will be the gift of the season!

I received this bag in exchange for a fair and honest review. I have to say, I literally LIVE out of my backpack. I have a job where I work out of three different offices and I have to haul a LOT of stuff around with me in order to "feel" like I'm not forgetting something. This includes my personal items. I have a "touch" of OCD and there are several must haves for me so that I can leave work and go to my work out also.This bag is PERFECT for work AND my work outs. It has two HUGE pockets that I can keep my personal and work items separate in, plus it came with a bag that I choose to use for my extra work out clothes, I throw my clean work out clothes in it every morning and leave it and my mat in my car, then use the bag with my personal and work items in it during the day, add my mat and work out clothes in the afternoon and I'm good to go! I love the two front pockets for smaller items like my keys, chapstick and cell phone so they don't get lost in the bigger pockets, and the side pocket really does hold a water bottle. It was a shock for me that it actually held the bottle instead of it falling out all the time! While I LOVE the little mesh pocket on the strap for my cellphone, I'm a terrible klutz, so I have a lifebox on my phone and it won't fit in the pocket, otherwise I'd keep my phone there! However, I do keep my business card holder in there, it fits perfectly and doesn't get lost in the mess of the big pockets! This is hands down the best day/night transitioning backpack I've had to date! I know it sounds crazy that someone would transition their pack that way, but I have too much stuff for a purse and this bag is perfect for me!

I was offered this item  in exchange for a fair and honest review. I actually jumped at the chance to review it because I had recently purchased a much more expensive HDMI cable and it wasn't up to snuff. I was in the market for another HDMI cable for my computer and I figured why not give this one a go?I was not disappointed! Now I will admit, I am NOT a tech savvy person at ALL. Great quality at half the cost, you just can't go wrong!

I received these socks free in exchange for a fair and honest review. With that being said, let me explain that I am not the most health conscious person in the world. It's not that I'm unhealthy, it's just that unless a zombie is chasing me, or there is only one beer left on earth I don't plan on EVER running if you get my drift.Sooo I get a new job this year. And part of this new job is discussing "recovery" with my peers and encouraging them to use healthy coping skills and such. Well... I'm not such a good role model now am I? So I decide to try yoga. And along come these wonderful socks at just about the right time, a couple of weeks after I sign up for my first yoga lessons. I figure if I'm going to have to preach to the choir, I might as well be able to say I tried to sing the songs right?These socks arrived about two weeks into my yoga experiment. Up to their arrival I had been using this yoga mat "towel" cover thingy that slipped and slid all over my mat while I was attempting to do the choking dog and the stroking out crane. ;) Did I mention I also quit smoking recently and nearly hocked up a lung trying to stretch into some of these positions? Anyhoo, using the towel thing was extremely dangerous for me. I don't know if it was dangerous because I'm a klutz or because I'm new to yoga, but I found these socks to be particularly helpful. They fit just fine and helped to keep me on my own mat rather than whomever had the misfortune of being next to me in class. And yes, I did end up on other people's mats several times, much to their dismay. It didn't bother me so much as them. I laughed heartily, them not so much :( The socks weren't so grippy that I wasn't able to easily switch positions, they were just right as a matter of fact! They weren't too loose, nor too tight on the toes, and they didn't slip off my ankles and down my feet either. I had worn some ankle socks the first time and actually lost one and never found it again. Seriously.I have since found that yoga is NOT my thing. The socks I enjoy immensely. I have moved on to PiYo, and the socks moved with me. :) I think the people of PiYo are much more forgiving of my klutziness and accepting of my "dropping" in during class into their personal space, and several have complimented my socks. ;)

This was my first experience with an Antimicrobial Toothbrush. I have to say, I haven't noticed a huge difference, which is a good thing of course!! My teeth are squeaky clean and sparkling white after brushing them, and usually I'm an extra firm brush user, but I'm happy with the firmness of this "soft" bristle brush. It's not so soft that I don't feel it isn't getting my teeth clean. While I received this brush free in exchange for a fair and honest review, I have to admit that knowing that it's antimicrobial might lean me towards purchasing these in the future since per brush they are within pennies of the current brand I purchase and I like them just as well as the brand I use.

This was my first experience using bamboo wash cloths. I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised! They were soft and very easily lathered with the soap and body wash that I tried with them. I liked the size of the cloth, I could easily soap one side and leave the other side soap free for a quick wash up and rinse for a child or toddler. They washed up great both prior to and after use and didn't shrink or change shape or size either, which is a huge plus for me! None of the edge came unraveled and overall the quality of these cloths is just amazing for the price of 6! I did receive these in exchange for a fair and honest review, but I truly enjoyed them so much that I would consider purchasing in the future for baby shower gifts. They are just wonderful and come packaged so nicely! What a great alternative, and if you're like me and think that baby wipes are a waste of money when you're at home, these cloths are great!

To Kill A Mockingbird is my favorite novel from my childhood. I was torn when I heard the announcement about this book. I wanted to read it, but I didn't want to read it. I wanted to love it, I wanted to hate it. I was sure it would never live up to my expectations... But somehow it surpassed them! I was surprised by the book, the topic, the "growth" of the characters and where they went in life. I was surprised by how I didn't want to put the book down until I had to put the book down, and how I was itching to pick it back up! It will never replace my beated up old paperback copy of TKAM but I enjoyed it.

I have a huge craft supply and I keep a LOT of my items in my grandma's old mason jars. I LOVE these labels because I can easily wipe them off and relabel the jars as I switch them out. This is one of the easiest selfie sticks I've ever used. It fit a variety of phones, plugged in and was simple and easy to use, even for my younger nieces to try with their phones without me present. I was offered a sample of this product in exchange for a fair and honest review. I loved them too, I would have loved them even more had I been able to have five or six berries!! They really are delicious and I can see why she stole the bag!

I had never tried commercial cacao powder before, so when I was offered this product in exchange for a fair and honest review I jumped at the chance to sample it. I have to say that I was excited to try and I am not disappointed at all! I have used it in a variety of baking recipes, in milkshakes and smoothies also. It has yet to disappoint me! The flavor is robust without being overpowering, and combines beautifully with the cacao nibs from Viva Labs also! Every product from this company is of the highest quality and the flavors are always to die for!

I love baking with cacao nibs, but anyone who regularly bakes with them knows that poor quality nibs, or stale nibs can make or break your recipe. These are some of the best quality, and best flavored nibs I've ever baked with. I've used them in a variety of baking recipes and tried them in my very first smoothie and I LOVE them! The flavor is bold without being overpowering. I have ordered some from other companies that have literally tasted like dirt and others that were alkaline tasting. These are by far my favorite and I will be ordering more in the future. I was offered these free in exchange for a fair and honest review, and I'm so glad I tried them. I love finding a product that is this good quality, it makes a huge difference in each recipe!

I was offered a free sample of these Chia seeds in exchange for a fair and honest review. I accepted because I had heard that chia seeds were high in magnesium and I suffer from strange cramps all over my body on a daily basis. I was quite excited to try these seeds and immediately began adding them to my morning yogurt along with my granola and fruit. I didn't mind the new texture, and I've come to enjoy the addition. After several days of consuming the chia seeds I began to notice fewer and fewer cramps also! When I say I was suffering from strange cramps let me explain. I would get charlie horse like cramps in my chin and neck, if I was carrying objects in my hand for more than a minute or two my thumb would lock up and start to twist towards my wrist, my toes would literally start to separate and curl UPWARDS. These were immensely painful and would cause almost contortionistic movements that I would have to strain to straighten out. So to not suffer from these anymore was more than relief, it was nirvana! I don't like using medications if I don't have to, so being able to add chia seeds to my diet makes me happy and confident that I'm doing something good for myself.

I wasn't looking to lose weight when I tried this MCT oil, I'm not over weight, and I normally have plenty of energy... I work in a psychiatric center and I literally walk about 6 miles a day while at work. I have adult ADHD, I'm sure you can only imagine how well that works at my job ;) I'm in a psychiatric center, I'm hyper and I can't concentrate :( Not a good combination to say the least. Anyhoo, I was offered a free sample of this product in exchange for a fair and honest review. Before accepting the product I did a quick bit of research on the product and saw that it had more than a few benefits to it. I'm very conscientious about what I put into my body. I have never medicated myself with psychotropic medications for my ADHD and I prefer to use all natural products and I avoid all foods with preservatives and dyes to control my ADHD. This product is purported to help with concentration, energy and weight loss. You may think I was crazy to try it when I'm already hyper but the results for me were phenomenal.I found that when I added a tablespoon of this to my yogurt, fruit and granola in the mornings I was more able to focus, remember things with out having to carry a list around with me and I actually had LESS energy spikes throughout the day. I was more level and able to perform my work duties without having to get up and move or bounce around like I normally do to release energy. I believe that this product helped to balance my hyperactivity, and kept me focused throughout the ENTIRE day. I was pleasantly surprised, as was my office mate! I went from constantly looking for the last thing that was in my hand or jumping up and moving around the office or running around the hospital to release some energy to being able to get some work done for extended periods of time and knowing exactly where EVERYTHING was!To date I haven't lost any weight, but that's absolutely fine by me, as long as I maintain my current weight I'm happy. My cholesterol seems to be fine according to my most recent bloodwork and it does not change the flavor of my yogurt at all.

Sooo I was offered these bulbs free in exchange for a fair and honest review. Here's the honest part. They are not at ALL what I expected. I thought they were to replace headlight bulbs. I know, I know, you're all thinking what an idiot right? Well I never claimed to be a rocket scientist. I thought they were the plug in thingy. I really take my free reviews to heart. I did not want to leave J&C hanging and not give them a fair review, and obviously I'm being completely honest. So I did some googling about what to do with these babies. Well lo and behold, I found out you can replace outdoor halogen bulbs with these things. I just happened to have unhooked two motion activated lights this summer because they were older and the trees constantly set them off and the cost was outrageous, even after adjusting them. So I thought, why not move them to a spot where the trees won't affect them, switch out the bulbs and rehook them up. I know, I know, now you're all asking how the girl who thought these were headlight replacements was able to accomplish that right? Well I didn't! hehe I had my husband and our boarder do it! Boo ya! I am smart enough to delegate the duties to those who have the proper qualifications ;)Fast forward a couple of weeks and we are in business! The lights work great, I even waited for an electric bill and there is barely a change! I was actually shocked at how easy it was for the guys to change these bulbs out for the halogens. I probably could have done it once they showed me what they did. Now I have a light that lights up the entire yard when I take the dog out at night, but doesn't go off when the wind blows and I learned that I should research strange offers before I accept them!

I will start off by saying that I have tried more than a few Insta Natural products and I've never been disappointed, and this one is no different! While I don't have a ton of wrinkles I am starting to get fine lines and I definitely have some darker spots on my face. I also have large pores and I have noticed a dramatic difference since I began using this product this summer. I have actually had coworkers ask me if I have started using different make up, if I had done something different with my hair, or if I was sleeping better. All have commented that my face looked brighter and that I do NOT look my age :) I'm about to turn 45 and one of my clients told me she guessed I was 28 last week! That was enough to convince me that this serum was doing it's job. I'm not one of those people who is fighting my age, but if something as simple as applying this serum makes people start to ask questions about why I look so good, then I'm not above using it every day!!How I use it:I remove my make up with a hypoallergenic make up remover cloth, I can't stand the oily residue it leaves behind so then I wash my face afterwards and I then apply the InstaNatural Vitamin C Serum. I know some folks have said they feel a sticky feeling, but I have had no such issues. I wait for it to dry before I put my glasses back on and I'm good to go ;) I love the fresh clean smell of the serum too. I do have chemical sensitivity issues and this product has never caused me any issues. In fact none of InstaNaturals products have, it's one of the reasons I love them so much!I highly recommend this product. It's great for anyone looking to lighten up dark spots, get rid of fine lines, or prevent them from starting!I did receive this item free in exchange for a fair and honest review.

I purchased a new house this year, with an inground pool. When I lived in my apartment across town I had lots of company for dinner parties, but ironically no one wanted to visit on sunny, hot days. What a turn around this year! The half acre yard was full to brimming with kids, adults, friends, family, neighbors and hangers on! Not that I mind, I love having company! However when people drop in at the last minute they rarely remember to bring important things like sunblock! While I had plenty of that on hand, people rarely remember to reapply it either!Enter Insta Natural Aloe Vera Gel!!! Seriously, this stuff was a life saver for at least 20 people this summer! I kept it in the cooler while everyone was over and as the burns happened we would apply it and soothe everyones hurts! This gel is hands down the BEST aloe gel I've ever had the pleasure of using. It's not thick, gooey or sticky the way many on the market are. Nor are there unneeded scents or "cooling" agents added. The consistency is just a tad thicker than water, it absorbs quickly and goes right to work. I have a LOT of chemical sensitivity issues with perfumes, detergents and the such and this gel worked great when I had a terrible reaction to wearing a new sunblock in the pool too! I ended up with a chemical burn and the aloe gel soothed it and took away the angry red and the sting. I also had a mishap with my new double oven and the gel worked great on that, no scar either! I really can't say enough about Insta Natural and their aloe gel. The price for this size bottle is half of what you'd pay for a comparable size of a name brand with perfumes and coloring at a drug store and in my opinion works twice as good without the added ick. I love that it comes with a pump, a screw cap and a push cap so you have three choices for dispensing the product too. I will definitely be investing in another bottle for next years pool season!I did receive a sample of this item in exchange for a fair and honest review.

Since I've received this case I've received many compliments on the unique design. I received this item in exchange for a fair and honest review.
