No one who  doesn't already understand what underlies the paradox of thrift, namely that if everyone stops spending at once, it will make everyone poorer, since your spending is my income and vice versa, will come away any the wiser. They don't want to explain the paradox of thrift, because they want to convince you that the reason our economy is a mess is because crass people got greedy and spent too much money, not that there could be anything fundamentally wrong with capitalism.

We all know the stories of WW2, the men and women of the Greatest Generation, maturing so young and fighting against Hitler, and returning to the US quietly to take up their life with the psychic wounds battened down. But it had never occurred to me that thousands of men deserted from the front lines in Europe, and that some of them lived as bandits, stealing from the US Army (leaving their own comrades short of supplies on the front lines) and selling their stolen goods on the black market. Yet that is the story this book tells.Only one man in the US Army was executed for desertion, but many more walked away from combat, got separated from their units, sometimes went AWOL *towards* the front lines rather than away from them, took up with prostitutes or other young women, hid in farmhouses, joined the French resistance or the French Foreign Legion, or ran riot through the streets of Paris. This is an engrossing tale. In the process of telling it, Charles Glass gives a clearer picture than most books of what life as a soldier in combat was actually like in WW2.Unfortunately for me, I had a hard time keeping track of the overlapping stories of several different men whose lives are narrated herein. I spread the reading of the book out over several weeks, and if I had made more of an effort, I could have followed the plot line more clearly.A couple of details stand out to me in this story--as a member of the Japanese-American community, I am struck by the fact that the famous Nisei 442 battalion recorded not a single desertion. I am also struck by the disproportionate punishments given to African-American soldiers who committed crimes while in uniform.And on a contemporary note, I am struck by the fact that Great Britain offered amnesty to all troops who had deserted during the war. Their crime was clearly much greater than the "crime" of those who come to the United States seeking work and a better life, and yet amnesty was chosen as the wisest course because it would allow them to be restored as functioning members of society, rather than living a shadowy existence without legal right to work.This book also made me realize that it is not impossible that some of the MIA from the Vietnam War may indeed have made the choice to disappear into a life with a Vietnamese wife. And how much easier it was for soldiers in Europe to blend in and simply taken on a new identity.In any case, this is a fascinating book and I am glad it was written while at least one of the men Glass writes about is still alive to tell his side of the tale.

I received this kindle book for free, in exchange for an honest review. The honest truth is that when I get something free, I tend not to rush to read it. But once I started this one, I had a hard time stopping. It caught and kept my interest.However, it's not a great book. The premise is a bit far-fetched, and there are many coincidences in the plot to make it work. Also, a lot of the exposition comes through long letters which the conspirators write to each other and encode, in which they tell each other all the background and the whole plot. This is not believable to me.But it does make one think--is there a method behind all the conspiracy theory madness?I was more than a little confused by Ted Kuzinski's role in the story (he's the Unibomber but he seemed to be a good guy here.)And yes, there's some hot sex here, though the fact that the main character and presumably alter-ego of the author is the one that the incredibly sexy hooker falls in love with was a bit creepy.And the very last page of the book seems to imply that the author actually fears for his life--he refuses to say anything about himself except that he's an adult male. I don't know if this is schtick or craziness.

but I don't have a smart phone, so this is the next best thing if I want to roam around Chicago and have some idea of what I am seeing. The walks are compact enough to actually make sense, and they cover a fair amount of the city.

When you entitle a longish book about a long road trip "The Longest Road," you have to be prepared for the possibility that the reader will want out of the car somewhere along the way! But this book kept me interested all the way from the end (or beginning) of the road in Key West, Florida, to the end of the country above the Arctic Circle in Prudhoe Bay,Alaska. The conceit of the book is that Caputo set out, not in search of himself, or even of America, but of the answer to the question: What (if anything) holds the 50 diverse states together? What is the Unum of the E Pluribus, as he puts it one time.So, like any book of this sort, the real interest is not so much in the descriptions of the scenery (though that is well-done) but of the conversations the author has with people along the way. In this regard, Philip Caputo seems like a decent companion. He manages to meet and mingle not only with "folksy" sorts, and not only with angry conservatives or liberals, but with a meaningful cross-section of Americans, if there can be such a thing (which is pretty much the underlying question here.)  If you are a strong conservative, you might not enjoy Caputo's company entirely, since he is a mellow sort of liberal who also happened to have served in combat in Vietnam (and apparently written a seminal book about it, though I hadn't heard of him or it previously.)Like any such book, there are the usual comments on marital harmony or lack therof along the way, though only a little, and there are the particular details of the travel itself, the repairs needed, the challenges of sleeping in a trailer, etc. But I found less of this self-reflection in the book, and more of an outward focus, on the places and people Philip and his wife met along the way. I have no desire to travel so many miles (over 8,300, and that's not counting the drive to Key West to start, nor the drive back to Texas to drop off the trailer!)My favorite road book of all time is Full Tilt (Ireland to India by bicycle!) and other books by the indefatigable Dervla Murphy, and this doesn't quite live up to that level, but it beats many an "across the USA to find ___" because Caputo is an amiable and observant companion who asks good questions and records the answers faithfully. (I certainly liked it better than Peking to Paris, which told a similar story, with way too much attention to the writer's own self-image.)

A couple of chapters into this book, I was asking myself, "How have I never heard of this writer before?" And before even finishing the book, I was ordering is previous work (Driving Mr. Albert) simply because I didn't want this book to end. This is a masterpiece, on a level with Jon Krakauer's Into Thin Air or Richard Preston's The Hot Zone, in which it doesn't matter that you had no previous interest in Mount Everest or biological warfare, or in  this case, Spanish cheese.Paterniti takes a more or less simple story of a farmer in Spain who creates a fantastic cheese and then, through mismanagement, loses the company he has built, and turns it into a reflection on how life is to be lived, how it feels to be a young father, what is worth living for, how time changes, and yet doesn't change, everything. He has a huge man-crush on this guy whose language he doesn't even speak at first, and he manages to spend so much time with him that he falls completely under his spell, bringing his wife and kids not once but twice, to spend weeks in a dessicated village in Spain.Life in the village of Guzman is everything that life in modern America is not. People spend their time in rooms that Paterniti calls Telling Rooms, caves, actually out on the hillside, where wine flows freely (wine they themselves have made) and food is shared lovingly with friend and stranger alike. No "stranger danger" here, no hours spent before screens "chatting" electronically with disembodied strangers. This is life as it has been for centuries. And yet, it is also real, not a stage-setting put on for the benefit of lost americanos who always go home to their clothes driers and air conditioners and ipads. And yet, beneath this hypnotic surface, there are also ancient (or not so ancient) hatreds that can never be explained, much less resolved. It is village life at its most comforting and also its most claustrophobic. And somehow, Paterniti allows us to experience it.It took him over a decade to write the book, and a fair amount of the story is about writing the book, or more accurately, being unable to write the book. Although a journalist, and a very successful one, writing long-form journalism for magazines, Paterniti can't find an ending, can't bring himself to commit the story to paper in only one way. In the end, there are ironic footnotes at length and much self-referential spinning of wheels. And yet, it is a book of great sincerity and honesty.I loved it. Your book club will love it. I hope it will be a best-seller. Both author and publisher deserve it, as do the people of Guzman.

Everything about this story felt familiar--the well-to-do couple set out on some sort of adventure/misadventure and learn about themselves along the way. This particular mis/adventure involves driving old cars across Asia and Europe, following a set of rather arcane rules. The author lacks confidence in her ability to navigate, and she gets carsick. What could go wrong? There was more naval-gazing than I really wanted to read, and less about the places they visited. Still, it was not a bad trip overall.

I almost owned last 4 generations of imac 21 inches. This time i jumped to 27 inch retina. i thought it would be different as it is retina. Though i am apple fan boy, i have to admit this imac is not for every one. I couldn't make use of the retina display. Moreover due to lack of 4k videos, except trailers or some you tube videos i have to watch videos in 1080p only. As the price was not justified for me, i sold it in 2 months. Hopefully someone else can make good use of it.
I really love it. Not very easy but easy to assemble for some one who has some experience.
Exact fit and macbook air closes opens fine. It serves its purpose.
I love it for its ease in use. works great whenever needed.
wow a great product. this serves it purpose. other products will also work.This is not flimsy for me as i dont move it a lot. If you have stationary products then this works fine.

i liked the product and its functionality. Its sturdy and holds good weight if you want to sit on it. I feel its china made but still works and looks good.Also the storage is good enough for items you need like socks or any other items
Its always a great product. gets scratches fast but you get 3 pieces.

Not great for over 7 months old. The balance can hardly made. If my daughter sleeps side ways then whole swing is inclined. It is not a safety issue for me but  it could be if you dint monitor. I returned as this didn't work for me.
Sorry, but this looks flimsy and loose. Not a very quality product. But for the price and use this works fine .
NIce bag

Let me start by saying this phone is amazing.This is my 6th windows phone in a span of 1 year. I keep phone maximum for 3 months and sell it with good value. Earlier i had Lumia 1020 which is amazing phone too. I was in market for a mini ipad.Then i came across this phone . So i thought why not buy Lumia 1520 which can be used as a mini tablet and phone.I have no regrets in buying this phone. Below is my experience with this phone.Form Factor: Yes phone is little big. As this is a phablet category, the size is expected.We cant have a SUV's room in a compact car. So the benefits of large screen is obvious. Also at the same time there will be some inconvinience.Both Hands: Yes most times you need to use both hands. For instance, you cant use back button without using 2nd hand. But i got used to it.After couple weeks ownership , i dont feel this as a inconvinience any more. It matters most in a CAR where you need to handle the phone single handed. So all the time i mount my phone and i can use single hand.Screen: Screen is great and retina. But if you use phone screen without any protector then the screen is very slippery.Camera: Didnt test much but looks as good as lumia 1020 with less zoom.Slim. This phone is very slim when compared to lumia 1020. there is no bulge on the back so it sits flat.I se phone for movies at gym. Lumia 1020's camera bulge was always a chalange at gym. As 1520 sits flat, it is more secure.Speed: I dont think i see much speed improvement over 1020. Though it is quad core ,system still takes time to repsond on certain apps.I believe the speed has to do with particular apps then the phones hardware.When i switched to 1520 ,i thought some lagging in 1020 will be gone in 1520/. but certains apps still lagg.Lanyard: I miss Lanyard of lumia 1020 in this phablet. As this is a big phone, Nokia must have Lanyard option. To remedy this, i added my own . I used incipio air case and added Lanyard to the speaker grill. It works great as the case is strong.Speakers:It is almost same as lumia 1020 speaker with 10-15% improvement in volume. The clarity is same. Both speakers are great. Ear piece could be louder. I dont know but Nokia Lumia series suffers with low ear piece volume.Red Lumia. Red is slippery as every one suggested. Incipio case took care of it.Tiles: Extra column for tiles is a plus. Now one can see more information without moving the screen.Side Keys: Side keys are too flat. It is quite difficult to find volume keys and lock keys .It could be better like lumia 1020.Phone in public: Yes it is eye catching. It doesnt look good if you talk on this phablet in public. But who cares.when Iphone first came, it looked too BIG. but it has become new NORM now. So people will get used to it as phablets become more popular.Also it keep you out of crowd.Pocket: It easily slides into pocket. In my formals and jeans i have no issue in sliding the phone. It fits and doesnt pop out of pocket. As it is slim, the extra length doesnt bother me.Wireless charging. I am really mad on ATT on removing wireless charging from this phone. Hell with the technology and standards. IF they care too much then why did they sell qi wireless chargers. Now that every one got one qi wireless chargers they removed this from phone.ATT ------ in this regard.battery: Awesome. It has very good battery life.It is almost twice that of lumia 1020. I tested battery by turning on everything.Even though the location was turned on, the battery drain was not significant. I believe if location is not used by any app then system turns it off.

Initially i was skeptical to purchase this for lumia 1520. As this phone is tall and heavy when compared to iphone 5, i was not sure this mount will work. Earlier i purchased similar mount for lumia 1020 which failed. Reason for failure was the big camera which doesnt have enough room for the back metal plate.This time lumia 1520 has enough room for metal plate.So i tried again. To my surprise the mount holds th ephone strong though not super strong. If my car hits a big bump or hole, so i am sure the phone may fall.But for daily use i dont have nay issue. So i attached one lanyard to my phone and hook it if i go for long distance. For daily use this works best. SNAP n GO.

I like this steering cover by looks. But once i received it , i came to know that it is soft cloth type.This can go dirty easily if you not careful. Steering is little difficult as it slips while turnings. But i still recommend it. This is not as cold as a leather cover. So in winter mornings i don't need to worry about cold steering. Overall good for winter driving.
works great every time.Very easy and straight forward.Large lcd easy on eyes. I will recommend this product.A + + +

Not worth the price Tag. Below are main difference between HSB800 And HSB 730.I am factoring price in rating this product.No complaints on sound .1 Noise cancellation: Though this headset got built in noise cancellation, but its not significant and doesnt justify the price. When playing music both headset performs equally. But when there is no music hsb800 handles noise better.But i dont think this is as good as full size headsets.2 Design: Hsb 800 got some design changes. They have placed the volume buttons and forward buttons to the side of headset where as its on top of hsb 730. the size of buttons are very minimal and makes it difficult to find when not looking directly. So i prefer control buttons hsb 730. Once used to it ,i guess it doesnt make much difference among these two.3 SOUND JBL Signature: I feel either there is no JBL signature on hsb 800 or it was already implemented on hsb 730. For me i didnt get any difference among these 2 headsets in regard to sound quality.4 Price: I will buy this for the price of 69 but any thing more makes the upgrades insignificant.So i prefer hsb 730 for 40$ then 129 price of hsb 800.5 Battery: there is no difference in battery consumption. Both headsets gives 10 hours play back.6 Weight. May be this is lighter. but hsb 730 also never reminded me of weight. So even weight reduced but it may not makes any difference.

As always, my all phones get Fosmon screen protector.So far all Fosmon protectors are almost 2 mm short of screen size. This is required as nokia phones are curved at the edges and if the screen protector is not short then it will not stick to screen at the edges.Fosmon screens are crystal clear but attracts finger prints easily.StillI am happy as the clarity is great if cleaned.
It worked as advertised. Nothing more nothing less. i am happy so far for this product is.I recommend this .

I have bluetooth voice only in my car. This has added A2DP profile to my car. It automatically connects to my car bt and this .Car connects to phone for voice only and this connects for music. Overall very well satisfied.

As title says, initially I owned iphone for over 5 years. I owned all iphones except the first one. Last year, just for change, I sold iphone 5 and bought used lumia 900 cyan. It was a great change after owning iphone for years. I still remember the clear black display and glossy curved screen. Within 2 months I bought lumia 920 off eBay before release. I used it for 4 months and was very happy with everything except the weight. I usually keep my phone in upper shirt pocket ,so I always felt lumia 920s weight. This year I sold Lumia 920 and bought HTC One. Great Phone, great resolution, stable OS, great speaker etc.Recently in Amazon Deals I found lumia 520 for 79 dollars without contract. Amazon has made one click too easy. So without thinking I just clicked.I got the phone within one day.My notes on this phone:Stable OS. I love windows 8. Clean OS and a good change from ios and android. Once it gets good apps then I think It will be on top soon.Great looks and availability of swappable multi color back covers.Awesome battery life. It reminds me olden days. I always used the battery saver mode. I charged this phone 3 days ago and it has some 35% left. I have to admit I didn't use it more than an hour for past 3 days. But doing the same with my HTC One, the battery will be dead in just 1 day. May be non availability of LTE runs it longer.Screen is good but not great. Though the resolution is almost same as lumia 900 ,I feel lumia 900 screen is much better than this one.The PPI on this phone is more then lumia 900 but lumia 900 screen looked sharp.I never found pixels in lumia 900. In this phone certain colors clearly shows pixels. The color of screen does makes difference. Green colors show pixels more then blue.If you planning to cut SIM and use it then be careful. I think the thickness of regular SIM  gives very tight fit on this phone. Though micro Sims slips very easily.Camera is not great. It's an average camera for basic photography.Price is unbeatable. Spend 3 dollars and its unlocked.I didnt feel there is any signal problem on this phone. You can hold any ways unlike iphone.Speaker is average. Sound is just enough.Voice is clear over conversation.Overall i recommend this phone for the low price.Can be a great secondary phone.

The concept was neat but poorly implemented. I was always fan of Sony because their products are always classy and stylish. Last year when this allinone first came, i sold my Imac for this. But due to Non availability, i bought latest Imac at that time. This year again i looked for allinone w8 machines and i found this. I bought it but not happy with it. The resolution is deal breaker for me. I can clearly see pixels every where .Those who are not sensitive to this may not find it deal breaker but for me it was. Also the system is not much stable and touch was not sensitive enough. Another annoying is the weight. If dell xps 18 could manage everything in under 6 pounds then why not this. I thought mid of this year there will be some design changes but it was replica of old one with bumped specs. So i moved over to dell XPS 18. Above issues were resolved in XPS but it has its own issues. Any way i may not recommend this based on resolution and weight.

I am really surprised by this fan. The air blows at ultra high rate. I hardly could find any fans in USA where the fan speeds are high. However the noise is high at level 3. The level 1 of this fan matches to my previous fans level 3.So all good except the noise.But still recommended.

There are very few reviews for this product ,so i wanted to add quick review. It is for my 3 year old son. The glasses came in nice package and works great out of box. I just had this for 1 week. Will update if some thing goes wrong.

This is my 5th tv in last 5 years. I keep replacing my TVs. Last one was Lg 47a7600.It was nice glossy 3d tv. I still miss the glossy screen. I should have gone with 8000 series for glossy screen.For price this is a awesome deal.

This worked fine for general purpose but the voice was not good. It was hardly audible and there was no option to change mic volume. So most time it was echo. So i cant use it and went with Logitech TV cam. Much better and independent of tv.
Though movie was good there were hardly any 3d efffects. the point of buying 3d blue ray is not worthwhile for this movie. I may not recommend for 3d effects.

First time i felt the reviews were not according to product.I waited up to 15 days to review this product.I know its very subjective who is using this product. If it is used for a small kid or pet then its a good one. But for people like me who is around 200 pound,its always flat to ground. Even for my wife who is 154, this doesn't do justice. It goes flat in 10 minutes. so don't know for whom it will fit like in the picture.Forget about 2 people,its not good for one.I hardly give 1 star reviews. For this product, it was very easy to give 1 star as it never served the purpose.So please do enough research on this before buying as it is a big deal later to return it or trash it.

This skin is really very light and thin. Really amazed at how thin this skin is. Though it is thin i think it will serve its purpose.I feel it could have more sticky to keyboard,so that it wont move when typing. I say the typing with this skin on will reduce the performance by 5% around.For very fast typers may be this an issue but for most casual users its no way going to be a problem. The skin should be more sticky. Right now when you type the keys on skin moves around 1 mm.As said its not an issue except the feel that there is skin on the keyboard. Any way i am very satisfied with the look and feel of this skin. At least during any spill it will give first hand protection.

I really feel good to touch this cover. It is very smooth and feels good. Protection is good but uprotected in rear both sides. I compare it to ipearl and i feel this is much better in quality. However i am not happy with teal color and wanted some thing darker blue.

If you like Opinel knives, what could be better than ten of them in a nice wooden display case?  All sizes included, except #1, which would be tiny. And #11 which is not enough of a difference between 10 and 12 to include. I think it's #5 up that include Opinels unique blade lock. These are the exact same knives they've made for ages. Just like my first I got more than 50 years ago. The same knife that Pablo Picasso and other greats used (or still use).

I guess I got the last one, because they're now unavailable. I just purchase a new iPhone 6 and one of the issues with this model is they can slip out of your hand quite easily, and you don't want to be dropping your expensive phone. So my first order of business was to acquire some decent protection for it. A case..... or two.... or three... or four. OK. I went a little overboard.And this was really supposed to be kind of a joke (my GF hates camo). And it was only $2.99, with free shipping. Looking at Loggerhead's page, I notice that free shipping is now in navailable as well.So why review this cheap case?  Because, although inexpensive, it's not really cheap. It has a hard plastic shell with a silicone rubber lining that makes gripping it easier and protection extends to the corners, with a slight lip that helps protect the screen. Its squarish shape kind of makes it look like a larger iPhone 5. Not as stylish, but might appeal to those who find the 6 a bit too slippery with its smooth, slim rounded edges. Even the opening to display the Apple logo has clear plastic protecting the phone.The camo design is made of thick vinyl, and is the only thing that makes it kind of cheap looking. The only other drawback is the recess for the switch to mute the phone is kind of deep making reaching it a bit difficult.So, one star off for the cheapish looking graphics. But otherwise a good case offering adequate drop protection, good fit, and OK design.A very satisfying purchase considering I wasn't expecting much for three bucks.

If you've updated your iDevice to iOS 9, plan on a big pain getting this to work without a spare PC to do a firmware update. And you don't know this when you get the message to grant access in 'Settings' for something you'll never find there. But let's assume you've done the firmware update and your intention was to move content on you device to the drive to free up space on the device. It's not like plugging in a flash drive. This thing has too many problems and too many drawbacks.First issue: syncing. It really doesn't. Photos and videos you can move and delete from your device. But that's about it. I don't know about restoring them because I updated to iOS 9 before I had a chance to try. And you're limited to your camera roll. Any other photos can be copied to the drive, but not deleted from the device. And photos is about it. Music is a whole other an of worms.Next issue: Power. Since the drive uses the Lightning port, you're limited to what your battery can provide while this thing is plugged in. And although I can't be sure since it was only used for a short time before iOS 9 was installed, I assume it will be an additional power drain.So if you planned on using the drive as a temporary storage space, think twice. Or keep a computer with iTunes handy. And if you have a PC with iTunes, do you really need this drive?I purchased this drive when the price dropped significantly for a short time and it's going back to Amazon. This drive just won't do what the description leads you to expect it would do. It doesn't unload music from your device. And it only unloads photos and videos taken with the device (i.e. Camera Roll and videos. Nothing that was synced with iTunes from your library). So, when my 64GB had 1.5GB free before the drive, it had 1.6GB free after moving what I could. None of my 20 gigs of music or 15 gigs of photos from my computer.So I upgraded my iPhone to one with 128GB, and goodbye flash drive. I suppose if you have limited storage and you want to store pictures you take with your phone on it, maybe. But as a media library with movies and readily available content on it, don't get your hopes up.A big disappointment, at any price.
Nice simple ring. Not too glittery. And no sharp edges. Perfect for everyday wear.Very happy with this purchase.

I love glasses that can hold enough iced tea to quench a healthy thirst. At 23oz, these certainly do the job. Might be a little large for petite hands, but not a problem for mine.Very happy with this purchase.
Very nice glasses. But be aware that these are very delicate and easily broken if great care is not taken when you wash them. More suited for special occasions than everyday use.

As long as you're aware that these are tiny little knives that aren't particularly sharp, you should be pleased with the quality. I would have preferred to buy just one for a quarter of the price. But the other three will make nice gifts or stocking stuffers this Christmas.Good for opening packages or cleaning fingernails. Not likely to be confiscated by the TSA in a security check.

An interesting documentary with the main character being unique and interesting. It's not the kind of movie you'd pick solely for entertainment, but more like a news magazine expose. But certainly good enough to keep your attention for an hour and a half.Loses track a bit between being about James "The Amazing" Randi, or from him discussing hoaxes and deception. With a little of his personal life thrown in.

Current version means the Mini now operates with an RF remote so you don't have to point it at the device to work it. Same remote that you get with the Roamio DVRs.Another plus is these now come with lifetime service, so no subscription fees. Watch your TiVo in any tv in the house. Uses MoCo networking. So if you have a cable connection, you just plug it in and go. (After a few connections to TiVo and pairing it with your DVR).

Yes, it's the same clock you remember from fifty years ago. You may read reviews that say the tail won't swing or eyes won't move. But a little common sense and hanging the clock level or tilted forward slightly, and it's a non-issue.It does make a tiny bit of noise when working, so some people might not like it hanging in a bedroom. But you can stop the tail from swinging, and the clock keeps running. Or just hang it in the kitchen. Which is where I remember ours was when I was a kid.Love this purchase. My new family heirloom to be passed on to future generations.

I get kind of tired of socks that claim to fit size 6-12. If you have size 12 shoes, expect to be standing on the heels of these socks before you walk 10 yards in them. Many low socks make the same claims, and some actually stay on. These don't. If you're looking to cover your toes, OK. But if you want them to cover your entire foot, shop elsewhere.

Finally the day has come when I can buy a shirt and not have to roll up the sleeves because they're too short.37" sleeves are ideal for me, but I bought 38-39" sleeves just because I could. Buttoning them keeps them from falling below my wrists and they're a dream come true. Otherwise just a nicely made button down collar oxford cloth shirt in blue or white, with enough room to breathe. It wasn't that long ago that nice roomy dress shirts were all the rage. And unless you spent long hours at the gym, fitted shirts just looked silly.Making it even better was the Lightning Deal that brought the price down to a reasonable $22.If you have 32-34" sleeves, it's just another nice shirt. But if you have long arms or are not the size of a store mannequin, this is a great shirt.Very pleased with this purchase.

I normally only buy items sold or fulfilled by Amazon. But since I couldn't find this from Amazon, I took a chance. Big mistake!What's wrong with this ring? First, sizing. I normally wear 10 1/2, so figured an 11 would fit. Nope! Partly because it seems to be sized small, but also because it is wide and flat, and has sharp edges. Secondly, the sharp edges. When the edges aren't cutting into me, the defective links are poking into my finger.I'd consider exchanging it for a size 12, but there are no guarantees it wouldn't have the same problems. And reading the fine print, free shipping is only free if you keep it. Return it and they'll deduct an unknown amount, which added on to the return postage will probably get me nothing for a refund.Lesson learned. If it isn't Prime eligible, you roll the dice. Even with vendors whose name I've seen on a lot of products.Very unhappy with this purchase. Caveat emptor.UPDATE Sept. 30, 2015 - Although this is a product review, my initial problems involved sizing and defects that, because it was not fulfilled by Amazon, would have been non-economical to get replaced. When I went to leave less than stellar vendor feedback, it was suggested (by the system) that I contact the vendor first. I did, complaining that postage and handling would not be worthwhile to even return the defective ring of an $8 item. The vendor (Sabrina Jewelry) responded, offering to replace the ring with the proper size and send a return envelope. They did, and the replacement arrived today. No sharp edges. And although a size larger than I normally wear, it fits well.So I am revising my rating to 4 stars, with the recommendation that (probably due to the design being wide and flat), if you order this item, go one size up from what you normally wear. I wear 10 1/2-11, and this is size 12

Despite not being what you might expect from Pendleton, this is a really nice shirt. Feels kind of like a lightweight poplin. Thin, but not cheap.I wear a tall, and the sleeves are nice and long for my 37" arms.Made in China.

Mediocre current detector attached to a flimsy plastic wand that doesn't stay extended. Is either too sensitive or not enough. So almost impossible to trace a live wire if it's near another, or inside a conduit.Don't waste your money. If you need an extension, tape a cheap one to a stick.

Coming from a die hard Roku fan. This is my second Fire Stick. Easy to set up and use. And if you travel, it's great to take along. Connects easily, even to hotel wifi systems.Comes preconfigured to your Amazon account, or you can start fresh. Remote is RF, so you don't have to be pointing it at the device. Of course, it works great with Prime, and with Kindle devices to connect to a 'Second Screen'. Also works better with a Slingbox than Roku, no smartphone or tablet needed.

Nice, comfortable shirt. And the white on blue color disguises the the plant pictured. Nobody's mentioned what it is or asked if it comes from a head shop.A nice change from run of the mill fare. Very happy with this purchase.
Very interesting as an exposÃ© on global warming and how it's affecting the planet. As a movie, aside from the beautiful cinematography, it can get as boring as counting krill at times.

Bought this for my GF after she decided to let her hair go grey. Her hairdresser kinda screwed things up and turned her hair from a nice auburn color to what she calls a 'mulchy' brown/blonde.This stuff, she says, takes the phony blonde out and makes her hair feel really nice. She bought another bottle for when this one runs out.When your girl approves of shampoo for grey hair, that's quite an endorsement in my opinion. Not to mention all the money she's saving on getting her hair dyed.

This is one of those items that you'll find on Amazon with prices ranging from $0.99 to over $50, with list prices going into the hundreds. For what are probably identical pieces. For $0.99 you'll pay shipping and you won't get a product fulfilled by Amazon. So, you're on your own if you don't get what you expected.King Will charges less than $20, which I was happy to pay to get the assurance I wouldn't be stuck with a piece of garbage. And I wasn't. It is exactly what I wanted and expected. The surface is that darker silver color you'd expect from tungsten carbide. The facets are cleanly cut and highly polished. It is a comfort fit design and the not overly domed, which is what I wanted. The edges of the ring are nice and thin; also what I wanted.Would I have gotten the same thing for half the price? Maybe. But $19 is not a huge investment for an attractive wedding band and one that I won't likely be wearing on my wedding day.So, I'm quite satisfied with this purchase, and have absolutely no complaints of the product or vendor.

I thought spending more and buying a Coleman chair would get me a better product. It was partially true. But this $25 chair was not a whole lot better than the ones you can find for $7 at Big Lots. The material is slightly better. The frame is a bit larger.But this is not at all as comfortable as I expected for the extra money they cost. The cooler and cup holder are no bonus features. Your drink still won't sit upright. And the cooler won't keep the next one cooler until you drink it.Is it bad? No. But put it next to one that costs a quarter of the price and you may be hard pressed to find a difference.

Don't know if these are sized small expecting the 'stretch' material to compensate. Or like a lot of Asian made clothes, just sized wrong.I wear a 36" waist. So I ordered size 36. After checking the label to see if they sent the wrong size I packed them back up to send back.Now the question was, did I get the one pair that was sewn wrong. Or, was the sizing way off. I have 34" pants that fit looser than these. So, I decided to go with the theory that they just sized these pants wrong and got a pair of 38" pants. As expected, they fit like a pair of 36" pants should.They're nice jeans. Soft and comfortable. No bizarre names with acid, stone, indigo, or a dozen other shades. They're bluejeans. Not too dark. Not uneven. Not bleached. Not tapered, boot cut, relaxed fit, skinny.... Just plain old jeans, with a little spandex in them for unknown reasons. You can't feel them stretch.So, for $25, you can get yourself a nice pair of jeans. I've given up expecting Levi's to make a pair of 501s that are going to be the same as the last pair I bought. Or why they charge $160 in one store and $30 in another. Although I wouldn't doubt that the $160 pair went through more stringent quality control than the cheaper ones.But gone are the days where there were 501s (505s, if you didn't like button fly) and a few others. There are now no fewer than two dozen five hundred series Levi's. And you don't get the same ones depending on who you buy them from.

I wanted something to be able to turn on or off a light from another room. I didn't need an expensive wifi connected device that would control a light in Pennsylvania from my car in Texas.These do exactly what I need. They work from up to 100 feet away on anything that will go off or on by cutting the power at the plug. What I mean by that is if you have a light that has a switch that has to be used if power is lost, these won't work. It has to be something that will go back on when power is reconnected.The other limitation is you can control up to five devices, or sets of devices. Each remote has ten buttons. Five on and five off. Programming is easy. You press a button on the controlled socket and then the remote. When I say sets of devices, I mean you can have as many sockets as you want controlled by each of the five remote codes. So you can have ten sockets programmed to one pair of buttons. And with one button turn on ten different lamps. But if you only want to turn on five lamps, you have to use a different pair of remote buttons.But for the price, given the ability to control five different sets of circuits, that's a lot of capability to have from your bedside. And you don't even have to clap. ;-)And with multiple remotes, you can have them in convenient locations. One by your bed. One by the front door to turn on lights when you get home. I have a fan controlled by one. Spouse and I each have a remote so either of us can control the fan as needed.It does what I need. It works well at long distances without line of sight requirement. Don't take up a lot of space. Easy to program. And they even include an extra set of batteries for the remotes. What more could you ask. They even work when your router has crashed. Which adds another capability. Companies make expensive devices to reboot routers to keep them working efficiently. Hook one of these up to your router or modem and every now and then shut it off and back on to clean things up.

Be aware with this series of plugs that wires are not held in with set screws. They are fed through a tube and the stripped portion of the wire doubled back over the tube and held in place when the end cap is screwed on. Not a very good description, but I don't know how else to describe it.With this design, they will work best with 12 gauge wire, or maybe 14. Smaller gauge wire will not fit snugly enough to work as well. Although it may fit, a cheaper series would probably function better.The plugs are also rather wide. So if space is a consideration, you might want to consider a different series or brand.I bought these because they were on sale. Otherwise I would have bought something cheaper. After all, the main requirement is just to get good contact at the end of a speaker wire. If you're using quality heavy gauge wire these would be a good fit. If you're using cheapo 18 gauge, it's like putting $300 Pirellis on a Yugo.

This is merely a typical polo. The only thing worth mentioning is, if you buy black, expect to think they sent the wrong item. It looks like a dark navy color. If you don't mind that, it's a decent shirt. If you do, buy a different color.

Besides being delightfully inexpensive, these shirts are extremely soft and light. But not flimsy feeling. They dry quickly. And if you like to wear t-shirts in lieu of pajamas, these work great. Your bed partner will appreciate the soft feel of them, too.Never thought a cheap t-shirt would be worth reviewing, but this one is. And if you travel, not only do they dry quickly, they take up very little space.Wish I was as happy with other purchases as I am with this one. Will add other colors to my closet.

I was going to check off "Fit as expected" because so many things require ordering a size or two up to fit properly. But other than an XL fitting like a smallish Large, and the buttons being a bit cheesy, this is not a bad lightweight jacket.Not suitable for warmth, or worn over a button down shirt, it works well with the sleeves pushed up over a cotton T-shirt. At least as long as your sense of style leans toward the upholstery on your grandmother's old couch.But I like it, since my tastes stray from more common garb. Just don't expect it to be beautifully made vintage clothing because of its appearance.

I read reviews with a grain of salt. So when I read all the reviews stating it was not as described I was going to pass on this item when it came up in a Lightning Deal. But since Amazon stands behind what it sells or fulfills, I decided to take a chance, and send it back if it was not up to expectations.As opposed to all the reviews from people who got free goods claiming to post 'honest and unbiased' reviews, the reviews here are honest, but wrong. There obviously was an inventory mixup and some reviewers got the wrong item.What I received is exactly as described. Albeit a bit creepy and a little unsettling, it is well made with nice details, like glassy eyes.So it will take a place on my shelf next to other oddball curios. If your tastes go toward the ghoulish, you won't likely be disappointed.And if you get something that's 5-7" tall, contact Amazon immediately and have them send the right item.

No one is an easily recognized name in quality boots. And the quality is definitely here in these. The leather is soft and supple. Not that stiff thick hide that looks like it was sliced off a sick cow. Nice fit. Suitable for dress or casual wear. Take care of them and wear with a suit. Or beat 'em up and tuck them under your favorite jeans.I haven't had them long but know they will provide years of useful life. The kind of boot that you take to a shoemaker when they wear down instead of tossing in the trash.

I have lots of watches. After awhile one gets tired of the similar designs and nondescript appearance. Modern watches usually keep accurate time and are reliable, whether $20 or $1,000.This watch is a nice hefty piece with clean design and a completely unique appearance. What more needs to be said? And even better, it lacks that stupid date window that you can't read and never set anyway.Very satisfied with this purchase.

After reading other reviews and having mine for about two years now, I thought I'd add my review. It seems others, like I did, considered this and the Honda as the top contenders. And I'd guess that those who got Hondas that failed also wrote reviews that said "I should have bought the Yamaha."Fortunately, I got one that seems to have worked flawlessly. Got me through a week without power during Sandy. And a godsend that used fuel very frugally as you had to fight for a tank of gas. If you could find gas at all. At one point I was siphoning gas out of my motorcycle.Not only has it worked without problems, but has lived under a tarp in the weather most of its life. The only time it failed to start was when I forgot to flick a switch. Enough power to keep a refrigerator running. Or in the cold, power a 1,500 watt heater, a TV, and a few lights.Very happy with this purchase.

It only took a mouthful to decide that these were going back. The idea seemed good, but I didn't enjoy eating with them at all.Why? The biggest reason is the curve of the tines. It reminded me of feeding a baby where you keep tilting the spoon up to get everything in baby's mouth. Second reason, sharp edges. Not the 'kn' part of the Knork, but the tines themselves. They're not rounded on the edges, but each tine has four distinct sides and in spots are quite sharp. As are the tips of each tine, even though the points are flattened.The handles overall are hefty and nice feeling, but the fork end feels too thin, partly because of the sharp tine edges. Not flexible. Just thin.And lastly I was expecting dark or black colored pieces. They're plain brushed stainless color. This would not have been a big deal if they were nice to use. Just unexpected considering how they look in the picture.Before purchasing try taking an old fork and bending the tines upward and try eating with them. I felt like I was scraping my upper teeth or the roof of my mouth. Especially with the sharp tines. In fact, the only place the tines aren't sharp are the spot you'd use to cut your food.A disappointing purchase.

They're called huggies, but they don't hug anything. The pattern, which is quite apparent in the picture is hard to see in actuality. The earring are a bit too wide so extend off my ears, so don't have the right look to them. Same with the gap between the ends. Too large to give them the right appearance. And the hinges are quite loose. Shouldn't be a problem if attached correctly, but contribute to a cheap feel.Lastly the edges and corners can be sharp and dig into my ears. So they're going back and the search for the ideal earring continues.

I like painter's pants. They're cheap, sturdy, and look nice. I bought these and a pair of Dickies at the same time. I like the Dickies. Can't say the same about these. They're just not very comfortable. A little too high waisted, and the stitching or fabric feels like it's digging into my waist all the time. They don't seem to be cut to fit my body right. And I'm not some unique shape. Maybe after a few dozen washings they'll soften up and fit better. But right now, they're going to be sitting in the closet until the Dickies are worn out.

Deep fryers used to be a pain to use. And wasted oil if you didn't use them constantly. Until now.Poured in a gallon of peanut oil (the only way to go for delicious deep fried food). Heated quickly. And in little time I was enjoying the best french fries and chicken ever. Once the oil cools it's drained and filtered into a container below with the flick of a switch. Heating element, vessel, basket all come off easily for quick cleanup.Now, if I could only get motivated to exercise and burn off all the calories those delicious fries are going to add to my waistline.Loving this purchase. And, I was NOT given a free sample in exchange for my honest review. Although I did get it in a Lightning Deal. It deserves every one of those five stars.

Small and inexpensive. But perfect vent mount for holding my iPhone to use with Waze while driving. No need to spend more on a bulky cradle. Easy to install and take with you.And if you haven't tried Waze, get that too. It's free! My GPS is becoming obsolete...
Perfect fit for an iPad. With room and pockets for plenty of other stuff. Well padded to keep your tablet safe. And big enough to accommodate a case.Quite pleased with this purchase.

Pleasantly surprised by this suit. Usually wear 44 long, so ordered 46 long since these things are usually cut small. Pants fit my 36 inch waist perfectly. And the sleeves were long enough for my 36" arms to not need any alteration.As with any linen/cotton garment, expect wrinkles that will need pressing. Lots of neat little pockets for pens, phone, coins, etc. Not tapered, but what they call modern fit. Thin lapels with unique stitching along the edge.The grey color is a nice pale unobtrusive shade.Pleasantly surprised with this purchase. Especially when so many clothes from Amazon have had to go back for being exceedingly small.

Purchased to use in my deep fryer. If you want the best tasting fried food, peanut oil is the way to go. It's what made the original Buffalo Wings famous. And if you ever taste really good French fries, they're probably cooked in peanut oil. It's hard to find gallons in a grocery store. And for about $20, the price is right.Beware of brands that say peanut oil, but are actually blended with cheaper oils.Just the ticket for great tasting fried foods. And probably one of the healthier ways to deep fry in oil.

An inexpensive way to say "excuse me" while riding your bike. Not really loud enough for alerting cars. But in a park to let pedestrians know you're behind them, it's perfect. Emits a polite ding when you flick the spring mounted hammer. Attaches easily ti standard handlebars. Hammer rotates to position it conveniently where you want it.

Purchased for a once in a lifetime marriage proposal. Of course, you don't want to skimp on what goes in the box, but if you want to highlight it, this is the perfect way to do it.Very nicely made, the light illuminates when the box is opened. In my case, it contained a 1 1/2 carat cushion cut raw diamond surrounded by pavÃ© diamonds in a white gold setting.

My original plan was to build my own string of lights. But when you add up the cost of all the components, it was cheaper to buy this product.With 25 lights, chances are one or two will arrive broken or DOA. So purchase this expecting that to be the case. And make sure you buy it from Amazon, or at least fulfilled by Amazon. That way you can exchange it, or Amazon will compensate you for any defective bulbs. In my case, they refunded enough to buy a dozen bulbs to replace only two that were faulty.This is a nice set. The bulbs are incandescent with retro styling. And the sockets are rubber to help seal out the weather when bulbs are screwed in. A female plug is on the end, allowing you to string two sets together. I don't believe the gauge of the wiring is heavy enough to safely add more than one more string.Quite satisfied with this purchase. And, as always, more than satisfied with Amazon's customer service.

Although I suspect this is not real leather, it is a nice journal. Not much to add to other reviews other than the fact that it is NOT college ruled. Whoever said it is does not know what college ruled is. If you can accept wider lines, you'll probably like this product.

I thought once you figured out the sizing, you might find a nice garment. Sometimes I have. But not here. This is as thin as a t-shirt. Poorly made. With no conceivable purpose. It's the kind of garment you'd pass up on the clearance rack at K-Mart even though it's been reduced to $2.99.I can be critical of some things in reviews. But this time I think it's justified. The material is unattractive, at least what there is of it. See the picture to get an idea of its weight. One picture you can see the tag through the material. In the other, there's a picture of the cardigan next to a similarly folded long sleeve lightweight t-shirt.

I was intrigued by the concept when I first saw these. So when they became available in a Lightning Deal, I decided to give them a try. Here are my first impressions.Since these are the Pro version I expected superior sound quality. I think I would consider the sound quality in line with their cost. Certainly not what you'd get from a $100+ set of buds, but clean sounding with no disturbing characteristics.I can't yet comment on reliability, but am very concerned by other reviews and obvious design deficiencies. Although the zipper design may help keeping tangles at bay, it is more of a gimmick than a truly novel design. At one end of the zipper there are relatively thin and fragile feeling cables going to the buds. And at the other end an equally slender cable going to the plug. With the connection points from plug to cable, cable to zipper, zipper to cables, and cables to buds, you have multiple points of potential failure. With the number of reviewers reporting failures, this is not confidence inspiring.I can see why the later design 'slide' instead of a zipper might be preferable, and put less strain on the transition points.Although not what I expected (I feel like I have to treat these gingerly so they don't fail), they're certainly a decent set of earbuds. Probably at a slight premium for the zipper, which will help deter tangles, but not eliminate them.I'll add another star if they continue to function over time. If they don't, I'll take two more off my rating.

Worked fine for awhile. Used as a repeater for a FIOS router/modem to cover my house. Then I noticed I could only connect on the 5g side. On the 2g side I connected to the FIOS router directly with a poor signal. Had to reset and reconfigure the ASUS, and it would work for a few hours or days, then crap out again.I haven't tried to get service yet but docs say I get 1 year or 3, but doesn't tell me which. Yet it also says if the router is sent in in anything other than the original box, they will charge me for repackaging it for return. Not confidence inspiring.

Not up to Dockers standards. I bought two and returned them both. One had a defective collar (material not properly sewn). But both had very cheap zippers that were difficult to zip (remember those old scratchy, metal things that broke easily?)Not even sure they're worth the three stars I gave them.

Often, when you get camo garments, you may sacrifice quality. Not the case with this swimsuit. Nicely made. Mesh lining in the suit keeps body parts in place. As well as mesh side pockets (not the cargo pockets, which have Velcro closures). 100% polyester for quick drying. Elastic waist with string tie.These are surprisingly well made, and quite comfortable. I even wear them when I'm not going swimming.Very satisfied with this purchase.

If for no other reason, I love this cookware because it's PTFE free. I have parrots, and exposing them even for a few seconds to an overheated Teflon pan can kill them. Not to mention being unhealthy to humans too.I've had a set for a couple of years and even with fancy tri-ply and AllClad pans, these are my go to cookware. Food doesn't stick. It's durable enough to withstand metal utensils if you're not too rough. And cleanup is a snap.Maybe it doesn't look fancy, and the bottoms will develop burn marks which are tough to clean with the grooves. And I'm not always so quick to wash the dishes, so the most used pan is very slightly discolored. But if you want a set of convenient to use pots and pans for the price of one fancy pan, this would be it.Don't wait until they discover you've been poisoning you family with nonstick (PTFE) Teflon pans. Get these instead.

After ordering Horst dress shirts, I had high hopes for these. I have long arms, and these are one of few manufacturers that provide sleeves that are long enough not to have to wear rolled up. But I was concerned that 'slim fit' might be a little snug around my expanding belly. Very nicely made, with tastefull patterns. Although the two I got seemed to be different fabric. One was very light. The other slightly heavier with more texture to it.So, why only three stars? And why are they going back, even if the waist was adequate? It's the chest that killed it. Unless you've got a sunken chest (no pun intended), or can breathe without inhaling, these will present a problem. The shoulders are wide enough, but when I breathe in or stand up straight with my shoulders back, the only thing holding the shirt closed are the straining buttons. Even in the picture, it looks like the model is pressing his shoulders forward and together to avert this unacceptable fit.If you chest is smaller than your waist, and you have long arms, then by all means consider these great shirts. Otherwise you may be wasting your time thinking that I must be exaggerating about the fit. I'm not. I don't have a wide chest, and look more like a bicycle rider than a weightlifter (for obvious reasons).

I've been looking at folding bikes to use with my RV without having to use a bike rack on the back. One of my main considerations was seat height, as I have long legs. All the specs for these things seem to focus on the height of the rider; totally worthless information. And they all are overly generous. This model says riders up to 6'4". I'm only 6'1" and this bike just fits. My inseam is 35", which should give you a better idea of if it will fit you.Another consideration is folded size. If you look at a comparison chart, you'll see the Downtown and Urban models are quite similar. One difference is the Downtown does not have folding pedals. So it will be a couple of inches thicker when folded. You can, however, remove the right pedal easily (the left one doesn't matter, as it doesn't stick out) with a wrench. Other differences are wheel size. The Downtown uses a standard 20" wheel. Listed weight is almost identical.Gearing should also be a consideration, since you only have one gear. I was concerned that it would be geared too low to make pedaling easier, but speeds slower. Happily, it wasn't, and is a good compromise. Moves right along on flat ground!So, I bought the Downtown as it was also quite a bit cheaper than the Urban.I also own a Dahon Vybe. Although a 7 speed bike, similar in many respects to the Allen, so I put them side by side to compare them. Here are a few thoughts.Materials. Both use quality materials and weigh in the mid twenty pound range. With a folder, carbon fiber components, or trying to shave a few ounces, is silly. Welds on the Dahon seem a little cleaner, but not much. I found in ridin the bikes, the handlebars flexed a little more on the Allen. Not enough to concern me.Components. Brakes, levers, cranks, rims are high quality on both bikes. Mostly alloy. Nothing cheap looking. Hardware to fold and open the bike is high quality, with safety mechanisms to keep them locked in place in use. Both have nice seats, but the Allen has a more modern design, making it more comfortable.Both bikes have kickstands, and reflectors on wheels, seat, and handlebars. The Allen has a nice little bell.Pricing. I do not pay full price for anything. The MSRP of the Dahon is more realistic. The Allen has a higher price, but on sale, a bigger discount. I bought the Allen from Amazon. It came well packed with the paint protected. All that was needed was attaching the right pedal (wrench not included so I just finger tightened, but I would not recommend that). The tires needed air before the bike could be ridden. I did notice the tires are directional, so the front wheel on the Downtown is on backwards. Hopefully I can just turn the wheel around. I bought the Dahon at a retail store, so it was assembled and ready to ride. I paid $245 and $320, plus tax, respectively for the bikes. The Allen Downtown retails for up to $200 more than I paid. The Urban, which is nearly the same, is even more. The Vybe C7 has been discontinued, and current models are about $100-200 more for the same quality level.Other bikes are considerably more expensive. Brampton for example is about $1,200. Retrospec, and other models can be somewhat less expensive. I think the $400-$500 price point gets you an excellent bicycle with few or no sacrifices in quality. I expect my two machines to provide me with reliable service for several years.

My patio set arrived this morning. A 220 lb. pallet of stuff.It appears to be pretty much what I expected with a few minor issues and one disappointment.The fabric on the cushions is synthetic and feels like it belongs on outdoor furniture, but not at all plasticky feeling. All the cushions have zippered covers, so can be removed for replacement or more extensive cleaning. The 'wicker' is plastic, which I actually prefer so it will hold up better. It, too, does not seem at all plasticky.Comfort is also about what I expected. Not bad at all.Now for the disappointment, for which I only subtracted one star, and I'm unsure how Amazon or the manufacturer will handle it. One of the armless chairs doesn't line up. Not a big deal sitting in it, but it just looks wrong. One of the boxes was crushed some, but I don't think that's what caused it. It appears to be from lack of quality control. (See pictures for the problem).And although delivery is usually not part of a product review, it is definitely part of this purchase. When ordering you are given a choice of delivery times within a few hour window. The pieces come on a single pallet in 5 or 6 boxes. So each box is easy to carry to its final location.

I normally don't write reviews of items I haven't purchased from Amazon (verified purchase). And why would I write one for a product I don't even own.Because I almost bought one without having read a significant warning. And that is, THIS MACHINE WONT BREW REGULAR KEURIG CUPS!I have a Keurig machine that I bought after all the rave reviews. I don't drink black coffee, and after adding milk it was often barely warm enough. Max brewing temp is 192 degrees, and I would sacrifice a bit of flavor in exchange for higher temps. And the cups aren't cheap. If you brew a larger size drink, it is not strong enough.Bear in mind, I am the guy who will never pay Starbucks for a cup of coffee.But back to the Rivo. After the REQUIRED UNIQUE CUPS, I read too many believeable reviews of product failure and plastic taste.Then, price is an issue. Remember, no Starbucks guy who doesn't like to pay more than 50 cents for a small cup of coffee. But a deal came up to buy a unit from Keurig for under $68. Too good to pass up, huh?But, when it came down to it I really didn't want another coffee machine that on,y used specific pods. So I never pressed 'Place Order', and wrote this review.

I already have a nice ice cream maker. So why invest a lot of money in this one? One pretty good reason... Ice cream in an hour. Without having to take up precious freezer space with a huge container that takes overnight to freeze before you can use it.With this, fill the bowl with your chosen ingredients, push a few buttons, and an hour later, dessert!Appears well made, with a failsafe mechanism to protect the motor. If you've ever poured liquid into an ice cream maker before it's turning, you'll know what I mean.

The title says it all. What more can you say about a pair of Psycho Bunny men's pink pajamas? I couldn't be happier if they were yellow and covered with Minions. The label says 100% cotton. Not sure, but they are comfortable. Elastic waist with a string tie. I have long legs, but they're just long enough, NOT high water pants.So if your charm can't impress your date, these will do the trick. I considered the grey ones, but pink bunnies just seem so right. Maybe if they hold up well, I'll add a grey pair. Actually, they're not really pink; red and white fine checked pattern that looks pink.Bought in a Lightning Deal. Not sure I'd invest almost $40 for them. But half that, yeah!

If you don't need to spend a lot of money, or have a smartphone app to use it, this is the thing for you. Control anything that you can plug into a socket, with a small remote that works from a good distance away. Control a single device with multiple remotes, or multiple devices with a single button. A cinch to program and does what it's supposed to.

Only one rating and no reviews, so here are my first impressions.There is more tint to the lenses than the picture seems to show. A good thing. They appear to be excellent optical quality. Which coming from a golf equipment company is quite understandable; so you can see where that slice went in the woods 200 yards away.One concern I had was the length of the temples. I need long ones, and these fit nicely.Come with a soft cloth storage bag and zippered hard case. I would pay the retail price, but for fifty bucks, a good value for the quality you get. One mystery I still haven't solved is what the difference is between the Scramble A and Scramble B glasses (except a silly millimeter width).

Kind of a limited use tool, but great for branches that are too big for manual loppers. Two extensions give you ample reach without having to climb a ladder. You can use one or both so the range is about 2' to more than 10'.And if you happen to be making a modern day gladiator movie, this baby can do some serious damage.I've only used it once. But it doesn't have automatic oiling, so you probably have to take care to keep the chain lubed.Solid. Not lightweight, but definitely handleable. I took off one star simply because it only does one thing, and something one doesn't do that often. (Unless you're a tree surgeon)
Just the way I remember them from long ago. For some, an acquired taste. For me, a piece of heaven.
My second set of these beauties. Nothing to add that isn't in the review title. Close easily without a struggle. Convenient sizes that nest in each other.

I bought this back in 2012 for a puppy, but it ended up being too small. Then after having it saved for a while I thought of using it for my cats. One cat shown in the pic loves this bed. It is his sleeping spot during winter & summer. He is in that bed all the time. It fits perfectly & he is about 12 lbs, but rather small. The bed itself has held up great in the washing machine & dryer. I wash it out every couple of months to get rid of all the cat hair on it. The colors have faded some, but the overall softness of the plush material is still there. The bottom, top & sides are cushioned but the bottom is not. There is a soft cushion pad that goes inside though. I haven't used the house open with my cats because they don't like going into it. The cat here that sleeps on it all the time likes his bed the way it is. This has been his bed for over a year now & if ever it does wear out I will be getting him a new one.

I bought this a year ago for my cats. My 6 lb kitten & 15 lb cat both love this bed. It is easy to wash, has a small removable center pad that is soft. The outside part is a little flimsy and won't stand up on it's own but that's alright because my cats still burrow in there. For the most part i am happy because there's always a cat sleeping in it, nice and warm in the winter months.

After having my laptop for 4 years the battery gave out. Delivery of this battery was fast with prime. I am happy that a year later the replacement battery is still working without any issues. Just make sure that you compare the serial number on your original factory battery to the new replacement battery so you won't have any issues with it fitting or working. I compared the 2 and both look identical. To me there is no difference. I am happy with this product. Would recommend.

This is a nice screen protector compared to the thin plastic version that I used to have for my phone. I'm not sure how well it will hold up yet against falls or even direct trauma to the glass & hopefully will not have to find out. It is easy enough to place on the phone, with a steady hand & a little bit of aligning up the edges. The air bubbles came out fast & none stayed behind after I had the glass in place. This is not so thick that you can actually feel that it is there. On my phone you can't tell I even have it on. It doesn't make using your touchscreen hard either, it is like nothing is there. I would say that this brand is exceptional compared to the flimsy plastic covers & probably would hold up well against direct trauma to the screen.

This is a nice brow filler, but for me I needed more definition because my brows are much to sparse to just 'fill in'. The color was natural & light, was easy to apply without dragging on my skin. For me the color lasted all day long, even in the summer humidity. I'm sure that for someone who has enough eyebrow hair, but needs something to darken them up or fill in from over plucking on occasion this would work great. I need something that adds more definition & much darker color because my brows are far to sparse to stand on their own.

My son loved these pacifiers when he was born. He'd want one all the time. The lactation nurse when he was born said he was a 'tongue sucker' and was doing that for comfort. I guess that by giving him a soft paci he found no reason to suck his tongue as much and started to want this paci instead. These are soft, flexible & come in sizes to fit as your baby grows from newborn up. I had to buy the size up once my son was 2 months old because the newborn ones were too small for him. The nipple tip is round instead of flat, which my son loved because his bottle nipples were also round tips by Avent.

This is a nice case. The inside black part is a flexible rubber & the outer gold part is a hard plastic. It goes on easy, looks nice & I"m sure will protect my phone against falls because of the inner flexible rubber part.

When my son was 10 months old he got a cold & was miserable with a stopped up nose, sneezing, coughing & i can imagine he had a sore throat because he made a few hard swallows while drinking his milk. I wanted something natural for him, that wouldn't make me feel bad for not knowing if I was giving him something that would help or make him feel worse. Hylands have always been a trusted brand in my house, because I've used the brand for different things in the past. This cold medicine is clear like water & I"m not sure the taste because I put the directed amount into my son's bottle instead of using the syringe to put it in his mouth-- he fights me when I try to use the syringe, so I measure it out first, then put that amount into his bottle so he doesn't know he's getting medicine. Within a few minutes his nose unclogs & I can hear him breathing easier, the coughing will stop & no more sneezing. I also use a little bit of Maty's baby rub on the soles of his feet with some warm socks before putting him to bed, along with a proper dose of this cold medicine. It helps him every time, day or night.

I've been using Demon WP since 2012. At first I bought it because we had roaches, the small fast ones that you can never move quick enough to squish & the big ugly ones that make your skin crawl just looking at them. This worked so well in killing roaches that every year I'd buy another pack to use. by 2014 the house was pretty much roach free & has stayed that way ever since.Now that there are no roaches to be seen, I assume they are either all dead of hiding from me, there have been spiders, a 'child of the earth' (if you don't know what it is, google it... i thought roaches made my skin crawl till one of these crawled on me.... ), scorpions & an occasional army of ants. We don't live in AZ & the scorpions here aren't aggressive or poisonous, so those tenants I try not to evict. Some spiders I don't have issues with either, except for the poisonous kinds like widows. In such cases I will double up the strength of Demon for a special once over the house in all hopes of either scaring every living arachnid out of this house, or killing what fearless ones that stay behind.So far I've found a dead 'child of the earth' (which means there must be more, thankfully I haven't seen them), scorpions & yes, spiders. Mostly all these bugs hide out in the garage where it is mainly dark, quiet & lots of hiding places. I pay extra attention to the dark crevices when I spray.Earlier this morning my 2 cats were playing with a widow. Yes, my heart stopped for a minute there when I realized my cat was 'mouthing' a live widow! Poor spider probably didn't sign up for a cat spit bath this morning, but I am thankful that my cats caught it before my one year old son was able to pick it up thinking it was something to play with. From the research I've done, widow bites can be quite dangerous to pets, young children & older adults causing trouble breathing, high blood pressure, vomiting, diarrhea & severe pain, etc.I'm guessing that since I went around the house putting drops of peppermint (said to ward off spiders) oil it must have drawn the spider out of its hiding place. No telling if the spider was offended by the smell or was attracted to the possibility of a candy cane free for all buffet. Either way, once again I pulled out the Demon WP to give the house a good once over so I can rest easy tonight knowing that no more spiders will face impending doom via a cat spit bath, then probably inevitably being eaten.Now, from what I have read about Demon WP it is considered safe once dry, although it does leave a white residue behind. Its good to open up windows while you spray because it stinks (not the 'if i spray some room spray it will go away smell", its more the 'oh what is that awful smell" stink). Like I mentioned above, I buy a pack of this once a year to spray in Spring when the bugs start coming out & always have a little left over to retouch up in Fall when the cooler weather seems to bring out the scorpions & spiders. I do keep the cats/baby out of the rooms I spray until it is completely dry. I'm not certain this is water proof, but after mopping it seems to keep working.I have used this outside too to spray inside the water meter (more for me than the water man, for those occasions i have to clean the dial), around the yard for fleas, flies and ants. Immediately after spraying the bugs start to die off with contact, especially an entire ant colony within 20 minutes after spraying directly into the hole & around.In all the years that i have been spraying bugs around the house (I have arachnophobia) Demon WP is the strongest I've found to kill even scorpions. So far it isn't one of those poisons you spray & 3 months later it stops working. In my house this has worked on it's own for a whole year.I've attached a picture of what the envelope looks like, there are 3 small packs of powder inside each one. I also attached a picture of the poor chewed up widow (the details in the pic are terrible. this widow had 2 white circles on the top & 3 red dots on the belly)On a side note I want to mention that I don't have an overly large house yet 3 packs of powder will last me a year considering I double the packs to spray one time, then go back again in Fall with a single pack to spray again.

we've had this mattress for 5 months now. it fits perfectly into my sons Graco Pack n Play, that we use as a crib for him. the mattress is water proof, so on those nights where his diaper doesn't hold up well the mattress is easily cleaned. the springs feel a little hard to the touch but that is what our pediatrician recommended for my son, that he have a hard mattress to sleep on. i've since added a thin foam topper to this because my son doesn't like sleeping on hard surfaces (he's a year old now & sleeps in his crib next to me). he sleeps through the night well and spends an hour or 2 during the day playing in his crib with toys sitting, laying down, jumping up and down. its held up well for him and i can imagine he will be sleeping on this mattress for quite a while longer.

My 3 cats love this toy. There is always a cat pouncing on it, or attacking the ball. It has also attracted my 11 month old son when the cats are playing with it. I put it in the middle of the room & soon enough there will be a cat or two sitting there with my son playing. The scratch pad has held up pretty well considering how much my cats love scratching on pads like this one. I've had the toy for about a year now & am so glad I bought it. My kitten, 1 year old & 2 year old cats play with it just like they are all kittens with a new toy. This toy doesn't seem to get old for them.

A while back the vet recommended using this for my cat because he was coughing up hairballs. The vet said it would also help his digestion, to move things along easier. I've been using it on & off with 3 cats. One cat likes the taste, the other 2 won't go near it. I put a small dime size drop on their paw before they run off acting like I touched them with something appalling. So far no hairballs, but as the vet said this does keep things going easier- the evidence is in the cat boxes. I'm not a big fan of petroleum, especially wanting my cats to ingest it but if the vet says it's safe, then I have gone on a trial & error run. My cats are healthy, I don't use this every day-more so as a as needed basis. It seems to work, so it's a keeper.

I bought this for my son because he is teething. He's 11 months old & some days he's inconsolable no matter what I do. I use this with Hylands natural teething gel, but use the gel more often than I reach for the Infants Advil. I'm very careful about what I give my son & have used Advil for many years myself for pain so I figured it would be good for my son too.He doesn't seem to like the flavor too much because he makes a funny face when I give it to him. I squirt a little at a time into the cheek part of his mouth until he had the recommended dose, plus it gives him a chance to swallow what's already in his mouth without choking on it or without it going down his throat causing him to choke.It seems to help because he rests better if I give it to him at bedtime, or is more content during the day if I give him a dose.

I bough this for my 11 month old when he started teething. It is all natural, so I don't feel bad about putting it on his little gums & worrying it will burn or cause some reaction from chemicals. I don't want to stick my finger in his mouth all the time so I put a couple drops of gel around the nipple of his bottle/on the straw or spout of his sippy cup before each feeding. I also leave this in the fridge so it is cool when it goes on his gums. It seems to be helping compared to not putting it on his bottle at all.
