On real bad days where he won't stop crying for anything & his gums are visibly red/swollen I will rub this on his gums after giving him some Infants Advil. I'd rather just use this gel than anything else though & since using it my son has been much happier during feedings of solids after having this on his gums. I haven't noticed any irritation from using it & since the company has been around for long as I can remember I trust the brand.

My 11 month old has terrible eczema & most any scented lotion or wash I use on him will cause a rash. I started using Cetaphil when he was 4 months old because the rashes were so bad in some spots of his body they would crack/bleed. This hasn't stopped all the rashes, but it sure doesn't cause irritation or more rashes than what he normally has. This wash is so gentle that I can use it on his hair too. There is a mild scent to this wash which I think is nice, compared to the Cetaphil bar which has no scent at all. I like that this wash will lather up the way regular soaps do as well. It rinses clean away & leaves no residue behind. I'd recommend.

I had this book when I was a kid (about 5 years old) & was so happy to find it here on Amazon! Now that I have a son, I want him to enjoy the same books I did when I was little too. It is so much fun reading to my son & the pictures are fun to look at too! This is one of my fondest memories of childhood, was reading my books (I loved books). The story line is simple, fun & really encourages kids to start reading on their own.

I've had this scale for about 12 years now. At first I had it programmed with my height/age to tell body fat, etc- but now just use it as a simple scale to tell my weight. I started out with a spring scale but had such a hard time bending over (with a bad back) to reset it before every use, so one day out shopping I came across this one at the store. It is easy enough to program, very simple to turn it on with one toe-no more bending over.My weight seems to be 3 lbs less on this scale compared to the the one at the doctors office. I'm going to just say that for me, 3 lbs difference is accurate enough considering that I am fully clothed wearing shoes at the doctor office when I get weighed in.In the 12 years of having this scale I have changed the batteries one time when it stopped working & I thought for sure it needed to be replaced. I don't weigh every day. more like every week or so. During my pregnancy I was on this scale every week & comparing it to the Dr. office (also every week), yet again it came out with the 3 lbs difference (my scale is old faithful at this point).I'm satisfied with the scale. It is easy enough to use, the digits can be read without much trouble (compared to squinting at a spring scale dial).If ever old faithful goes out then I will order another from Amazon because I am certain the store I purchased the one I have now, no longer carries them.

This screen protector isn't so thick that you can't use the touch screen on your phone. Actually it doesn't even look or feel like it is even on the phone at all. I broke one of these and it does shatter but doesn't drop big pieces of glass, just little tiny shards that can stick in your finger if you're not careful cleaning it up. I think this is a good investment towards the life of my phone.
This works as expected. Arrived quickly with no problems. Good to have since I download lots of mp3's onto my phone & have tons of apps. Great price too

I'm in the process of transitioning my one year old off the bottle and into a sippy cup. He does not want anything to do with sippy cups. So, this sippy came with a spout & nipple (the nipple has bumps on it- I read it helps to get a toddler used to different textures in their mouths to help with eating solids). Well, since this comes with a spout I figured I'd try it on his bottle, so at least he'd be getting used to the feeling of not drinking from his regular nipple-which will help when I put the spout back on his sippy. It fit well on the Classic Avent plastic bottle without leaking & he didn't even notice a difference except that the spout didn't flow fast as the nipple he's used to. Hopefully this will help him to get used to a different feeling than the nipple he's used to, so that when i do switch to the sippy (just a different color & look from his bottle) he will be familiar with how the spout feels and accept the sippy. Of course this might not work, but it's worth a try!I also wanted this sippy because it is easier to clean than the straw one and the cap stays tight on so when my son throws it to the ground at least the spout won't get dirty. The handles don't come off like some cups that have removable handles, but that's alright. The handles are soft to grip and I am guessing this cup is 8 oz? I'm not sure yet because I haven't had a chance to fill it up. The times I've given it to my son he just pushed it away or threw it. We are still in the learning to play & accept his sippy stages. I'm confident this sippy will be a good replacement for his Avent bottle.

This is about the only case I have found to go on a Moto E 1st gen phone. It is a firm rubber that feels pretty secure on the phone. I'm going to say that it will be hard to remove from the phone as well. It's not a hard plastic case. There are grooves on the side to keep the phone from slipping out of your hands, which is a nice feature. It isn't bulky at all. I like the cut out in the back that shows the Motorola logo. Overall this is a nice case that feels like it could really hold up for a long time while protecting the phone from drops.

My 11 month old is teething & teething rings keep coming up in conversations. I'm not so sure how well this would work for a teething baby, because my son is determined to throw it out of his crib at every chance he gets. He plays with it like a toy, but doesn't chew on it. I like that it's easy for my son to hold, has little grippers on the leaves and a ring for him to grasp. This makes for a good toy, even though my son won't chew on it yet.

This is a nice little case & does what it's supposed to. My son is always playing with my phone & either drops or throws it. This case has helped keep my phone in one piece against a 11 month old. The front plate falls off though when ever my son throws my phone but the back plate stays secure. I've had some difficulty removing the back plate but it's not impossible. The colors on this case are nice, haven't worn off yet.I'd recommend it to others. It works well to protect my phone & I like the colors.

I'm not entirely new to essential oils, but this one was a first for me. I wanted Lavender because of how well it works to calm & relax, also for making 'dream pillows' by spraying a diluted amount onto the bedding at night. This oil is very strong & only needs a couple of drops for most anything you're planning to do with it. The bottle should last quite a long time. I've made bath salts, sugar scrubs, 'dream pillow's, used it to refresh furniture, window covers, rugs & also made homemade shower gel with this. A little goes a very, very long way. The scent is pleasant when diluted.The only problem is that I can't have it around my son because even diluted the scent is too strong for him & he will cough until he's no longer around it. I did read though that this oil is safe when diluted to use on & around babies (6 mo & older), but do your own research before taking my word for it. My son is 11 months old & I haven't used any essential oils on him, nor in his bath so I can't say how safe this is for babies.What i can say is that diluted in a bottle of water it makes a great room freshener when spritzed around the house.

Recently I bought one of these for my Moto E 1st gen phone & am glad I did. For many years I've used screen protectors on my phones to save them from scratches & it has worked. This one is thicker than the old fashioned plastic protectors I'm used to. It was easy to put on the phone & looks durable enough to protect against most any kind of reasonable damage to the screen.I will note that these do not bend or cut. The screen protector will shatter if bent or cut & even though it doesn't break off into wedges of glass, tiny shards do fall off.From what I can tell so far this protector doesn't interfere with the touch screen & doesn't make the screen look dull in any way. Big plus.I'd buy again & would recommend.

We have an outside gate that people would get into so now we have it locked with one of these master locks. This brand holds up through the rain & snow without rusting. It feels to be thick enough that it can't be cut very easy, nor picked without some effort. Either way it is keeping people out of the fenced in area we don't want them breaking into.

I bought this for my 11 mo old son because he's always taking my phone to play with. Now he has his own! Hopefully it will hold up with him throwing it around like he does his other toys. He likes lights & sounds, so this one looks to be something worth trying. Either way it's too cute to pass up & if my son gets some entertainment out of it, then it is all worth it!

First of all I want to make it clear that I am not one of those people who got this phone in exchange for a 'honest' review.I bought this phone because I am a 'light' phone user & want to spend as little every month towards phone service that is possible. This brought me to Tracfone. $10 a month cards with triple minutes, plus carry over that stays active for 6 months at a time if you use the phone at least once in that time period. But then Tracfone got even better with android phones that are wifi capable (install text/calling apps to use on wifi without using up  your phones minutes). See where I'm going with this?My requirements for an android phone are to at least have a 4.5 inch gorilla glass screen, decent camera that is front/back facing with a flash, run nothing less than android 4.4, be on the Verizon network (a deal breaker. I refuse to use a phone on Sprint towers due to terrible signal & blackout days), no SIM card at all (too much hassle to activate).This phone might not be running android 6.0, nor be an iPhone, doesn't have the latest technology but it works for what I want it to do & is what I was looking for in an android phone.Activation is easy as well. Go online to Tracfone's website, click on activation & enter in the required information, on the phone itself click on what ever window pops up to complete activation, make that one last phone call & hear the recorded message that your phone has been successfully activated. Simple.Now it might be a hassle to some people to use 2 separate phone numbers (a text/calling app phone number-plus your given Tracfone number) on one phone but if you really think about how much money you are saving each month/year by switching to Tracfone & using wifi for the heavier calling/texting/data (for free) it really isn't a hassle anymore. It just makes sense. Why pay more when you don't have to?

This is my first purchase of peppermint oil. I initially have peppermint tea bags for upset stomach/IBS symptoms that work well but wanted something a little stronger to try in hopes that it will calm my IBS. My doctor recommended that I try a 'high grade' peppermint oil daily in a glass of water (just a couple drops of peppermint oil). It took me a while to research the different brands to find one that actually is safe to ingest. During my research i learned that peppermint oil is also good to ward off spiders, clean the house, disinfect & great for tooth problems (a couple drops in toothpaste), also helps to stimulate hair re-growth (a couple drops in a carrier oil, or in shampoo).I want to make it clear that I am not one of those people who got this free in return for a 'honest' review.I'm pretty new to peppermint oils & this one smells just like a candy cane. I put 3 drops mixed in with coconut/grapeseed oil to massage into my hair/scalp for an overnight treatment & smell like a candy cane now. I can feel the oil tingling on my scalp too.The smell is pleasant & nice. I like that there is a dropper or a cap you can use. The packaging was also very secure.I've also added some onto the vaporizer for a nice minty scent in the room. I plan to also use a couple drops on toothpaste, to try and clean with it. Earlier I had some peppermint tea with a couple drops of this & it tasted nice. Cleared my sinuses pretty well too.I really like the smell of this oil & will buy again. This bottle is huge, so it will probably last me quite a while though. Just a couple drops go a very, very long way.

I bought this for my Honeywell home security panel because the battery was going out. For some reason the panel still says 'low battery'. I'm not sure if the one sent to me was new or not but it looks new. My panel is fairly new so I'm not thinking it would be something wrong on my end. Either way, it is installed in the panel. the incessant beeping from a low battery stopped so for the time being i am happy at least to not hear that beep every few seconds. i wouldn't order this battery again. next time i plan to go directly to the alarm company to purchase a new battery.

Initially i wanted a mop that would save me from having to pull out the bucket of water & wring a heavy mop every time i wanted clean floors. then i started thinking about my 10 month old son crawling around on the floors, plus seeing how dirty his socks were by the end of day. that is how i came to the decision of trying out a steam mop & after reading the good reviews on this one figured it was worth a try.i couldn't be happier with my steam mop. it is easy to use, has the carpet attachment to 'touch up' carpets (or in my case area rugs), 2 washable pads & the cord is long enough that i don't have to plug into every room.we have unsealed wood floors that collect too much dirt no matter how often i mop, so at least this steam mop has made cleaning the floors easier. it produces a lot of hot steam quickly after turning the unit on & will clean 2 medium sized rooms on one full tank of water.it is very easy to use, doesn't weigh much & cleans without having to push down on it. i'd recommend to others looking for a steam mop.

This is probably one of the best toys I could ever get for my 3 cats. I have gone through 2 of these in a year already. My cats love scratching on these pads. One cat has been found sleeping on it. Now i have 2 beat up pads sitting in the house, with the really beat up one being their favorite to keep scratching on. Its fun watching my cats when I put a little bit of nip on the pad, because they go wild over it!If you have more than one cat, you might want to order to so they won't fight over who gets to play with the new toy first.

This shower head is not for people with long hair. It takes me forever to get all the soap out of my hair in the shower, but after months of using this shower head our water bill has stayed pretty low. We can now take 15 or 20 minute showers without worrying about a higher water bill. There is a nice stream of water pressure as well, so this is not a trickle in the shower, it is like a regular shower head but with much less force.

I ordered this a few months back thinking it would be nice to have a reflective sign on my car showing other tail gating drivers that my son is in the car & to slow down. So far it hasn't kept road hogging tail gating drivers off my bumper but it gives me peace of mind knowing that at least other drivers are aware that i have a baby in the car. I thought after washing the car, or a good rain storm that it would fall off but actually it is holding up very well. I moved it recently to another spot on the back of my car & had to pull pretty hard to get it off. This is also a nice sized magnet.I would recommend & am very happy with my magnet. Now if only people would stop being road hogs & tailgating

the wipes are thick and do the job great for diaper changes, cleaning up after eating and even wiping dirty little hands. i don't like the scent though, which actually made diaper changes much smellier for us. these are gentle on the skin & didn't aggravate my sons eczema.

these are pretty much the same as name brand batteries, except the price is better. my 10 month old has a couple of toys that require batteries & instead of always running out every couple of weeks I stock up for when we need them. the batteries last about as long as any other brand would in a child's toy. I love the price & convenience of having them delivered to the door.

I put this on the high chair while feeding my son & he loves to bang on it to make the fishes inside move around. Its a great little toy for floor play & even during feedings because it wipes down easy.

I bought these for my son 2 months ago & they are still his favorite toy to play with. He crawls around carrying one, banging it on things or throwing it around the room. They are light enough to carry around, a nice size for little hands to grab onto & clean easy. I'm happy about getting them because my son crawls right to them every morning to play and picks them up throughout the day. The little ball inside moves around making noise too, which keeps my son wanting to bang them around to hear more noise!

I'm happy to say that these do not upset my stomach. Most vitamins either upset my stomach or make me constipated. These aren't the smallest of vitamins but still easy enough to swallow once you get used to the size of them. I take these in the morning & after a week rotate to the nights & back again to mornings. So far I've had extra energy & my nails seem to be growing out thicker, which is a plus.
These have great clear sound.

My 3 indoor cats love this grass. It is super easy to grow. I put a handful of seeds in a small pot, left it in a dark spot & within 3 days there were sprouts. I just wish the grass would last longer indoors instead of drying out after the cats nibble on it for a couple of days. Either way, there are enough seeds to keep growing in pots indoors & my cats really enjoy nibbling at it.

I really like this sticker. It is big enough that you can see it & the white color makes it stand out even on tinted windows.It was easy enough to apply, seems to be stuck on the glass pretty well. Either way it is peace of mind knowing that tail gaiters will hopefully see it & slow down knowing that my son is in the car.

I wish I'd known this was such a bad buy so i wouldn't have ordered it. The points of the heart are sharp & the writing on it instead of saying "forever more" says 'not ever more"Don't waste your time on this piece. It is not worth it.

This is the 4th watch I have ordered for my husband. He uses one for work & the other for when he goes out. People have given him countless compliments on how expensive looking & nice this watch is. Someone even wanted to buy it from him!After a couple months of heavy wear the metal starts to peel off, but otherwise it is a nice watch for a great price. It is water proof, stands up well to daily wear. Looks great.
I love this mascara. It only needs to be applied once & causes no irritation or stinging like some do.The color is dark, looks great & does not clump.I'd definitely buy again.

These fit as expected, are a little thick which is great for colder months. Wash well & don't lose their color. the only problem I have with them is that after a month of wearing & washing they lost their elasticity. The ankle part came loose & wouldn't hold up anymore.

My son is 8 months old & this is the only bottle I use for his feedings. I didn't want plastic, so a glass bottle was ideal & looking for one was very hard until I found this one. We started out with this brand before he was born & once I saw how easy to handle the bottles are I opted for a glass one. These bottles are easy to grip & hold when you're feeding, also very easy to clean. There is some weight to this bottle & it is a thick glass, so i have to be careful when my son is crawling around & the bottle is out so that he doesn't bump himself in the head with it. i don't let him hold the bottle either, because again I am afraid he'd conk himself in the head accidentally with it.I haven't dropped this bottle yet so I can't say how well it would hold up against an accidental drop, but would imagine it could (not that i'd use a glass bottle that had been dropped on a hard surface, nor would I recommend it, because you can't always see tiny cracks!)Overall this is a great bottle & stays cold in the fridge, holds the cold in with an ice pack when we go out (it is summer right now)I'd recommend to anyone looking for a glass bottle.

I bought this when my son was 8 months old & now he's a year old, this is one of his favorite toys to play with when he's in his crib for naps. My son likes Twinkle Twinkle Little Star & some of the other songs it sings. This pup sings the ABC's, Twinkle Twinkle, wash your hands song, and more. The voice is kind of loud and there is no volume control. The only part that actually lights up is the heart with a small bright light in the middle part of it. There is a hard plastic back to it, but so far my son hasn't hurt himself on it. The rest is plush & soft. My son plays with this pup before going to sleep and again when he waked up. He has even learned how to push the feet & ear to make the sounds come on.
The sticker is in fact large, easy to install & looks great on the back window of a car! Great purchase!

I'm not a watch person, but this one is so pretty & the price couldn't be beat so I had to try it out. The butterfly detail is beautiful in person. Easy to put on, the face is a little large, the numbering is easy to see. It is a beautiful watch that looks very expensive, even though it costed barely anything at all! I would recommend for a gift, or for yourself if you love butterflies too!
This was a gift, it has great sound is small enough to carry in a pocket or purse. The person I gave it to is very happy with it.

I bought this for my 8 month old son because he wasn't yet crawling & I thought he'd like to try his legs at walking. He's not ready yet to walk, but is already crawling now. He wants to jump when he's in it & gets mad because he can't figure out how to move around.Over all it is a great toy for an infant, with toys on it to keep my son busy. He chews on the little balls & plays with the wheel.The seat is cushioned & easy to clean. The walker moves easily on carpet.It is height adjustable, which is great for a growing baby!Overall I am happy with this purchase. it gives me time to do things I need to while my son is entertained & it's easy to move this where ever I am at in the house so he can keep an eye on me.

I'm not sure about this scent, because I have the eucalyptus one instead.About the product, I am so glad to have stumbled across it. Back in April 2015 my male non altered cat decided to spray the ENTIRE house, including beds, chairs, curtains, floors, walls. It was a horrible stinking mess. I ordered 4 bottles of a urine odor remover, which did nothing except bleed my wallet dry & cover up the stink. My cat kept spraying including the entire month after I had him neutered (he quit after that, except for the occasional puddle). We were about ready to re-home my cat because it was a lot of work shampooing carpets, mopping, laundering & wiping down walls each time he'd spray or pee somewhere.Finally after searching the internet for home remedies to rid the stink I came across several posts mentioning Odoban for removing cat pee stink. Luckily it is carried here locally so I could pick up a gallon right away & start using it.I mixed a gallon bottle as directed & filled up a spray bottle. The more concentrated you make the mixture, the stronger the scent (with the one I have it is overpowering if you make it too concentrated).Day 1 with Odoban. I cleaned the entire house. Did a sweep of walls, furniture, laundered with a half cup of diluted Odoban I made a mixture from, shampooed the carpets, mopped & sprayed down bathroom, kitchen & everything else I thought could use a cleaning. It was a lot of work, but once I was done the sinks shined, the hardwood floors looked clean, there was no more cat pee stink. (I do want to mention that when you apply to cat pee on fabric, the pee stink will come out until the Odoban dries & then it goes away).Day 2 with Odoban, the cat did not spray or pee anywhere.Days went on & no more puddles. I wish I'd found Odoban before spending all that money on urine stink remover that failed. It was the end of month 2 of him spraying, after he was neutered & thankfully the Odoban deterred him from marking the house further.Now I am still using Odoban daily to spray down counter tops, sinks, bathrooms, mop hardwood floors, clean the stove & even clean the litter boxes with. It removes odors wonderfully & the scent fades away after a couple hours. My cat still leaves puddles around the house every now & then when he's mad at me, but this time I have my Odoban to spray & clean up. Works every time.(My hardwood floors are unsealed & original flooring in a 70 year old house. I've had no problems mopping with Odoban one part diluted mixture, 3 parts water)
This sheet is very soft, fit perfectly to the spring mattress I ordered for a Graco Pack n' Play. Launder without shrinking or fading.

I read about this in an online IBS group from someone posting about painful hemorrhoids (the poster lives in the UK). Of course as a sufferer of IBS-D & hemorrhoids I wanted to try it (Prep H only works so much). The waiting time was painful (I had bad hemorrhoids), but once it came in such relief was found! It took a few days of continual use (very tiny amount) to notice a difference in the pain, size & itching. Finally the hemorrhoids are shrinking. I won't compare this to Prep H, because every product works different for each person. What I will say is that this stuff really has helped me & I am going to re-order for the next time I have hemorrhoids just so I can have an extra on hand (don't want to run out)

Someone else said this is nothing but water & after trying it, I agree. I bought this for my son because he's started teething & thought it would help him to not be so uncomfortable (fussy) but it was nothing but water (awful tasting I imagine from the face my son made).It would have been great if this worked, even though it is awful tasting water but it didn't do anything for my son.

I love the cotton underwear & always have such hard time finding my size in stores. These fit slightly larger than the size I'd normally get in stores. No shrinkage with washing & no fading. Best part is no bunching, binding or riding up. I don't have problems with these cutting into my legs either.Even though they are a little larger than my regular size I have ordered twice already & will continue to again because Amazon has my size (or close enough), these are a great price, good quality, soft cotton & delivered to my door.

Seems to work just like any other brand does. Stays on at least a week for me, but I am a mom & no manicure survives longer than a week for me!Clear & glossy, sets easy. No mess. Small bottle. Shipping took a while but the polish was worth the wait. Great price. Does have a mirror finish. I would buy again.

Bunny is made of soft material, doesn't feel hard with the stuffing & the ears are super smooth. Shipping was fast, the price is great. The bunny is small enough to fit in a diaper bag, take it along in the car seat or stroller. My son has slept on bunny a few nights already after chewing on it.It's too bad bunny isn't washable, except for wipe down because of all the baby spits soaking it up from my teething 8 month old.Overall this is a great baby gift or toy

I'm a new mom, have a 7 month old son & IBS. I've suffered with anxiety my entire life, without medications or any counseling. In the past I'd depended on herbs to help with the anxiety, but hadn't found any certain brand that helped.After reading reviews & doing a little research of my own on the herbs of this brand I decided that maybe it's worth a try. If it works great, if it doesn't work, then I am out $40 which is not so great.At first I started out with just 1 a day, at night to help me sleep. I had a really restful nights sleep after taking 1 of these a half hour before bedtime.Then i figured it would be worth a try to see if it helps with my anxiety during the day, since I was suffering with a severe IBS-D flare up that left me having panic attacks every single time I'd have to use the bathroom (IBS suffers understand). I would literally start shaking & cry because I knew it would hurt & I was just so sick during the flare up.After a couple days of taking 1 during the day I noticed that my anxiety was less. I wasn't crying or having a panic attack every time I had to use the bathroom, which with an IBS flare up is OFTEN!A week went by & I started taking 2 pills a day. 1 in the morning & 1 again before bedtime. I noticed more restful sleep at night & less anxiety during my days.I figured it was just me thinking these pills work so I skipped 1. Wow. What a difference! Now I stick to taking 2 a day.The feeling I get from these is just a total calm, not groggy or anything else. Just more relaxed & not so easily stressed out. I don't have such horrible panic attacks & I'm able to go about my day.My husband has severe anxiety as well & he gets the chest tightness with palpitations. He's started taking 1 a day & has noticed the difference within 2 days of taking these. He feels calmer, sleeps better at night & his chest isn't as tight.

This was a gift for my husband. It shipped fast, came in exactly when it was supposed to. The shirt fits just as expected, true to size. Washes & dries well, does not lose coloring in the wash & does not lose shape when dried. My husband is very happy with this shirt & it didn't even cost what they do in department stores!

I really do wish I could say this product worked for my 3 month old son but it didn't. The very first bath with this product broke him out in such a horrible rash that I couldn't use it again. My son has very sensitive skin, so I thought that with all the reviews & some online research of safe products to use this would not be harsh on his skin, but unfortunately it didn't work for us.Other than the rash it was very drying to his skin, which is also a reason why I purchased it, was to help with his very dry skin & hopefully find something that would not strip the moisture right out.

My 4 month old son loves this pillow. He chews on the eye balls & plays contently on the mat trying to pull himself over the pillow. It's nice & soft, cradles his body without being too hard & washes easy when he soaks it in baby spit.The mat is non skid on the bottom & soft material on the top. Both wash & dry well in the dryer or hang dry. I would recommend to anyone looking for a soft toy for their infant to use for belly time.

It works to find stains, even works on poop stains that are set in, washed out & still there. A cat of mine pooped on a rug that I washed several times & used this light on only to find the spot he pooped glow purple in color.We don't have carpets, so this will work on hard wood flooring & even on walls (paint drops will glow purple). I didn't get much use of it though, probably because my cat didn't mark his territory as much as I initially thought he did. Plus, the Nature's Miracle I mopped the floors with, sprayed the walls & cleaned the furniture with got rid of all the stains before I got to use this light.Be sure to use with the special glasses sold here on Amazon, or else the light alone hurts your eyes even if you hold is a ways from your face.

Back in the end of March 2015 I had to put my baby Marble to sleep because he had a severe intestinal obstruction that went untreated due to a negligent vet misdiagnosing him. I had 4 special days with my baby before he became so sick there was no other option. It was extremely painful losing him & I wanted something to keep him close to my heart always. When i found this pendant while searching for an urn here on Amazon I knew it was exactly what would keep my baby Marble with me.Delivery was fast, it came in a day before his urn was ready to pick up at the vets office. I had no trouble at all placing a tiny amount of his cremains into the pendant & the tiny screw on top did not need glue to hold it in place.Ever since March 29, 2015 I have worn this pendant with absolutely no problems with the screw coming out or the pendant losing its beautiful shine. I have gotten one compliment from a lady who saw the pendant, without knowing what it is. She mentioned "loving that cat pendant". I love my pendant too, because every time I miss my baby Marble all I have to do is reach up & hold the kitty pendant in my hand. This is truly a beautiful urn pendant. The details of the cats whiskers, ears, legs & face are clearly seen. The back has a very small space that can be engraved by a jeweler, as I am wanting to have that done with Marble's name one day.I have added a photo of my pendant for anyone who is considering this for themselves. I would recommend this pendant to anyone who has lost a cat & I do send out my deepest sympathies to you. The pain of losing a fur baby is immeasurable. It is my philosophy that cats are angels that grace our lives with their love & companionship.There are 3 photos attached. One is the pendant in person. 2nd is the pendant on my baby's urn so you can see the size (my baby's urn is small about the size of a large box of matches. Finally is a photo of my baby Marble when he was well. To be able to keep my baby close to me at all times is such a wonderful feeling for me, so I am thankful to the company who makes these beautiful pendants.

UPDATE *This is now bottle #3. My male unaltered cat has come to sexual maturity & decided to mark his territory all over the house. Nature's Miracle is the only thing I can find to remove the stink from his urine. I have laundered blankets, rugs, clothes with no problems using N.M.. My cats latest spot to pee is the bed... a nice big puddle right in the middle of the bed (memory foam mattress topper included). I used an almost empty bottle of Febreeze & mixed in equal parts water/N.M. into the bottle so it's easier to spray not only small areas but also large surfaces at once. I soaked the bed & within hours the stink faded to nothing. I've also had to use that spray bottle to soak a cloth material recliner that my cat sprayed (he's been a busy boy). We have a large wool area rug that covers the living area that he peed all over & with the spray bottle I was able to soak the rug enough to remove the stink.I've mopped our wood (not sealed) floors with N.M., wiped down counter tops, cleaned the litter box & even used it on the walls (especially by doors & windows where he sprayed). There were no issues on any of the surfaces I used it on (be sure to spot check before you do though)If you get to the puddle of urine while it is still damp, spray or saturate the fabric with N.M., as it dries the stink will go away & leave no stain. Of course you need to pull up as much urine as you can with paper towels or a dry towel before treating the spot.A word of the wise, plain old laundry soap does not remove the stink of cat spray (I found that out the hard way). Also, ammonia based cleaners will make the stink worse, even attract the cat back to where he originally peed or sprayed (cat urine is ammonia based).I'd recommend this to anyone who is dealing with cat urine smell. It also works in bathrooms for human urine too!
It is hard to describe the scent, but this is a very exotic, feminine perfume. The scent lingers long after spraying, especially if you spray a little on clothing.

My cats really do love this gel. I'm not sure how well it works for hairballs, but since it has no petroleum jelly I think it's worth trying. I have 2 DMH hair cats & a DSH. My DSH has hairballs that he's struggling to cough up, so I wanted to try this gel. It is a nice consistency, doesn't smell awful bad & my cats enjoy eating it so there's no mess in applying it to their fur.*UPDATE*April 12, 2015I wanted to write an update to say this stuff does work. One of my cats has been coughing, but not able to produce a hairball--but when he eats this stuff he doesn't cough as bad & a hairball actually came up! The other cat has been 'passing' hair, which I am at least glad it is coming out. My cats are happier & eat this stuff right out of the tube! It's a great way to get cats to groom each other too!*UPDATE*November 15, 2015Here is my updated review. So far I have 3 cats who I use this on. It's more of a touch & go, literally. I have to put a drop on the paw before my cat runs off acting like I touched him with something disgusting... The other cat does enjoy the Salmon flavor & I have no problems getting him to lick it right out of the tube. My cat still struggles with hairballs occasionally. I so much prefer this one over the petroleum version, simply because it seems more natural to me than petroleum. I do have the petroleum version as well, because the vet recommended it, although I am on the fence so to speak about using it as often as I would this one.
My cats think this stuff is a treat! They eat it right from the tube.I feed high quality dry & wet food for my cats, but a little extra vitamins can't hurt.

My 9 week old son has Colic & I really wanted this to work for us, but it didn't. For the first few days giving my son Gripe Water in his bottle or directly with the dropper he didn't show much discomfort during or after a feeding, but soon that all wore off. We do everything from burping every 2 ounces of a bottle, changing his formula, sitting him up during & after a feeding, so when we saw the reviews on Gripe water it looked promising to help him not scream/cry during feedings. His pediatrician has given my son a clean bill of health, so there's no other reason except Colic making him fussy with feedings. Maybe this would work for some one else, but it didn't for us.

Excellent quality gloves at a reasonable price.  I have used these gloves woke working on plumbing at my hone.  They were fairly surname and only ripped after repeated friction on a metal pipe snake.  The gloves are comfortable and fit well and did not leave any odor or residue the way that latex gloves do.

This GE Bluetooth Sm  art Switch is a very good timer but is only average for "smart" device.  Setup is very simple, you simply download the app to your smartphone, plug in the switch and then set it using the app.  It allows for basic programmability to control a lamp or small appliance so you can set it to turn on a light on a schedule or even using sunrise and sunset times for your area.  This device works great as a simple light timer the problem is that it is priced like a smart switch.  Since this device does not have wifi you cannot control it while you are away.  For example if you are at the airport and forgot to program this timer before leaving you are out of luck.  Other devices let you program and operate the device from anywhere you have access to wifi.  Of course this device is supposed to simplify the ability to set a timer for a lamp or small device but honestly why not just buy an ordinary timer for less than $10 bucks if all you want is the lamp to be on or off at preset times?  Perhaps if you purchase a few of these and create the "bleutooth" mesh network then this would provide more functionality.  As a standalone device, other products have a lot more features at a similar price point which make this product simply average for its price.

My 5 year old daughter has played with her brother's Aqua Bead set in the past so when I got a chance to get this for her I thought it would be perfect.  Immediately she was excited to open up the set an get busy.  This set has a lot of different colored beads and the pen makes it easy to place the beads to make multicolored designs.  The biggest problem I had with this set was getting my daughter to stop playing with and go to bed!  This toy really encourages creativity and hand eye coordination.  More importantly it encourages patience which is something that our electronics oriented world does not teach anymore.  The one big downside to this product is that the replacement beads are a bit expensive but considering how much fun my daughter has it is well worth it.

This hair removal system really does work to reduce the amount of body hair in the areas you treat.  What makes this system different than others I have tried is that it works for more skin tones and can also be used on some areas of the face.  The light does seem a bit stronger than the Remington iLight pro system I have used in the past so hopefully it will yield faster results. The one big downside to this setup is that it is significantly more costly.  Also worth noting is that a single cartridge replacement for this is $150 dollars whereas the iLight pro cartridge is only $20.  One of the other reviewers mentioned that this cartidge is good for over 100000 pulses witch is significantly more than the 1200 pulses that the Remington cartridge lasts for.  I will update this review as I see the results and can vouch for the cartridge lifespan.

This Epson PictureMate is a great photo printer that is easy to use and produces excellent quality photos.  There are other reviews of this printer that state that the ink packs are too costly and make this more expensive to use than similar products from Cannon or HP.  Amazon currently has the ink pack along with 100 sheets of photo paper retailing for $29.99.  The actual price is a bit lower than retail so that equates to prints that are 30 cents per photo or less.  This is about the same as most other dedicated photo printers.  Where the Epson really excels is in its photo quality.  The prints look far better than the competition especially when you consider how vibrant the colors are.Another positive point of this printer is that it is very portable and easy to use.  The screen and trays all fold and make this printer very easy to store.  There is no battery option with this printer so you will need a power source but for most people this will not be an issue.  This printer is great for producing high quality photos especially when you need instant photos and cannot get to a photo studio.  I find it very handy to make instant printouts to give to friends and family at get-togethers and events.The one big downside to this printer is that it has a pretty high initial price. Canon has a line of photo printers that cost less than $100.  Of course this Epson has much better photo quality than the Cannon but it costs nearly twice the price.  This would easily be a 5 star product if its initial price was lower or if its cost per photo was lower, but at its current price it is 3.5 - 4 Stars.*** Positive Points: ***- Excellent quality photos that cost 30 cents per photo or less- Easy Setup- Good Sized Color LCD which makes it easy to see the photos you want to print directly from an SD card- Everything folds away for easy storage*** Negative Points: ***- Even at 30 cents per photo this is a lot more costly to print at home than at major photo shops such as Costco or Walmart which charge 10 cents per photo- Print Speeds are rather slow taking about a minute per photo- Part of the setup requires you to print out some of the instructions.  This is very wasteful considering you are printing onto photo paper- Cannot print photos larger than 5 X 7- High initial purchase price

Initially I got this as an alternative treatment for my kids when they have the cold and cough.  Unfortunately I read more about the ingredients specifically " Bryonia" and found an article on "WebMd" that stated it was unsafe at any dose.  This medicine has been used in homeopathic medicine for a while and is known for its laxative effect.  Other references online simply point to how it is used and don't mention any safety concerns.  As such I did not try this in my children and instead tried this only for myself.  It had a pleasant taste and did not seem to cause any dangerous side effects.  It did have a mild effect on my cold symptoms though far less than Nyquil or Dayquil do.  Considering the safety alert online I think it would be better to stick with more "modern" medicines that have known side effects rather than taking  a chance on your chjildren

I have a bathroom fixture that uses 6 candelbra bulbs.  Using 25 watt bulbs, that fixture was using a total of 150 watts.  I purchased this 10 pack of LED candle bulbs and so far they are working great.  The light output is nearly the same as the standard bulbs but I only use 18 watts.  The bulbs themselves are attractive and seem very well made.  Each came individually packaged and all worked flawlessly.  The light they give off is a warm yellowish tone which was very similar to the standard bulbs I was using which makes this a lot more natural to look at than some of the LED bulbs out there.  The best part is that these bulbs cost around $2.80 each when you buy the 10 pack.  My local hardware store sells a 3 pack of these for $12 (their sale price though normally they are $18)  I have purchased  a pack of those in the past and those tended to give more of a bluish light which was too harsh for bathroom use.  Considering the lower cost of these LEDMO bulbs and their more natural light characteristics, these are definitely a 5 star product.

Case Logic is known for making high quality camera cases that offer great protection and a variety of features.  I own about 5 different camera cases so when I got the chance to review this KDM-102 I thought it would be a great way to see how it stacks up to my current favorite the SLRC-202 (found at this link ... Case Logic SLRC-202 Medium SLR Camera Bag (Black)  ).  Even though both cases are listed as being medium sized cases this KDM 102 is definitely larger.  It can easily accomodate my Cannon T4i with an extra 55-300 and 18-55 lens.  It has a total of 4 pockets for holding additional items such as chargers, filters, and memory cards.  I wouldn't put a lens in the outside pocket because it is not padded but for non-delicate items they are very roomy.  Overall I still prefer my SLRC-202 case as it is slightly more compact and offers a bit more padding than this one.  If you have a larger camera or need more storage space then this case will definitely suite your needs.*** Positive Points: ***- Hammock system makes it easy to safely store your camera with the lens facing down so it is easy to access- Can easily accommodate 2 extra lens... I was able to put in my 55-300 lens with plenty of room to spare- Side storage pouches and front storage are very roomy though they are not padded- Bottom of the case is made of hard rubber so it will protect your camera from minor drops*** Negative Points: ***- Case is significantly larger than my current favorite the Case Logic SLRC 202- Camera and Lenses are stored in the same main compartment so if you have a larger camera you may need to take the camera out first before you can access your lens- The sides of the case are not as well padded as the SLRC 202Overall this is a great case if you dont mind its relatively large size.  I have included pictures of this case alongside the SLRC 202 so you can see the difference with the Cannon T4i and a 55-300 lens

The first time I bought this Fisher Price Laugh and Learn Puppy was over 7 years ago when my son was in the intended age group.  That puppy got so much use that it literally wore out which is amazing in this day and age of toys that are only used for a few days then ignored.After all these years I am given the chance to review the new version of this product and it is simply wonderful.  It is cute and colorful which immediately makes it attractive to kids. The colors are neutral so it works for both boys and girls.  The phrases that it speaks are fun and actually educational. All the great things of the original are there but the smart stages switch allow this to adjust to your child's age.  Considering its reasonable price this is an excellent toy.

I bought this to replace a Frigidaire refrigerator filter.  The old filter had not been replaced for a couple of years and it was extremely disgusting and brown from all of the sediment it had removed from out tap water.  This filter was easily replaced the old one and the water taste was improved significantly.  Even the ice cubes had less of an aftertaste once this filter was installed.  The real beauty of this filter is that it costs less than 1/3 the price of the original Frigidaire Filter so I can finally afford to replace it more than every few years!  Excellent Fit + Good Quality + Reasonable Price = 5 Stars

I generally like the scent of most Calvin Klein fragrances so when I got the chance to try this Eternity Now deodorant it was a pleasant surprise.  The fragrance is very different from the classic Eternity scent, it almost has a lighter more modern aroma but still has that elegant undertone.  The Deodorant part of this spray is a bit on the weak side.  It will work for a few hours but don't expect this to take the place of a deodorant stick or true deodorant.  In my opinion this is more of a freshening  up deodorant that you can apply after a long day at work in preparation for a night or dinner out. It is similar to a lot of body sprays out there but it has a more refined (expensive) scent... of course it costs more too!!

4.5 Stars - The Revlon Pro One Step Hair Dryer and Styler is an excellent product.  My wife has long (waist length) hair that she spends a considerable amount of time blow drying, brushing, and straightening.  This hair dryer allowed her to dry her hair in about half the time that she normally spends.  There was no need to hold a brush in one hand while drying with the other, the Revlon Hair Dryer allowed her to simply brush her hair and dry it in one step.  The Brush itself is very light weight... lighter than even her travel dryer,  which makes it easy to use.  The controls are simple twist controls on the bottom of the brush so it is easy to know what setting you are in.  The cord on the bottom is free to rotate so it does not entangle you as you move it across your hair.  The other benefit of this dryer is that it does have a mild straightening effect.  It won't replace a dedicated hair straightener but it will definitely cut down the frequency and time you spend straightening your hair. The one big downside to this product is its hefty price.  If it cost the same as most hair dryers it would be an easy 5 stars but since it is about double the price of a decent hair dryer I took off half a star.  Overall this is an excellent product though a little pricey.*** Positive Points: ***- Excellent design that truly saves time compared to an ordinary hair dryer- Lightweight and easy to maneuver- Easy to use controls- Cord rotates so it won't entangle you while you are drying your hair- Fast heat up time*** Negative Points: ***- High Price- No extras like a carrying case included-

I have tried all kinds of shaving products over the years.  I have no less than 5 electric razors, everything from Norelco, to Remington and even Braun.  All are decent products but none of them provide a shave that is even close to a regular blade.  This Panasonic razor is the best electric razor I have ever tried.  The instructions say that it takes up to 30 days for your skin to adjust for optimum performance but honestly on my first shave I could tell that this shaver was incredible.  I prepped my face like I normally do by washing with warm water the only difference was that I did not apply any shaving cream.  I was able to do my face on average in about 3-4 minutes.  The results were very good and even my wife was not able to tell that I had switched from my manual blade razor. The shave that this provides is extremely close and without spending a whole lot of time.The one big drawback to this Panasonic Shaver is its price.  It is a big initial investment at about $250 (current price on Amazon) but if you average this out over 2 years it is about $125 per year.  My current favorite manual razor is the Shick Quattro Power which works out to be about $150 per year (I use each blade about 1 week before I change it and an 8 pack of blades is about $20). Of course this does not take into consideration that the instructions on the Panasonic advise that you change the foil every year and you change the blades every 2 years (the cost is about $70 for the set).  The Panasonic does cost more to use but the difference is not huge when you average it out in the long run.  Overall the best shave is still with a manual razor but this Panasonic is simply the closest you can get without the fear of nicks or cuts.*** Positive Points: ***- Excellent Shave, the best shave I have ever had with an electric razor- Comes with Carrying case- Take less time to shave than a manual razor (average about 3-4 minutes for me)- Easy cleanup mode by simply holding down the power button- LCD display shows charge, elapsed time during shave, and when the blades need cleaning or changing*** Negative Points: ***- High Price (at least up front and also for the replacement parts)- Is actually only 2 blades though it has 5 foils on top- Instructions are not really very detailed for a product in the high end category- Instructions state that the foil should be replaced ever year and the blades every 2 years (the set costs $70)- Carrying case does not have room for power cord

The Large version  of this bath mat is very long.  It goes from my shower drain nearly to my shower door which is great for preventing slips  all along the tub.  The material is about the same quality as most good bath mats with big ridges to "massage" your feet. The one big downside is that the mat comes only in lighter shades which means it will likely stain over a few months.  I would have preferred some darker colors which do not show stains.  Other than that this is s great choice in bath mats.

These Panasonic headphones are a good deal for anyone looking for budget headphones.  The headphones are well built though made out of mostly plastic.  I personally don't like the feeling of having something fitting tightly into my ears but these do fit pretty well into the ear canal.  After a few minutes of listening they became a lot more comfortable and I actually forgot they were in my ears.  The microphone control has a button on it which can be used to play/pause your music which is a great addition especially at this price range.  The microphone itself provides decent call quality with very few people on the other end being able to tell I was on a handsfree mic.  The one big downside to these headphones was sound quality.  If you are not picky about your sound then you will find it to be satisfactory, but if you are an audiophile you will find the sound to be rather flat.  It is not bad considering the price and probably on par with most headphones in the $10 price range but again if you are picky about sound it may be worthwhile to spend a bit more to get a pair with better sound quality.

The Hot Wheels Monster Jam Dragon buildup is a good toy with a few flaws.  It is a pretty simple setup that involves launching one of the included trucks up a ramp and avoiding the dragon from chomping down on you.  If you make it past the dragon's jaw and hit the dragon's tail you get a trophy.  It is simple but fun and will keep the intended age group of 4-10 year olds entertained.  For the $20 price range this is a good purchase.*** Positive Points: ***- Works with other Hot Wheels cars- Easy to assemble and put away in the box- Comes with 3 trucks that the kids love- Good quality and value for the $20 price point*** Negative Points: ***- Frustration Free Package does not excite the kids when they first see or open it since there are no pictures on it- The track is rather small and not compatible with other tracks- Only one launcher means kids will have to take turns instead of battle each other- Play is somewhat limited thought the kids enjoy playing with the trucks

This Burberry Brit Sheer is simply amazing.  It is light but has a woody undertone.  Not too floral but not heavy either.  It has a very "expensive" aroma that works well for party wear a s well as business. The perfume itself is clear so it will not likely stain white clothes. The only downside is that this wonderful scent is rather expensive and the bottle is somewhat plain looking compared to many of the other fragrances on the market.  Other than that this is a great scent.

This stuff is simply amazing.  I started having a roach problem a few months ago and over the last few weeks it seemed uncontrollable.  I had tried every product I could find at my local Home Depot but the Roaches kept coming back.  Finally I decided to try this Advion Roach Gel (based on the reviews) and I must say the results are impressive.  Basically you put this bait in the areas where you have seen roaches.  I put this on the old roach motels that I had lying around my kitchen area.  The roaches really love this food and they will consume it.  Within a few days you will see the dead or dying roaches all over your kitchen.  Of course you will need to retreat the area after a few weeks just to make sure that they are all gone.  Also you want to make sure that small children are bot able to pick up or go near the food since it has a creamy white color that may attract them.  The price seems a bit high but in the long run it is worth it because the cheaper treatments really do not compare to this.

I used this on a gas stove that had the pain peeling off the control panel. I first prepped the surface of the stove by removing oil with a degreasing spray (Easy Off Oven Cleaner worked well).  After that I sanded the area with a fine sandpaper and removed the loose paint.  I sprayed this on from about 6 inches away and got very good results.  I had to make about 2-3 passes but the final result was a nice glossy finish that matched the original finish on my stove.  This proved to be an excellent product for refinishing a stove.

I have used a few fitness trackers over the last year and most have been cumbersome and not really useful. When I got a chance to evaluate this Jawbone UP2 I thought it would be another pedometer or heart rate monitor but this proved to be very different.  The UP2 is truly a lifestyle changing device.  It is very comfortable to wear (almost to the point that you will forget you have it on) and its one week battery life makes this very convenient to just wear and forget.  The App that goes with the UP2 is among the best that I have seen.  It not only tracks your activity level (like most of these devices do) but it also tracks your sleep patterns and allows you to input the food that you eat so it gives you an idea of your calorie consumption.  It not only tracks all of these things but it gives you tips every day with online articles that you can reference.  This thing doesn't just track your activity it actually educates and gives you real feedback!Some of the other cool features of the UP2 is that it vibrates to give you alerts.  For example you can set an alarm in the App so it can either wake you up in the morning or tell you when it is time to go to bed.  The band can also be set to vibrate if you have been inactive for prolonged periods of time (such as sitting at your desk at work).  The whole thing is very discrete and elegant.The only reason why I did not give this a 5 star rating is that the initial setup was a bit tricky for me.  The Jawbone did not pair with my Galaxy Note 4 until about the 3rd or 4th try.  To make matters worse, there is only a small quick start guide included in the package so it is very hard to know what to do if something goes wrong in the paring process.  I had to go the Jawbone website to learn how to get the Jawbone into the manual pairing mode.and after this it worked well.  Also the APP (while very useful) requires a bit of practice to fully understand all of the features.  It is easy to use once you have played with but the learning curve is still present.  Overall this is an excellent purchase for anyone looking to improve their fitness.*** Positive Points: ***- Very nice design that looks good on men and women- Comfortable to wear 24/7, you actually forget you are wearing it- Sturdy and water resistant with great battery life (I get about 5 days)- App for Android is simply amazing, it tracks food, sleep, and activity levels and is very easy to use and has some great tips to get you in shape- Band vibrates to give you reminders or alerts such as if you have been sitting too long or if you set a bedtime alert- Sleep tracking function is very nice to help you analyze how your sleep affects your daily performance*** Negative Points: ***- No real instructions in the box, just a quick setup guide- pairing was a bit finicky with my Galaxy Note 4, it did work but it took a few tries (also the lack of included instructions forced me to go on the web to read the FAQ on Jawbone's site)- Charger is innovative (with its magnetic hold) but very short so you will need to charge it on a counter or computer; also the included charger is USB only and does not come with a wall adapter

I have used these to store blended fruits in the freezer to prevent them from rotting. I later use these for smoothies.  The first thing you notice about the bags is that they are very thick and seem durable enough to last a long time.  We used to use small plastic boxes in the freezer but those would break if dropped.  These bags are strong enough to be thrown around with frozen goods inside and not puncture or rip.  These are an excellent way to store things while saving money in the long run.  The one big downside is that these are costly.  At Nearly $5 a bag these cost as much as 1 box of a 100 zip lock bags of a similar size.  If I used 1 bag per day it would take me 3 months to equal the cost of this bag.  If you use a lot this will pay for itself very quickly but if you rarely freeze and use items these probably wont be worth it.

I thought this would be a great small reminder for work.  Unfortunately it turned out to have very limited functionality.  The surface is small and the included pen stores separately.  The included magnetic pins are nice but are not well made.  This will get the job done but for almost $12 you expect a little more functionality and features.

3.5 Stars - To be honest I am not a big fan of "organic" anything.  The claims are often exaggerated and the benefits are not pronounced.  That being said, when I was given the chance to try this Campbells Organic Tomato soup I thought it would be a good way to judge if the "Organic Soup" tasted better than the plain tomato soup.  My Personal favorite boxed soup is from Costco which has a rich and creamy taste.  I expected this to be similar but to be honest it tasted much more plain.  The salt is there, the tomato flavor is there, the cream and basil is also there but this soup somehow lacks a strong flavor.  Not sure what it is but something is just quite lacking in its flavor.  Some plus points about this soup are that it is all natural and organic (if that makes a difference to you) and it is vegetarian (meaning no meat broths).  The price is very reasonable but considering you can get a slightly more flavorfull  soup for about the same price.

Basically this is a small sized 100 page spiral notebook with a cloth cover.  The cover to this spiral notebook is very nice and durable.  The overall size is also nice and compact which makes it easy to carry so you can jot down quick notes to yourself.  The built in pen loop is nice and makes it easy to always be ready to jot down notes and the divider inside is a great addition.  The problem with this notebook is that it is rather wasteful and pricey.  After your 100 pages are done you are forced to buy another notebook for the nearly $5 price tag.  I have bought spiral bound 100 page botebooks for less than 25 cents each so the $5 price is somewhat obscene.

My 5 year old daughter has curly hair that she struggles with when it is time to brush or comb.  We normally oil her hair with a mineral oil to make it a pain free process but she still sometimes struggles.  When I got the chance to try this Suave Kids Detangling I thought she would be the perfect candidate.  To put it simply, this stuff works.  It really helped to soften her hair and allow her mom to brush it without causing her pain.  It was not as effective as the oil but it was not as messy and a lot easier to apply.  The smell is very light and my daughter actually enjoyed it.  It is a reasonably priced and effective making it 5 stars.

The first thing to think about these labels is do you really need them.  They are expensive... nearly $4 each so there should be a very clear need before making the investment.  The quality of the labels is actually very good.  They are easy to print on but a bit tricky to actually get them to "laminate" perfectly. The other thing to keep in mind is that the top side of the label is laminate but the back side is not and is adhesive to allow you to stick it onto an object.  These are meant to be labels that you stick onto something which is important to keep in mind.  Overall these are very good for a limited set of purposes.  I used them to print a label key for my fuse box.  It looks great and I know it will hold up over the years.  If the price were a little cheaper these would be an excellent product.

These Avery Removable chalkboard labels are a great way to provide an erasable writing surface to small areas.  They remind me of the chalkboard price placards found in stores such as Trader Joes.  These are great for a small business or restaurant to list prices yet be able to change them as the need arises.  The labels themselves are durable and are actually very easy to write on and erase.  The only downside is that they are a bit pricey when compared to ordinary labels or even dollar store chalkboards that are a slightly larger size.  Other than that these are a great purchase.

I have used a variety of inkjet printers over the years, and many have promised to provide reasonable ink costs.  While some models were cheaper to print with than others, they were still much more expensive than laser printers.  This Epson Workforce changes the whole Printer/Ink business model and gives you a relatively high priced printer with extremely low cost ink that lasts as long as a laser toner cartridge but at a much cheaper cost.Personally I think this is a great model for most users since if you print a lot you will easily cover its high price within in a matter of a year or two.  For example, I also have an Epson Workforce 810 which costs me $180 to purchase but costs over $60 dollars to replace all the ink cartridges.  That printer only prints about 400-500 pages before it needs more ink so it would take me 10 cartridge refills (at $60 a set) to reach 4000 pages of printouts that this Epson Workforce printer provides.  I would have spent over $600 in ink alone! just to equal the output of this printer.  What is even better is that the replacement ink for this Epson Printer costs about $13 per bottle (at current Amazon Prices) x 4 colors which is roughly $50 to print another 4000-6000 pages. This makes it even cheaper than most laser Toner Cartridges which cost between $75-$100 and cannot print in color.  If you print a lot this printer will definitely save you money in the long run.Apart from cost, This printer offers very good quality printouts in black and white as well as color.  I also tried a few photo printouts and this did a great job of producing low cost photos. They are not as bright and high quality as a dedicated photo printer and I am not sure how the pictures will hold up over the years but they look great at least in the short term.The major downside to this printer is that it does not offer basic features that should be standard at this price point.  For example the screen is relatively small and low resolution.  The paper tray has a low capacity and sometimes misses the alignment of pages.  The biggest blow is that there is no auto-duplexing (2 sided print) and there are no SD/USB slots.  Despite these shortcomings, this is a very good printer that will save you a lot of money if you print more than a few hundred pages a year.*** Positive Points: ***- Very Low ink costs- Decent quality printouts- Can print decent photos at a very low cost making this cheaper than even Costco or Walmart for printing photos- Relatively small size that can fit on most desks (just beware of the back side paper tray and side mount for the inks)- Relatively easy setup even for the wifi though the ink tank refill process was long*** Negative Points: ***- EXPENSIVE (basically you are paying more for the printer to make up for cheaper inks)- Slower than laser printers that are in this price range; Also slower than some high end inkjet printers- Does not have duplexing (though the more expensive model comes with this)- Paper tray is on the back/top  which will make this difficult to use in tight spaces- Ink refill process is a bit of a hassle though it will only be done once every 1-2 years.- LCD screen is extremely tiny considering the price of this printer

I have short wavy/curly hair that tends to frizz after I have applied shampoo and also when it is humid outside.  I tried this Suave cream and it worked pretty well to keep a decent hold on the areas that I styled while still controlling frizz on the other areas.  It is not too heavy like styling gel yet it offers a decent amount of hold.  The one big downside is that the instructions are  kind of vague and really only tell you about how to use this while creating a pony tail (not very helpful for a male with short hair).  Also worth noting is that the first 2 ingredients listed are water and alcohol. So this may end up stripping your hair of its natural oils.  It worked fine on my hair so far but this may be a concern for some.

How do you review latex gloves?  Well for starters you have to be specific about the intended use.  I use these while cleaning with chemicals that I don't want to come into contact with my skin.  I tried these while cleaning a range/oven with heavy duty oven cleaner.  The gloves were easy to to put on and remove.  These do not have any powder residue nor do they leave your hands feeling wet after use.  I was able to remove and re-use these about 3-4 times before they began to rip.  Other latex gloves I have used in the past only worked for 1-2 uses.  The tear was near the base of the glove so it did not interfere or allow the chemicals to come into contact with my skin.  The sizing was spot on for my large sized hands and it did not feel tight nor loose. Overall these are a great buy for Latex Gloves that will protect your skin at a reasonable price

I got this for my 10 year old son.  The fit was as expected and not bad.  The material used is very lightweight  and did not look like it would withstand much abuse.  On the positive side, the material was light and airy so it is good for summertime use. Overall this is a decent buy for a generic white polo shirt.  If you get this at a cheap enough price (sub $6) it is worth the money.

I have curly/wavy hair and I only occasionally use styling products to style certain areas of my hair.  When I ordered this Axe White Label Style Refresher I thought it would be a great way to get some style back as the day wore on.  I tried it on a Saturday morning without having taken a shower and it really did not improve the look of my hair significantly. My hair did smell great but in terms of actual style this did nothing to improve the look.  I tried this a few more times in the evening after a long day at work and I had the same issue.  While my hair smelled "fresh" the look really did not match.  This may work for other hair styles but for me it did nothing more than give a nice Axe fragrance to my hair

This Nature Valley Toasted Oats Muesli is great tasting and healthy.  I have tried this several ways both on top of yogurt as well as a stand alone with milk or water.  Either way this was a very tasty addition to any diet.  The ingredients are very simple and the only real downside is that it is a bit pricey.  Considering the nuts and fruit that are added it seems reasonable.

I bought these Etekcity Programmable Rmote switches on a whim.  I have a pair of amplified speakers that are connected to a bluetooth audio input but every time I wanted to listen to music I had to turn on each individual speaker since their power switch was on the back of the speaker.  This Etekcity set helped me to simplify my setup.  It was very easy to program and I was able have 2 switches (one for each speaker) controlled by the same button on the remote. All I do is hit one button on the remote and both my speakers as well as my audio source turn on.  My room is fairly large and the speakers are in a semi hidden area yet the control always is able to turn on both speakers with just one press.  What make this remote setup even more handy is that you have 5 recievers that can be controlled individually (by different buttons on the remote) or by the same button.  Everything was easy to program and took less than a few minutes to setup.  I bought this for a slightly cheaper price but even at about $30 dollars this is well worth its price.*** Positive Points: ***- Comes with 5 switches, 2 remotes and even batteries for the remote- Can be set to control each receiver with a separate button or multiple receivers with the same button- Works even without a line of sight which means the remote can control the receiver even when it is hidden or out of site- Everything in the set was fairly good quality*** Negative Points: ***- Remote uses an odd sized battery (it is easy to find but not standard like AA or AAA sized batteries)- Would be even better if remote buttons were backlit

I bought these to use in my range hood.  I previously had 50 watt halogen bulbs but wanted to try something that used less power.  These LE brand dimmable LED bulbs were an excellent replacement.  They were a perfect fit for my range and they work well with the 2 position dimmer.  The light that these give off was brighter than my halogen bulbs yet they only use 6.5 watts (about 1/8th the power consumption of the Halogen bulbs).  The best part is that the light that these bulbs give is a yellowish (not blue) light that is very similar to the original halogen bulbs.  These are an excellent purchase.

My Wife and I both love oats in the morning.  We have tried a variety of products over the years but this Nature Valley oats was amongst the best.  It was fairly easy to cook though it took a bit longer than what we normally prepare.  We tried this in both milk and on yogurt and it was very good.  The price is a bit higher than the typical Quaker oats but it was not so high as to make it seem expensive.  Overall this is a great product for anyone who likes toasted oats.

When my 5 year old daughter first laid eyes on this Learning Journey Play and Learn Shopping Cart she was extremely excited.  She immediately made me open the box and help her build the shopping cart.  The construction was fairly easy and the cart itself seemed very sturdy.  The only real downer was that the included "food" items were a little cheap looking.  Even the boxes seemed a bit flimsy although they were realistic.  This didn't really bother my daughter and she had a blast playing with her shopping cart and groceries.  Considering the relatively low price this is a great toy that most young kids will enjoy.

This Boss Double Plush High Back Executive Chair is a very comfortable and elegant  chair that looks like it is worth much more than its $150 price tag.  The assembly was fairly easy and took about 30 minutes. The instructions  were easy to follow diagrams and all the parts are labelled and even have tags indicating which side they go on.  The only confusing part was that the arms are attached with the included Allen Wrench while all the parts are attached with normal screws requiring a screwdriver.Once the chair was assembled , I immediately noticed that the leather has a nice soft touch feel very much like the interior of a luxury car. Once you sit on the cushion it feels comfortable and  plush with that exotic buttery softness that is characteristic of high quality furniture.  There were a few minor flaws in quality such as a scuff on the bottom piece that holds the wheels and a cheap plastic cover for the gas lift.  Other than these minor issues, this is a very comfortable and elegant looking chair that befits its $150 price.*** Positive Points: ***- Very Comfortable- Easy to assemble- Soft touch leather material- Good packaging that protects the chair*** Negative Points: ***- Some cheap parts such as the cover for the gas lift- Assembly is somewhat unusual in that the included Allen Wrench is only for the arms, the rest of the assembly requires a screwdriver- A few minor quality issues such as a scuffed base where the wheels attach

The first thing you notice about this stapler is that its small.  Compared to other staplers I have used that can handle up to 50 sheets this Rapid S50 is about half the size.  The next big difference is that this is a flat clinch stapler. What does this mean?  Well it staples by folding the ends of the metal together but without curving them inwards.  This leads to a flatter stack (the stapled part of the pages does not fold in).  The problem with this style of stapler is that it does not handle small projects very well.  If you try and staple 2 sheets together it will lead to the metal staples being easy to snag onto other things (even your fingers).  I tried this on a stack of 40 pages and it worked very well and it was easy to remove the staple when I got to work.  The price is a bit high but on par with other heavy duty staplers.

I got this to use on an HP Slatebook which is a 14- inch Android Laptop. This case basically is designed to protect your computer and allows you to use it without taking it out (almost like a shell). The laptop fits perfectly but I found that it sat too low and made it impossible to access the charging port or the USB ports.  Another issue was that it tended to block some of the vents on the bottom which made the laptop run hot.  I really liked the protection that this case offered so I wanted to see if I could make this case work out.  Eventually what I did was to put the case on in reverse so that the corner clips were near my keyboard and the elastic slots were on the screen.  This worked perfectly.  When I open the case the laptop rises about an inch which makes it easy to access all the ports.  It also raises the bottom of the computer up so the vents are no longer blocked.  The only downside to this is that the corners of the screen are slightly covered, not a major issue but sometimes annoying.  Also the case is a bit pricey considering it does not offer any pockets or other "bells and whistles" found in most other cases.

I have used a number of "vinyl protectors" over the years.  The classic stuff was always Armor All which left a nice slick glaze to let you know it was working.  Unfortunately that slick glaze was slippery to the point of being dangerous and it seemed to fade away after just a few weeks.
