I have done bananas, apples, strawberries and even did mangoes and all came out really good!Now I gave this 4 stars because the manual is almost laughable. If they had a manual that you could really understand and was easy to use then this would have been a 5 star product. You basically have to figure out how to use this on your own but once you've got it down you're good to go. There is no assembly needed which is great so that's a plus!I have a lot of counter space in my kitchen but I can say that it takes up as about as much space as a microwave. They trays holds quite a bit of product so this is perfect for families. I have kids who loves dried fruit and we've been having a lot of fun using it thus far. Overall I'd say this is a 4 1/2 star dehydrator and totally recommend getting it even at this price.

Over the course of having several children, I have become pickier and pickier about my car seats. The Maxi-Cosi Vello 65 Convertible Car Seat meets several of my car seat standards. The first thing I loved about the car seat was when I took it out of the box, it had some weight to it. Thatâ€™s always a positive in my book. I donâ€™t want to stick my child in a flimsy, light weight car seat. The total weight of this car seat is 23 pounds.I loved the color of the car seat. The one we received was black. If you touch the material on the car seat itâ€™s very soft, almost like a cozy blanket.Here are a few of the best features of the car seat.·  The headrest is super easy to adjust, which I love. I can pull the red tab up or down to make it fit my child the way it needs to.Â·  The straps are super easy to move up and down.Â·  The straps tighten and loosen with the pull of a strap or push of a button.Â·  The car seat also goes from 9 pounds all the way to 64 pounds.There arenâ€™t many cons to this car seat, but I did see a few.Â·  Itâ€™s not super easy to install. I struggled to make it extremely tight in our vehicle. I feel like itâ€™s a little complicated for a parent to install. I actually plan on taking mine to the fire station to make sure itâ€™s properly installed.Â·  I did not like how the buckle has to be adjusted at the bottom (where their bottom sits). You have to take it out of the slot to adjust it. Not really ideal.Overall this is an excellent car seat. Comfortable, safety tested, stylish, and can last an incredibly long time. Also, itâ€™s forward facing and rear facing, which is always a plus in my book.

Got this for my husband who is really picky about his fragrance. He loves Polo Blue by Ralph Lauren for Men, Eau De Toilette Natural Spray and is really unwilling to try anything else. With his birthday coming up I figured I'd get him something that he can change up and it was a hit. He loves the light not overpowering scent and so do I. It's great for both day and night. If the man in your life like the stronger stuff then you might want to get something different. This is definitely not your Axe deodorant spray but for a real man's man.

I love the Invicta brand and own two of their female version. With hubby's birthday coming up I decided to get him this one. It comes in a big bright yellow package (reminds me of Big Bird) and for a moment I thought, why this cheap packaging. However on the inside is a nicer package with your watch enfolded in it. The watch is heavy, not your regular cheap $20 watch but $595 is a bit of a stretch because personally I don't think this watch is worth maybe more than $200, but who am I to judge, I'm no watch maker. It's a beautiful watch and it looks just like the photo on Amazon. Haven't had a chance to test out the water resistant function but my old Invictas have held up so I'm sure this one will too.My husband is a big guy, 6' 5" and 220lbs and with big wrists. If you're a female with small wrists I would say skip this. This watch was made for big hands. It looks beautiful on his wrist and he loves it. I would definitely buy this and gift it for Christmas or birthdays. You wouldn't be disappointed and neither would the receiver.

First I have to say that I was fairly surprised when the box showed up. I was expecting a HUGE box but what we got was a fairly small box and I wasn't sure if this big carpet cleaner could fit in there. Well it did. It easily fitted together once taken out of the box and they even included a sample cleaner for you to get started with. I personally use Resolve but the cleaner worked well.Now I have pets, a dog and a cat and we're still house training our dog so I was really excited to give it a try and boy did it work. I usually pay to have my carpets cleaned but with this I won't have to anymore. I do have to say that it is fairly heavy but it does the job! My family room is fairly large and I didn't have to unplug and replug as often as I would have with my old carpet cleaner. This included a very lengthy cord that can do big rooms in a breeze.Now after cleaning my carpets I have to say that this carpet cleaner by Bissell is definitely worth the money.

I have to say that this compact baby swing is just that, compact. Not like the big ones that you usually see. Assembly is also pretty simple and straight forward. I like the fact that its  a 2 in 1, both a glider and a bouncer so you're generally saving yourself a bit of money. The glider according to Graco is for babies up to 30lbs and the bouncer for babies up to 20lbs. It does come with a newborn baby support insert so it's great for your newborns and you'll be able to give mom a break while baby gently glides or bounces so you can get things done around the house. It's not loud and obnoxious but the toys could have been a bit prettier in my opinion.Another feature that I've been loving since they've introduced it is the battery/AC option. Now you can take this to any room in the house as long as you have an outlet there and if you don't then you have the option of using a battery. The seats are plush and nice so I know your little one would be comfortable in it.Now I gave this 4 stars because there were a few things I didn't like. For 1, the toys don't do much. They just sit there so they're basically useless. The swing itself doesn't seem to swing very well the heavier the baby is but I guess that's to be expected but even at just 15lbs, it was a hit or miss. The colors could have been a little bit more vibrant but I guess this is perfect for just all boys. Still....

OK so I might be a bit prejudiced but I've always been a fan of Turtle Beach and it's what I own and use with all my gaming systems. Now I like giving others a try and having boys who destroy headsets I personally don't buy Turtle Beach for them but get them cheaper versions. This I got for my 14yr old who games more than he reads.I decided to test this headset out for myself while doing the Gears of War beta. Now if you're a big fan of FPS then you know why games prefer the Turtle Beach headsets. With a TB you feel like you're right there in the game. Sounds is amazing and you can't beat that. These on the other hand, the sound wasn't spectacular but at this price I wasn't really expecting them to be. The set up was easy enough and I was able to wear them for about an hour before they started to feel irritating around my ears. TBH that's a problem I have with most headsets anyway because of the bulkiness. They do feel comfortable once you put them on and the padding is enough to not make my ear hurt on instant contact.Now I did have a bit of problem with the mic. It seems like I had to shout a little louder for my teammates to hear me. Not something I want to be doing in the middle of the night. I seem to be hearing them ok but they couldn't hear me well. Besides that small issue these would have been a great headset. Maybe they could get that sorted out.Now if you have kids and don't want to spend the money for a Turtle Beach then this is a safe bet.

Before I got this I owned the Yale Security YRD240-NR-619 which is the keyless touchscreen version and I loved it. I've had no issues with it but my home currently has 3 entry ways and I wanted something that I felt would keep me safe. When given the chance to test this one out I jumped at it because I was actually looking into getting one on my own. I loved my first Yale and wanted to keep my love going. This one isn't touchscreen but great for the entry way I was going to use it for.One thing I should mention is that installation and set up for these are actually pretty easy. You would think that since it seems so complicated it would be but they're not. I was able to install mine in less than 10 minutes. One of the feature that I just love is the illuminated keypad. While it's not a glowing light, it's bright enough for you to see without having to peer really closely. Perfect for those late nights from the club when you're not quite yourself.It does come with 4 batteries already included (thank you Yale) and from using my other one I would say that battery life is long lasting. So far I've had no issues with my old one batteries going low and I've had it for quite some time now. So far I have programmed it with 3 codes. One for me, one for my kids and another for my mother-in-law who's visiting. Once she leaves that code will be deleted. It's another safety feature that I love about these locks. Set the code for maintenance crew coming in to your home etc, and delete once they leave. Better than leaving a key laying out that they can copy.If you're big on home security and don't want to invest in a home security system, this is by far one of the better locks that you can buy. Thieves would have a hard time trying to break in and you'll feel secure knowing that you can change codes as often as you want. No more need to change locks and get new keys. I couldn't be happier!

This is your very basic musical mobile. For the price it isn't bad. It's pretty easy to install on your crib and love the fact that the toys are removable. However in this day and age it's the norm for parents to want something such as a remote. You know, you don't want to actually go in the room and put the mobile on if you can avoid waking up baby. This unfortunately is not the case. The music plays for about 20 minutes so when it ends you have to go and turn it back on. Volume is either low/high but not too loud to be annoying. If you're doing the entire collection then I would say get it or I'd pass.

I recently got this to replace an HTC that was broken on the Cricket network. I was at first amazed at the price and the fact that it doesn't really say much about the phone in the description. Set up was super easy once we got it and we were pleasantly surprised at the cameras. While it's not as great as my Galaxy S6, it's still a great camera. As a matter of fact the front facing camera actually took better photos than my Galaxy S6. There's not a lot of apps downloaded on the phone but you can always delete what you don't want.It came with some really nice headsets and it has an FM radio to boot. Not much phones come with FM radios these days. My last one was a Nokia many years ago. The only con and I'm sure there might be a way to do is, is the talk to text feature that I just love on my Galaxy. I couldn't figure out for the life of me how to get it, or maybe it's just non-existent.The battery life seems to work as any typical phone. While I don't talk much I do spend a lot of time surfing the web and texting and so far I've been able to go for about 8hrs with still about 40% of battery life left. For an unlocked phone this is a great price and I wouldn't hesitate to get another if needed. This may be cheap but it certainly doesn't look or feel that way.

I recently purchased one of the Classic Doodle with Stamps for my pre-schooler and it was a total waste of money. It lasted about 1 week before the erase board was totally unusable if that long. When you spend money on a toy you want that toy to last for as long as it can and 1 week doesn't cut it for me. I threw it in the trash and we decided to just practice using crayon/pencil/pen and paper. When I saw this one from VTech I decided to give it another try. After all this one had a carrying handle and can be taken on our road trips which we just love to take. All pieces were intact and it does come with 2AA trial batteries. I decided to leave the batteries in because they worked. If you have a pre-schooler you know how tough they can be on toys. So far she had written so roughly on the pad that it leaves the indentation on it but I was still able to erase it and it looks so much better than the Classic Doodle.The stamps are an added touch and she has been happily stamping away to her contentment. I love the fact that the pen is attached and also the voice is clear enough for her to follow the instructions. She has been having a blast and this is now one of her go to toy. Now I didn't give it 5 stars because the writing pad is slowly losing it's life. I just wish there was a way for toy makers to make this last a little longer, at least it lasted more than a week!

If you have the Woodland Friends line then I would suggest getting this to complete your collection. If you don't then I would say give this one a skip. While it is easy to set up, all you need is a Philips screwdriver and a D battery, you may want to rethink if you have a baby older than say 3 months old. This is perfect for newborns with a very light vibration and the toys are bright enough for your baby to look at. Reaching them on the other hand may not be an easy feat. The cover is removable so it's hygienic, after all you don't want your baby sitting in a dirty seat.If you're looking for music then there is none, just vibrations. This is very basic and I think you can do a lot better for the price.

If you have a baby/toddler still in diapers and you're looking for a great diaper pail, I think this is the one that you should be thinking of getting. While most diaper pails are made of plastic, I love the fact that this one is made of steel which means that it will last a lot longer than usual. I've noticed that it does keep the smell in but beware once you open it, you will surely smell it. That's expected of course though since after all it's meant to keep the smell in. I love the toddler safety lock which is great for those who have kids who love to open things. Another of the plus is that you don't need any special bags. Unlike those where you have to buy replacement bags which ends up costing you an arm and a leg this one doesn't. Setting it up was pretty easy and emptying was also pretty easy too. You'll definitely love this.

I had to return these twice as they fit rather small and then when I reordered I went up 2 sizes and it fit too big. I finally ordered one size up and it finally fit just right, well kinda. I've always been a big fan of Dr. Martens and my oldest daughter own a few pairs so when I saw the toddler version I just had to pick them up for my 3 year old. She loves them and couldn't wait to put them on. So far we've had no issues with the fit and wear and she's worn them for a few hours very comfortably. Would I recommend them? I sure would but be sure to go up a size.

My daughter recently got decided that Monster High was the next best thing so when I got the chance to give this a try we couldn't say no. This is big and it however does come in a box that you can wrap so have no fear that the receiver will see what's inside. Although it's recommended for ages 6-12 it can be used for those a little younger with supervision. This is 3 stories tall so there is lots to do and your little one will have fun playing for quite a few hours. Just let her imagination take flight. With movable parts it is truly a lot of fun.It did take a little time to put together because the parts although labeled was a little confusing. Besides that it will surely make a great toy for all your Monster High fans. Perfect for birthdays and christmas.

I love Fisher Price Swings and would probably not get any other when shopping for baby gifts etc. This however is one that I might pass on if shopping. While this is easy to set up as most FP swings are and is considered deluxe, it's not quite as plush as most of their other deluxe swings. I love the plush comfort and this certainly isn't. It is however removable and machine washable so makes it easy to clean. It does come with 2 different swinging motions (front to back & side by side) and even with the smart swing technology that gives you 6 different swing speeds, I noticed that the baby who weighed about 15lbs, didn't swing quite as well as in an older FP swing we had. It comes with 16 songs but the sound wasn't that great either. The owls overhead is a cute factor but doesn't do anything, your baby just looks at them but I did love that their is a mirror overhead since babies love looking at themselves. Another thing I loved was the tray that included beads that will give older babies something to play with. It has 2 power option, battery and AC Outlet so you can save money on batteries if you prefer which I do.Bottom line, while I love the bright colors, I personally wouldn't pay this much for the Woodland Friends swing. Not as soft and plush and the swing technology didn't perform as well as the more expensive models. I give this one 3 1/2 stars.

Even though I have boys my daughter is as big a Thomas fan as any of them, maybe even bigger. When given the chance to get this to review she couldn't wait to open the box, and boy what a big box it was. It is HUGE! Since this comes in it's own packaging it might be a bit difficult to conceal if you're buying as a gift. As soon as she saw it she made her dad open and put it together. Set up wasn't too difficult but since we have carpeted floors it wasn't too much fun at first. I bought a play mat and placed it on there and boy what fun she had. I love the fact that this doesn't come with motorized trains so it makes it a lot more fun for her pushing the trains around the tracks. Going under the bridges and even rolling up to the station. It comes with quite a bit of parts for imaginative play and I would definitely recommend this for Thomas & Friends enthusiasts ages 3+.

I'm usually a fan of Amazon jewelry but this one is a definite pass. Personally I would not pay close to $100 for this, maybe $40/$50 max. It's 10k and truly looks better online than it does in person. See all the fancy gift boxes that Amazon shows you? First it does not come in anything quite so fancy but a regular plain blue box and the earrings in a little ziploc bag. Not gifting quality at all. The earrings are pretty light but I don't like anything weighing me down so that's a plus. They are pretty sturdy but the hooks are flimsy and really sharp going in your ears, so be careful putting them in. While I personally wouldn't give these to an adult my teenage daughter seemed to like them and they're a better fit for the younger kids. Maybe as a graduation gift perhaps.I give these about a 3 1/2 stars not quite 4 because of the packaging, size and the overall quality of these. As I stated, I wouldn't pay over $50 for them.

If youâ€™ve ever put a baby item together and were annoyed with the process, youâ€™ll love this basic kidâ€™s toy. Literally 4 snaps and youâ€™re done putting it together. Would I pay $25 for this toy? Probably not. The quality of the item is good, but still feels like itâ€™s cheaply made. Thereâ€™s nothing incredibly special about this toy that would warrant such an expensive price. The toy is lightweight and easy to move around. The batteries do not come with the toy.The activities on the Fisher-Price Animal Friends Learning Table are pretty age appropriate. Iâ€™d worry that a child would become bored with it pretty quickly though. Overall, a good toy, but the price is a little too much for something so basic. If youâ€™re looking for a basic learning toy thatâ€™s easy to put together, this is what you want!

I've tried a few of the other MINOR'S products before and loved them and this one is no exception. I love the fact that their sauces are all ready to and easy to use and while this boasts of a spicy sauce I have to admit that it's really not. It's why I took off the one star. Besides that it is pretty good. I'm surprised that they said that there was a hint of chili pepper because I personally couldn't taste it. You'd have to add a bit more peppers if you're looking for a spicier taste. I was able to make a bit of Thai-style curry chicken and I have to say that it came out pretty good. These sauces are actually turning me into a better cook. It's like I have a chef in the kitchen. I love that it doesn't contain that high fructose corn syrup and the ingredients are all ones that I know about. Would I recommend it? I sure would!

This bouncer might be smaller in size, but thatâ€™s what makes it perfect for our family. With several people living in a tiny space, itâ€™s nice when a baby item doesnâ€™t take up the whole house. I also love that it doesnâ€™t cost an arm and a leg to run the bouncer. A lot of baby products take at least four D or C batteries but not this one. It only requires 1 D battery!The box it came in was so lightweight that I knew the item itself wasnâ€™t going wasnâ€™t going to be big or bulky. It was simple to put together and didnâ€™t take much time. The design of the bouncer is also nice. I can see it being used for a boy or a girl.The baby sat quite comfortably in it and was supported by the design of the bouncer. I would recommend this bouncer over a traditional bouncer. Easy to put together and even easier to use!

There are a lot of places where you can get cloud storage for free or cheap, which is great and has its uses, but there are also a lot of reasons for having a local backup and storage solution. If you have a data cap or a slow connection, nothing beats a portable hard drive. If you are an Apple user, the My Passport for Mac is a great solution.The 1 TB version is around $60-70 and comes preformatted to work on Macs and is plug and play storage for Time Machine. It supports the latest USB 3.0 standard for fast transfers of up to 5 GB/s and lets you set up password protection for solid security if your drive is ever lost or stolen. Data is encrypted with a hardware based, 256-bit encryption solution that is very secure if a proper password is used.If you arenâ€™t a Mac user, have no fear because itâ€™s easy enough to plug the drive in and reformat it for Windows with just a few clicks of the mouse. All the same security and convenience features are available with the included software package.As is typical with Western Digital products, you get a solid feeling, well made and attractive piece of hardware available in several colors. The My Passport has a compact footprint of a little over 3 ¼â€ by 4 Â¼â€ by Â¾â€ thick. In addition, itâ€™s backed by a three year limited warranty and can also be set up to use cloud storage as a backup to your backup for a basically unbeatable layer of redundancy.

If you love creamer in your coffee you're going to love this. My only wish is that it lasted a bit longer once it's opened. This is also a little bit sweeter than the original that you can keep in your fridge. I have this right next to my Keurig and K-Cups and it doesn't take up much room at all. I have noticed though that my pump tends to kind of clog so I decided to just pour in just what I think I need. Even though I like this I still think I'll stick with the ones I can keep in my refrigerator because I feel a bit better having it stored there. This is great for restaurants etc but if you drink a LOT of coffee at home this will be great for you too.

I have been using Dreft for YEARS and it's the one detergent that I always recommend to any of my friends who's having a baby. I have very sensitive skin and so does my kids so I have to be careful with my detergent. When my toddler was a newborn, Dreft was the only detergent I used. While I still use Dreft, I recently found the Stage 2 and loved it. Having a toddler who can dirty clothes like there's no tomorrow, I needed something that would be safe and gentle and still take stains out. This is all of that and more. I can wash her clothes in both cold and hot water and it still comes out smelling great and clean. I only wished they had come out with this a long time ago.

I'm a huge fan of asian cuisine and I've tried replicating it myself with just soy and a few extra stuff but it never tastes the same. This is as close as I got to what I love. I was able to make a chicken stir fry and the family thought for some reason that I had ordered out and it wasn't my masterpiece. You don't even need to really add anything else with this sauce well except your ingredients, peppers, onions etc. It's not too salty, not too sweet and has a nice mellow taste which I'm sure your family would enjoy as well.I am really loving these Minor's Sauces and I can't wait to give a few more a try. This sure makes life easier in the kitchen and is making me a better cook.

When you have a newborn, you will do anything to protect them. Theyâ€™re so fragile and everything is about them. The Britax B-Safe 35 Elite Infant Car Seat is one of those car seats that you want on your side. Everything about is screams safety. They didnâ€™t just slap something together to try and sell it, they carefully put every detail in to ensure your baby is comfortable and safe.It was a very simple installation and also every easy to do. One thing I hate about infant car seats is that they tend to take up a lot of room and that's pretty standard with this one. I love the click and go feature that allows you to connect it to a Britax stroller but I don't own one at this time but it's good to know that it can be used.I have to admit that the easily adjustable straps are also a nice perk of the carseat. I love the no-rethread harness which makes it super easy to adjust and keep your little one secure in his/her seat. The frame is incredibly sturdy and thatâ€™s what matters when it comes time to utilize the carseat. I also love that this carseat goes up to 35 pounds. So many people switch their babies over too soon because the weight on a normal infant carseat can only hold 22 pounds.Britax B-Safe 35 Elite Infant Car Seat puts safety and quality first but also manages to create this insanely stylish carseat, which amazes me. I wish I had this confidence in the carseats I used for my other babies. btw this car seat is also certified for aircraft travel.

I got this for my cell phone and it has worked miracles for me. I noticed that my memory was getting depleted and I needed something that would be easy to use in order to transfer my photos. The transfer was pretty fast and for the price it's a pretty good deal. While I've always been a fan of Sandisk, I'm now a fan of PNY. It's pretty fast and reliable and so far I've had no problems with it. It was pretty easy to use and even for someone like me who sometimes have no idea what they're doing this was simple. I'd certainly recommend this for those wanting a memory boost in their cell phones.

I love cooking and trying out sauces. I especially love ordering Orange Chicken whenever I order asian food. I read all the positive reviews before I ordered this and I also read the negative reviews as well. After all I didn't want to try something that might not be any good at all. I was pleasantly surprised at the taste. I decided to give it a try and I'm happy that I did. It has a sweetish taste but not quite orange, it does state that it contains ginger and a few other ingredients and while I don't taste the zest of the ginger, it did however make my chicken taste good. The kids loved it and I plan on buying another bottle when mine runs out.

I just bought a house and the one thing that was highly recommended and one that I would recommend to anyone getting a new home, or even a rental, is to get a new lock. Since this is my home which includes children I wanted a lock that would keep us safe. We have a security system and I live in a cul-de-sac in a very safe community but you can never be too safe. When you have kids one thing that you worry about as well is the fact that they're going to lose their keys and someone is going to find it. So when I discovered this Yale Security lock I just had to have it.Installation was a breeze and took me about 20 minutes. It comes with 4AA batteries but I also love the fact that it uses a 9V battery back up in the case of anything remotely happening. I can't say how long the AA batteries will last because I haven't had it that long but so far so good.One the features that really sold me on this is the fact that I can give each child a separate code, so my 10yr old who is autistic was able to choose a code that he would remember fairly easily. I can also give the babysitter or the dogsitter a separate code just for the night. No need to pass out keys because there isn't any so I don't have to worry about someone making a copy of my house keys. That was what really sold me on this. It has been easy to use and we just love it and now wonder why we never thought of getting one before. I now recommend it to everyone.

Since this starts in July I haven't used it yet but I have taken a look at it and I just love what I see. As a blogger I work with quite a few companies and I have to know when to schedule out their reviews. Normally the planners I've owned are great from Monday - Friday but the weekends are usually so small that I can barely write in them. This has ample space for every single day which I love. The planner itself is of great quality, while it has the look and feel of leather, it isn't but that's just how nicely made it is. There are tabs for each month making it easy to find the month that you're looking for without having to flip through pages. Overall I think this is a great planner for bloggers and even those who like to plan out their days/weeks. I highly recommend getting this and it's reasonably priced too.

I've had a few Manhattan Toy dolls but this is by far one of my favorite. We just moved into a new house and of course my toddler refused to sleep in her own bed because she was now in a strange room. Although all her old furniture is in the room she decided that the best place to sleep was in my bed. When we received the Baby Stella Sweet Dreams I decided to introduce it to her as a way to transition to her new room. The soothing lavender scent isn't overpowering and actually smells pretty good. The fact that the doll is soft all over makes it the perfect bedtime toy. No hard heads or limbs to bump into in the middle of the night. She loved taking the clothes off and trying to put them on by herself. Great learning doll as well and if you have a baby in the family, it's great to teach your little one how to hold the doll and feed it properly, instead of giving them their baby brother or sister. The magnets gives it a nice touch.So why did I give it 4 stars? Well since the smell is released by hugs, if you have a child who loves hugging after a while the scent will become too much. It is also pretty pricey for a doll, maybe wait for a price drop.

Don't let the price fool you, this is a really great piece of jewelry. The size of the pendant is about the size of a nickel and the diamonds of course are almost invisible but still this makes a great graduation gift for your teenage daughter. If they're fans of silver it could quite possibly be their very first "diamond" piece. It comes packaged in pretty box that is perfect for gifting. It's a great value at the current price under $50 but I probably won't pay the retail value for this.

Received this and placed this in my guest bathroom. It's a beautiful lace design but you'll need a liner of course. I love the fact that it is machine washable because being white you know that it will show up dirt rather quickly. However I'm not so sure how much it will hold up in the wash since the quality isn't that great in my opinion. It is rather pretty thin which means of course that it is totally see through. Perfect if you don't get a lot of light into your bathroom. I still can't give this 5 stars but the price is rather reasonable.

I live in a ranch style home with a walk out basement. I with Comcast and pay for their Extreme Internet package which is supposed to give me 150Mbps download. With our router and modem connected downstairs sometimes those upstairs weren't able to connect and we would still have dropped connection. We currently have the Motorola SurfBoard SB6141 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem connected to this router and so far we haven't had any problems.As far as the set up process, it took me quite a few hours to get it set up even with their guide. I wish that Linksys would make their set up a lot easier. I've never had a problem setting up my Netgear router and I hope Linksys would get with the program. Plug and Play is definitely the way to go.I have to state that we usually have 3 computers on at any one time along with 2 smart TV's possibly watching Netflix or Hulu, along with 3 Xbox One's and a PS4. At any given time they may all be in use and so far I have actually seen an improvement in my connection. I'm finally getting what I paid for from my cable company.As far as the price, its on par with what new technology cost these days. I expect it to drop in a few months. This would have been a 5 star product for me if the set up wasn't so difficult. Great connection and so far no down time. If that ever changes I'll be sure to update.

We recently got a Siberian Husky and I wanted the best for him. Before him we had a Shih-Tzu that we had since he was 8 weeks old. A few months ago my toddler opened the front door and he got out in the yard. By the time I realized he was outside, he was gone, someone stole him. We decided that we would get another to fill the void of losing our beloved Gizmo so got Shadow. His owner stated that he was being fed Pedigree Puppy. I've never used Pedigree dog food but decided to take a look at the ingredients and wasn't happy. If you're a pet owner you know that you have to mix their food until he gets used to the new food. I initially bought Blue Wilderness because that's what we were feeding our Shih-Tzu but after hearing the debacle with Blue about where they were getting their ingredients etc, I decided to switch to Wellness CORE and I have no regrets. Not only is it cheaper but it's also a pretty darn good puppy food and the ingredients are just as good. He was able to tolerate the switch pretty well and I'm hoping this is the last switch we will have to make until he weans off puppy food.

I needed something for my toddler daughter for special occasion and I've always been a fan of Pink Sugar in my younger years. Now that I'm older (almost 40) my taste have matured. I use this whenever we go to church etc and the fragrance last a very long time. I don't spray it directly on my skin but on her clothing before she puts in on and everyone says how sweet she looks and smells. The price is really good compared to what you pay at Sephora and I've read reviews stating that this is fake. I got mine directly from Amazon and it does have a little lighter scent that what I knew before but it still lasts a long time. I'm thinking the manufacturer might just be making it differently. I still recommend this for the teens and young adults in your life. For the older crowd you might consider getting Prada Candy, it's a bit pricey but totally worth it.

I've been a fan of Livie and Luca for quite some time and not only are they well made but they are comfortable too. I bought these for my toddler as she has wide feet and this brand has always been one that accommodated that. She wears a size 9 1/2 so I got her the size 10 and she wears them with socks and so far we've had no issues. She runs around in them and has worn them for a few hours at a time. I originally bought the mocha but loved it so much also got the grape. We love the fact that she can put it on by herself since the laces are really more for decoration purpose since it has a side zipper. It has a cushioned footbed and the bottom has added traction making it great for her to jump, skip, run and hop, you name it she can do it and do it well in these.

I have kids so what that means is that I usually have a dirty vehicle filled with sand from the park, left over food, you name it, it's in my car. I usually take my car to the car wash to get it cleaned and then every once in a while I take it to get a thorough cleaning if I can't do it myself. This little vac has saved me quite a bit of money so far. While it doesn't leave my vehicle looking like it just got detailed it comes really close. I was able to vacuum the sand and grime from my minivan and when I picked up my son from school he asked, did you get your car cleaned today. I said "Yup I sure did,  and I did it myself". My daughter uses it on her VW Beetle Convertible and now she refuses to take her car in as well.This little vac has great suction power and the filter that's included helps keep the dust down. I've so far only used 2 of the extensions, the slim one (the crevice tool) which gets ever nook and cranny and the brush which I use when vacuuming.It was super easy to put together and so far we've only used it as a dry vac. Not sure if we will ever need to use it as a wet vac but I'm sure it will do well in that area as well.

I really liked the look of this and so did my daughter who is presently in college. She's studying mass comm but is into fashion and hoping to work with fashion magazines when she graduates. So naturally she was drawn to this High Heel Stapler. Should have named it "High Hell Stapler" because it was hell to get it to staple a few pieces of paper together. First of all beware, it does not comes with staples (not even a starter pack like most staplers) so you'll have to buy the special one that they say you need. Then when you do buy them it's going to be hell to get it to work. This is more of a novelty item that you want to show off on your desk. If you want something that truly works buy something else.

I purchased this for my oldest daughter for her birthday. If this wasn't a specific requested birthday gift I personally would have returned it. It is really small and I think it really looks better on young adults and teens than on adults. According to my daughter it does hold quite a bit of her necessities which in her case is a wallet, phone and a few makeup (lip gloss, mascara). The leather is well done and it seems like it will last a long time. We got it in white and so far she has been able to keep it clean. It is pretty pricey so you may want to wait for a price drop.

My daughter still uses wipes and I always keep a pack in every bag that I take with me. There is even a pack in my minivan. I was using Pampers Sensitive because we both have very sensitive skin and Pampers have been the only brand that has worked. Well until now. These are just the right size for portable use and while it does say that they're unscented, they do have a slight scent but nothing unbearable.I love the fact that they are alcohol free and contain no phthalates or parabens. They are great for babies and great for toddlers and even adults too. They do come with a warning to avoid contact with eyes but I've still used them to wipe her dirty face after eating and have had no problems. They are not as thick as they claim but I didn't mind. They do the job they are meant to do.I do however wish they were flushable making them more "eco" as they claim to be, instead they'll be filling up your landfill so I could took off a star for that and the fact that they are a little expensive as well but they are totally worth the price.

While I love OtterBox I couldn't give this in all honesty 5 stars. First of all it was a pain to put on. I mean I actually struggled a bit to install it unlike their other cases that are super easy. It does make your iPhone a bit heavier but that's to be expected, after all this is a whole other battery that's being added to your iPhone. Otterbox claims that this extends your battery life but I couldn't see it personally. It doesn't take long to charge but to me it seems like it drained just as easily and maybe even easier than the original iPhone itself. The biggest issue I had is that there is no screen protection on this at all. You'll have to buy a screen protector for your iPhone. Kinda defeats the purpose of having major protection doesn't it? Not a big fan of this one at all.

I have a Himalayan who isn't particularly picky. I'm saying she would eat our dog's food if you aren't watching. I've used Wellness Complete Natural before and while she loved it she wasn't that big of a fan so I switched her to Merrick Before Grain which she loves. The first ingredient is chicken and she's a big fan of meat. When offered to review the Wellness TruFood I decided to give it a try. After all it had wholesome ingredients and I always look at the ingredients before buying food for my pets, after all they're family. My Siberian Husky is currently using Wellness Core Puppy Food (currently transitioning from Blue Wilderness Puppy after hearing the complaints about Blue) and he loves it too. There are no by-meat products and we love that chicken is the first ingredient in both of their foods.The first time I offered her this food she basically ran through the food in less than 5 minutes and was still licking her tongue. She knows the sound of the bag being opened and I have caught her trying to claw her way into it to get it open herself. I've seen reviews about picky eaters not liking this food but my cat is totally the opposite. If your cat isn't too picky he/she might like it as much as mine does. This is a great food for indoor cats and so far no complaints on my end or hers either.

I was really excited to get this, after all I had just bought a new house and wanted a few decor for my outdoor garden/patio. What a disappointment this was. I thought maybe it might have been a fluke but after seeing another reviewer also received the same thing I can see that it's not. According to my 3 year old when I opened the package "that's a very ugly fish". No where on this fish is the bright yellow depicted in the photo on Amazon. Instead is this rather ugly brown fish with spots. The only bright thing about this is the blue eyes. I took photos in different lighting outdoors so you can see exactly what you are getting. For those who like this color this might be good for you but I'm giving it 2 stars for deceiving me in thinking I was getting something totally different than what I received.It however is a good enough size and seems well made and as I said, if you're looking for something like this color then it'll be perfect for you. If you're looking for something bright like the photo, keep looking.

I love Jolly Rancher Hard Candy and while this is only one flavor it's one that actually taste pretty good. I don't do much candy in my household but I do keep them in my car to distract my kids whenever we're going on long trips. I've never had anyone say that candy doesn't taste good and these obviously have been a hit with them. They've actually been trying to find my hiding spot so they can get them without me knowing. They are going to last quite some time and would be perfect to hand out on Halloween especially since they're individually wrapped. I do however wish they came with different flavors but this one isn't too bad at all.

Having raised 4 kids I know a thing or two about diapers and while I'm not really a huge fan of Huggies I decided to give this one a try. My friend is currently staying with me and has a baby so better to try these on. I recently got a chance to try the Huggies Snug and Dry Diapers and I have to say that I love the value and quality. Sometimes Iâ€™m hesitant to try the new â€œimprovementsâ€ that any brand makes, but I do think the Huggies Snug and Dry Diapers improvements were for the better.I donâ€™t like bulky diapers and while some may seem to think the bulkier the better, that's not always true. Iâ€™m pleased with the quality of these diapers and would recommend them to anyone.

My hair gets the weirdest award for not being curly or straight. I was excited to try this hot brush/ceramic flat iron because I like to wear my hair both ways. I turned up the temperature as high as it would go because I wanted to ensure my hair actually did what I wanted it to do. It did take a while to heat up, which is a bummer if youâ€™re in a hurry.Within a few minutes my hair was as straight as a board. Keep in mind I have thick hair, so the ceramic flat iron works great on hair of my thickness. The hot brush part of the styler is not ideal for making cute little singlet curls. Instead, itâ€™s ideal for curling your hair under or out.Comparing the price against products just like it, the InStyler Ionic Styler Pro Ionic Hot Brush and Ceramic Flat Iron is an investment. Itâ€™s not poorly made and is made of high quality materials, which makes it well worth the buy.Iâ€™m giving it 4 stars because I wish the brush part was as awesome as the hot iron part.

My son is 4 and in 4T. Heâ€™s been potty trained for almost 2 years but cannot seem to get the night time potty training thing down. I recently tried the Pull-Ups Training Pants Night Time for Boys to see if it would help his nighttime routine a little more and it has.I think heâ€™s tired at night and doesnâ€™t always understand whatâ€™s going on when heâ€™s sleepy. The Pull-Ups Training Pants Night Time for Boys makes it really easy for him to maneuver his pants and pull up at night. I also love the quick open sides because it doesnâ€™t need to feel like a diaper. These pull ups are what make him feel like a big boy!The characters are fun and my son loves the glow in the dark features. We use these for night time but I imagine they are great for potty training any time of the day.

With the new MacBook Pro I wanted a way for me to be able to store my files easily. Set up with this was actually seamless as they made it out to be and when I finally was able to set it up I couldn't upload anything. I'm not sure how much easier this would be on a Windows computer but it's listed as it works for both Windows and IOS users. Unfortunately Mac users may have a bit of issues with this. Everything you need to set it up comes included though so I guess that's a plus but not enough for me to give even 3 stars. Since I wasn't able to get this to actually work I have to give it 2 stars.

Are you looking for an awesome gift to give a new mom? This is one of the coolest baby â€œgiftsâ€ that they would ever receive. I loved the package the Huggies Little Snugglers Diapers came in, the box was adorable! I also love that it can be reused in the nursery.The best part is when you open the package and there you have both your newborn diapers and size one diapers. Although they say that packaging may vary, I was happy with what is in the package. The gift receiver is also going to love the little baby wipes holder that came with their package, itâ€™s very lightweight and super stylish.I think this is a five star product all of the way because of the top quality product that Huggies offers, plus the cute packaging, and nice variety of products in the box.

If you are breastfeeding, you need some sort of manual pump to help pump and store breastmilkâ€”this is it. There are times when you may not have access to an electric pump and need to pump milk and the Philips AVENT SCF330/20 Comfort Manual Breast Pump works wonders. It's also super portable so great for those who work. Fits easily into your bag for you to take to whatever room you may take it to if you need to pump. It is light and very convenient.The flange is very soft and comfortable, even for bigger breasted women. The handle makes it super easy to pump milk and the cap and nipple make storage and/or bottle feeding streamlined. I also love that it goes with Avent bottles because thatâ€™s what we use to feed our little ones.The only reason Iâ€™m giving this four stars is because the price is a bit up there for the quality of the product. This is a single manual breast pump and isnâ€™t always the fastest at pumping. However, I think itâ€™s a great option to have on hand for any breastfeeding mother.

I haven't always been a fan of Huggies  but I can say that I love these Pull-Ups. The cooling feature has been working great on my toddler. She hasn't really been wanting to use the potty and it's been a struggle. She's not consistent. One minute she wants to use the potty, the next she couldn't be bothered. Since using these she has been wanting to use the potty a lot more. I think it's the cooling feature. Whenever she goes she doesn't like feeling the coolness on her bum so she wants to keep it dry. While these would be fine for daytime use, I would prefer her not to sleep in them so I don't use them for sleeping. Kids go in their diapers when they're asleep and feeling cool all night long isn't something that I want her to feel, especially since she's such a heavy sleeper.I love the fact that the front and back are easily to see with these and she just love the Disney characters on these as well. So while they're great for daytime use I'll look for something else for night time, unless of course you're training your toddler to wake up and use the potty at night. We're just not quite there yet.

Having the right set of bottles for a newborn baby is extremely important. The Philips AVENT Classic Plus Newborn Starter Set comes with several different sizes of bottles, which makes caring and feeding a newborn extremely easy on the parents. Obviously the smaller bottles work perfectly for a newborn. I love it because you donâ€™t have to waste formula or breastmilk by adding too much to a bottle.The bottle cleaner is a huge bonus for me in this newborn starter pack. I love how the bottle cleaner is made. If you notice, when you use the bottle cleaner, it gets every corner of the bottle and is very well made. I think Avent bottles are very easy to clean and this bottle cleaner is to thank!You'll also love the idea that you're set for your babyâ€™s first 0-12 months when you purchase this bottle set. You can even transform them into sippy cups, which is awesome feature for me.The bigger Avent bottles work perfect for the baby who is growing and needs more to eat. Everything you need for your new baby is right in this newborn starter kit from Avent.

When it comes to feeding a baby, a mom wants to do whatâ€™s best! I have used many bottles in the past but the best bottle I have found on the market has been from AVENT. Our babies have always been colicky and Iâ€™ve searched high and low for a bottle that will help our situation. The bottle helps prevent air from going in the babyâ€™s tummy (air is believed to upset the babyâ€™s tummy).The nipple has also worked wonders with our children. Iâ€™ve never had a nipple confusion problem while switching between nursing and bottle feeding with our babies. Can I also say that these AVENT bottles are SUPER easy to clean?! These are by far my favorite bottles for any baby ages 0-12 months.

Breastfeeding has always been a huge part of my life with my little ones. However, unthawing breastmilk and having it readily available for my child can be tough. There are times when you cannot nurse or need to leave the baby with someone else. I donâ€™t like unthawing breastmilk unless I know Iâ€™m going to use it. The Phillips AVENT bottle warmer can defrost breastmilk in a matter of minutes. I also love that it warms the bottle evenly, so I donâ€™t have to worry about cold chunks of ice upsetting the baby. Of course, warming evenly also means there are no hot spots either. I love having a trusted brand like AVENT in my home, knowing it can help make my life as a mom a whole lot easier is the topping on the cake.

With little boys in the household Cars is a huge deal around here. We waited until the little ones had gone to bed and had the 9 year old set up the Cozy Cone and Mack, along with the Tractor Tippinâ€™ and Pit Stop Launchers. They got up and sat down to eat breakfast as usual. About halfway through breakfast, our three year old goes, â€œHey, Whatâ€™s Mack doing over there?â€ and breakfast was over. The rest of the day was spent in Cars heaven.The playsets are all modular so they can be arranged a bunch of different ways, including using the Pit Stop Launcher next to Doc Hudsonâ€™s garage, which makes a great launching ramp. The sets are pretty well built, although there are a lot of small pieces so little ones have to be watched. They have a good level of detail, there are road signs, billboards and overhead wires - right down to the â€œplasmaâ€ inside of Mackâ€™s trailer. Assembly is required, but our nine year old handled it all. All in all, theyâ€™re a worthwhile buy, weâ€™ve had them a week and the new and fun still hasnâ€™t worn off them.

We've had a few other T.S. Shure products and I have to say that I just love them. With a toddler who is into Jake and the Neverland Pirate I knew that she would love this and I was right. This comes with quite a few pieces (40 to be exact) and all attach magnetically to the 2 characters included. I love the fact that it comes with the plastic carrying case that has a snap closure that makes it easy for her to take with her whenever we visit friends. Also keeps the pieces safe and secure in the bag. It's a great toy and will keep your little ones entertained for quite some time. She just loves changing the clothing and making her own outfits. The pieces are well made and I have had no complaints with the others I've gotten either. This would be a great toy for all the little pirate fans in your life. Totally recommend.

I've had quite a lot of baby monitors. My toddler is exactly that, a toddler and sleeps in her own room. She's in her room most of the time playing her toys, trying to read, watching a movie, whatever she's doing in there I like to keep an eye on her. She loves to climb and I have even caught her on her dresser trying to mess with her TV. It's one of the reason why I still use a baby monitor. I love knowing that I can check up on her without her knowing (she knows) but I also like to give her her space and not barge in her room like a helicopter mom.Having a monitor with video has always been one of the main options for me. I couldn't just have sound, I need to see what she's up to. This was however disappointing, while it wasn't too bad it not at all what I expected. For a price tag of $200 I expected high quality picture and what I got wasn't. I've used Motorola which has an excellent picture and even VTech's monitors are pretty good. It was difficult seeing her at night and even during the day it's not as clear as I would like it to be.The range on this monitor is pretty good and so is the sound. The 2 way communicator is also good. I'm now able to talk to her without going in the room and have her answer me. Imagine her surprise the first time she was doing something she wasn't and I spoke to her. Having control of the camera is also really nice.The app for this is also pretty good. I was able to download it on my S5 and I'm able to use it in the house and outside. Pretty cool! Now I would give this about a 3 1/2 stars. I wish the video quality was better but I really can't recommend buying this at this price tag. There are other monitors out there that do just as good a job for a whole lot less.

One of the most important parts of being a new mom is making sure youâ€™re in touch with your baby at all times. The Phillips Avent Baby Monitor is very simple to put together and doesnâ€™t take longer than a minute to set up. I like how easy the directions were to follow and all I had to do was add batteries or plug in the baby monitor to the outlet.A lot of baby monitors in todayâ€™s day and age are so high tech that you canâ€™t even figure them out. The Phillips Avent Baby Monitor is budget friendly and also technologically friendly. I didnâ€™t have to spend my whole day trying to figure out how it works. Time is precious to me as a mom and I appreciate the time this baby monitor didnâ€™t take from me.Itâ€™s pure joy to hear your baby cooing or talking, but to also get to them quickly when they need you. The Phillips Avent Baby Monitor offers no static and I can hear whatâ€™s going on in the other room very clearly. Budget friendly, easy to use, and clear sounds waves make The Phillips Avent Baby Monitor a perfect choice for a new mom or a 4th time mom.

These earrings come beautifully packaged and are perfect for a gift or to keep!I have never owned any Rose Gold jewelry and I am in love with the tone of these hoops.  The texture and pattern are elegant but not too fancy for wearing every day.  They are very well made and look heavy but they feel light to wear.I tend to get into the habit of wearing the same earrings all the time so when I put these earrings on the other day my husband was surprised and commented about how much he liked them!  I am so excited to have them to add to my jewelry collection.

I've been wanting to get a laminator now for quite some time but just never got around to it, so when given the chance to review this I just jumped on it. If you're planning on gifting the box is big/small enough for you to wrap. I have 4 kids and every once in a while I want to laminate something and this little machine, although small does the job really well. It heats up pretty quickly and so far I've had no issues. It does have an auto shut off which it does after about 30 minutes to conserve energy. It is lightweight and very easy to use and I recommend it for light office use.

If you are like most people youââ‚¬â„¢re probably wondering what the point of a separate router is when most modern cable and DSL modems have routers built into them.There are a couple of reasons, the first one is range.  If you are in an apartment, this isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t really an issue.  In medium sized and larger houses, or if you want to use Wi-Fi in the yard and garage, the range on your modem probably wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t cut it.  This is a strong selling point for the Netgear N300.  The external antennas give a solid boost to the range and strength of signal.The second big selling point to a third party router is security.  Your modem comes with a certain set of preset security options, but making changes isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t always easy and with so many of them in use, there is a big incentive for black hats to figure out how to exploit any weaknesses.  The Netgear has a number of great security features built into it, even beyond its ease of use.  It has a Guest mode that allows you to let guests connect to your router without giving them the ability to change settings in the router itself.  In addition you can allow a guest to access other devices on your network but not the internet, or the other way around.  The Netgear also has built in parental controls to give you the ability to filter what web pages can or cannot be seen on your network.  This is great for letting your kids use the computer without worrying as much about them stumbling across content that isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t age appropriate.  It is, of course, no substitute for monitoring them, but it lets you build up the freedom they are allowed.The third big selling point of the Netgear is the Netgear Genie App.  This is a easy to use home network manager that lets you seamlessly share between your PCs/Macs and phones (both Android and Apple).  It also lets you make any printer Airprint compatible for easy printing from your phone or tablet.The last main reason is bandwidth.  If you have several devices connected to your modemÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s wireless and all are making heavy use of the internet, it is possible that you will see performance degrade as it struggles to meet the demand.  The Netgear N300 is capable of speeds up to 300 Mbp/s, meaning that unless you are lucky enough to have and EXTREMELY fast internet connection, your internet connection will be your bottleneck long before your router will be.The Netgear is easy to set up, easy to use and offers a lot of great utilities, making it a worthwhile upgrade over the capabilities of your cable or DSL modem.

My best friend recently had her very first baby and when I say this is a lifesaver I mean it. Where was this when I had my own kids 18 years ago. Back then I did everything manually and I did so 3 years ago when I had my toddler as well but this would have saved me so much time. It is super easy to use, instructions were well written and the concept was well laid out. Now you don't have to worry that you're putting "too much or too little" formula in the bottle. Love the two temperature setting and my thing I would say is that I wished that the tank held a lot more water for those growth spurt days when you need just a bit more.Cleaning was super easy and I can't recommend this anymore than I do right now. This is truly a lifesaver for new moms.

My toddler is at that age where she does pretend play very well. We got another T.S. Shure product recently and she loved it. When given the chance to try out this magnetic Pocket Bear I jumped at the opportunity because not only does she like playing with dolls, but she also enjoys dressing them. This was a way to do both things and have fun while doing it.The set comes with 2 bears and lots of pieces to dress up. When they say they're magnetic they truly meant it. She dresses them in whatever style she wants, complete with top, bottom and shoes and they actually stay on when she holds her bear upside down. There are so many different pieces that allows her to be creative.The set comes in a wooden box used for storing the pieces when she's done playing and there's a clear plastic lid that slides on that keeps them in place. Its also light enough that she can take it with her if we decide to go visiting.I do recommend this set highly. It has kept my little one entertained for a few hours well and she never sits too long with a toy but this was a hit with her. Lot of clothing and styling options, great storage case, light and portable and lots of fun!

If you have a newborn you know that there are times when you need a break and this is such a lifesaver in that fashion. Most babies like motion and if you have dinner to make, homework to help with, you're going to have to put that baby down. The Fisher Price Moonlight Meadow Deluxe Cradle n Swing is there to help you. The assembly for this was pretty easy and took less than 20 minutes to do.Not every baby likes the standard back and forth motion so I was happy to see that this includes side by side. Now the reason I say this is a money saver is that it uses an AC adapter, meaning it can be plugged into the wall. Now you don't have to keep this in the same place all the time because it also uses 4D batteries as well. So you can move from room to room or even take it outside on the patio for baby to have some time outdoors in the fresh air (weather permitting of course).The smart swing technology is awesome because I remember in the days of having to actually push the swing in order to make it move. With smart swing technology (from what I gathered) it measures your baby and swings accordingly. It says according to the instructions that the speed won't slow down as your baby grows so I'm hoping that's true. The seat reclines and the fabric is pretty nice too. Baby is almost snuggled in it.While the color is unisex, I however found that this would be better for a little boy since I love getting pinks for girls, but it can be used for both genders. I do however wish that the mobile was a little better and the mirror isn't too bad either. After all who doesn't like looking at themselves? I recommend this as a great gift for all new moms, and even those that aren't quite new. Makes a great baby shower gift.

I'm 38 and African American. While a lot say that we don't age as fast as our counterparts, that's not true. I however want to look young for as long as I can, so when given the chance to review this item I took it. After all I personally won't spend this much money unless there were guaranteed results, or it was recommended by a friend. I've tried cheaper products that just seemed as though I've wasted my money.I have been using it for close to two weeks now and I think that while this might not be a fair review since I'm sure you'll have to use it a lot longer than that to actually see the difference, from what I've seen I can recommend this. Now the reason I took off a star was not because of the price but because I had a little mild irritation while using it. I would recommend testing it out on your hands before using it on your face. Although I did that and my hands turned out fine. It was my face that turned slightly red.This has pearls on the inside that when pumped comes out in a milky like consistency. You can also feel a slight difference when using it and I must say that it was great to actually feel it. Others takes days before you can actually see it but this one was so much faster. Do I recommend this? You bet I do. My only wish was that it was a little cheaper so I can truly keep on buying it.

I got this for my 3 year old who loves Jake and the Neverland Pirates so I thought she would be able to get to play with a few pirates of her own. She was delighted to get it and couldn't wait to open it up. It does come with enough blocks to entertain and I love the fact that they are all wooden. You might want to be careful with children who still likes putting things in their mouth because of choking hazards. She loves putting the ship together and I love hearing trying to interact with the puzzle pieces. We also love the storybook that is included. I do however wish the storage tray was designed better to store the pieces in, but besides that this is a great set for not just boys but girls too.

I had never heard of the name Pyle before but decided to take a chance on this Stereo Speaker System. I had been looking for one to replace the tinny sound of my TV in my bedroom. In my living room, it's completely done with Bose Surround but I didn't want to spend that much money for my bedroom where my TV is mainly used for TV shows I missed while I was at work.It does have a little higher profile than I would like since my TV sits on a stand so you'll have to be careful how you set it up so that it doesn't block your remote signal. I currently have a universal remote that I use with my TV that controls both TV and Direct TV box, I'm trying to find the code to program the Pyle so that I don't have to keep on using 2 remotes. I am pleasantly pleased with this system and if you don't want to plunk down the money on a system like Bose this will be good for you.

I got this for my son's bunk bed. I had just recently received another that had innersprings for one son and wanted to replace the other. I was pleasantly surprised when Amazon offered this one. At 6 inches I thought that I would need to get maybe a box spring to go along with it but I was amazed and happy to see that I didn't. My son weighs about 80lbs and has slept on the bed for about 2 weeks now and just loves it.The mattress comes compact and so its easy to take to whatever room you need it in. I was able to open it by myself without the need for hubby and let it expand. There wasn't any horrible smell which was great and by the end of the afternoon my son was able to sleep on it. It is comfortable and a bit firm but I like it that way and so does he. This will make a great mattress and it's also a great buy for any child's bed.

I happened to be looking for mattresses for my boys bunk bed and purchased one just a few days before being offered this one from Amazon Vine. The other I purchased was a little bit more expensive than this one. I had actually bypassed this one because of price and now I wish I hadn't. It came compressed which made it easy for me a female to take to their room. Usually I would have to have help from hubby to do things like this but this surely made it super easy. It came packed again in a bag and once I opened the bag and took it out the plastic it expanded fully. I didn't notice any "new" smell like some stated and the room didn't have any windows opened so I would have noticed it. Once I put it on the bed (all by myself) my son couldn't wait to get on. I actually had to test it out before he did and while it's not as soft as I like my mattress it's not too firm either. I would say that this is close to a medium/firm. It is super comfortable but more for kids and not adults. I personally couldn't see myself laying on this every night. I'm 160lbs and I was able to feel the springs a little. My son who is about 100lbs though said that he couldn't feel them so it's great for him. If I was a smidge lighter this would have been the perfect mattress for me. It is however a great value for a kids bed or a guest bed that won't be staying too long.

I got another brand that I've had for quite some time now but it's the spray and not this gel type. I happened to get the cute little pink one and as a female it fits well in my hands. I hope I never have to use it but to be honest I think I prefer my spray to this gel. While my spray has a bigger reach ratio, this gel while it claims to be better, also means that I also have to have a better aim. When you're being attacked you're not worried about trying to aim straight, you just want to spray to get away from your assailant. I live in a very quiet area so I hope I never have to use it but it's going to be great for me as a back up spray.

I have "collected" all the Assassin's Creed game sine Desmond was the star in the original Assassins Creed 1 which is by far one of the most difficult to play. It took me a while but I finally got a hang and love for the game. So when AC2 came out I was all over it and totally loved it. I spent hours and hours playing, trying to find the collectibles, trying to 100% all my assassinations. It seems that every year a new game comes out and they keep going from bad to worse. This is by far one of the worst that I have yet to play.Unity feels like a game that was rushed to market to make a quick few dollars. Looking at the price it is now I'm really not surprised that the price has dropped that significantly this quickly. Don't worry after purchasing this game Ubi wants you to pop a few more of your hard dollars once again. There is also a companion app that is required for you to even a few chests. If you're not happy with that, then I assume you won't be happy with the game glitching either. I'm consistently being stuck and have to turn it on/off. The graphics also aren't as great as predecessors. This is so not next-gen for me.Assassins Creed could have been a great franchise but greed has ruined a great game.

Our youngest just turned 1 and was so ready for sitting at the table with the rest of us but the high chair we had was too big and bulky for putting at the table.  The 3-in-1 tightly attaches to our dining room chair and sits up to the table just right. Your little one will be so excited that they get to sit and the table and join the rest of the family!I love that it swivels to easily get your little one in and out of the seat.  It has straps to keep them safe when they start to fidget or doesn't want to stay sitting.  I wish we'd had this when our toddler was younger too. The attachable tray and reclining seat are great for smaller babies.  I love that it can grow with your child!The fabric is easy to wipe clean.  The cover is easy to remove if it needs a thorough cleaning.  I love the print and colors of the Abbington because it is more grown up and elegant for the dining room.My nephew and his wife are expecting this summer and I'll be purchasing one for them.  It's a great shower gift!

What follows is a long-winded review, read this around bedtime if you are having trouble falling asleep! ;-) For those seeking the Reader's Digest version - overall, I think the Freiling French Press, though expensive, is the best French Press money can buy. I have tried offerings from 4-5 other French Press makers, including Espro and Bodum, and the Freiling IMHO has the highest quality build, has the best heat retention capability during the brew cycle, and will be the most durable long term due to its 100% 18/10 stainless construction - no plastic parts here!!. It is one of the very few 100% stainless French Presses you can find - plus it also a very attractive vessel to boot! I actually leave it out on my counter due to its good looks!! There are many good reasons why the Freiling French Press are the best sellers, and why reviews here on Amazon are so plentiful and positive. Amongst those reasons are quality, reliability, consistency and durability.Do realize however, that just because you spend the money and buy a Freiling will NOT guarantee you will automatically start making great coffee - as with any French Press the method is more important than the tool! You must pay attention to ALL of the variables involved in correct coffee extraction procedures - if you want the best coffee possible with a French Press, it is all about the process - assuring correct brew temperature, you use freshly ground beans, you are using an adequate grinder that grinds to consistent texture, and more!! Below I offer some tips to assuring a great cup of coffee with the Freiling, those may help in your pursuit of the perfect cup!!Just as important - do realize that the Freiling is a BREWING vessel ;-) and not a STORAGE carafe. You will see in the reviews that some complain the Freiling does not keep their coffee "hot" for hours - the coffee should only stay in the Freiling for around four minutes to brew, you will need a nice storage carafe to keep it hot thereafter!! Those that keep the coffee in the press with the grounds after the four minute mark are destroying the taste. Moreover, even if you transfer the coffee out, and remove the grounds and then use the Freiling as your storage vessel - you would be much better served purchasing a separate carafe to store the coffee when done. The Freiling is NOT an ideal storage carafe. (For example - I use a Zojirushi glass lined carafe for my needs).***End of Reader's Digest version - now on to the details!!Here is what I like about the Freiling Press:- Double Wall carafe construction - this is both ideal and necessary for the ever-so critical heat retention during your preheating and steeping phases. The method I employ can hold brew temps between 195 and 204 throughout the entire steeping / brewing phase, and I could never accomplish that with other presses made of glass, plastic, etc. Some have claimed that the Freiling is vacuum sealed in addition, but it is not - it is double walled and that is it. *** Note - I typically keep my brew temps around 200-202 degrees - please Google "SCAA recommended coffee brewing temperatures" for some background on correct temps to brew / extract coffee**- 100% 18/10 stainless - beautifully finished, but it is more than just good looks - the thick stainless assures the press will last for a long time and it will aid in heat retention already mentioned. It is durable and virtually indestructible if used with any modicum of care and not dropped daily on the tile! My 33oz Freiling is 3 years old, and it operates like the day I bought it. Plus, it still looks good also - other than a couple of minor scratches to the polished stainless exterior.- Top / Plunger assembly comes apart for thorough cleaning. You get a sense of the attention to detail and the cost it takes to make a Freiling press when you disassemble the constituent parts that make up the top / plunger. It wreaks of quality through and through... the fact it can be disassembled, and remains 100% stainless is no small feat, and a testament to the quality - and why it costs so much. Consider what it takes to be able to deliver this assembly - and why competing press makers don't!- Double walled top / lid - I already mentioned the double walled carafe - but the fact the lid is ALSO double walled construction is worth calling out- again, the competitors don't even approach this and even make their tops / lids out of PLASTIC says it all.- They are darned nice to look at! Let's face it - they are an attractive vessel.Here is what I don't like about the Freiling:- Price - this one is more of a whine ;-) and not anything wrong with the product, but hey, I can still not like it! Bottom line is I would still buy it again.. To make it less painful, I got this 44oz version for $98 here on Amazon - it was in my cart for over a year in the $125 range, and when I saw the price drop temporarily I jumped on it!- The top on my 33oz version had a weld seam failure around the hole where the plunger is inserted - causing the top to fill with water that I could not get back out. HOWEVER, Freiling sent me a new top when I asked with no hassle... it was a "one-off" problem and don't expect it to happen on my other Freilings.- I can't think of anything of substance I DON'T like about the Freiling - if you learn how to use it, perfect your method then this is the top of the heap when it comes to French Press. It is the best tool for the Press job IMHO.I have owned the 33 oz Freiling Stainless Press for a few years and have used it almost daily to make my morning coffee (except for the once a week I use my Technivorm drip brewer). Therefore, I do have experience with Freiling's presses, and understand how to best utilize them to squeeze out the optimal cup of coffee.Some pointers / things to think about as you pursue the "perfect" cup of coffee:- Make sure and pre-heat your Press and storage carafe in advance - don't put your coffee / boiling water into a cold French Press; and don't put your finished product in a cold storage carafe!!! (google it, this affects the taste). At a minimum, use hot tap water to pre-heat, which usually gets to 130-140 degrees. Personally, I use boiling water to pre-heat - you can boil it on the stove, or perhaps use something like a Zojirushi hot water kettle / boiler that is ready in advance when you wake!- Use fresh beans, and grind the beans right before use. Coffee beans are best within two weeks of roasting, and most store bought beans can be MANY weeks old by the time you buy them. If you can find a local source for your beans that are fresh, do it. You will notice a marked improvement in your finished product.- Buy a decent quality grinder. The $20 blade grinders are just not good enough for French Press - it needs a consistent, coarse grind. At a minimum, I recommend a Capresso Infinity for around $70, then use the "Coarse" settings, dialing it in to where you eliminate 95% of the sludge in your cup. I use an Orphan Espresso LIDO hand grinder ($150), and alternate that with a Capresso Infinity. You can also get a Baratza Virtuoso if you want to spend more! The grind is CRITICAL - it needs to be the correct coarseness - but more importantly needs to be CONSISTENT. Consistency is the main challenge for most cheap grinders on the market.- Assure your steeping / brewing temperatures are in the 195-204 degree range. This is not my own recommendation, this is the "proven" range for the best coffee extraction. Invest in something like a Thermapen, or a cheaper temperature probe, that allows you to test the water temperature while steeping. Another critical step to success.
