Her mother is busy reading, Mom ignores Suzieâ€™s important question, â€œWhy are we flying backwards?â€ When Suzie gets up to walk to the back of the plane, she notices a group of people dressed in robes and hoods. A young girl asks her if she is bored and would like to play. Suzie says yes, and the adventure begins.Before she realizes what has happened, Suzie finds herself falling through the sky holding the hand of her new friend, Allaya. Their adventure turns sour when they land short of Aruahua and find themselves on an island inhabited by starved dragons. Allaya apologizes profusely; they are about to die. Suzie uses her ingenuity to trick the dragons in time for rescuers to arrive. Soon Suzie finds out that Allaya is the Princess of Rainbow Island. Allaya and her kingdom believe Suzie to be the lost Dragon Princess. When a series of earthquakes and volcanoes threaten the kingdom, she and Allaya will have to fight for their lives, caught in a death struggle with the forces of nature, the dragons, and the lizards who have arisen again from the sea. Will Suzie be able to escape with her life a second time? Does the kingdom survive? Will Suzie ever get back to her own time and family on twenty-first century earth?The characters are appealing and interesting, and the plot elements just intricate enough to hold interest and keep the story moving along, although there are a few instances where there might have been a bit less dialogue. A few illustrations would make the read more appealing to third and fourth graders or reluctant readers. This book would make a nice classroom read aloud as the chapters are short and manageable.Princesses, dragons, lizards, time travel, castles and fantasy. What more could a middle grade reader want? This book is targeted for children in grades three to six.Suzie is sitting in seat 32A feeling bored. Her mother is busy reading, Mom ignores Suzieâ€™s important question, â€œWhy are we flying backwards?â€ When Suzie gets up to walk to the back of the plane, she notices a group of people dressed in robes and hoods. A young girl asks her if she is bored and would like to play. Suzie says yes, and the adventure begins.Before she realizes what has happened, Suzie finds herself falling through the sky holding the hand of her new friend, Allaya. Their adventure turns sour when they land short of Aruahua and find themselves on an island inhabited by starved dragons. Allaya apologizes profusely; they are about to die. Suzie uses her ingenuity to trick the dragons in time for rescuers to arrive. Soon Suzie finds out that Allaya is the Princess of Rainbow Island. Allaya and her kingdom believe Suzie to be the lost Dragon Princess. When a series of earthquakes and volcanoes threaten the kingdom, she and Allaya will have to fight for their lives, caught in a death struggle with the forces of nature, the dragons, and the lizards who have arisen again from the sea. Will Suzie be able to escape with her life a second time? Does the kingdom survive? Will Suzie ever get back to her own time and family on twenty-first century earth?The characters are appealing and interesting, and the plot elements just intricate enough to hold interest and keep the story moving along, although there are a few instances where there might have been a bit less dialogue. A few illustrations would make the read more appealing to third and fourth graders or reluctant readers. This book would make a nice classroom read aloud as the chapters are short and manageable.

Okay, I have occasionally been accused of being a sourpuss and not possessing the best sense of humor. However, I must admit this book had me grinning from ear to ear. Targeted for readers age seven and up, I know that the fifth grade students that I used to teach would be fighting over who gets to read this first. None of the jokes are complicated to remember; children can memorize and quiz peers and adults easily. Many of them are easy to figure out, but others are a bit more sophisticated The subjects are varied, but all are done in good, clean fun.Perfect book for a long car ride, party games, or a read aloud with family members. Children who are reluctant readers or learning disabled will love the simple question/answer format and large,easy to read print.. Highly recommended for parents, teachers, librarians and kids.

Short story about a family vacation that goes terribly awry. A couple headed from Michigan to Florida on a car vacation with their son and nephew run into every kind of bad luck imaginable. Beginning with a swerve to avoid a pothole, this family endures one misfortune after another. Though the story is a largely predictable, it is written in a conversational, breezy tone that forces the reader to cheer the family on and dread what they suspect will happen next.This story is family friendly; it would make an enjoyable family read aloud. Children ages eight and older should be able to read independently and enjoy the humor of what the author calls, "The National Lampoon Vacation." Recommended for anyone look for a short, relaxing read.

This is a charming tale about an Egyptian girl named Sahar who moves to Canada and has trouble adjusting. Her Aunt Lodi feels her pain; she gifts her niece with an old stuffed cat toy. Imagine Sahar's surprise when the cat comes alive and informs her that she can make dreams come true. How does Isecas the cat fulfill Sahar's dreams and provide her with the self-confidence that Sahar needs to believe in herself?This book contains beautiful digital illustrations that portray the characters' feelings accurately. Younger children will get the meaning from looking at them. Text is not difficult; children seven and older should be able to read the story independently. Perfect book for a family planning to move or for a classroom teacher to read aloud at the beginning of the school year.

I like the blue color and the pretty polka dotted trim of this towel. I also like that it is 100% organic. However this towel is a bit on the thin side.  And while this towel is not super soft, it is also not rough and scratchy. It is okay, just not great.

This SmartLab contains a lens that you can clip onto your smartphone to take close-up pictures. I used it on my iPhone 6. You clip the lens onto the phone. It does not stay firmly in place and tends to move if you bump it. There is a light on the lens which is just strong enough to light up the image. This lens is a bit tricky to use. You have to zoom in all the way with the phone and then try to focus. The objects tend to go in and out of focus if you are not using a tripod. Itâ€™s hard to hold the phone steady enough to get good focus at that magnification. A little tripod would solve that problem. I like the little booklet that comes with this lens. It has lots of different ideas or experiments that you can do with this lens. There is also a slide included that contains a microprinting, a fruitfly and a microchip. Overall, not bad for a toy that sells for less than $7 and I was able to get some interesting photos.

This game is easy to learn. It can be a lot of fun to playâ€¦..or, it can be really awkward and inappropriate, depending on the ages of the people playing. I thought the question on the box about the pig and bear would be a typical question, in other words, fun and silly scenarios that elementary school to middle school aged kids would find fun to play. But there were many questions that were geared towards adults and the kids would either not know how to answer them, or they would just plain be inappropriate for them. The questions should be geared towards one age group. They should not try to be all things to all people. The adults will just find the silly questions too juvenile and the kids will find many questions just do not apply or they do not understand them.I played this with my nieces (ages around 10, 11). They had fun overall, especially with all the silly questions about burping and farts, or eating bugs vs. tapeworms, etc.  We had to skip several cards that just did not make sense to them (like questions about the NBA) or were inappropriate (like drinking from a keg, or having the butt of the person next to them, or about being overweight). This game is labeled for 12 and up. I certainly donâ€™t think any 12 year old should contemplate drinking from a keg! I think most of the questions are okay, but if they had narrowed the questions down to a specific age group, this game would have been so much better.

This cover is a nice two-tone blue color. It has lots of great features. It has a drawstring cord at the bottom. It has tie down straps. It has covered vents all around. It is made of a lightweight material. These covers are water resistant and have held up well during the light rains we have had here recently. We have not had any heavy rains since I have started using this cover.I was worried about the quality of these covers when I read some of the negative reviews that said this cover tears, flakes into pieces. etc. I have not had any problems so far, but I have only been using this cover for a few weeks and I donâ€™t live in such a hot climate. As far as durability, time will tell and I will update my review if there are any problems with this cover.  This cover does come with a one year guarantee.

This book is the life story of Laura Lynne Jackson and her path to discovering and understanding her psychic abilities. This book is 260 pages long. It is divided into 3 parts, with each part containing 10 or 11 chapters. Each chapter is a different story or incident in her life. This book is full of little stories of supernatural events that occurred in her life, starting at the age of 6 and how she tried to make sense of it all and come to terms with her ability. I was captivated by the stories and found them to be very interesting. I have always been interested in the supernatural. I love reading stories about the connection between this world and the next. Lauraâ€™s writing style is easy going and conversational. I really enjoyed reading this book.

This camera is really lightweight and small. It measures about 6 cm x 4 cm x 3cm (with lens), or  roughly 2 ¼ â€œ x 1 Â½ â€œ x 1â€ . It weighs only 2 ounces (without the case).It comes with lots of accessories. It takes a while to figure out how to use all of these accessories. The instruction booklet has very small pictures of different combinations and their use, but the photos are hard to see. But, after a little experimenting I was able to figure is out.I set the camera and video options to its highest resolution. I found the quality of the still pictures to be just okay. They were also a bit grainy in lower light situations. The video quality is also just okay. There is no image stabilization. There is no audio.All the plastic components seem very sturdy and well made.There are 2 batteries included.Overall, this is a good choice if you have a limited budget, or you are giving this to a child to use.  So even though there are some quality issues, I donâ€™t think you could find a better camera, (with all these accessories and 2 batteries), in this price range.*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

This is a good basic cable. I use it with my iPhone 6. It works well. I have had no issues with it. The cord is 3 feet long. The ends of this cable are reinforced and the cable seems durable. I can use this with my phone while it is still in case.

This is a pretty apron. I like the like the pattern and I like the green color. The fabric is 100% cotton. This apron gives good coverage. It comes down to just above my knees and wraps around to cover my sides completely. It has 2 large pockets. The straps are long enough that you can tie them in front.

This tape dispenser is a nice, bright turquoise blue color. It is not large. It is about 5 Â½ inches long. Thereâ€™s not much to say about a tape dispenser. They all work the same. The thing I like about this one is that it has an anti-skid base. I have a glass top on my desk and this tape dispenser really stays in place. I can actually pull out a piece of tape without having to hold the tape dispenser down with my other hand.

This 2 in 1 shampoo/conditioner has a nice fragrance to it. My husband used it and his hair smells great. He said it was easy to rinse out. It left no residue. It was easier to rinse out than if he had used a separate conditioner. However, it did not leave his hair as soft as if he had used a separate conditioner. After he dried his hair he noticed no difference between this product and his old regimen of shampoo then conditioner. So, all in all, he is happy with product because it saved him time by only having to use one product.

This potting mix is made of sphagnum peat moss, composted bark fines, and a natural fertilizer. The fertilizer is supposed to feed for 2 months. The potting mix is nice and loose. The bag is 8 dry quarts and will fill 2 eight inch pots. I used it for planting herbs.  So far they are doing well. They seem nice and healthy. The mix drains well.I like using organic soil and/or potting mix whenever I plant something edible. This product is filling that need nicely.This potting mix is made in the U.S.A.

Assuming your shower nozzle is standard, the install is as simple as you would think, just screw the showerhead onto your nozzle. I havenâ€™t had any issues with it so far, it works as advertised. The light turns red when the water is hot, purple when the water is warm, and blue when the water is cold. Other reviewers complain of a high pitched noise or flashing lights, but I have yet to experience this â€“ if it happens Iâ€™ll update the review.

This game is fairly quick and easy to learn how to play. There are 2 different difficulty levels to choose from. You are supposed to use either the 3 tile side or the 4 tile side for all players, but I think that if you have different aged players you could even have the younger kids use the 3 tile side while the older players use the 4 tile side to even the playing field. That way the different skill levels can play at the same time. This game is fun to play if you like puzzles like Tetris. If you really donâ€™t like puzzles you may find this game to be too frustrating. The timed rounds make the play more fun and exciting.The puzzle pieces are made of a thick durable cardboard. They look great now, but Iâ€™m not sure how they will wear with time. I wish they were made of plastic..

This hair product is made for aging hair, which I have plenty of. My hair is dry and dull and I was hoping this product would help with that. This product has a mild, fruity scent. It is in a lotion form. Although it contains silicones, it is not the traditional, clear silicone serum type of product. You are supposed to use about 4 â€“ 5 pumps on damp hair, then style with heat as usual.  I didnâ€™t really notice and improved softness or shine in my hair after using this product. It didn't do anything for my hair and I really see no point in using it.

A Route 66 road trip has to the ultimate road trip of Americana. There so much to see along that famous path, and if youâ€™re ever lucky enough to do it then this book would be great to have with you so you donâ€™t miss a thing. This travel guide is about 120 pages long. It has a pull out map that measures about 15 x 11 inches. The map shows the entire Route 66 from Santa Monica, California to Chicago, Illinois. This guide is packed with information about the various attractions along the way. I like that there are attractions marked as â€œtrip highlightâ€. Those are the ones that really make Route 66 what it is. This guide also has all the usual Lonely Planet recommendations for restaurants and lodging.This guide book does not go into too much detail about any one attraction. I think this is good book for general information and a great way to help plan the trip.

These pants are really nice. The black color is more of muted black rather than an intense black. I really like that. The fabric is 65% polyester and 35% cotton and it has a good weight and feel to it. The fabric is sturdy but not stiff.  They are true to size and fit my son perfectly. They are very comfortable to wear and he loves them.  I think this tapered style is great for teens and young adults. Maybe not so much for older guys. .

This hemp protein is a very fine powder. It is organic. It has a 50% protein value. There are 15 servings per bag. Each serving is 4 Tbsp. Each serving is 110 calories and contains 15 grams of protein. That makes it a good way to add protein to your diet.This hemp protein powder has a nutty taste to it. I like the taste. There are a lot of ways you can use this powder and I am still experimenting with different way. I like adding this to my smoothies. The nutty flavor works well with the fruit and milk.

This eyeliner is very smooth and creamy. Its color is an intense black. I am used to applying eyeliner in pencil form, so this cream eyeliner did take some practice. I used a very small eyeliner brush which I happened to have. The eyeliner goes on very smoothly. You can smudge it if you do it right away. If you wait too long and it dries you wonâ€™t be able to smudge it. It really stays put. I have used many brands of so-called waterproof eyeliner in the past and none of them were really waterproof. All of them smudged and smeared. This one truly is waterproof. It wonâ€™t come off with regular water-based makeup remover. You have to use an oil-based makeup remover.*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

I have long, curly, frizzy hair that is a pain in the neck to style. This styler had so much potential. It has a rounded brush and stiff enough bristles, which is what I need to smooth out my hair. The only problem is that this styler does not have enough power.It is too weak and does not get hot enough. Thatâ€™s really too bad because, like I said, it had so much potential. If it was stronger it would have been the perfect styling tool for me.

This cleanser is different than any Iâ€™ve tried before. It is applied to dry skin (with dry hands). You rub it onto your dry face, add some water to emulsify it, and then rinse it off. Because of its oiliness it takes about twice as long to rinse off than my regular cleansers. I was skeptical, but my skin was actually not greasy afterwards. This cleanser does a good job of removing waterproof makeup.The fragrance of this cleanser is nice.

This deodorant smells really nice. It is a strong scent and if you are familiar with AXE products that wonâ€™t surprise you. Fortunately I like AXE scents. My husband uses this deodorant and I like the way he smells when he uses it. He is happy with its performance. It keeps working all day long.  It goes on smoothly and leaves no residue on his clothes.

Let me start off by saying that this cleanser is really thin. The fact that itâ€™s in a tube makes you think itâ€™s going to be thick and creamy, but in reality it is watered down and runs out of the tube quickly. It really should be thickerHaving said that, I do think that this is a good cleanser. My skin feels great after using it. It is not drying. My skin feels clean. I have not had any significant breakouts since starting this.  The active ingredient in this product is Benzoyl Peroxide which has always worked well for me.

There are 3 bags in this item, 2 large bags and one small bag. I could fit a small foam pillow in the smaller bag. I got 3 king pillows in the large bag. These bags are easy to use. Simply insert your items, zip the bag closed and then just place the vacuum hose at the inlet and suck all the air out. That is always fun to watch. It shrinks down quite a bit. Once the air is gone you can screw on one of the black caps.These bags are made of a thick plastic and seem durable. They are a great way to store bulky items like pillows and comforters.*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

This neck wallet measures about 7 ¾ â€œ x 5 Â½ â€œ. The neck cord is really long and easily adjustable to any size you want, so you can wear it around your neck or over the shoulder. The main compartment is divided in two by a mesh divider. The top flap has a velcro type closure.The design on this item is really clever. You can access the either of the two main compartments from the side zippers. There is also a small pocket on the front that is closed with a zipper. The small compartment is really handy for smaller items like driverâ€™s licenses and credit cards.This neck wallet is lightweight and thin (as long as you donâ€™t over stuff it). You can easily wear this inside your shirt to keep your valuable items safe. And the fact that it is made of RJID blocking fabric makes this item even better.*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

These gloves are really great. I use latex gloves all the time and they often tear. These gloves are really heavy duty. They are thicker than standard latex gloves and they are much stronger. I have small hands and I wear a size small in the standard latex gloves and they fit perfectly. This size small glove is just a bit bigger than my regular gloves, but it is not a problem.

This is a really nice organizing system. It comes with 3 large hooks, 2 small hooks, and a bin. You can configure them any way you want. They stay put and they donâ€™t move around. When you want to rearrange them you can easily remove them to do that. This system is very sturdy. I installed it directly into the studs so that It will hold a lot of weight.

This is a leave-in type of product for the hair. You can use it on damp or dry hair. It has a nice fragrance. It did not leave my hair sticky or greasy. It did not really do much for my hair though. My hair certainly did not look more youthful.  I will go back to my regular hair products.

There is an error on the directions on this product box people should be aware of. It says it can be used 2-3 times per week, but then it goes on to say if excessive dryness occurs then you should start with one application daily and then gradually increased to two times daily. Hopefully people will realize that they meant weekly.In any case, to use this mask you simply apply it to clean skin and leave it to dry on your skin. You rinse if off after 5 minutes. It made my eyes water the whole time I had it on, and I know it did not come in contact with my eyes. Also, I found rinsing it off to be really uncomfortable. It is very rough on the skin and left my skin very irritated. The active ingredient in this mask is salicylic acid 0.5%, which is a good acne medication but I would rather get that from another product.

This is a 2 part system. You simply brush your teeth with step 1 for one minute, spit it out but donâ€™t rinse, then brush your teeth with step 2 for another minute. Step 1 is supposed to be a deep cleansing toothpaste. Step 2 is what they call a whitening finisher.The flavor is good, a mild minty taste that is not overwhelming. My teeth felt very clean afterwards. After using this for a few weeks, I really donâ€™t think it whitened my teeth at all. But there was one benefit, it made me aware of just how long Iâ€™m brushing my teeth and ensures that I am brushing my teeth for the full 2 minutes.

This product is made for naturally dry, coarse and curly hair, which is exactly what I have. This product can be used on wet or dry hair. It has a nice, mild scent. It is not sticky or greasy.  I did not feel it really did much for my hair. I didnâ€™t notice any improvement in softness or frizz control. I still needed to use other products to control frizz.

This paper shredder is a nice compact size. It stands just about 13 inches high. It is about 14 inches wide and 7 inches deep. It has a lift up handle so you can easily remove the top. The basket has a clear, plastic window so that you can see the level of the shredded paper and know when it is full and time to empty it out. This shredder is strong. It can handle up to 8 sheets of paper easily. If you set the shredder in the auto start positon it will be ready to shred the paper at any time. No need to turn it on every time. It has a reverse button in case thereâ€™s a jam from too much paper. The shreds are all cross-cut which is the kind I prefer.Overall, this is a good quality shredder and it gets the job done.*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

This phone holder is applied by a suction cup. You just put it where you want, and push the lever down to lock it into position. It sticks very securely. The flexible goose-neck arm is very sturdy and will stay in the position you put it in. The phone holder is attached to the arm by a ball joint so you can rotate it to any position you want.The clamp that holds the phone opens up about 3 ½ inches. The jaws of the clamp are lined with rubber grips and they really hold the phone securely. I donâ€™t have to take my iPhone 6 out of its case to use this holder. The issue I have with this holder is that the phone tends to jiggle a bit while driving. I much prefer the: Ipow CD Slot Smartphone Car Mount Holder*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

This phone holder mounts in the air vent of your car. This product does not come preassembled, but putting it together was very easy. It is a nice holder. To use, you just pull back on the spring loaded hook and insert it into the air vent, and release the hook. To insert your phone into the holder you press the button on the back to release the side arms, pull out the support brackets on the bottom, insert your phone and push the side brackets back in. the side brackets will lock in place. The side brackets are cushioned. They are low enough to not interfere with the side buttons on my iPhone 6. The bottom support brackets have 3 different positions so that you can adjust them so they do not interfere with the headphone port or the speaker on the bottom of the phone.The ball head allows 360 degree rotation so can view your phone in any direction.*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

This smartphone holder is installed right in the CD player slot in your car. It is easy to install. It has 3 sub pads that you can choose from to adjust the fit to have it fit securely. I used the largest sub pad a got a really good fit. You simply insert this into the CD slot, then push down the little lever to lock it in place. To insert your phone you simply pull out the spring loaded arm of the holder and place your phone into it. The arm pulls out quite a bit and will probably accommodate any phone. It pulls out almost 3.5 inches. I have an iPhone 6 and I donâ€™t have to remove it from its case to use this holder. Furthermore, the arms donâ€™t interfere with any of the buttons on the phone. You can rotate the head of this unit so that it holds the phone in either landscape or portrait mode. You can You can also angle it to the right and to the left.*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

This digital scale is small and light weight, making it really portable. It is about 6 inches long. It runs on a lithium battery which is included.It is easy to use. You can set it to measure in lbs, oz, g, or kg. it will auto shut-off in 60 seconds or you can power it off by pressing the button for 3 seconds. I tested it out be weighing a lot of items and comparing them to my very accurate digital floor scale. And while it turned out this scale is not as accurate, it was close enough.For example, I weighed my full carry-on handbag on my floor scale and it was 19.6 pounds. Using this portable scale, I got 19.16 pounds. Considering the size and cost of this item, that is a pretty good result. When packing a suitcase it is hard to tell if you are close to the max weight or not without a scale. I like to buy stuff while on vacation and I donâ€™t really know until I get to the airport what my bag weighs. So until they start putting scales in hotel rooms, this is a must have travel item to carry with me.*I was provided with a free sample for evaluation, and any opinions stated are entirely my own and I was not paid or told what to write.

This low oil fryer is big. It takes up a lot counter space. So for me, to use something that is going to do that it better be good. I really like this fryer. I first made homemade french fries from fresh potatoes, not frozen. I made the maximum amount which is 2.2 pounds. I added the oil (which was just a little bit over 1 tablespoon) and I turned it on. About 35 minutes later  they were done. They had a nice golden brown color. And most important of all they were good. The family really liked them. Everyone thought they were almost as good as deep fried french fries.This unit has a heating element on the bottom and one on top. The mixing paddle is removable so you can also make things that donâ€™t need to be stirred.

This is a really cute puppet. It is very soft. You can activate it by opening and closing its mouth or just by pressing/squeezing its mouth. He only says 6 or 7 different phrases. It can get tiresome quickly hearing those same phrases over and over again. But babies like repetition and they will play with it over and over again. Overall, this is a nice quality, cute hand puppet.

The color of this set is described as â€œecruâ€. Ecru generally refers to a light beige color. I do not consider this product to be any shade of beige. This set is definitely yellow in color. And I know that I did not get the wrong item because they donâ€™t even sell a â€œyellowâ€. They have pink, blue, celery, white and ecru. Having said that, I do like the color of this set.  It is a nice shade of yellow. It is toned down, warm shade of yellow. It is very neutral and would work well for girls or boys.This is an adorable crib starter set. Everything is 100% cotton (except for the waterproof backing on the quilted pad. That is a layer of vinyl/plastic to make it waterproof. The sheets in this set are very, very soft.

This is an adorable mini crib set. Everything is 100% cotton (except for the waterproof backing on the quilted pad. That is a layer of vinyl/plastic to make it waterproof.The pink color is such a nice shade of pink. It is not the usual bright pink you see everywhere on the â€œgirls sideâ€ of the baby section in any store. These are a softer, warmer shade of pink.The sheets in this set are very, very soft.

This is not just for men. I am a woman with long, curly hair and I love this product. It kind of reminds me of VO5 hairdressing, but this product is much thicker and waxier. It does not liquify in your hands when you rub them together (like the VO5 does), so it is a bit harder to distribute to your hair.Nevertheless, it does a great job of smoothing down flyaways and giving a nice subtle shine to my hair. I only use just a touch so it really doesnâ€™t weigh down my hair or make it greasy.

I'm disappointed that the capsules appear to be significantly smaller (perhaps 25%) than the other 750 mg rated capsules of Beta Alanine I just finished.  I had been using the bulk supplement competitor's caps, also rated at 750 mg, but they were more expensive and so I went for this value option.  Now I know why they cost less, because this company delivers less.I will not reorder from Serious Nutrition Solution, and I would hold their other products as suspect as well...

Because I can use this as a multi-purpose modifier for a monolight, bare bulb flash, or speedlight, its value to me far exceeds its cost.  It can be used as a gridded reflector, semi-soft reflector/box (with only the internal baffle), or double diffused soft box - plus, with a minor DIY addition, you can make it a beauty dish.  So whether you need a wide, soft spread or a more directional, sharp light this tool delivers in degrees depending on how you choose to set it up.Perhaps the best feature is its parabolic shape, which is tight and efficient.  Shallower modifiers don't focus the light nearly as well.  Despite the many advantages listed above, I would not have bought this if it didn't have such a deep parabol.  Similarly shaped boxes/umbrellas/dishes are uncommon and costly.Many negative reviews here are narrowly focused on the umbrella mechanism, but I see it as a post to mount a round dish reflector on to cool the center hot spot.  I realize that if someone needed to break this down after each shoot then they would encounter problems with it consistently latching/locking and holding open (sooner or later).  But I am able to keep it assembled so it's not a problem.  Even if the latch on the shaft failed, I think it would be an easy fix to clamp or tie the mechanism so that it stays open.I have never purchased a strobe/flash modifier from CowboyStudio before and, frankly, they seem to be an entry-level brand so I shopped around to find alternatives to this before pulling the trigger.  The alternatives either had fewer positive attributes or they were the same with a higher cost.  The Paul C. Buff folding octabox is probably better quality, but with a grid it costs four times as much - and I don't shoot with their lights.I've been doing advanced lighting for years with all manner of modifiers, but this one is like a really cool Swiss Army knife.  I'm excited to have gotten it for so cheap, too.  Totally recommended for lighting enthusiasts...

The description of this mount as "multifunctional" is important to note, because the images (as of the time of this review) don't fully show how this can be used.  You should observe that the bracket has both 3/8" and 1/4" threaded holes to attach your spigot / stud to, which can be very helpful in using speedlights.  With common adapters, this mount can be placed on stands, doors, tables, etc. and used for adding light in precarious places.Also, I must add that, since I already own several dedicated mounts with studs, this new style mount has an opening (or mouth, so to speak) that is significantly wider than is common.  It opens about 3/4" wider than the other C-type mounts with studs that I have used for years.  This means you can attach it to larger poles, stands, tables, doors, car windows, etc. than the typical mounts allow for, thus making it more useful overall.Yes, the main reason I bought it was to secure my power pack for the AD-360 (which it does very well).  But the fact that it has multiple functions makes this mount much more valuable than other screw-type mounts with studs.  The value is there, in my opinion, so I would highly recommend this...

I wish that these were available 10 years ago when I was jury rigging speedrings, trying to get more power in a portable form factor.  This double flash speedring is solid, far more professional looking than my adaptations, and adjusts to fit your various flashguns.You can attach it to a boom or stand either with the internal thread (1/4) or by pinching the stud with an umbrella adapter.  I have two of these, one attached to a beauty dish and the other for use with octoboxes or softboxes.  In both cases, controlling it is fairly solid if you can get a good bite on the stud.  With two flashes attached, it is fairly well balanced too.I would pay a lot more, frankly, because it gives me the freedom to use a host of modifiers with confidence.  Highly recommended...

Although she's only worn this since Christmas, my wife is wildly happy to have gotten this as a gift and she wears it daily.  I'm not sure how well the finish will hold up under regular usage (probably not too good, based on other reviews) but at this price, who cares?  I would be embarrassed to have her know how little it cost, especially since she loves it so much.  Based on its feel and look, it definitely is a bargain.I would buy this again in a heartbeat.  Highly recommended...

This cartridge is perfectly sized for my mini-keg.  For those who have the simple, squeeze trigger style Co2 charger for their cornelius kegs (http://www.amazon.com/Genuine-Innovations-Cornelius-Keg-Charger/dp/B000NV9CE6/ref=sr_1_11?ie=UTF8&qid=1422736438&sr=8-11&keywords=3+gallon+keg) this is the ideal cartridge to keep your brew charged.I have tried others and they don't really work well due to a poor fit.  This one fills up the space fully, doesn't shift or rattle, and aligns perfectly when installing so that there is no leakage.Four stars because the price is a bit high for what it is.  I would buy this again and highly recommend them...

We love to make really strong coffee (in a french press), so I use this powdered calcium in every cup of coffee (1/4 tsp.) to tame the acid. It's tasteless, and dissolves well.  It can be used in wine, but I haven't done that myself.This bottle lasts a long time at the rate we use it. Highly recommended...

I find it hard to express how pleased I am to have discovered this sauce.  Having experimented with so many sauces over the years trying to find one that gives a full flavor of the habanero without destroying the tongue, I had practically given up and settled for one that had a strong vinegar base.  My friend found Marie Sharp's on a trip to Belize and brought it home to share.  What a gift!This sauce is really natural tasting, using carrots and lime as the base, primarily, and so the pure habanero flavor shines through really well.  I've been buying in bulk here and giving them to my friends who like spicy food, and now several of them have come to see this as their favorite as well.My only complaint is the cost, but for what it is and how much I enjoy it (on many types of dishes) I would pay more now that I'm hooked...

My wife has been using this to control pain/inflammation post surgery to reduce dependency on NSAID's and Acetominephen. While not as powerful as a drug, bromelain is preferred if you want to keep from harming precious organs. Remember that it is most potent when taken on an empty stomach.After shopping around and comparing the relative strength/potency of the leading sellers of bromelain here on amazon and vitacost, the NOW brand gives the most bang-for-the-buck. I only wish that this Bromelain was not so expensive (for what it is and does).I will continue to buy this here and would recommend it for certain circumstances...

A must have, for me, after being forced to use a Windows8 machine. It simply restores sanity to the universe, after the debacle of Win8 hit, by giving us a darn start button again. Sheesh. It's too bad I had to pay for an aftermarket solution, but at least there is a good one.I like that Start8 lets me easily customize the start menu with not only the apps I want but also how many should appear (and where I want them). Windows should take note of this before unleashing their next operating system and possibly further damaging their product experience.Start8 has some cool functionality for appearances and such but it doesn't get me excited. Make no mistake, Microsoft created an industry for Stardock by their stupid decision to go all 'metro' style with their dumbest OS release since Vista - and leave off the central paradigm icon of all Windows versions - the darn start button. Good grief.

The following review is what I posted on the site we originally purchased these from a couple years ago:The value and convenience of these is what attracted us to buy them well over a year ago, but had I known the problems we'd have with the fabric itself then I would have looked for another product altogether.The fabric pills up constantly, leaving textured dots or tufts.  Early on, you could manage it with regular picking, brushing, or using wide tape to grab the small tufts.  Soon it became a losing battle because the pilling effect was more widespread and the individual tufts were harder to remove.  Now it's a lost cause and looks terrible.Who cares about the nice fit and value when you cannot accept the overall appearance -- due to poor fabric performance?  Don't buy these...

Looks like I found my new, favorite hot sauce!  I tried it once at a friend's house and just fell in love with it, and was so glad to find these 10 ounce bottles on amazon for a decent price.Habanero sauces, in my experience, have tended to be too riddled with vinegar, too mild, or too hot.  This 'white label' version of Marie Sharp's (there are many she makes, but I haven't tried those) strikes the perfect balance of solid flavor, mild-to-medium heat, and no punishing aftertaste.  Every time I use it, I apply what seems like a lot on my food - and then I eventually add still more because it's so good and doesn't kill the natural food taste or your tongue.From Belize, Mary Sharp's sauce is like ketchup down there and for good reason.  It really has a unique taste that even non-hot sauce people can appreciate.  I would rate the 'heat' index here at a 4 out of 10, and the flavor at least a 9!  Highly recommended...

We love to watch this show as a family and tell many others about it as well.  Shark Tank has many learning possibilities for young and old which are almost nonexistent in network television (or anywhere else).Both for wise business as well as certain life lessons, the cases explored in these shows can be very helpful.  From half-baked ideas of new entrepreneurs to emotionally compromised investors, the negative lessons offer many cautions.  And, of course, there are some 'slam dunk' cases that are inherently good for both the entrepreneur as well as the shark investors.While I feel the entertainment factor in Shark Tank is subordinate to the real world lessons to be garnered, there are plenty of moments full of comedy, surprise, and controversy.  The producers get a wild variety of entrepreneurs that make it interesting for most audiences.  Heck, by watching it you might even find a product, service, or business opportunity you wouldn't have discovered otherwise.From season one up to five, there has been improvements in many aspects.  Better sharks helps a lot (fewer guest sharks who do little more than sit) but I'd like to see at least one rotate off per season.  Better follow-up stories in the 'updates' allow the viewer to feel more connected to the stories.  Better production too, especially from season one to two.Overall, we highly recommend this show for real world examples of risk, reward, and proper business strategies.  Season five is at the top of the heap (so far) and if you're only going to get one season then this is the one...

After so many great reviews I almost thought it vain to add one more to the stack, but I'm a discriminating user with a fair amount of history with smartphones and their paraphernalia. Maybe it will help you decide - if you look at 'most recent' reviews instead of 'most helpful' ones?This case came highly recommended by another experienced user and I'm glad I got it first when I upgraded (so many choices in this space). Two generations of galaxy ago, I landed on another Otterbox case that I liked as well so it wasn't without this knowledge that I bought this Symmetry series case. A couple of big positives I found here: it doesn't add too much thickness to the profile of the S5, and it's pretty darn tough. Those two things were really important to me and are 'five star' attributes in my estimation.I am giving it four stars for one minor aspect that was underwhelming: the texture on the back isn't 'grippy' enough for me to feel confident. If my hands were slightly wet or sweaty and I pulled the phone out too casually then I feel there's a 50/50 chance it slips out and drops. While I haven't dropped it yet because of this (taking extra precaution now) it could have easily been improved. Simple grooves in a waffle or diamond pattern would rectify this, and since these are form molded then it's an oversight that occurred at the design level.Nevertheless, with care in handling this case should satisfy every major concern for device use and protection. I would buy this again and generally recommend it to all...

After my daughter accidentally dropped the old tray, shattering it in pieces, I worried that I would have to spend a fortune on a replacement.  Finding this one at a reasonable price fixed all that.  It fits perfectly and matches the stock tray in every respect.  Highly recommended...

Going through the thinner sticks is getting old and expensive, so I updgraded to a slightly thicker/larger diameter and it's working out marvelously.  The additional meat isn't uncomfortable and the cost is decent.  Time will tell if these are worthy of a five star rating, so in the mean time I recommend these to solve for premature breaks...

This is THE tool you need to pull your oil filter on Camry models (mine is 2011 but it should work going back several years).  The bizarre measurement Toyota chose is inexplicable, according to my mechanic, and necessitates this special tool.  Of course, Toyota makes and sells their own for more money, so I'm glad that this one is equivalent in every way - but for less money.There are cheaper ones but they won't have the slots on the side (that allows for heavy cranking) or the bored out end.  This is the one...

This taco bowl form is fantastic for making fresh shells for salads.  A bit of instructions would have been nice (but at least the reviews here helped a lot).  No doubt, this thing is commercial grade because it's built like a tank and can be used on the big 12 inch tortillas.  I especially like that the base is rather large in terms of diameter so that your shells can be filled with dinner-sized portions.I used my large fryer to test it out with and it's fine, but I'm thinking next time I'll try to use a large round pot with tall sides instead.  The reason is that my fryer has the heating elements on the bottom and I was constantly pressing the tortilla down there to fully submerge the shell - and so the bottom of the shell more cooked than the rest.  It didn't effect the taste at all so it's no big deal.As has been said before, you don't put the tortilla inside of the form/basket.  You put it in the oil and then press down with this shell maker directly in the center of the tortilla.  The tortilla will be shaped upward and wrap itself around the form as it cooks.My shells took about one minute to fully cook and harden at 375 degrees in peanut oil.  Just keep a set of tongs in one hand to grab the shell with, shake off, and drain on paper towels.  325-350 might be better next time (to make golden, flaky shells instead of light brown ones) but it will take a little longer to make.Also, I'm thinking that next time I'll use uncooked, fresh tortillas to see if they turn out more crisp and flaky than ones made from cooked white flower tortillas.  Will update later if there's anything to report...

Sometimes you just need a dead hanging reflector to either boost or block light and this is just what I was looking for.  It fits on most any light stand and grabs your reflector with decent tension.  You wouldn't want to try using this in a windy environment, of course.  There's not a lot to say about such a small, simple thing except that it's a bit overpriced for what it is.  Nevertheless, I'd recommend it and buy it again...

My daughter loves playing/pretending to be a gymnastic dancer on the nintendo wii and has taken to making her own homemade ribbons with whatever she can get her hands on.  So looking around here on amazon was a natural step towards surprising her with the real thing and I'm so glad I found these.  The price was so cheap that I got two.  My daughter loves them and all her friends and sisters cannot keep their hands off them.The quality seems good too.  I thought the fabric might be either too heavy or too weak/cheap but I was pleasantly surprised that it seems suited well to be spun in the air.  The rods/handles are adequately strong without being heavy or flimsy.  Overall, I'm very pleased with the purchase and would gladly buy these again.  Highly recommended...

Getting capsules is the way to go because they're fast acting and don't cause any stomach issues (and capsules are not common for melatonin, apparently).  This brand isn't one I've ever purchased before so I cannot speak to their quality over a range of products, but this one is just what I was looking for.My neurologist swears that humans cannot absorb more than a half of a milligram of melatonin so he implored me to get the smallest dose possible.  These are the smallest dose I could find unless you get some proprietary blend - and even then they load you up with too much melatonin.Although I'm pleased with this purchase and would buy again I'm docking a star because I feel the price is a bit steep for such a common product that's widely available.

I went through a long season where I was bedridden and had a hard time sleeping.  Going through many types of pillows was part of the problem, but I was so glad to have discovered these.  The foam is in small chunks or pieces and so can be moved around to a desirable shape.  Generally speaking, it's firmer than down feather pillows but softer than the solid foam pillows that are so common.  I'm on my third set of pillows now and cannot imagine a good night's rest without them.My only complaint is that they don't make a king sized version of the pillows.  In fact, the only version they make is really small looking on my king sized bed, so I use two.Overall, I'd say these are good value and give a solid recommendation...

This tube is really a great tool for adding smoke to your standard grilling or just plain old cold smoking meats and cheeses.  Because it's not meant to flame up, the smouldering pellets can give off hours of rich smoke without getting hot.  And clean up is easy and fast too.The trick is to place it far away from any potential drafts so that the pellets don't wick up into a flame, which in my case required me to tape over some holes in my barbecue in order to create a 'sweet spot' for it to rest when smoking.  Also, if you don't get a sufficient burn initially then don't be surprised if you come back an hour later to find it not emitting smoke.  Use one of those refillable torch-style lighters and really burn the end of the pellets so that the flame would remain lit on its own, and then blow it out to begin the smoke process.If you're on the fence, I'd say watch some online videos and then just go for it...

Flossing has been a total hassle for me since getting braces.  I didn't know that a product like this existed (other than those rigid flossing toothpicks that are too large) and so was amazed after my dentist gave me a trial pack.  The tips are not only small/thin enough to fit between the teeth near the gums but they are coated with a thin layer of what seems to be latex - which gives it a rubbery texture to grab onto whatever needs to be removed.My only complaint is that if you don't try inserting the tip at just the right angle then the tip will bend (at least in my case where tight fits are everwhere).  Nevertheless, the quality and value here has me very happy.  I would gladly buy these again...

With all of the great reviews here I bought this with confidence.  Glad I did because this hose is really built well and oozes quality.  The fittings are like those you'd expect on a more expensive hose, and the hose itself is very thick/durable.  Now I'm thinking about replacing all of my hoses with ones made from the manufacturer.  Highly recommended...

I got this as part of a larger kit a while back and it's use has exceeded the original needs.  Now I use it mostly on location, handheld by an assistant, and with modified flashguns.  Because it's light (being made of rigid aluminum tubing) it's not terribly difficult to hold out while in full extension in order to get more challenging shots.  And the lock stops on both the head and the extension part have never slipped even when under heavy load.A perfect complement to this would be the Lastolite LL LS2499 Waist Holder, which I'm looking at now.  It would made hold this boom over long jobs easier and more stable.While aluminum will bend a bit, if you're mounting a huge softbox to a monolight it might make more sense to get that chrome one from Westcott since it's very rigid (I use this in studio) and can easily manage the heaviest loads.I know that I will get another one of these eventually, and I have no hesitation recommending it...

The leap pen is a great tool and having these books really adds to its utility.  There's a lot of eye candy and learning challenges in this book that are suitable for my four year-old.  Since getting it, however, she has gone through this one so much that I'm afraid it will be 'old hat' soon - but that is no knock against the product.What is a minor negative is the need to go online and download the audio as a companion file to make the book make sense.  This requires you to download a host application that acts as a hub/server for each of the books to be downloaded onto the leap pen.  It's not a problem if you're somewhat savvy in general but it will definitely create too many steps for some.Overall, I would buy this again and recommend it with the minor caution above...

The leap pen is a great tool and having these books really adds to its utility. Because my daughter enjoys the show that this book is based on it seemed like a good fit, which it has definitely turned out to be. Since getting it, however, she has gone through this one so much that I'm afraid it will be 'old hat' soon - but that is no knock against the product.What is a minor negative is the need to go online and download the audio as a companion file to make the book make sense. This requires you to download a host application that acts as a hub/server for each of the books to be downloaded onto the leap pen. It's not a problem if you're somewhat savvy in general but it will definitely create too many steps for some.Overall, I would buy this again and recommend it with the minor caution above...

After a long season of perfect use, my rabbit corkscrew (from Costco long ago) stopped uncorking bottles.  It would plunge down as expected but never extract the cork (natural or synthetic).  The screw would just slide back up/out anymore.I thought the popularity of these kinds of corkscrews would have driven the prices down but just the opposite is true, so simply buying a whole new unit seemed unwise.  Finding these from metrokane was perfect in terms of value and function.  Now I've got my old faithful rabbit back - good as new.  Highly recommended...

With my Nikon D800, I was using the fastest SD card I could find while using my older, slower CF cards in the second slot as backup.  I began having the 'freeze' or 'hang' problem where after making an exposure the rear monitor would lock up, showing only the hanging hour glass.  Only waiting for an indefinite period of time or a hard shut down would clear this writing error.  After doing a lot of research and trying to find out what others were doing to remedy the problem (since sending the body to Nikon wasn't resolving things for others who tried) the one thing people said cured the issue was to switch to CF priority.These 1000x cards from Transcend are their best/fastest so I knew it had the greatest potential to write files without the hanging hour glass freeze.  Once I got the card and made the switch in the menu system, the issue hasn't come back once.  So kudo to transcend for making a fast card at a reasonable price.  Shame on Nikon for creating or allowing the problem in the first place.Highly recommended card...

These look as good as the images here and they came really fast via prime shipping.  Because they aren't cotton it's not a fair comparison to expect that kind of feeling, but they aren't scratchy or stiff like the cheaper cotton ones you find at the lower end of the market either.  The polyester is smooth and rather soft.The only knock is that these won't 'breathe' as much and so will feel warmer.  This can be a problem for hot sleepers or those in warmer climates.Still the value is quite good and they could fetch more in a retail environment.  I would buy these again without reservation...

For digital post-process work, this panel is a bargain. Of course, I always use a hardware calibrator so my review is predicated on that sort of correction being applied. And once dialed in, the depth of color and dynamic range is pro level, and I would put this next to most IPS LED monitors and see it lacks nothing essential.I'm impressed at how it handles blacks too, blowing away my old samsung LED. No light leaks on my model either. From a cold state to warm up, I notice no shift in tone, saturation, or brightness.Refresh rates for gaming/movies is not what it was designed to be optimal for. And I haven't/don't use it in the vertical portrait orientation so I cannot speak to that function.After using it for extended sessions for a few weeks now, I'd say I'm totally satisfied. It feels like a much more expensive product. All of the quality I was hoping would shine through is there. If it holds like this for a couple more years I'd simply have to reorder a new one when this model dies. Until then, I highly recommend it for creative applications...

With so many options for cases, this one stood out as being a good compromise between protection and functionality.  I'm glad I bought it because it really is very stout without making the power button be difficult to use.  And the overall thickness really isn't bad compared to some older generation cases I used on my GS3 so that's cool.The only knock I would notice is that the broad surface of the case itself is rather slippery (but no more slippery than the actual shell for the GS4).  I wish it had a little texture to make it grip more confidently when pulling it out.  Otherwise this is a fine product, and I would buy it again...

These 'miracle-in-a-bottle' things can get reviews from all over the place, both positive and negative, so I don't want to join the extreme voices here. My experience is based on necessity since the winter fuel here in the northwest is so lousy that all of our vehicles start rough and burn hard. The awful performance is most obvious when you need to suddenly accelerate hard and the vehicle misfires or stutters (it's so lame, and I don't know who to be more upset at - the government or the fuel companies).So I tried a couple of the 5.25 ounce bottles of this Lucas fuel stuff in two or our rigs and the main thing I noticed was that things are smoother, as you'd expect in normal circumstances. Now I bought the gallon version and am refilling these smaller bottles and using it full time (pencils out to be about a buck a treatment doing it this way) and it's been about five tanks. Definitely smoother but not noticing any savings in the miles per gallon department yet. Perhaps on long trips where it's mostly freeway mileage? Don't know and really don't care. The injectors are clear and things are as they should be.Not a miracle, just maintenance...

The name brand 'calm' versions of this powder taste great (like lemon or raspberry) but I tried to save money here since we use magnesium citrate for a sleep aid often.  Unfortunately, while effective, this product isn't flavored like those more popular products.  Maybe it wasn't trying to compete directly and that makes sense, but next time I'll read the nutritional facts a bit closer.  The NOW brand is pretty solid overall so this isn't a knock on them...

We had to discover the healing properties of lavender oil in a total emergency when my wife had severely burnt herself. But we were blown away at how it seemed to calm the inflammation and expedite healing, so we have kept a bottle around ever since. Buying this one on amazon isn't that much cheaper than our local hippie shop sells theirs for, unfortunately, so on second thought I might rather support the local business next time. Nevertheless, I feel the value is there when burns happen because dollars don't matter under such excruciating circumstances. Recommended...

For my daughter's 12th birthday (going on 16) I thought a more mature-looking purse would get her excited.  I was totally right and she loves this thing.  It's a little glossy, has a compact form, and can be used with or without the chain.  The chain seems kinda chintz so don't expect much there.  But given the price and the color choices I'd say this clutch/purse is a bargain.  Just don't expect fast shipping...

My power steering housing in my van had been leaking for awhile, and then a friend recommended this to me.  Since I didn't want to spend the hundreds to properly fix it (yet) I thought it really couldn't hurt.  The first, smaller bottle definitely slowed the leak but more was required.  After about a total of a half quart added, over time as needed, the leak is almost a non-issue.  I'm very glad that Lucas has something like this to save me the money - especially in an older rig that doesn't really justify the added cost of a full steering unit.  I would buy this again...

There's enough information in these reviews, coupled together with online video demonstrations, to do the job yourself and get good results with this kit (plus Meguiar's PlastX Clear Plastic Cleaner and Polish as a final step).  I just did it with my 1500 rpm cordless drill and two charged batteries and I'm very pleased.  I saved a bunch of money compared to having a pro do it for me too.I did, unfortunately, slightly burn the lens once from a bit too much friction when I held the rotary disc in a spot too long.  The fix was to put the previous, tougher grit disc back on and rebuff that spot and then go back to work more carefully.The job itself took about an hour for each lamp from start to finish and they look new again.  Highly recommended...

Finally got around to polishing the old, fogged up lenses on my 2005 ride with a 3M kit from amazon.  But I didn't want to go to all that trouble and just conclude after using their rubbing compound (which made a big difference after the 3000 grit polishing stage).  So after researching for some sort of final polish that would also protect the lens, I decided meguiar's was probably the amazon crowd favorite upon reading a bunch of reviews.I used the same sponge head adapted for application with drill that came with the 3M kit (just wash/rinse well before using the meguiar product) which made this final step rather quick and easy.  The results were noticeably more clear and 'new looking' afterwards, which is exactly what I was hoping for.  There's enough left over to do the job many times over.This product worked great, but I've got nothing else to compare it with - and I don't know how long the 'new look' will last so I reserving a star.  But I would certainly recommend it using the same process as I described above.

When the wireless adapter in my all-in-one desktop started freaking out (searching for the connection every couple minutes after randomly breaking the connection to the router sitting 18 feet away) I knew I needed a solution.  There's so many of these things here on amazon and so researching the top five or so paid off.  Volume of reviews was an asset here, as well as longevity of brand of make.  It wasn't a risk to get this one by medialink via prime, knowing it could easily be returned.Not taking cost into account, I just wanted a version that was a simple USB edition, had rather recent firmware, and was tested by many before me.  After the quick shipment, it took a couple minutes to install the firmware from the included cd.  Assuming I would have to update the firmware after getting things up and running, I was pleasantly surprised that the disc already had the latest firmware. All told, the process took about three minutes from initially plugging in of the device to setting the adapter as my default in windows device manager via the control panel.  Not bad at all.So I immediately went to speedtest dot net and tested out at 28mbps download speed - which is almost six times as fast as the old built-in adapter speed was giving me with the same router/broadband service.  Pretty cool.All told, I would buy this product again and recommend it without reservation...
Using the silk browser for kindle, pinterest dot com really stinks.  Too buggy and lags a lot.  With this app those problems are lessened and almost non-existent.  Very cool...

After the last power surge toasted my expensive router, I decided to get some of these to connect at the wall as insurance.  What I like about this version from Philips is the center screw that mounts firmly to the wall, eliminating pull-outs when disconnecting stubborn plugs.  Oh, and I also like that they were more affordable than most comparable surge protectors.If we've had power surges recently I wouldn't know since all seems well.  I'll update here if these fail during a bad event, but until then I'm satisfied...

These got good reviews elsewhere too, so I thought my wife would enjoy an upgrade to her old runners.  After almost a year of moderate use in workouts and around the house, she still thinks they were a good purchase.  Could slightly improve the shoe's breath-ability to control foot temps, but it's not that bad.  My wife wishes they made an all black version from certain situations.We would buy these again...

I've been using these Fram filters in my other cars for years so I was glad they had a size for my new car already.  It fits well and seems more substantial than the stock filter that came in the car.  Funny thing was the old filter simply had an arrow for 'up' and the Fram filter has an arrow showing direction of airflow, so I had to compare the soft side vs. firmer side when installing it and ultimately the arrows ended up pointing in opposite directions (even though I believe it's installed correctly).  Weird.These are slightly better quality than OEM gear, in my opinion, so if that's your value then buy with confidence...

Buying clothes online is such a gamble, even if the images of an item are accurate the sizing is often hard to predict.  My son's waist measures 30 inches so a medium size in these shorts should have fit, but we upsized and got the large and am glad for it.  Since these are being used for basketball and they have a drawstring, cinching up a little is no problem.  The quality and price are fairly good overall.  Nothing spectacular but a solid deal.  Recommended...

The comments section for the champion toilet reveals the need for these if you own those toilets, and if you're reading this then there's a likely chance that you already know the seals eventually leak.Having three of these toilets for nine years, and very glad to have made the investment, the benefits outweigh the cost.  I don't expect that household items that are used often shouldn't break or even be perfectly engineered, so five stars is warranted in my opinion.  I've only needed these new seals once in all these years, and I bought a few more for the next go around to avoid delaying repairs.The fix itself is fast and easy, with the instructions supplied for a problem free repair.  Even if you don't have the problem yet, all things tend to break down so just get this and stow it away for the inevitable...

These pads are working as good as the more expensive ones, at least most of them are.  The kick drum/floor bass pad has taken its usual beating and the smaller circle where the foot pedal makes contact has come off twice now.  I'll think of a more permanent solution than utility adhesive, like gaffer's tape or something.I like the value, mainly, and that there's no brand name.  And I would buy these again with no hesitation (even though I would fix the problem stated above at the outset instead of waiting for it to get worse)...

Haynes manuals help with the basics plus some moderate maintenance and repair - nothing more.  This guide allows me to save money on those chores I could do myself with a little time and effort, and for that it's easily worth the money spent to purchase.Are there enough diagrams and/or photos of every operation?  No way.  Could they add tips/tricks to avoid the hidden hassles that arise when taking apart something kind of complex?  Definitely.  Should they have their own online forum for follow up questions by manual users?  Absolutely.  But there are other forums that pick up where the knowledge contained in this guides isn't adequate, so I'm not going to expect this rather affordable guide be everything I need.For what it is and costs, it's just fine...

While not the cheapest option for an auxiliary cable this one might be one of the best.  The flat cable portion makes is easy to manage and avoid knots and kinks.  The sound quality coming through my mp3 player to my car's sound system is top notch, which is what matters in the end.  The plugs feel like they will be durable too with the nice metal touches.  If this cable holds up like this for a year then I'll tack on another star.  Until then I can recommend it based on what I've already experienced...

Over the year, this is probably the sixth or seventh unique K&N filter I've bought, and it will certainly not be the last. Thankfully, this particular one was less expensive probably because it's for a very popular vehicle (Camry), and so that's nice since I've paid upwards of $75 for other versions or styles.Saving money and getting more performance is always a good thing. Why everyone isn't using these is a real mystery, and I'd like to ask why a major auto manufacturer wouldn't license these as a 'value add' for their brand. Highly recommended...

I trusted the reviews here before buying and so I feel vindicated.  These are thick enough to endure some rather pokey/rough jobs (unlike some other softer and thinner gloves I've bought in the past).  In fact, for those quick jobs it feels like a waste to take these off and just throw them away because I get the sense they'd last a while before needing replaced.Even though I'll definitely order more when needed, I'm docking a star because I feel they are overpriced (basically $.25 per pair).  Maybe I'm not seeing real market value, but in today's day/age I'd think competition would have driven the prices down lower.Quite recommeded for those looking for higher quality/more durable sterile gloves...

This ball is such a perfect fit for my eight year-old daughter, who is really getting into the game of basketball these days.  Aside from the color that is suited to her liking, the size and grip are well suited.  She's taken ownership of her responsibilities to the team more now that she feels some connection with her ball and is practicing more/harder.  And for the price it's just a sweet deal.  Highly recommended...

Recently purchased these for a 2011 Camry XLE and I was a little skeptical because the price was a bit lower than the weathertech ones (which seemed solid, based on a friend's experience, but look too boxy and lacking the custom contour).  The contours are molded well to fit the floors with only slight gapping on the very edges, which might go away over time when they relax a bit more.I'm docking them a star because the description seemed to stretch the bounds of reality (described as 'rubberized non-slip material' when it feels a whole lot like plastic) and the driver's side front liner wasn't notched out for the trunk/fuel door latches (the image represents this accurately).  Not a real problem to cut out my own notches with a utility knife, but I was hoping for a softer 'rubberized' finish like my older Honda Pilot has.Overall, they look good, feel durable, and at this price I'd generally recommend them.--UPDATE 3/2/14--After several weeks of mild use in my 2011 Camry, I'm very disappointed that the outer edges of both front and rears liners are shrinking away from the natural floor contours.  Now they look like a misfit and not very custom.  And this is surprising since they fit well and looked great initially.  At this price, for what is mostly plastic molded in an automated form process, the price should be less or the quality should be improved.What's worse is that now I've just recently passed the 30 day return period there is no recourse and I'm stuck with these for awhile.  Lame.I'm removing my recommendation and changing the review to 2 stars.  Be warned.

I really want to like these a lot. We bought two as gifts for our kids and each player has it's own quirks, and we nearly sent one back since it apparently died but came alive just before shipping away.They are so light and diminutive that they hardly weigh anything, and they don't have enough weight to cause concern for breaking. It's as if they could be clipped on and forgotten.The interface is straightforward and the little back button was smart. The final click of the headphone input is so stiff that you think you're going to break it by continuing to push (but the sound won't work unless you just force it). It charges fast enough too.Syncing with the USB interface seems decent but definitely not fast, and using a fast micro SD card hasn't yielded the results you'd expect either.There's the major problem of random hangs, glitches that can freeze the player's software for moments or minutes at a time. It's random, which grates against my scientific mind.Overall, I love the price and like the form factor. If they both are working in a year then I'll come back and upgrade this review to four stars...

I really want to like these a lot.  We bought two as gifts for our kids and each player has it's own quirks, and we nearly sent one back since it apparently died but came alive just before shipping away.They are so light and diminutive that they hardly weigh anything, and they don't have enough weight to cause concern for breaking.  It's as if they could be clipped on and forgotten.The interface is straightforward and the little back button was smart.  The final click of the headphone input is so stiff that you think you're going to break it by continuing to push (but the sound won't work unless you just force it).  It charges fast enough too.Syncing with the USB interface seems decent but definitely not fast, and using a fast micro SD card hasn't yielded the results you'd expect either.There's the major problem of random hangs, glitches that can freeze the player's software for moments or minutes at a time.  It's random, which grates against my scientific mind.Overall, I love the price and like the form factor.  If they both are working in a year then I'll come back and upgrade this review to four stars...

A watch this large is a real gamble when giving it as a gift, but I took the chance that 'tough-looking' was more important than 'smart' or 'elegant' to my son when choosing this.  After breaking so many watches before in odd ways, I thought this one would hold up for him since it's basically built like a tank.  He really loves it and was glad I chose it over some other designs.It cannot be stressed enough just how large a watch this is, both in terms of thickness and span across the wrist, so make sure that's what you're looking for in a timepiece.  Plus, it's got some heft to it that might be uncomfortable for fitness activites.If it's holding up after a year then I'll come back and edit this up to five stars...

These speakers are a solid four star item.  I like that they are rather compact and cleanly designed, which fits the look I wanted.  As long as you aren't expecting good bass sound, you'll be pleasantly surprised the capabilities here.  Max volume is pretty decent and with less distortion than others I've owned.  In the mid range the quality really shines.After so many reviews exist here, I just wanted to say I'd get them again...

Got these as a gift for Christmas and am glad I did.  They fit will at my native size, even though putting them on is fairly difficult compared to other slip-on style shoes I've owned.  The sole is more comfortable than their thickness would imply, and the leather is top shelf.  The stitching is stylish and rugged too.Been wearing them for a week and while they aren't fully broken in yet I can tell I will enjoy them for a good long time.  The only slight negative is what I mentioned before about putting them on - very tight.  Having the finger loop on the heel is helpful but it still requires two hands to put these on because it's so tight to fit your foot through.  Once on, they aren't going to accidently come off.Overall, I would recommend these and probably repurchase in the future...

I've been in the market for a corner desk for awhile and this design is different from what's common.  I like that the legs are spread well, allowing easy access.  The look is simple, elegant, and clean.  I also like that the desk slides right up next to the wall even though our room has base boards (because the desk top extends out beyond the legs a little bit), and this adds to the efficiency you want from corner desks.Assembly had a couple challenges that weren't foretold in the mediocre instructions, unfortunately.  I think the quirks here will inevitably frustrate the average buyer, perhaps even enough to force them to return it.  I persevered because I really like the desk but this model isn't consumer-friendly in terms of assembly.Overall, I am pleased and would buy it again - despite the hassle of assembly...

I shopped our local 'cash and carry' grocer/restaurant supply and saw they sold these, but buying from them would have cost me almost double.  Glad I checked amazon first and saved big time.  The peel itself is clean, smooth, and large enough for any job.  It stows easily since it has a hold drilled on the end of the handle for hanging.  This thing is just right for me.  Highly recommended...

These are perfect for our folding chairs which lost their plastic feet.  I took a guess at the size and order since these were on prime and amazon's return policy rocks.  No need to return though because these rubber tips fit snugly.I imagine if you used chairs with these tips daily, moving the chair around periodically, then they'd wear out before long.  Rubber is durable but the metal tube legs are rather sharp on the ends and will eventually break through at the point where it makes contact with the floor.  But at this price, it is easy and cheap to just replace any problem tips.  Highly recommended...

I got the 64gig card on a special day-only sale so I am fully satisfied by the value itself, even if the speed is questionable.Anything by Sandisk is going to have a certain degree of performance and that speaks well of the brand regardless of the grade of memory you're buying. In short, an average Sandisk card is going to fare better overall against a supposedly faster competitor (not named Lexar).My only gripe, and the reason I docked it a star, is the read time. Normally it's the write times that are exaggerated and problematic but the opposite is true here. In a newer DSLR with more information per image and faster frame rates, the card will write decently and not lag. But when copy/pasting image files from the card into storage drives the performance just doesn't live up to the 'extreme' name.
