Using current USB 3.0 gear throughout my system, the bottleneck when moving files has to be the card itself. And the fastest transfer rate I've gotten when pushing RAW files is 41 mbps. This is much slower than it should be, frankly.Overall, I'd recommend the card as a fine compromise of modest speed and great space for a relatively low cost.

This stand feels solid (aluminum mesh, dense polycarbonate) and looks decent.  I like that the tilt is adjustable too.  There's slots for cabling on the rear of the base if you want more sanity.  For what you pay, this stand seems like a good deal.I would have given it five stars if the front of the base (where the foremost edge of the laptop rests against) were either raised a little or spaced back a bit.  The problem is that most laptops have ports in the front for microphone, headphone, etc.and so it makes for a crowded/awkward fit when using an external keyboard.Overall, I'd recommend this and probably buy it again...

This is the third champion 1-piece I've bought over the years, and I wish now that I had simply gotten three to replace the old ones from the start. After getting the first two, those bathrooms have been consistently working and never clogged for several years now, while the third was upstairs and hardly used (so I didn't think it needful to go to the expense of replacing a functional, if older. toilet there).  Lately that old toilet has been a terror and the cost of maintaining it was large.So glad they still make and sell these at reasonable prices.  Aside from the fact that they flush reliably, I think they look nice too.  I would purchase this again and highly recommend it...

I do a lot of cooking for groups and would buy a 16 inch version of this skillet in a heartbeat (if it existed). What I like best about this make is the base; it's thicker and evenly flat - unlike the last two 14 inch pans I've gone through. The handles are great too. For the money I think this skillet gives a lot in return. I would buy it again without hesitation.The reason I rated it only four stars is the non-stick surface has a more pitted texture than I expected and so it requires a bit more fat/seasoning when such is required for the job at hand. This texture makes for a little more work in cleaning as well, but it's not terrible (I'm only comparing it to the typical non-stick surfaces most are familiar with). Still highly recommended...

I'm glad that Gilmour makes something like this to correct the mistakes of foolhardy homeowners who switch hose bibs to fine threaded spigots.  Never want to try replacing a bib since too many things can go wrong, so this adapter saved me the hassle and cost.  It works fine and I'd buy it again without hesitation.  I'm giving it four stars because the price seems a bit steep for a small piece of brass...

I've only been using this for a week now but it's performing on par with the others from Nikon I've used over the years (MB-D10 most recently).  It fits securely, even if the front doesn't fully contour around the base of the lens mount.  Because I only use the 8 AA battery portion I can say it fits smoothly into the grip with no wiggling, and the slots for each battery is fitted fine (not too tight, as was the case with another knock-off I tried).The front and rear command dials work just as you'd expect, but I noticed the resistance on each is slightly less than Nikon's own.  This isn't a problem for me but some might think it indicates something is wrong when it really isn't.AF-ON works perfectly and the shutter release is spot on.  The little thumb joystick knob is small and susceptible to minor mistakes in pressure angle - exactly like Nikon's own - so nothing gained or lost here.Overall, I'd say it's a great value but only time will tell.  I stopped using Nikon brand grips after going through two of them in two years.  The way I see it, if grips are only good for a short time then why pay the outrageous Nikon tax?

I needed a replacement strap and the original Nikon version was thirty bucks (which seemed like a ripoff).  Since the Nikon version is just nylon and not very comfortable I thought I'd give neoprene a try.  For so little cost I wasn't expecting much but I'm pleasantly surprised at how comfortable this one is.  While it has a spongy, flexible feel that doesn't feel too secure it's not like it is vulnerable to breaking.  The stitches are tight and solid and the connecting nylon ends are on par with Nikon's own.While I wouldn't use this for long shoots with a heavy lens, it's great for about 98% of everything you'd need.  And it's really comfortable too.  For this price it's a no-brainer...

I use these to 'daisy chain' two flashguns together to fire from one receiver (one in the hotshoe of the receiver and another fired via PC sync).  There really is no room for improvement here.  The coil allows for a tight form factor for storing while also giving you extra reach if needed.  I also like that the PC connector is threaded so if your flash supports threads then it won't slip out.  The price is reasonable too for what it is and does.  Just get it already...

It does seem like the Envy line tends to be very good products, and this printer is no exception.  Set up was easy and you can print from your phone or tablet as well.It is listed as a photo printer but it works great on all types of printing. It's smaller then my previous HP printers but I like both the size and how it works.Very good printer and recommended.

I was offered a sample of this bracelet to review and I wasn't sure how it would look in person - it's gorgeous!  I have a slightly wide wrist and it did fit perfectly.It's SO pretty and it's perfect for either dressy or everyday wear.  It comes in a little velvet gift bag and would make a great gift.Beautiful bracelet and recommended.

This is a great set of headphones, especially for the price. I have a few other brand of headphones that are much more expensive then these, and the sound quality of these is as good. These are also more comfortable. The ear cushion is really nice.They fold and have a nice case for travel.  They'd make a great gift as they are very nice packaged. They have a microphone so you can talk on your phone or listen to music. Sample provided for review.Very nice headphone and recommended.

This is a gorgeous watch. The case and watch face are a beautiful rose gold tone and the crown is very decorative.  It's a fancy watch and would be great for any special occasion. It keeps the date as well as time.What I didn't love about it was the deployment clasp. It would be great if it came with directions of how to use it, but it does not. My husband and I found a video on you tube titled, 'Instructions on how to use your deployment clasp', but until we found it and watched it multiple times we could not figure out how to get it to work correctly.Once my husband got the deployment clasp set up to the correct size for his wrist, it works great - you want to set it up once and then leave it set. The purpose of this type of clasp is to preserve the leather strap, but I'm not sure if it's worth it.Other then the clasp issue, this is a beautiful watch and recommended.

This is a nice basic retractable leash. It goes out quite a length but does include a lock so you can set it to your desired length and just lock it there.It's got a flashlight attached at the top. It takes three AAA batteries, which are not included. It's a nice way to have a flashlight on those days you end up walking longer then planned, especially at this time of year when it gets dark so early.Sample provided for review.

First of all, this is a beautiful leather wallet. It would make a great gift for any man in your life.  The stitching is nice and tight and the leather is beautiful.It's also got RFID protection in each credit card pocket. It's literally got a silver lining that is supposed to protect your credit cards for electronic theft. Discounted sample provided for review.It's a tiny bit larger then my husbands current wallet, but he gave this two thumbs up.  It comes in a gift box as well.Beautiful, elegant wallet with some nice extra protection.

This is a gorgeous set of rings. There are two included, both a band and an engagement type ring, with nice large stones.  Sample provided for review.The stones have great sparkle, the rings look like white gold and I don't think anyone would know that they are cubic zirconiums unless you told them.I normally wear a size 7 ring and these fit perfectly. A beautiful set of rings.

I was an original beta tester for Zus and have been using it for a few months now. It is a busy moms best friend. If I'm running to Costco or to the shopping mall, I don't have to worry like I used to about where I parked my car. When I'm ready to leave Zus finds it for me.It's very easy to use. I paired it with my iPhone easily, using Bluetooth and when I park the car it remembers my location. When I'm ready to leave, I just open the Zus App and it leads me to my car. So easy! I also love that it has two charging ports. Sample provided for review.Great locater and highly recommended.

This is a cute apron. I like the variety of colors and patterns and it seems well made.  They are not for everyone, especially if you're a busty girl. Then the fit is sort of weird and unflattering.Okay, depending on your figure.

If you use clothes to wipe your counters and wash your dishes, these will come in handy. They're not that big, 12 x 12 inches, so definitely smaller then regular dishtowels.They are 100 percent cotton and the colors are nice. They washed well, but seem fairly thin so I'm not sure how long they'll last.

I've been using a few different Vortex Heaters in a few different rooms and I am sold on this brand.  They're small, attractive and have some great safety features. The cases stay cool to the touch and they will turn off automatically if they tip over.They're quiet, powerful and heat up your room quickly. They're very easy to use as well. Great heater and recommended.

This is a very nice water bottle. It's stainless steel with a pretty blue and grey top. It kept my water cold for a long time.. It has a handle at the top and a straw that pops up, one handed and clicks closed as well. Sample provided for review.This is a nice water bottle and recommended.

This is a very nice gaming headset. It's in a plug in model, with great sound and a great look too. It's very cool looking and lights up as well. Sample provided for review.Our resident gamer tested it out for me and said it worked great. It's very comfortable and the microphone can retract if you're not using it. It has volume and Mic control and you can turn the lights off or on. Nice headset!

I do a lot of cooking and do need to zest things fairly often. This zester is great. I've used it for lemon and lime zest, for zesting whole nutmegs and for parmesan cheese as well. Sample provided for review.It's sharp and seems well made.  It has a cover to keep the sharp edges covered. Nice Zester.

This is the best headlamp I've ever used. It's comfortable and the fit is adjustable. The light can zoom in or out and you can tilt the light as well. Sample provided for review.It works great for any type of detailed work where you need extra light but want to be hands free. My son is taking electronics courses and it's perfect for him to use while he's building circuits, etc. This headlamp takes three AAA batteries, not provided.Batteries were easy to place, it works well and is recommended.

I've been researching Reishi Mushroom extract and it does seem like there's been a lot of research done on it.  It's been used for thousands of years, as  tonic and immune booster and was called the 'tonic for emperors". Dr. Weil says that there is research showing that it boosts the immune system by raising the amount of macrophages T-cells which is important for anyone with an immune system disorder.For the rest of us, it's supposed to help keep our immune systems working well, which for me is especially important during the cold and flu season. There are also a number of other benefits, it really is a good all around tonic. Sample was provided for review.I really like this this is Organic, as I do try to use only organic food and supplements if possible. It's just better for us to eat less pesticides and GMOs. A good brand and recommended.

This seemed like new, even though it is reconditioned. It's a large humidifier with a big tank, so once filled it can run a long time.I especially like the Silver Clean protection as I have had mold issues previously. No extra filters are required either.It's working well and is recommended.

I have a lot of devices I charge up daily and I have a few different places I charge them. This set of four usb adapters is great. They're really pretty too. Discounted product provided for review.I love the different colors so I can color code what each one is used for. They've been working well, and are recommended.

This is a really pretty winter scarf. The color - I got blue - is beautiful and it's got a variety of blue and black colors that are knitted together for the scarf.  It's really soft and you can wear it a number of different ways, depending on how you loop it. Sample provided for review.It has an Elle Tahari tag, which is a luxury brand. This would make a great holiday gift. Beautiful scarf!

I had previously been using a cassette to ipod adapter in my car, but once the weather gets cold, it won't work until my car is really warmed up so I can't listen to my music. Sample provided for review.This FM transmitter works really well. First of all it's Bluetooth so you don't need any cords. It synced easily with my iPhone and I could play music and take hands free calls, right through my car radio. You want to find a channel that's not being used and set both the transmitter and your car radio to the same channel.It was easy to set up, works great - it's really pretty too - and is recommended.

This is a nice set of two fruit and veggie peelers. They are sharp and work well. Two different colors on the handles and the handle is comfortable to hold. Sample provided for review.It's easy to use, easy to clean up and recommended.

This is a great ladle. It's long, 15 inches and has a curved top so you can hang it on the edge of your pot and not have to worry about it falling in. It'll work for whatever your cooking up.It holds four ounces and has a flat bottom. It's great for spreading pizza sauce but I'm also using it for canning. I needed a long ladle that wouldn't slip down into my pot and it's working perfectly. It's made of stainless steel and pours great too.A great ladle, easy to use and recommended.

This is a beautiful laptop bag, would make a great weekender as well. It has a nice amount of extra pocket both inside and out and the gold zippers are elegant looking.It's not too big, which I really love as I'm not that tall and some backpacks just don't work for me. 14 inches is about the size limit for a laptop, which is perfect for me. It's pricey because of the brand, but I do think for the cost an included dust bag would have been nice.Very nice backpack, seems very well made and is recommended.

A solid convertible seat but I would go with the Graco Size4Me 65 Convertible Car Seat, Pierce instead.For a the same price range (when the Size4Me is on sale) it offers extra padding for infants and a much better base with a great recline feature for forward-facing toddlers.Worth noting that the Graco chest buckles (regardless of the model) are a bit of a pain to undo.One issue I encountered specific to the Contender is with the rear-facing latch clips. They were very difficult to tighten and I think this is also related to the poor design of the base.

This quickly became our "when friends with infants/toddlers are over" high chair. It is no frills and gets the job done but is lacking in a few features I really like.Let's start with what I don't like:- No height adjustment. My little one likes to kick the table when the chair is too high. I prefer a height just below the surface of the table we eat at to prevent this.- The leg divider is part of the tray not the chair. This makes using it without the tray nearly impossible.- No rollers/casters on the feet. Moving around when in use is not easy.Things I like:- Super lightweight and folds up just like my Graco stroller. Really easy to store.- The seat cover is nicely padded and very easy to clean.Odd things I discovered:- Our cat loves to sleep in the storage sling below the seat.  :)If weight and/or storage isn't your primary concern, check out the Fisher-Price Rainforest Healthy Care High Chair which is often on sale for around $90.

Strong Performance out of the box.- Rock solid connection and very reliable during the first month of ownership.- Consistently averaging 59.62 Mbps Download and 6.70 Mbps Upload w/ Comcast using Ookla Speedtest.Aesthetics- Much prefer the vertical profile and LED-less front vs. the Nighthawk AC1900.Connectivity- Smart WiFi App provides a lot of customization and remote control.- USB 3.0 is super-fast for Movie StreamingNo complaints as of yet. Nearly 20 active devices on the network and zero issues.

System works well. I'd say it is on par with the many 3 step Salicylic Acid systems you can purchase locally or online. I especially like the Foaming Cleanser. Highly recommended!  It is very simple to set up and comes with everything you need to to ensure a solid fit with the right height and the right tension. The clamps have a solid grip and posts are very heavy-duty.A great upgrade for anyone looking for a new net.

I find the Stiga Pure Color to be much better than the STIGA Performance Rackets I've been using for months. It has much faster play and much better spin. Good taste but not the assortment described. Disappointing that this did not include the two coffee flavored chocolates shown in the photo (No Cafe Mocha or Cappuccino). I've uploaded a photo of the assortment I received.

First things first. This thing is HUGE. It reminds me of an old-school 4:3 LCD monitor sitting on my desk.Assembly: Super-simple. It even includes a basic screwdriver to attach the bolt to the base/stand.Construction: A lot of plastic but sturdy and well built. The base is weighted so it feels very solid.Flexibility: Good adjustment capability; I personally use it in the lowest position angled at my head (30-degrees) and about 3 feet from my keyboard.What is that thing? This is the question everyone will ask when they this on your desk at work.I've been using it for 30-mins a day at full power when I first get into the office in the morning. I also use it towards the end of the day when the sun has gone down in the lower power setting. It makes for a great task light.

This is an absolute beast. We use this on our second floor where there is high traffic from the pets and kids. From a pure cleaning perspective; this is an amazing performer however there are a few issues. I'll break down some of the pros and cons below.Pros:- Separate Brush Control- Retractable Cord- Great reach when fully extended.- Powerful consistent suction- Large canister with one hand detach from base.Cons:- Heavy/Bulky. Watch out for baseboards, this thing can do some damage if you lack finesse.- Some of the one click attachment tools are not included.- Storing this is more difficult than a traditional upright vacuum due to the size/style.

These are absolutely priceless towels/rags for any bar owner. Highly concentrated, easy to rinse, foams well, and super-safe for your car's finish and the environment.One of my favorite 1Z products along with Einszett Gummi Pflege.Highly recommended!
This worked perfectly for removing blood out of two microfiber bath mats. No discoloring of the mats and 100% removal of the blood.As an added bonus, it has a great/fresh scent.Highly recommended.

Excellent value vs. purchasing standalone. If you are shopping for both items and a basic camera will fit your needs, you shouldn't pass up this deal. If you are looking for more advanced features in the camera (E.g. Pan/Tilt, Vox, Room Temp, etc.) you should pass and buy what you want individually.Camera Pros:- Good screen size- Decent Range- Decent Night VisionOn par with other ~$100 units.Movement Sensor Pros:- Works great once you get it installed correctly. Initially it gave false alarms; a lot.- Does not require a piece of wood under the mattress like the Angelcare I owned previously.- Requires AAA batteries so no Power Cord/Outlet required.

I've tested out many baby monitor/camera systems in the sub-$100 range. It gets the job done but there are better options for the money.Pro:Really good manual adjustability for up/down. I tested out the 210PB and 203CPBN. Both are great feeders that are easy to fill, clean, and hang. In my backyard, the 203CPBN gets twice the action of this unit. Still great but the 203CPBN is much preferred.

I love this feeder. It is easy to fill, easy to clean, and most importantly, the local hummingbirds love it. I'm not sure if it is the location or the design but this unit is much preferred to the Perky-Pet 210PB feeder.

The camera is solid and provides stunning HD video and the night vision is superb. The base is very sturdy and rubberized compared to many of the cheap plastic cameras on the market.  It stays put once you get it in the right position.Worth noting: There is no remote pan/tilt with this unit; surprising give the MSRP. You have to manually adjust and that requires removing the camera "eye" from the base" socket" each time. Minor annoyance.The big problem (and the reason for the low star rating) is with the Android Application. I encountered consistent trouble getting it to connect/reconnect after setup. It just isn't reliable.

Meets your basic needs but is missing some of the real helpful features like Zoom and VOX. I would recommend the Infant Optics DXR-5 2.4 GHz Digital Video Baby Monitor with Night Vision instead; it has a larger screen, VOX, and is less $.The screen is ultra-small which makes it very difficult to see if you baby is awake or not.The screenshot they show in the product images is 100% fake/simulated You will not get anything close to that quality; very misleading by Lorex.The antenna also came loose after a few uses. It no longer snaps back into place.

The remote (Smartphone/Tablet) viewing on this product is horrid. You should take a look at all of the unbiased reviews in the Google Play Store and the Apple App Store before making the same mistake that I did.My major complaints:1. The app resolution is horrible if you have a high-end smartphone or tablet. I'm using a Nexus 5 and an iPad 3 and you can see for yourself under Customer Images.2. Night vision is a joke. Again, see Customer Images. Is that supposed to be a baby in the crib?3. If you unplug the camera or lose power, getting it to reconnect in the App requires deleting it and adding it back. This is actualy what Summer Infant Customer Service recommends as the "fix". Really?The other real annoyance is the product screenshots used by Summer Infant are 100% simulated. The actual output and resolution is no where near that high. That is extremely misleading.The camera and handheld work average at best with each other. Nothing special and certainly not worth the money.Avoid this. Seriously.

Nothing really special here.Pros:- Motor speed stays consistent regardless of how much "charge" is left.- Storage Pouch is a nice plus.Cons:- Doesn't handle tough stubble very effectively.- Not really wide enough for use anywhere other than the face.- Feels like a toy.

My house has several hot/cold spots and I struggled to get each room "just right". By using this kit, I was able to get them all with in 1/2 degrees of each other by adjusting in-room registers and tracking the changes on the multi-room display.Highly recommended if you have a similar issue with temperature control.

Pros: Super easy to use foam that leaves zero smell or sticky residue.Cons: It does take longer for your hands to dry vs. alcohol-based sanitizers.Unknown: Is benzalkonium chloride safe around babies? Mixed reviews when researching on the web have me reconsidering use of this product.

I'm not going to waste time writing about the clips and darts. They are available individually elsewhere and there are a ton of reviews already out there.I will comment on the included  "ammo" box.To sum it up . . . I'm not really a fan.It is just a basic box with no real way of organizing anything inside. Sure, you can dump 300-darts in there but what is the value over any other box? It would have been great if it included some kind of system of grooves inside so various size N-strike ammo clips would fit snugly. That would have been smart. Unfortunately, there is nothing practical like that inside. It is just a basic box with a difficult to open latch and a piece of thick string as a handle.My recommendation would be to buy the darts and clips separately and skip this combo.

A great combination of products. I use the brush for all my bottles and keep supplemental formula in my bag using the included dispenser. A must have when on the go. Unfortunately, my little one did not take to this pacifier.As far as the bottles go, they are my (and my baby's) new favorite.Here is why:Nipple - The Natural nipple is wider than the classic nipple. For my baby, he has an easier time sucking with very little leaking unlike the classic nipple that does leak often. Additionally, the Natural nipple is more like my own nipple which helps lessen nipple confusion between the breast and bottle feeding.Cleaning - The Natural nipple has only three parts to clean including the nipple, the collar and the nipple cap. This is one less part than the classic which has the parts listed and an additional collar inside the bottle. This makes for one less part to clean which I like. Although it is only one part, when you are cleaning bottles everyday the time saved adds up.Baby Reaction - I mentioned there is less leaking with these bottles but I also notice that for our baby there is less burping and less hiccups when I use these bottles.  I cannot completely attribute this to the bottles because there are other factors that could be at play.

Works great w/ the local LCD monitor but falls on its face when trying to connect remotely via smartphone or tablet.1) The Android App simply doesn't work. Following the steps yields "Connection Failed" every time. Check out the reviews in the Google Play store for "Lorex Care" and you'll see many others having the same issue.2) I decided to try connecting with my iPad instead. To my surprise, there is no Lorex Care app in the iOS App Store for iPad. There is an iPhone version but I get similar errors and it simply will not connect. Reviews are just as poor.Two strikes.I'm going to give the developers some time to try to fix this. If the app isn't updated in 2-weeks this is going back. I'll follow-up at that time.

Really great system that nails all the basics. The vibration function is a nice touch and can certainly help sooth the fussiest of babies.Pros:- Expand-ability from Infant to over 6 months- Easy to drain and hang up/store after use- Removable padded head rest (Simply attaches to the hanger)- Easy to follow instructions.Cons:- Does not fit correctly on my sink so I use it directly on the counter or in the bathtub- No Temperature Guide like the one found on the Fisher-Price Ocean Wonders Aquarium Bath Center.Note: A Philips screwdriver and one C battery is required to use the Vibration function.

Love this two-sided play mat. I wanted to call that fact out in the review because it isn't very obvious from just reading the description. Be sure to check out the additional photos to see what the City scene looks like. Our little one loves "driving" his toy cars on the streets.Pros:- This is a BIG mat at nearly 6' long. It fills our nursery's floor.- Well padded.- Surprisingly light weight.- Very easy to clean.- Includes carry pouch with shoulder strap.Cons:- The colors are a bit muted/washed out. Not as bright as you'd expect.- The surface material isn't as soft as your typical yoga mat.Note: The sides don't lay flat when first unrolled but after a few uses (especially if you swap sides a few times) it will settle.
Exact fit and quality for my son's 2000 CR-V.  No complaints.
Exact fit and quality for my son's 2000 CR-V.  No complaints.
Exact fit and quality for my son's 2000 CR-V.  No complaints.

This is an exact fit for my son's 2000 CR-V.  Old part came out very easy and this part went in just as you would expect.  Existing hoses clamped right into place with no problems at all.  Functions as good as original.A couple items of note:1 - you will need to remove the feed elbow from your existing pump to install onto this unit.  Not a big deal - just 2 screws.2 - I ordered the pulley but I doubt I needed it.  It is a bit tougher to get the pulley retention bolt off of the old pump and on to the new one. But this needs to be done regardless.Other than than, this was a very quick fix.

Great product.  Awesome product.  This is so much better than a typical coffee grinder which uses whirling blades to pulverize coffee beans into submission.  This grinder is much more like a pepper mill to crush.grind beans to a consistent size.  You will get better tasting coffee and a more efficient use of beans.It could not be easier to use. 1- set to desired level of grinding by adjusting the small wheel/nut at the base of the grinder. 2- pour beans in the top. 3-place the collection cup on the bottom. 4- crank away, and away, and away....Seriously, this provides a superior grind and will improve the yield from the beans used, but at a cost.  It takes several minutes of grinding to produce enough coffee for a single pot.  It's all good, but do not be deceived - several minutes of grinding per pot.  Compare this to 15 seconds in a power grinder and I can tell you that this will quickly take a back seat in our house.  Am I lazy?  Maybe, but I just can't see cranking away for 3 minutes or more to get enough grounds for a single pot.UPDATE#1 -Question.  How many handle cranks does it take to process enough beans for 6 cups of coffee. In a drip coffee maker?Answer. 267Slight OCD are we?  Maybe.

While this is a good idea for a product, this has already found a spot in my tech-toy junk pile.Where to startâ€¦  the USB dongle is relatively large and the pen mounts to the magnetic base and sits up like a statue stuck to the side of your laptop, or tablet.  The very nature of a laptop & tablet is the portability aspect so you continually have to dock & undock the pen & dongle.  A better solution would be a docking stand that plugs into a USB port, but sits next to the laptop/tablet/phone.  At least then there would only be a cord that you would need to plug in and out and not have to deal with the dongle.The pen itself seems unbalanced and did not feel like a useful extension while writing on a touch screen. The stylus is permanently extended; there is no way to retract it during storage or carry.  To me this seems like a long term risk for damaging the tip accidentally.  A cover or retraction capability would be nice.  Also it should have a pocket clip.  Even a cheap or high end ballpoint would come with this so why not then pen?The apps worked well for me, but you need to buy them and this can increase the cost of this pen substantially.Bottom-line.  I received this as a free item from Amazon Vine to review.  For me, free is about the right price for this device.  It has to many drawbacks for me to say it is worth spending $75 for the device and then multiple dollars more for the apps.
sweet & sexy.  Fits the misses just fine and she can be tough to shop for.  She is a 12 petite.

This is a great product.We struggle with houseflies this time of year and we have tried many products.  Since we live outdoors in the summer, the biggest challenge is keeping them from getting into the house.  Next to that is keeping them away from our outdoor space; after all, who wants flies buzzing around your when you are trying to enjoy yourself.  Next up is finding something that does not replace flies with a total stench.Last year we tried another product and it worked great, but it smelled like a cat died in our back yard.  It was horrible!We switched to this product this year and it is spot on.  With all the rain we have had this year in Texas - the flies were at an all time high.  Last weekend I killed 35 in the house on one day alone.  This arrived on Monday and we have been fly free ever since.  Both inside & outside.  They are all trapped in the jar.  And there is zero smell!!!Awesome product.

My dog is a member of our family, he is my friend and our protector.  I treat him accordingly.  A dog is a responsibility and in my mind, if you you can't afford quality food for your dog, you probably should reconsider owning a pet.Wellness CORE is a high quality food for your dog, it is well balanced and has high quality ingredients.  Plus your dog will love to eat it.Do your dog a favor and feed him/her a food that has the quality products that you would want.  This food is just that.

Big & firm.  This stands about 2 feet off the ground, which is great when you don't have a bed frame to go with the mattress.Auto inflates in about 4 minutes and (this is cool) power deflates to boot.  Very comfortable, firm & flat top.  It does not feel like an inflatable mattress.  I would recommend getting a nice pillow-top cover sheet to complete the outfit.

Great fitting for capturing action using your wrist.  We used it on our local zip-line and it work just as expected.  Very secure - no risk of it slipping off your wrist or having the camera shake off.

I love the shredded memory foam pillows. And surprisingly the whole "bamboo" cover is also a nice touch.  I never would have equated bamboo with soft fabric, but here it is; so much nicer than cotton and it breathes too.This pillow is okay.  It is a heavy weight and will hold up to years of scrunching, no doubt.  But it does have some serious flaws.1 - smells bad.  They say "new car smell" and they could not be farther off the mark.  How about "moldy shack smell".  This is what this reeks of.  The other memory foam pillows also had this odor, but this particular one is several times worse.  40 minutes in the drier helped a bunch.2 - Does not state that it is machine washable.  It states "surface clean only", what ever that means.  The other memory foam pillows we have clearly state that you can throw it in the washer when ever you want.  Not sure why this one is different if it is made with the same basic materials.3 - Too lumpy.  It appears that this pillow it simply stuffed with chunks of memory foam and some of them are quite big.  This leaves this pillow with lots of lumps.  SOFT lumps to be sure, but lumps none the less.  Our other memory foam pillows seems to have two foam sheets on the top and bottom of the inner lining with foam chunks in the core.  Same idea, but there is a barrier between your head and the chunks.  Bottom line - no lumps.So while I like the pillow, there are better options.  I would recommend looking at - http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00L4AWEOK/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o06_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1This is the "Clara Clark Rayon made from Bamboo Shredded Memory Foam Pillow, Queen Size" that I am using as a comparison.  It is cheaper (as of this writing) as well.

These are just like the set used by a local grill master at the local diner.  Sturdy, high quality steel won't bend or distort.  The shorty is great for scraping the grill or pan clean and has a sharpened edge.  The larger onf has more flex and is great for griddle cakes and can easily flip two egga at a time.

Deceptively simple to use, almost to a fault.What you get.. the unit, the stand and a charge cord.  What you still need, either an Android or Apple smartphone.  This only works with the app loaded on a phone.  Download the app, follow the instructions and then you are set to record fat levels in different areas of your body.  This is your baseline profile and you begin adding to it each week - hopefully with ever improving results.Like My Fitness Pal, this is a great way to get real time feedback on your improvements.Great motivation to keep things moving forward.

Good stuff.  Organic?  Farm grown products, lot's of quality protein from various sources along with quality vegetables & fruits.  Nice balance of protein, fats & fiber - plus he likes it.  Doubtful the indigence are organic which is a negative and the Omega-6's seem a bit high, but overall a very high quality food for your dog.Price is a bit high, but if I were the one having to eat this I would want it to be as pure as possible.

This is an awesome product,, but it is clearly not for everyone.  It is too cost prohibitive.  The product is very high protein, has few ingredients other than turkey, chicken and some quality vegetables, and it has a softer - even chewy texture to it.  It goes without saying that my dog loves it and I feel good feeding it to him.  Since we have already been providing him with an organic dry food for years, we are just adding this as a mix in for some added variety, taste enhancement and protein boost.But then there is the cost factor to contend with.  If you can afford it, this is a great product.  If you want to add some benefits to your existing feed, then this is worth considering.  But for me it is outside the boundaries of my budget.  My wife and I already eat healthy for our selves and buy organic that winds up on out plate. And we always make sure that we save a bit for Roscoe; so in a way he is already geting the bennefits of this product without having to buy it separate.So in the end - it is a mixed review.  It is a great product but I can not afford it.
Excellent.  I use mine for identifying luggage.

Don't get me wrong, I like these but they have their place in the grand scheme of things.  If you have an office, waiting room, small business / cafe or live in a small apartment or dormitory, then these are a great way to add a bit of flare without spending too much on decor.  Have blemish on the wall that you want to conceal quickly & easily?  These are great for that as well.  But these are not great works of art and they are very light weight solutions (good & bad there).The construction is such that you affix a small piece of Velcro to the wall.  You then line up the base of the fixture over the Velcro and use the built in level to make sure it is lined up correctly, then push into place.  The decorative plates that go on top are held in place with a magnet which makes changing things up a breeze.  It also makes it easier to clean; pop it off, clean it up and stick it back in place.To make mine a bit more appealing, I will take some of my favorite photos and have them printer on sticky backed paper and then mount them to the plate.Over all - pretty nice & easy way to dress things up quickly & inexpensively.

This is a nice blanket.  And unlike other reviewers, this IS black.  Not mocha, not dark brown; midnight black.Okay, so it is plush, it is warm, it is a decent weight for the amount of warmth it provides, and it is well made. So what could possibly be a downside?  Well for us it is dog hair.  This is a dog hair magnet and once it is on there it is almost impossible to get off.  This is a big deal for us. As clean as we keep the house, or single dog produces a lot of hair.  And it shows on this blanket.  Perhaps a different color would "show" it less, even though it would hold it just as much.So great blanket, if you don't have a dog or cat.  But if you do you may want to consider this before purchasing.  If your house is pet and or hair free.... this is your blanket.

Nice design is quick to heat up and easy to use.  We appreciate the universal voltage capability as our previous flat iron did not have this.  One trip to Ireland and it died even though we had all the right adapters and converters.  The only downside is the temp dial is somewhat difficult to access.

This is a really nice phone, but don't try to do a direct compare with the top phones from Apple or Samsung.  This is exactly what it claims to be, a good phone with capable features, running on a steady Android platform and a "no frills" build.  Things like a battery that a user can not replace indicates that this really is meant to be bought, used and thrown away after a few years.  Which is okay - by the time the battery cycles down you will want a new phone and BLU will be there with another value priced model.Nice - runs Android so it will be familiar to anyone who has owned a previous smart phone, plus it will be easy to learn for a new user.Big, and I mean huge - screen!  Great for tired eyes and great for younger video hungry users.Downsides?  A few..  the touch screen is not as sensitive as others and this can get a bit annoying at times when you are trying to navigate your way around.  Also, the "Back" button is on the lower left of the phone as opposed to Samsung which is on the lower right.  Why does this matter?  Well the screen is so large that right hand users now require two hands on the phone to go "back" (right hand to hold it - left hand to toggle).

Hair - what a pain.  I often wonder what I would do if I ended up like the dude in "Cast Away"?  Oh well..  not to worry as long as I have items like this at my disposal!  I use this for a lot of grooming... pesky hairs inside the nose & ears, trimming under and around the eyebrows, and using the detachable comb the eyebrows themselves.  It really does cover the full range of grooming needs, does it very well, and is a sturdy design.This is easy to clean, is well balanced for comfortable handling and the cutter is recessed just enough to avaoid catching your skin while still cutting the hair very close to the surface.I still have one of the barrel style groomers for getting real close in the nose - it just seems to get closer than these blade types, but this unit does everything else.

1:32 MinsThis is a great set.  Well made, durable construction and nice, even heating.We have had a Cuisinart set for many years and it has served us well, but in a side by side comparison, the T-fal set is a better value.  They are heavier, have glass lids for viewing, a hollow handle for heat management and a nice overall finish to them.  Stainless steel has become our defacto standard for cooking.  We gave up non-stick years ago for health reasons; same with aluminum.  Stainless may not be as easy to clean as non-stick on day one, but it will outshine non-stick on day 500 for sure.  With no health issues in the mean time.  Just get some non-stick spray and some Bar Keepers Friend and you'll survive just fine!We love this set; our new favorite and it would be hard to beat this one.

Keyboard, mouse & access USB attachment.I plugged in the device and Windows 7 -64 recognized it straight away.  In a very short time I was connected to the PC and connected to the keyboard & mouse.  The USB dongle is very small - great for a laptop where you want a full size keyboard & mouse because the dongle is very small and low profile.  It won't get hung up on anything, won't snap if it did and fits very snugly into the USB bay.  Very nice.The keyboard is a good, full size unit, with a full compliment of keys, which are crisp & responsive to the touch.  The rest for the palms is functional and comfortable.  I do a lot of data entry, so having a separate number pad is always a welcome touch (I understand that most have these, but I would seriously miss it if it were not there).  The key pad presents itself at a nice angle which is comfortable for long spells at the keyboard.On to the mouse - I don't like it much.  The folks at Logitech went for design and lost some functionality by making it look stylish.  I much prefer a more classic looking mouse and I also prefer one with a bit more weight to it.  The mouse in the set is small, light and oddly shaped - I don't care for it at all.The claim is that the battery life is greatly extended - I really hope so because I use my PC a lot and right now I have to change out cells about every 3-4 months.  They claim as long as 36 months for the keyboard but I will need to see this to believe it.  My cell phone say the battery will last up to 36 hours, sure... if you turn all features off and never make a call or look at the screen.  Once you start using the phone.. well I would be thrilled with 8 hours of regular day use.  I sure hope that 36 months is not assuming that it just sits there and is not touched.  We'll see.Overall - it is okay.  Not great, mostly due to the mouse, but I am grading this as a set, not individual pieces.  I am sure I will get the hang of the mouse in time, but a more classic style & weight would be better for me.

Use sparingly - a little goes a long way.I find this is best used right out of the shower.  Towel dry and then apply a small amount right away; style as you want.  Works best when everything is still damp. After, you can dry off the rest of your body, your hair is done.The scent is delicate and does not compete with other styling products of after shave.  Light enough to not care about, but it smells good anyway.Very nice - I will be a repeat customer for sure.

Works well as it should, same active ingredience.  But the price seems a bit high to me for a product from this manufacturer.I do like the packaging better that the Frountline products - it is easier to open and apply.  I always struggle with the bullet proof packaging from Frountline and this was a welcome change.  It also has a slightly wider aperture in the dispensing applicator so the product flowed better that the competition.I am happy with the product, I just wish it was a bit lower priced.

I really enjoy all the Odd Thomas books and this one is no exception.  I love the narrative tone to this series and this one dives deeply into the atmosphere of life in a monastery.  Dean uses rich language, full of color and shape to describe Odd's surroundings and he dealings with a wide array of varied characters.  I also really like the selection of narrator (audio edition) for the Odd Thomas series.  He really brings Odd to life and does a great job voicing the other characters as well.The ending is not as strong as I would have hoped for, but it is still an enjoyable listening experience none the less.

Great design.  Soft silicon, yet sturdy construction.  What you can not tell from the photo is that it has multiple standoffs on the bottom side that allow for debris to easily flow through the grid and into either your sink trap or disposal.  No gunk build up underneath.The color works best with a stainless steel sink, it is a bit off looking in a white ceramic which is what we have.  We would have preferred a white product, but this functions well so we can live with the color difference.

I have a love-hate relationship with most cases.  I love the way they protect an expensive item like a tablet or phone, but I hate the added bulk and weight.  This case for the Kindle Fire is a very nice balance of being protective enough for 99% of any unforeseen accident, yet it is very light weight and unobtrusive.  I can not think of a better set up or anything I would change about this case to make it any better.It is perfect for use around the house and while traveling; securing the Fire while not adding any burden of having the extra protection.Great product.  Perfect.

Seiko is the best for putting out a consistent, high quality watch and this is no exception.  Good looking, heavy with rock solid construction.  Obviously keeps perfect time and the battery lasts a long time.  The best - BEST - feature is the sapphire crystal; it simply will not scratch no matter how long you own this watch.  The metal will pick up scuffs before the crystal ever will.If you like the looks of this watch - you will love it on your wrist.

I bought 3 of these units to cut down on the possibility of a power surge destroying my new Smart TV and equipment.  I read a lot of reviews on the various units before deciding to purchase this one.  The reviews I like to read are unfortunately by people that had a surge and the results they obtained from the surge protector they used.  Many complaints were from the fact that their equipment got destroyed since the protector failed its job.  Others complained at how their lesser-known brands had warranties but getting them honored was impossible.I've used APC equipment while installing and managing computer equipment for years.  APC is sometime pricy but I've never had an APC unit fail and as a result allow damage to connected equipment.  Many other surge suppressors promise the world but when a problem happens people have a hard time getting the manufacturer to honor their warranty.Not only does the warranty on this unit cover the replacement of the unit but it also covers up to $25,000 in attached equipment that gets damaged as a result of a surge that traveled through the unit.  Of course you will have to send them the surge unit that failed so they can confirm that a surge traveled through it.When I got the items in the mail I was a bit confused as there were three different papers in with the device that all seemed to give conflicting information.  One read that the warranty only replaced the surge protector, another read that the warranty was only for 2 years and that you could purchase additional coverage, yet the packaging the unit came in says it covers up to $25,000 in connected equipment that was surged as a result of failure of the unit.Being confused now I decided to do some research to track down someone at APC to get the correct information.When I contacted APC (manufacturer) they rep did not know about the 2 year, or only the protector being replaced, rather he told me that the model I purchased P1T had the $25,000 connected equipment coverage.  He even sent me an email stating this protection with a direct explanation of this coverage in detail and told me to keep the email for future reference as it indicated whom to contact etc for warranty coverage.Now I was happy since I had the straight facts from the manufacturer.  The other documents inside the package were attempt by advertisers to get my contact information which I did not need to bother to deal with at all.The only thing that I'm not liking is that there are 2 bright green led lights on the front of the unit which show up quite bright in a dark bedroom at night behind the wall mounted TV.  I'll need to put some black tape over them to cut down the light as I like a dark room when I sleep.  I have room darkening shades, thermal curtains, and mini-blinds to cut down light so for sure I do something to dull the light while still being able to tell it still working.You won't be sorry if you purchase this APC unit.  It does cost more than the cheaper units for little less known manufactures, but when you are protecting equipment that has value, you probably want something as reliable as this company.PROS:- Small size- Included phone surge protected splitter on bottom (line in to 2 line outs)(? do people still use landlines?)- 2 LED indication showing that the circuit is properly grounded and that you are protected (both should be on always)- Comes with $25,000 connected equipment lifetime warranty- UL listed and rated- Made by APC, well known company in electronics industry that been around forever, know for UPS devices and other surge units for commercial environments- APC stands behind their equipmentCONS:- Covers up both outlets on wall plug- 2 green LED lights are rather bright (if you prefer a dark room at night cover 90% with tape allowing you to still be able to tell it works)- Cost more than most but that's because it is well made and APC stands behind their equipment

I am using this is a cinder block room that has no insulation in it.  The room is about 25 x 25 with a drop ceiling.  This little heater does a nice job at supplementing another one in the room.  It is really small in size but the blower on it can be felt from about 3 feet away with a little breeze.  It is about 1/2 the size of a standard shoe box.  But for that little size it really packs a punch.One of the girls in the office commented on how nice it was and she wanted to get one for her bedroom at home since her heater has a hard time supplying the heat to the farthest room in the house.The heater has a fan only setting,  a low heat setting, and a high heat setting.  The fan will run based on the temperature that you set the unit at, even when set to fan only.  There appears to be no filter to clean on this unit so I'd make it a habit of periodically running the vacuum over it to remove any dust before it builds up.I liked the one I got for work so much that I decided to buy another one to store near the furnace in case our furnace fails.  This unit should be able to keep my insulated basement warm enough so I wouldn't need to worry about frozen pipes in the event of a furnace failure.Would also be the perfect size for a travel trailer camper.  My dad had one similar to this when I was a kid and it did a great job keeping the travel trailer toasty.PROS:- Metal Construction- Fits under desk drawer section of office desk easily (about as tall as a shoebox and about 1/2 the length of one too)- Two setting heat- The case does not get hot when running, only the front exhaust- Would be ideal to use in a travel trailer to save on propane- Can run as Fan only, Low Heat, HIgh Heat- Temperature setting know on side allows for cycling on/off of unit and fan- Dropped from 4 feet up onto concrete floor with no sign of damage or ill effect on operation (try that with plastic)CONS:- Wished unit was bigger in size to have a stronger blower to push air greater distance- Air breeze felt only up to 3 feet from unit- No filter to remove and clean; need to remember to vacuum unit periodically so it doesn't plug up with dustIf you buy it, knowing it's size and limitations I'm sure you'll be impressed by this little heater too.

I like the print but only wished that for the price it were larger.  I looked all over the internet to try to find a better deal on the price of these pictures but Amazon had the best prince.The eyes in the picture are piercing which is probably my favorite detail.  I also wish that the picture wasn't cropped as much on the top of his head.I don't understand why these prints of the painting have to be so costly.  After watching the movie and listening to the painter's story I would have thought that she'd want everyone to be able to share in the gift that she obtained.  Instead it appears as though the reprinting of these pictures from the original painting is to get as much money as possible rather than make it possible for everyone to have a nice Christian picture in their home.  Hopefully the prices on these comes down in the future as I'd really like a larger one for the wall of my front room.

This game is okay but not what I'd call very interesting.  You have to drop blocks onto a continuous building stack of blocks.  Haven't seen it do much anything else.  When the block you drop doesn't land on top of the previous block it simply shows "Epic Fail."  I tried it and wanted to delete it from the Kindle but the wife wanted to keep it instead since it was a simple concept.The kids play this game for a short time before giving up too.

Kids enjoy playing this game on wife's kindle.  Nice having a game that isn't all about killing people and the such but rather sending them on small journeys.  I have seen first hand how the older kids (9yrs) get hooked into playing it.Wish it had an option to read the statements out-loud for the younger ones that can't read yet.

We mounted an automatic air freshener in our basement laundry room because our cat's litter box is stored down there too.  I think our little kitty has a bad habit of not covering up and using the automatic air freshener set to 30 minute sprays with these Linen Fresh scent allows us to keep our sanity.I tried other scents in the past and I'm not a big fragrance person.  Meaning I not into smelling flowers in the basement.  I just wanted a neutral smell without some obnoxious smell.  Linen Fresh scent fits the bill.  It smell like clean laundry without all of the perfume smell.This can is the exact replacement size to replace the Technical Concepts (TC) brand of 6 oz Linen Fresh 3000 metered sprays that has become ever so hard to find a replacement for.  TC's stock number was 400983 and UPC was 763905009836 if you too are looking for an replacement with the same size measures for the spray can to keep your sprayer operational.We kept the cat so yes, it truly does the job, and I now have a source for replacements again.This is the most important measurement: From bottom of can to top of sprayer is 5 and 3/8 inches.

I'm using these bungee cords to hold the plastic cover on my glass table when I store it outside for the winter.  I love the fact that you get multiple cords for the price.  I use 2 on my table and another can be used to hold the cover on the stacked chairs.This length cord was perfect to go over the top of the glass table and then connect on the supports in the middle of the table on the underside.  Now the wind and snow can howl all it wants but I know that my cover will be staying in place.I only wished that the galvanized hooks were completely covered in vinyl instead of just the tip.  Made me nervous that the metal hooks may be able to scratch my table supports but luckily they did not.

I looked around for a quality switch to replace the one that was on my generator.I needed a simple on/off toggle switch and this one fit the bill.  Comes with a lower nut that fits a wrench and another top nut that is round which can be gripped with pliers.  I put the lower nut at the depth needed for the cover I installed the switch in and then tightened the top nut down to the cover plate which held the switch snugly in place.  Since I mounted it on a vibrating generator I needed to make sure the connection could hold up to vibration so I was easily able to solder the connections so the screws could not come loose.This is a high quality switch with a solid toggle action. Could easily be used for DC applications, like on your boat, or AC applications like I used it for to ground out a generator shutting it off.

I've been using the Duracell Procell line now exclusively and have not regretted paying the extra price for the increased quality.The Procell is basically the higher end line of battery. They seem to be built to a higher standard and I've yet to have a problem with any of them leaking to date.  I like knowing that the battery I put in my devices is not going to damage them like I've had happen with other brands.

This is a LED revolving beacon that can be powered by internal AA batteries or can be powered by an external power source plugged into the jack on the bottom of the unit.  The interesting thing about the bottom jack is that it takes an unusual voltage (4.5vdc) instead of 12vdc or even 6vdc that would be a bit more common.PROS:- Does not just flash like most LED instead it simulates a rotating beacon which looks much more impressive- Rotation rate can be adjusted using potentiometer at center of light inside lens assembly- Rotation can be very fast (like strobe) or very slow to look like old style beacon light- LED lights virtually never burn out- Very Bright- 3 strong magnets on bottom of unit hold it secure to roof- Can run off of AA batteries or off of external power source via plug on bottom- Produces no noise or sound- Has water resistant seal on bottom of lens assemblyCONS:- Unusual power needs (4.5 vdc) if using external power source
Nice security tip at a reasonable price too.
I was in a bind so I bought this tip in a rush.  Tip is normal but the price over nine dollars was a bit extreme.

After reading comments made by others I knew that each of these tiles was thin, about 1/8", so I would need to double up the thickness to use normal push pins. This is why I ordered 2 packs.Upon receiving the packs I glued two tiles together to double the thickness.  I glued the panels together around the edges only in the event that the hardness of the dried glue would prevent a push pin from going through. Don't bother using the tape that comes with them. It won't stick to the tiles.Now I took my double thick tiles and used hot glue to attack them to the wall.  The hot glue goes into the pores of the tiles and even adheres well to a cinderblock wall (typically found at college). Now I have a bulletin board on the wall that takes the pushpins and since I used hot glue if I want to take it down it will come down without damaging the wall. The tiles however will probably not be reuseable as they will probably tear on removal but the wall will be damage free.  I use hot glue all the time at work to put up posters and stuff on cinderblock walls. Removal doesn't damage the paint or the wall typically unless I went crazy with the glue.

Nice and soft pet mat to put outside of litter box. I like that the mat is firm enough to have the cat's paw open (like stepping on the floor) thus allowing any litter in the paw to release.  This mat is soft and doesn't appear to hurt my feet or the cat's paws.Cleaning the mat is done easily with the home vacuum using an attachment and suction only. I would not use the beater head.The size is nice and fits easily in front of the box.  If anything, I would like it to be another foot longer.PROS:- Soft on human feet and on cat paw- Flat surface with gaps provides support for paw and allows paw to spread to drop litter- Easily cleaned with vac using suction onlyCONS- Would like a cheaper price

Solder does the trick.Helped me solder up multiple light fixtures on an underground wire run before sealing the connections in rubber. Solder melts nicely and doesn't spit when heated. Worked great for my application and the 0.05" thickness was the perfect size.Nice price too.

When I first received the wiper blades I was a bit surprised to see what appeared to be thick dust or dirt on the actual blades. The dirt was only on the actual wipers not on the packaging so I knew it was a manufacturing thing. The packages were also sealed.I opened up the clear plastic containers and then scrubbed the wiper blades clean before putting them on my clean car. Don't know why they come pre-dusty or dirty, and I've never had anything like this before, but clearly booth packages that I ordered were identical in the dirt on the blades and both needed cleaning.The cleaned wipers look nice on the car and seem to have worked well for the first rain. Waiting to see now how they perform when we get some freezing weather in a couple of months.  My car sleeps in a garage at night so sun damage should not be a problem before winter hits.

I love this planner. Yeah I know I have a phone but this particular model has behind the address section blank tear out pages that you can take notes on. This is so much more convenient than dragging around paper. I take notes during my meetings and have a calendar as well at my fingers with my months, year, etc at my finger tips which is still quicker thank scanning through on my phone.The best part is that Staples has this but they charge about eight dollars more and mine was delivered to my door in two days.

Cordless phone working great. We have had this for months now and it has been clear, loud, and problem free. I also like that I could leave the base in the front room and could still talk out to the garage.The range does not appear to be as far as my older 900mhz unit (1/2 block) but I don't need to receive phone calls that far away from home on my landline anyway.  That is what cell phones are for.Wife likes the simplicity of the phone and asked if we could get a few more.

Have used these in the past multiple times.If introducing a new cat into a home with another cat for a short time it seems to help. But, if the new visitor (cat) stays for a longer time period the scent doesn't seem to do the trick any more. We had 3 of these running in different parts of the home as our 2 cats didn't like the idea of us allowing my deceased parent's cat come into our home to stay.When our cats had their space invaded at first they were tolerant, and I think the scents helped, but eventually they saw the visitor not leaving so they ganged up on the older visitor to show dominance. Continued exposure over time and supervised contact seems to be the overall key one the locals learn that they are not being replaced by the newcomer.Did it help? We think so, but don't think that it is the fix that will solve all problems.

Like the fact that it is a good app for having phone lists for the local stake and wards. Also contains all scriptures and classroom manuals for student and instructor. Magazine subscriptions can also be a thing of the past as they are available here for kids, teens, and adults for free too.Program requires you to have a LDS.org sign-in to verify that you should have access to information.  Based on this information you are given access to information where you are listed as residing.  The program updates often and verification of your log-in credentials is often made often.Overall a great free app that anyone attending an LDS church should have access too.
